20‘But those who don’t purify themselves will be excluded from the community. They’ve defiled the LORD’s sanctuary. The water for removing impurity wasn’t sprinkled on them. 21Those who sprinkle the water will wash their clothes, and those who touch the water will be ceremonially unclean until evening. 22Anything an unclean person touches is unclean; anyone that touches it is unclean till evening.’” Num 19:20-22

The Death of Miriam

20:1The whole community came to the Wilderness of Zin in the first month and stayed at Kadesh. Miriam died and they buried her there.

Moses Strikes the Rock

2The community didn’t have water and gathered against Moses and Aaron,

3“If only we’d perished when our relatives perished in the LORD’s presence! 4Why bring his assembly into this desert for us and our animals to die? 5Why make us come up from Egypt to this wretched place? It’s not a place with grain, figs, grapes, or pomegranates; and there’s no water.” Num 20:1-5

6Moses and Aaron came from the assembly to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and fell on their faces. The glory of the LORD appeared to them. 7He told Moses, 8“Take the staff. You and your brother gather the community. Speak to the rock in front of them so it will yield water, and the community and their animals can drink.” 9Moses took the staff, 10and he and Aaron gathered the assembly in front of the rock. He said, “Listen, you rebels. Should we bring water out of this rock for you?” 11Moses struck the rock twice with his staff, water came out abundantly, and the community and their animals could drink. 12But the LORD told him and Aaron, “Since youpl haven’t treated me as holy in front of them, you won’t bring this assembly to the land I’ve given them.” 13That was the water at Meribah, because the Israelites “quarreled” with the LORD, and he proved himself holy among them. Num 20:6-13

Edom Refuses Passage

14Moses sent ambassadors from Kadesh to the king of Edom.

“Your relative Israel says, ‘You know the hardship that has fallen to us. 15You know that our ancestors went down to Egypt and stayed there a long time, and that the Egyptians mistreated them and us. 16But when we cried out to the LORD, he sent an angel to bring us out. We’re at Kadesh on the edge of your territory. 17Let us go through your land. We won’t go through fields or vineyards, or even drink water from a well. We’ll stay on the King’s Highway till we get past your territory.’”

18But Edom said, “No. I’ll come out with swords.”

19Again the Israelites said, “We’ll go up the highway. If any of our livestock do drink your water, we’ll pay for it. Just let us walk through; it’s not a big thing.”

20But he said, “No.” He came out against them with a heavy force 21and refused to let them go through; so Israel turned away. Num 20:14-21

The Death of Aaron

22When they left Kadesh, the whole community came to Mount Hor. 23The LORD told Moses and Aaron there at the border of Edom,

24“Aaron will pass on to his people. He won’t enter the land I’ve given Israel because youpl rebelled against my command at Meribah. 25Bring him and his son Eleazar up to Mount Hor. 26Take off his vestments and put them on Eleazar.”

27The three of them went up on Mount Hor as the community watched. 28After Moses stripped Aaron and put his vestments on Eleazar, Aaron died. Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain. 29When the community saw Aaron had died, they mourned for him 30 days.

Num 20:22-29

Arad Destroyed

21:1When the Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev, heard that Israel was coming by way of Atharim, he fought Israel and took some captives. 2Israel vowed to the LORD, “If you’ll deliver them to me, we’ll destroy their towns.” 3He delivered them, and they “destroyed” them and their towns; the name of the place became Hormah. Num 21:1-3

The Bronze Snake

4Then they set out from Mount Hor by taking the road to the Red Sea, to go around Edom, and the people got impatient because of the journey. 5They criticized God and Moses, “Why bring us out of Egypt to die in the desert? There’s no food or water. We hate this miserable food!” 6The LORD sent poisonous snakes among them. They bit the people and a lot of them died. 7They came to Moses, “We’ve sinned; we’ve criticized you and the LORD. Intercede with him so he’ll take the snakes away.” Moses did that, 8and the LORD told him, “Fashion a poisonous snake on a standard so everybody that looks at it will survive.” 9Moses did that. If a snake bit anyone and they looked at the bronze serpent, they’d survive. Num 21:4-9

Israel’s Journey to Moab

10The Israelites moved out and camped in Oboth, 11 from there to Iyeabarim in the desert east of Moab, 12from there to Wadi Zered, 13and then to the other side of the Arnon in the desert that comes out of the border of the Amorite. The Arnon forms the border between Moab and the Amorites. 14 The Book of the Wars of the LORD says,

“Waheb in Suphah and the wadis of the Arnon,

15and the slope of the wadis

that extends to Ar

and leads to the border of Moab.” Num 21:10-15

16From there they continued to Beer. That’s the “well” where the LORD told Moses, “Gather the people so I can give them water.”

17Then Israel sang this song:

“Spring up, O well! Sing to it!

18The well that the leaders sank,

that the nobles dug

with their scepters and staffs.”

From the desert they continued to Mattanah, 19to Nahaliel, to Bamoth, 20to the valley in Moab, at the top of Pisgah, which overlooks Jeshimon. Num 21:16-20

King Sihon Defeated

21Israel sent ambassadors to Sihon, king of the Amorites,

22“Let me go through your land. We won’t turn off into fields or vineyards, or drink water from your wells. We’ll go by the King’s Highway till we’ve passed through.”

23But Sihon wouldn’t let them. He gathered his army and attacked Israel in the Wilderness at Jahaz. 24Israel struck him with the sword and took his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, as far as the Ammonites. Jazer was the border of Ammon. 25Israel took those towns and lived in them, in Heshbon and its surrounding villages. 26Heshbon was Sihon’s city, who had fought the former king of Moab and took his land as far as the Arnon. 27The ones that recite proverbs say,

“Come to Heshbon and build it!

Set up Sihon’s city.

28A fire went out from Heshbon,

a flame from Sihon’s city.

It consumed Ar in Moab,

the dominating Bamoth of the Arnon.

29Misfortune awaits you, Moab!

You’re ruined, people of Chemosh!

He made his sons refugees

and turned his daughters over to captivity,

to an Amorite king, Sihon.

30But we’ve thrown them down;

from Heshbon to Dibon;

we wiped them out

from Nophah to Medeba.”

King Og Defeated

31So Israel lived in the territory of the Amorites. 32Moses sent men to spy out Jazer, and they captured its villages and expelled the Amorites there.

33Then they turned and went up by the way of Bashan. Og, king of Bashan, went out with his people to fight at Edrei. 34But the LORD told Moses, “Don’t be afraid of him. I’ll give him, his people, and his land to you. Do to him what you did to Sihon.” 35So they killed him, his sons, and his people till there wasn’t a remnant left. They took over his land. Num 21:21-35

Balak Summons Balaam

22:1Israel traveled and camped in the plains of Moab across the Jordan from Jericho. 2Balak son of Zippor saw what Israel did to the Amorites. 3The people of Moab were afraid of them because there were so many of them. 4The king of Moab told the elders in Midian, “This horde will eat up everything around us like an ox eats up grass in a pasture.” Balak, king of Moab at the time, 5sent messengers to Balaam son of Beor at Pethor, near the River Euphrates in the land of his people. He called him and said,

“A people has come out of Egypt. They cover the ground; they’re living across from me. 6Come and put a curse on them; there are too many of them for me to fight. Maybe I can defeat them and drive them out. I know that whoever you bless is blessed, and whoever you curse is cursed.” Num 22:1-6

7The elders in Moab and Midian left with a fee for fortunetelling in hand and went to Balaam with Balak’s message.

8He said, “Spend the night here, and I’ll bring word back to you as the LORD tells me.” So they stayed with him.

9God came to Balaam, “Who are these men?”

10“Balak son of Zippor sent me a message, 11‘A people has come out of Egypt and covered the land. Come put a curse on them for me. Maybe I can fight them and drive them out.’”

12“Don’t go with them. Don’t curse the people because they’re blessed.”

13Balaam got up in the morning and told Balak’s leaders, “Go back. The LORD has refused to let me go with you.” Num 22:7-13

14They went back to Balak, “Balaam wouldn’t come with us.”

15Balak sent a bigger group of more distinguished officials,

16“Balak says, ‘Please don’t let anything keep you from coming to me. 17I’ll honor you richly and do whatever you tell me. Come put a curse on this nation for me.’”

18Balaam said,

“Though Balak gives me his house full of silver and gold, I couldn’t do anything great or small that’s contrary to what the LORD my God says. 19Stay here tonight, and I’ll find out what else the LORD may say.”

20God came to him at night, “If the men have come to call you, go ahead with them; but only do what I tell you.” Num 22:14-20

Balaam and His Donkey

21Balaam got up in the morning, saddled his donkey, and went with them. 22But God was angry because he was going, and the angel of the LORD stood in the road to hinder him. He was riding his donkey, and his two servants were with him. 23When the donkey saw the angel standing there with his sword drawn, she went off the road into a field, but Balaam hit her to get her back on the road. 24Then the angel stood in a narrow path between vineyards with a wall on both sides. 25When the donkey saw the angel, she pressed herself to the wall and mashed Balaam’s foot; so he hit her again. 26The angel went on ahead and stood in a narrow place where there was no room to turn either way. 27When the donkey saw the angel, she lay down under Balaam. He was mad and hit her with his stick. Num 22:21-27

28The LORD opened her mouth, and she asked, “What have I done to you to hit me three times?”

29Balaam said, “You’ve mocked me! If I’d had a sword, I would’ve killed you!”

30The donkey said, “Am I not the donkey you’ve ridden all your life? Have I ever acted like this before?”

31Then the LORD opened Balaam’s eyes, and he saw the angel standing on the road with his sword drawn, and he bowed to the ground.

32The angel said,

“Why did you hit your donkey three times? I’ve come to restrain you, because you’re opposing me. 33But the donkey saw me and turned aside three times. If she hadn’t, I would’ve killed you and let her live.”

34Balaam said, “I’ve sinned. I didn’t know you were standing on the road. If you want me to, I’ll turn around.”

35But the angel said, “Go on with the men, but only say what I tell you.”

So Balaam went along with them. Num 22:28-35

36When Balak heard Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at the city of Moab on the Arnon border. 37He said, “Didn’t I urgently call you? Why didn’t you come? Am I really not able to honor you?” 38Balaam said, “I’m here! Can I say just anything? I’ll say what God tells me.” 39He went with Balak to Kiriath-huzoth. 40Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep, and sent some to Balaam and the leaders that were with him. 41In the morning he took Balaam to the high places of Baal to see part of the people from there. Num 22:36-41

Balaam’s First Oracle

23:1Then Balaam told Balak, “Build seven altars for me here and prepare seven bulls and rams.” 2They offered a bull and a ram on each altar. 3Balaam told him, “Stand beside your burnt offering, and I’ll go. Maybe the LORD will come to me, and I’ll tell you what he shows me.” He went to a bare hill. 4God met him, and he said, “I’ve set up seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each one.” 5The LORD gave Balaam a message, “Go tell Balak such and such.” 6He went back to Balak, who was standing by his burnt offering with the leaders of Moab. Num 23:1-6

7Balaam took up this oracle:

“Balak brought me from Aram,

Moab’s king from the eastern mountains.

‘Come curse Jacob for me;

come denounce Israel.’

8How can I curse someone God hasn’t cursed?

How can I denounce the one God hasn’t denounced?

9I see him from the top of the cliffs

and look at him from the hills;

a people that lives off by itself

won’t be counted among the nations.

10Who can count the dust of Jacob

or number even a fourth of Israel?

Let me die like the godly;

let my demise be like theirs!” Num 23:7-10

11Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I told you to curse my enemies; you’ve blessed them!”

12“Don’t I have to say what the LORD tells me?”

Balaam’s Second Oracle

13Balak said, “Come to a different place, where you can see them—even though it’ll just be the tail-end of them. Curse them for me from there.” 14He took him to the Field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars and offered a bull and ram on each one.

15Balaam told him, “Stand here by your burnt offering while I meet the LORD over there.” 16The LORD met Balaam and gave him a message, “Go back to Balak, and say such and such.” 17Balaam went to him, who was standing by his burnt offering with the officials of Moab. Balak asked, “What has the LORD said?” Num 23:11-17

18Balaam took up this oracle:

“Balak, listen;

pay attention, son of Zippor.

19God does not lie like people do

or change his mind like their offspring.

Has he said and won’t do?

Has he spoken and not made it good?

20I’ve received a command to bless;

when he has blessed, I can’t revoke it.

21He hasn’t observed misfortune in Jacob

or seen trouble in Israel.

The LORD their God is with them,

and has been proclaimed their king.

22God is bringing them out of Egypt;

he’s like the horns of a wild ox for them.

23There’s no omen against Jacob,

no fortunetelling against Israel.

At the right time what God has done

will be said to Jacob;

it will be told to Israel.

24These people rise like a lioness;

they get up like a lion.

They won’t lie down till they eat their prey

and drink the blood of the slain.” Num 23:18-24

25Balak told him, “Don’t curse them at all or bless them at all!”

26But Balaam answered, “Didn’t I tell you I have to do what the LORD says?”

27Balak said to him, “Come on; I’ll take you to another place. Maybe God will agree to put a curse on them there.” 28Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, which overlooks Jeshimon. 29Balaam told him, “Build seven altars here and prepare seven bulls and rams.” 30Balak did that and offered a bull and ram on each altar. Num 23:25-30

Balaam’s Third Oracle

24;1When Balaam saw that it pleased the LORD to bless Israel, he didn’t go like before to look for omens, but faced the open country. 2He saw Israel camping by tribes, and God’s Spirit came on him. 3He took up this oracle:

“The oracle of Balaam son of Beor,

the oracle of a man with his eyes wide open,

4the oracle of one that hears God’s message,

that sees a vision from the Almighty,

that falls down with his eyes wide open.

5“How fair your tents, Jacob,

the places where you live, Israel!

6like valleys that stretch out,

like orchards beside a river,

like aloes the LORD planted,

like cedars beside the water.

7Water will flow from Jacob’s buckets;

his seed will live by abundant water;

his king will be greater than Agag;

his kingdom will be exalted.

8God is bringing him out of Egypt;

he’s like the horns of a wild ox for him.

He’ll devastate the nations that oppose him;

he’ll crush their bones to pieces

and shatter them with his arrows.

9Israel lies down like a lion;

who dares to rouse him?

Blessed is everyone that blesses him;

cursed are all who curse him.” Num 24:1-9

10Balak was mad at Balaam. He clapped his hands, and said, “I called you to curse my enemies, and you’ve persisted in blessing them three times! 11Go back home. I said I’d greatly honor you, but the LORD has prevented you from receiving your honor.”

12Balaam said,

“Didn’t I tell your messengers, 13‘Though Balak gives me his house full of silver and gold, on my own I can’t do anything contrary to the LORD’s command, good or bad. I’ll say what he says.’? 14I’m going to my people, but I’ll advise you what this nation will do to your people later.” Num 24:10-14

Balaam’s Last Oracle

15He took up this oracle:

“The oracle of Balaam son of Beor,

the oracle of a man with his eyes wide open,

16the oracle of one that hears God’s message,

that knows Elyon,

that sees a vision from the Almighty,

and falls down with eyes wide open.

17“I see him, but not now;

I look at him, but not near.

A star will rise out of Jacob;

a scepter will arise from Israel.

He’ll crush the forehead of Moab

and tear down the sons of Sheth.

18Edom will be a possession;

Seir, his enemy, will be overtaken,

while Israel grows strong.

19A ruler will arise from Jacob

and destroy the remnant of Ir. Num 24:15-19

20He looked at Amalek and took up this oracle:

“Amalek was first among the nations,

but he’ll end in destruction.”

21He looked at the Kenites and took up this oracle:

“Where you live endures;

your nest sits on a cliff.

22Nevertheless, Kain will be consumed;

how long will Asshur hold you captive?

23He took up his oracle:

“Who can live except God ordains it?

24But ships will come from the coast of Kittim

and attack Asshur and Eber;

so they’ll end up in destruction too.”

25Balaam went home and Balak left. Num 24:20-25

Moab Seduces Israel

25:1While Israel was camping in Shittim, the people started carrying on prostitution with the women of Moab. 2They invited the people to the sacrifices to their gods, and the people ate and bowed to their gods. 3In this way, Israel joined themselves to Baal of Peor, and the LORD was angry. 4He told Moses, “Seize the ringleaders and execute them in broad daylight in my presence so my fierce anger will turn away from Israel.” 5Moses told the judges, “Each of you put to death his men that have joined in worshiping Baal of Peor.” Num 25:1-5

6One Israelite even brought a Midianite woman among his fellow Jews right in front of Moses and the assembly while they were crying at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting. 7When Phinehas son of Eleazar son of Aaron the priest saw it, he got up from the assembly. He took a spear, 8followed the man into the tent, and ran both of them through, and so checked the plague on Israel. 924,000 had died from it. Num 25:6-9

10Then the LORD told Moses,

11“Phinehas has turned away my anger because he was as zealous as I am for my honor, so I didn’t destroy Israel. 12So say, ‘I’m giving him and his descendants my covenant of peace, 13a permanent priesthood, because he was zealous for me and atoned for Israel.’”

14The slain man was Zimri son of Salu, a family leader in Simeon. 15The Midianite woman was Cozbi, daughter of Zur, a family leader in Midian.

16The LORD told Moses,

17“Attack the Midianites and strike them down. 18They’ve been hostile to you by deceiving you at Peor with Cozbi their sister, who was killed at the time of the plague because of what happened at Peor.” Num 25:10-18

The Second Registration of Israel’s Troops

26:1After the plague the LORD told Moses and Eleazar, 2“Count by families the men 20 years old and up that can go to war.” 3Moses and Eleazar told them in the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, 4“Count the men 20 years old and up.” The Israelites that came out of Egypt were as follows:

5Reuben by families was Hanoch, Pallu, 6-7Hezron, and Carmi: 43,730

8The son of Pallu was Eliab, 9father of Nemuel, Dathan, and Abiram. These are the Dathan and Abiram the community called on to oppose Moses and Aaron in the company of Korah, when they contended against the LORD. 10The ground opened up and swallowed them with Korah, when that company died, and the fire consumed 250 men. That served as a warning. 11The sons of Korah, however, didn’t die.

12-14Simeon by families was Nemuel, Jamin, Jachin, Zerah, and Shaul. 22,200

15-18Gad by families was Zephon, Haggai, Shuni, Ozni, Eri, Arod, and Areli. 40,500

19-22Judah by families was Shelah, Perez, and Zerah. 76,500

The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul. Judah’s other sons Er

and Onan died in Canaan.

23-25Issachar by families was Tola, Puvah, Jashub, and Shimron. 64,300

26-27Zebulun by families was Sered, Elon, and Jahleel. 60,500

28-37Joseph by families was Manasseh and Ephraim.

The sons of Manasseh were Machir, father of Gilead, father of Jezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Shemida, and Hepher. Hepher was father of Zelophehad, whose daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah. 52,700

The sons of Ephraim were Shuthelah, Becher, and Tahan. The son of Shuthelah was Eran. 32,500

38-41Benjamin by families was Bela, Ashbel, Ahiram, Shephupham, and Hupham.

The sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman. 45,600

42-43Dan’s family was Shuham. 64,400

44-47Asher by families was Imnah, Ishvi, and Beriah. 53,400

The sons of Beriah were Heber and Malchiel. Asher’s daughter was Serah.

48-50Naphtali by families was Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem. 45,400

51601,730

Num 26:1-51

52The LORD told Moses,

53“Parcel out the land among these for an inheritance in proportion to their numbers, 54a larger inheritance for larger groups, a smaller one for smaller groups. 55Divide it up by lot by tribes. [56]” Num 26:52-56

57These are the Levites numbered by families: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari. 58These are the families of Levi: the Libnites, Hebronites, Mahlites, Mushites, and the Korahites. Kohath became the father of Amram. 59Amram’s wife was Jochebed, daughter of Levi, born in Egypt. She bore Aaron, Moses, and their sister Miriam. 60Aaron became the father of Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar. 61Nadab and Abihu died from offering before the LORD fire different from what he’d commanded. 62The number of male Levites a month old and up was 23,000. They weren’t counted with the Israelites because they didn’t inherit with them.

63Those were the ones Moses and Eleazar counted in the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho. 64But Moses and Aaron didn’t count anyone they’d counted in the Wilderness at Sinai. 65That was because the LORD had said they’d die in the desert. Only Caleb and Joshua would survive. Num 26:57-65

The Daughters of Zelophehad

27:1The daughters of Zelophehad son of (Hepher son of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh son of) Joseph came near: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah. 2They stood in front of Moses, Eleazar, and the leaders of the community at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, and said,

3“Our father died in the wilderness, but not among those who opposed the LORD with Korah. He died in his own sin and didn’t have any sons. 4Why should he disappear from his clan just because he didn’t have any sons? Give us a possession among our father’s brothers.” Num 27:1-4

5Moses brought the case to the LORD.

6The LORD told him,

7“Zelophehad’s daughters are right. Give them a possession among their father’s brothers and transfer their father’s inheritance to them. 8If a man dies without a son, transfer his inheritance to his daughter. 9If he doesn’t have a daughter, give it to his brothers. 10If he doesn’t have any brothers, give it to his father’s brothers. 11If his father doesn’t have any brothers, give it to the nearest other relative in his family. It will be an ordinance in Israel.”

Joahua to Succeed Moses

12The LORD told Moses,

“Climb one of the mountains in the Abarim range and look at the land I’ll give Israel. 13When you’ve seen it, you’ll pass on to your people like Aaron did. 14In the Wilderness of Zin, during the conflict with the community, you rebelled against my command to honor me as holy in front of them at the water” (of Meribah at Kadesh). Num 27:5-14

15Moses said,

16“May the LORD, the God that gives breath to all flesh, appoint a man 17to lead the community so they won’t be like sheep without a shepherd.”

18The LORD told him,

“Take Joshua son of Nun, a man that has the Spirit in him, and put your hand on him. 19Have him stand in the presence of Eleazar and the community and commission him. 20Put some of your authority on him so the community can obey him. 21He’ll present himself to Eleazar, who will ask the LORD for him by the Urim. At his command, he and this whole community will determine what to do.”

22So Moses stood Joshua in front of Eleazar and the community, 23put his hand on him, and commissioned him. Num 27:15-23

Daily Offerings

28:1-2The LORD told Moses to tell Israel,

“Present my offerings by fire at their scheduled times, an aroma pleasing to me, my ‘food.’ 3Make this offering by fire to the LORD every day: 2 male lambs a year old without defect. 4Offer one in the morning, the other in the evening. 5For a grain offering, offer .11 bushel .1 ephah of fine flour mixed with 3 pints ¼ hin of pressed olive oil. 6It’s a daily burnt offering that was ordained at Mount Sinai. 7The liquid offering that goes with it will be 3 pints ¼ hin of alcohol for each lamb, poured out in the Holy Place. 8Offer the other lamb that evening the same way with its grain offering and liquid offering. Num 28:1-8

Sabbath Offerings

9“On the Sabbath, offer two male lambs a year old without defect, and a fifth of a measure of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering with its liquid offering. 10The burnt offering on each Sabbath is in addition to the daily burnt offering and its liquid offering.

Monthly Offerings

11“At the beginning of each month, present a burnt offering to the LORD: 2 bulls and 1 ram, 12as well as .3 measure of fine flour for a grain offering mixed with olive oil for each bull, 13and .1 of a measure of fine flour mixed with olive oil for each lamb, an aroma pleasing to the LORD. 14Their liquid offerings will be 3 quarts ½ hin of wine for a bull, 2 quarts ⅓ hin for a ram, and 3 pints ¼ hin for a lamb. 15Offer one male goat for a sin offering with its liquid offering in addition to the daily burnt offering. Num 28:9-15

Passover Offerings

16“The fourteenth day, first month is the LORD’s Passover. 17On the fifteenth the festival will begin. For a week, eat bread with no yeast. 18On the first day is a holy convocation; don’t work. 19Present a burnt offering to the LORD: 2 bulls, 1 ram, and 7 male lambs a year old without defect. 20For their grain offering, present fine flour mixed with olive oil—.3 of a measure for a bull, .2 for the ram, 21and .1 for each lamb. 22Offer 1 male goat for a sin offering, to atone for yourselves. 23Present them besides the morning’s daily burnt offering. 24Daily for 7 days, present the food of the offering by fire, an aroma pleasing to the LORD. Present it with its liquid offering in addition to the daily burnt offering. 25The seventh day, hold a holy convocation; don’t work. Num 28:16-25

Feast of Weeks Offerings

26“At the time of the first of the harvest, when you present a new grain offering in your Festival of Weeks, hold a holy convocation; don’t work. 27Offer a burnt offering for an aroma pleasing to the LORD: 2 young bulls, 1 ram, 7 male lambs a year old, 28and their grain offering of fine flour mixed with olive oil—.3 of a measure for each bull, .2 for the ram, 29and .1 for each lamb. 30Offer 1 male goat to atone for yourselves. 31Besides the daily burnt offering and its grain offering, present them with their liquid offerings. They’ll be without defect.

Num 28:26-31

Feast of Trumpets Offerings

29:1“The first day, seventh month, hold a holy convocation; don’t work. Celebrate the Festival of Trumpets. 2Offer a burnt offering as an aroma pleasing to the LORD: 1 bull, 1 ram, and 7 male lambs a year old without defect. 3Offer with them their grain offerings of fine flour mixed with olive oil—.3 of a measure for the bull, .2 for the ram, 4and .1 for each lamb. 5Offer 1 male goat for a sin offering to atone for yourselves. 6Offer them in addition to the burnt offering at the new moon and its grain offering, and the daily burnt offering and its grain offering. Offer their liquid offerings. Num 29:1-6

Day of Atonement Offerings

7“The tenth day, seventh month, hold a holy convocation; fast and don’t work. 8Present a burnt offering to the LORD as a pleasing aroma: 1 bull, 1 ram, and 7 male lambs a year old without defect. 9Offer them together with the grain offering of fine flour mixed with olive oil—.3 of a measure for the bull, .2 for the ram, 10and .1 for each lamb. 11Offer one male goat for a sin offering in addition to the sin offering of atonement and the daily burnt offering, grain offering, and liquid offering. Num 29:7-11

Feast of Booths Offerings

12“The fifteenth day, seventh month, hold a holy convocation; don’t work. Observe a festival to the LORD for a week. 13Present a burnt offering as an aroma pleasing to the LORD: 13 bulls, 2 rams, and 14 male lambs a year old without defect. 14Offer them together with their grain offerings of fine flour mixed with olive oil—.3 of a measure for each bull, .2 for each ram, 15and .1 for each lamb. 16Offer one male goat as a sin offering in addition to the daily burnt offering, grain offering, and liquid offering. Num 29:12-16

17“The second day, offer 12 bulls, 2 rams, and 14 male lambs a year old without defect. 18Offer them together with the grain offering and liquid offering for each bull, ram, and lamb in standard fashion. 19Offer 1 male goat as a sin offering in addition to the daily burnt offering, its grain offering, and liquid offering.

20-22“The third day, offer 11 bulls. Do the rest like the second day.

23-25“The fourth day, offer 10 bulls. Do the rest like the second day.

26-28“The fifth day, offer 9 bulls. Do the rest like the second day.

29-31“The sixth day, offer 8 bulls. Do the rest like the second day.

32-34“The seventh day, offer 7 bulls. Do the rest like the second day.

35“The eighth day, hold a solemn assembly; don’t work. 36Present a burnt offering as an aroma pleasing to the LORD: 1 bull, 1 ram, and 7 male lambs a year old without defect. [37-38]

39“Present those to the LORD at your scheduled times in addition to your offerings for fulling a vow, free will offerings, burnt offerings, and the liquid offerings for your peace offerings.”

40Moses told Israel everything the LORD commanded him. Num 29:17-40

Men’s Vows

30:1Then Moses told the tribal leaders,

“This is what the LORD has commanded. 2If a man makes a vow to the LORD or takes an oath that obligates him to do something, he must keep his word.

Women’s Vows

3If a woman takes a vow to the LORD and obligates herself to do something while in her father’s family in her youth, 4and her father hears it and doesn’t object, then her vow or pledge stands. 5But if her father forbids her, her vow or pledge doesn’t stand. The LORD will release her from them because her father forbade her.

6“But, if she marries while under her vow or rash statement 7and her husband hears about it and doesn’t object, then her vow or pledge stands. 8But, if he forbids her, he annuls her vow or rash statement, and the LORD will release her from it.

9“The vow of a widow or divorced woman stands. Num 30:1-9

10“However, if she vows in her husband’s house or binds herself to an obligation with an oath 11and her husband hears it, but doesn’t object, then her vow or pledge stands. 12But if her husband annuls it, it won’t stand, and the LORD will release her from them.

13“A husband can annul any vow or binding oath a wife submits herself to. 14If he doesn’t say anything to her the day he hears it, then he confirms it. 15But if he tries to annul it later, he’ll bear her guilt.”

16Those statutes the LORD commanded Moses about a husband and wife and a father and daughter in her youth in his home. Num 30:10-16

Conquest of the Midianites

31:1The LORD told Moses, 2“Take revenge for Israel on the Midianites. Afterward you’ll pass on to your people.”

3Moses told the people, “Arm men to attack Midian and carry out the LORD’s revenge on it. 4Send 1,000 men from each tribe.”

5They provided 12,000 men. 6Moses sent them to war with Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest along with the holy items from the sanctuary and bugles for signaling. 7They fought Midian and killed every male, 8including its five kings: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, Reba. They also killed Balaam son of Beor with a sword. 9They took the women and children, their cattle, flocks, and possessions. 10They burned their towns, houses, and camps; 11and took the spoil—people and animals. 12They brought the captives, prey, and spoil to Moses, Eleazar, and the community on the plains of Moab across the Jordan from Jericho. Num 31:1-12

13Moses, Eleazar, and the leaders of the community met them outside the camp. 14Moses was mad at the officers of the army and the commanders of thousands and hundreds.

15“You’ve saved the women alive? 16They’re what got Israel to sin against the LORD at Peor, and a plague came into the community by Balaam’s advice. 17So kill every male child and every woman that has had intercourse with a man. 18Keep alive for yourselves the young girls that are virgins. 19Camp outside the camp for a week. Whoever has killed anybody or touched a slain body, purify yourself on the third day and seventh day, you and your captives. 20Purify every piece of clothing, anything made out of skin, goat hair, or wood.”

21Eleazar told the men that fought,

“The LORD commanded Moses this statute. 22‘The gold, silver, brass, iron, tin, and lead—23anything that doesn’t burn—put through fire to cleanse it; then purify it with water. Anything that will burn, purify with water. 24Wash your clothes the seventh day. You’ll be ceremonially clean then, and you can come into the camp.” Num 31:13-24

25The LORD told Moses,

26“You, Eleazar, and heads of families, count the spoil—people and animals—27and divide it between soldiers and community. 28Levy a tax for the LORD from the soldiers’ spoil: 1 per 500 persons, cattle, donkeys, and sheep. 29Give this share to Eleazar as a heave offering to the LORD. 30From Israel’s half, take 1 from every 50 persons, cattle, donkeys, and sheep, and give them to the Levites that take care of the Tabernacle.”

31Moses and Eleazar did that.

32The prey that was left from the soldiers’ spoil was 675,000 sheep, 3372,000 cattle, 3461,000 donkeys, 3532,000 virgins.

36The soldiers’ half was 337,500 sheep; 37the LORDv’s levy, 675.

38There were 36,000 cattle; the LORD’s levy, 72.

39There were 30,500 donkeys; the LORD’s levy, 61.

40There were 16,000 persons; the LORD’s levy, 32.

41Moses gave the LORD’s levy to Eleazar the priest. Num 31:25-41

42Israel’s half was 43337,500 sheep, 4436,000 cattle, 4530,500 donkeys, 46and 16,000 persons. 47From Israel’s half Moses took out one from every 50 people and animals, and gave them to the Levites that take care of the Tabernacle.

48The commanders of thousands and hundreds came to Moses,

49“We’ve counted the men who fought and not a one is missing. 50So, from what each man found, we’ve brought an offering to the LORD: articles of gold, armlets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and neck chains to atone for ourselves.”

51Moses and Eleazar took the gold and crafted articles, 52418¾ lbs 16,750 shekels worth. 53Each soldier had taken spoil. 54Moses and Eleazar brought the commanders’ gold to the Tent of Meeting as a memorial to Israel before the LORD. Num 31:42-54

Reuben and Gad Settle in Gilead

32:1Reuben and Gad had lots of livestock. When they saw that Jazer and Gilead had good grazing land, 2they spoke to Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the leaders of the community,

3“Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon—4land the LORD overthrew for Israel—is suitable for our livestock. 5If we’re pleasing to you, give us this land instead of having us cross the Jordan.”

6Moses said,

“Will your relatives go to war, and you sit here? 7Why discourage Israel from going to the land the LORD has given them? 8That’s what your fathers did when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to spy out the land. 9When they went to the Valley of Eshcol and saw the land, they discouraged Israel from going in. 10The LORD was angry that day and swore, 11‘No men that came up from Egypt 20 years and older will see the land I promised Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, because they wouldn’t follow me. 12Only Caleb the Kenizzite and Joshua son of Nun faithfully followed me.’ 13The LORD made Israel wander in the desert for 40 years till that generation died off. 14You’re replacing your parents as sinful people to anger the LORD toward Israel. 15If you turn aside from him, he’ll leave you in the desert. You’ll be responsible for destroying this nation.” Num 32:1-15

16They came to him and said,

“We’ll build corrals here for our livestock and towns for our children, 17but we’ll take up arms and go with Israel till we’ve brought them to their place. Our children will live in fortified towns because of the people still in the land. 18We won’t go home till everyone has received their inheritance. 19We won’t inherit with them on that side of the Jordan; our inheritance will lie here.”

Num 32:16-19

20Moses said,

“If you take up arms 21and cross the Jordan till the LORD 22has conquered the land, you’ll meet your obligations. 23If you don’t, be sure your sin will find you out. 24Build your towns, put up corrals, and do what you’ve promised.”

25“We will. 26Our little ones, wives, flocks, and cattle will stay in towns in Gilead. 27But we’ll cross over armed to fight like you’ve said.”

28Moses charged Eleazar, Joshua, and the leaders of Israel,

29“If Gad and Reuben cross the Jordan and help you conquer the land, give them Gilead. 30If they don’t, they’ll have possessions among you in Canaan.” [31-32] Num 32:20-32

33Moses gave to Gad, Reuben, and the Manasseh half-tribe the kingdoms of Sihon and Og, and the towns and territory around them. 34Gad rebuilt Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer, 35Atroth-Shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah, 36Beth-nimrah, and Beth-haran—fortified towns and corrals for sheep. 37Reuben rebuilt Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim, 38Nebo, and Baal-meon (new names), and Sibmah. They renamed the towns they built. 39The sons of Machir son of Manasseh went to Gilead and took it away from the Amorites. 40Moses gave them Gilead and they lived there. 41“Jair” son of Manasseh took its “towns” and called them Havvoth-jair. 42Nobah took Kenath and its villages and renamed it after himself. Num 32:33-42

Recounting Israel’s Journey

33:1These are the segments of the journey Israel took when they left Egypt. 2The LORD told Moses to write them down. 3They traveled from Rameses on the fifteenth day, first month, the day after Passover. They left right in front of the Egyptians 4while they were burying the firstborn that the LORD struck. The LORD also carried out judgments against their gods.

Num 33:1-4

5They left from Ramses to Succoth,

6to Etham on the edge of open country,

where they turned back,

7to Pi-hahiroth, in front of Baal-Zephon,

and camped near Migdol.

8They passed through the sea

to the Wilderness of Etham

for 3 days

They camped at Marah and

9Elim, where there were

12 springs and 70 palms trees.

10They camped by the Red Sea,

11then in the Wilderness of Sin,

12in Dophkah,

13Alush,

14in Rephidim, where there was

no water to drink.

15They camped in the Wilderness of Sinai,

16Kibroth-hattaavah,

17Hazeroth,

18Rithmah,

19Rimmon-perez,

20Libnah,

21Rissah,

22Kehelathah,

23Shepher,

24and Haradah,

25in Makheloth,

26Tahath,

27Terah,

28Mithkah

29and Hashmonah,

30in Maseroth

31and Bene-jaakan,

32in Hor-haggidgad,

33Jotbathah,

34Abronah,

35Ezion-geber,

36in the Wilderness of Zin (Kadesh),

37and at Mount Hor on the edge of Edom

Num 33:5-37

38The LORD told Aaron to go up to Mount Hor. He died the first day, fifth month, fortieth year after Israel left Egypt; 39he was 123. 40The Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev, heard Israel was coming.

41Israel went from Mount Hor

and camped in Zalmonah,

42then Punon,

43 Oboth,

44Iyeabarim (Iyim) on the border of Moab,

45at Dibon-gad,

46 Almon-diblathaim,

47the mountains of Abarim near Nebo,

48and in the plains of Moab

by the Jordan across from Jericho.

49They camped by the Jordan from Beth-jeshimoth to Abel-shittim on the plains of Moab.

Num 33:38-49

50-51The LORD told Moses to tell Israel there,

“When you cross the Jordan into Canaan, 52drive out the people, destroy their carved stones and molten images, and tear down their pagan shrines. 53Take the land and live in it because I’ve given it to you. 54You’ll inherit land by allotment per clan. Bigger clans will inherit more; the smaller ones will inherit less. Their allotments will fall within their tribe. 55If you don’t drive out the people, they’ll be pricks in your eyes and thorns in your sides and cause you trouble. 56I’ll end up doing to you what I intend to do to them.” Num 33:50-56

Boundaries of the Land

34:1-2The LORD told Moses to say to Israel,

“When you go into Canaan, 3your south border will run from the Wilderness of Zin alongside Edom from the end of the Dead Sea eastward. 4Your border will turn from the south to the ascent of Akrabbim and go on along to Zin. It will end south of Kadesh-barnea, go out to Hazaraddar, and on along to Azmon. 5The border will turn from Azmon to where the River of Egypt empties into the Mediterranean Sea. Num 34:1-5

6“Your west border will be the Mediterranean Sea.

7“Your north border will stretch from the Mediterranean Sea to Mount Hor, 8Lebo-hamath, Zedad, 9Ziphron, and end at Hazar-enan.

10“Your east border will run from Hazar-enan to Shepham 11down to Riblah on the east of Ain down to the slopes east of the Sea of Chinnereth. 12It will go down to the Jordan and on down to the Dead Sea.”

13Moses told Israel,

“That’s the land you’ll inherit by lot, land the LORD told you to give to the-nine-and-a-half tribes. 14-15Reuben, Gad, and the Manasseh half-tribe have received their inheritance 15beyond the Jordan.” Num 34:6-15

Leaders for Dividing the Land

16The LORD told Moses,

17“Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun will divide up the land. 18Name one leader from each tribe to divide it up:

19from Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh;

20from Simeon, Samuel son of Ammihud;

21from Benjamin, Elidad son of Chislon;

22from Dan, Bukki son of Jogli;

23from Joseph—Manasseh, Hanniel son of Ephod;

24 —Ephraim, Kemuel son of Shiphtan;

25from Zebulun, Elizaphan son of Parnach;

26from Issachar, Paltiel son of Azza;

27from Asher, Ahihud son of Shelomi;

28from Naphtali, Pedahel son of Ammihud.”

29The LORD commissioned those men to divide up Canaan for Israel. Num 34:16-29

Towns for the Levites

35:1In the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, the LORD said to Moses,

2“Tell Israel to give the Levites towns to live in, 3along with pastureland for their cattle, herds, and animals. 4The pastures will extend 1500ft out from the wall all around the city, 5a 3,000ft diameter of pastureland. 6Give the Levites 6 cities as refuge for a person to flee to that’s killed someone accidentally. 7Give them 42 other towns with their pastures to make 48 total. 8The towns you give them will be in proportion to the number of towns each tribe inherits.” Num 35:1-8

Cities of Refuge

9-10The LORD told Moses to say to Israel,

“When you cross the Jordan into Canaan, 11identify cities of refuge a person can flee to from killing someone accidentally. 12-13The 6 cities will serve as refuges from an avenger till the slayer can stand public trial: 143 cities beyond the Jordan and three in Canaan. 15They’ll serve Israelites, foreigners, and people living temporarily in Israel. Num 35:9-15

16“If a slayer kills someone with an iron instrument, it’s murder; execute the slayer. 17The same applies if the weapon is stone 18or wood. 19The avenger is to execute the murderer on the spot when they meet. 20If one person pushes another in hate, throws something from an ambush, 21or hits barehanded with enmity and kills the other, it’s murder. The avenger is to execute the murderer on the spot when they meet. Num 35:16-21

22“One person might push someone suddenly without enmity or throw something 23like a stone and hit the other accidentally. 24The community will decide between the slayer and the avenger by these ordinances. 25They’ll protect the slayer from the avenger by returning the slayer to the city of refuge till the high priest dies. 26If the slayer ventures outside the city, 27the avenger is not considered a murderer. 28The slayer should’ve stayed in the city till the high priest died. Then the slayer could have gone home. Num 35:22-28

29“These are permanent statutes wherever you live. 30On the testimony of two or more witnesses, execute whoever commits murder. One witness isn’t enough. 31Don’t take a ransom in place of execution 32or for someone that flees to a city of refuge so they can go home early before the high priest dies. 33Don’t defile the land you live in; blood defiles it. Don’t atone for land defiled by blood except by the blood of the one that shed it. 34Don’t defile the land you’re living in because I’m living in it with you.” Num 35:29-34

Women Heirs of Property

36:1The heads of clans came down from Gilead (son of Machir son of Manasseh son of Joseph) to Moses and Israel’s leaders. 2They said,

“The LORD told you to allot land to Israel for inheritance, and to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our relative to his daughters. 3But if they marry outside their tribe, their inheritance will move to the new tribe. 4When Israel’s Year of Jubilee comes, it will become permanent in the new tribe and lost from ours.”

5So from the LORD Moses said,

“Joseph’s descendants are raising a legitimate issue. 6Do this: the daughters of Zelophehad can marry anyone in their father’s tribe. 7Inheritance can’t move from tribe to tribe. 8Every daughter that inherits must marry in her tribe. 9Each tribe will retain its inheritance.”

10That’s what the daughters of Zelophehad did. 11Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah married their uncles’ sons; 12and their inheritance stayed in their father’s tribe.

13The LORD gave those commandments to Israel through Moses in the Plain of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho. Num 36:1-13

DEUTERONOMY

The Command to Leave Horeb

1:1Moses spoke to Israel in the open country east of the Jordan, in the Arabah across from Suph between Paran and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab. 2It takes 11 days to travel from Horeb/Sinai past Mount Seir to Kadesh-barnea. 3The first day, eleventh month, fortieth year, Moses told Israel everything the LORD had told him to give them. 4That was after he’d defeated Sihon, king of the Amorites, in Heshbon and Og, king of Bashan, in Ashtaroth and Edrei. 5East of the Jordan in Moab, Moses undertook to explain the Law. Deut 1:1-5

6“The LORD our God told us at Horeb/Sinai, ‘You’ve stayed long enough at this mountain. 7Go to the Amorites and their neighbors in the Arabah, the hill country, the western foothills, the Negev, the seacoast, the land of the Canaanites, and Lebanon as far as the Euphrates River. 8I’ve put the land in front of you. Go in and take over what I swore to give to your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and their descendants.’

Tribal Leaders Appointed

9“At that time, I told you, ‘I can’t handle the responsibility for you by myself. 10The LORD has multiplied you, and there are as many of you as stars in the sky. 11May he multiply you a thousand times and bless you like he promised, 12but I can’t handle the responsibility for you and your conflict by myself. 13Choose wise, insightful, experienced men from your tribes, and I’ll appoint them as your leaders.’ 14You answered, ‘That’s good.’ 15I took those wise, insightful men, and appointed them over thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens.

Deut 1:6-15

16“I instructed your judges, ‘Hear cases between citizens. Judge justly between them or the foreigners among them. 17Don’t show favoritism; hear least and greatest the same way. Don’t be afraid of people; it’s God’s judgment. Any case that’s too hard, bring to me. 18I’ve told you everything to do.’

Spies Sent Out

19“Then we left Horeb/Sinai and went through that terrible desert you saw on our way to the hill country of the Amorites. We came to Kadesh-barnea. 20I told you, ‘You’ve come to the hill country of the Amorites that the LORD is about to give us. 21Look, he has put the land in front of you. Take it over like he told you. Don’t be afraid or intimidated.’ 22Then you came and said to me, ‘Let’s send scouts ahead to look over the land, and report how to proceed against the towns we’ll enter.’ 23I liked that idea and took a man from each tribe. 24They went to the hill country and the Valley of Eschol and spied it out. 25They brought some fruit down to us and reported, ‘The land the LORD our God is about to give us is a good land.’ Deut 1:16-25

Israel’s Rebellion Against the LORD

26“But you wouldn’t go up. You rebelled against the LORD. 27You complained in your tents, ‘The LORD hates us. He brought us out of Egypt to deliver us to the Amorites. 28Where can we go up? Our relatives made our hearts melt when they said the people are bigger and taller than we are. The towns are large and fortified to the sky. They saw Anakim there.’ 29I told you, ‘Don’t be afraid of them. 30The LORD your God will go ahead of you and fight for you like you saw him do in Egypt. 31In the desert you saw how he carried you all the way here like a man carries his son.’ 32Despite that, you wouldn’t trust the One 33that goes ahead of you to find a place to camp and show you how to get there, the One that goes by fire at night and cloud by day. Deut 1:26-33

Israel’s Wanderings Decreed

34“What the LORD heard you say made him angry. He swore, 35‘None of you sinful people from this generation will see the good land I swore to give your ancestors. 36Only Caleb son of Jephunneh will see it. I’ll give him and his descendants the land he set foot on, because he’s followed me faithfully.’ 37The LORD was angry with me, too, as a lesson to you, ‘You won’t go in either. 38Your assistant, Joshua son of Nun, will go in. Encourage him; he’ll make Israel able to inherit the land. 39What’s more, yourpl little ones that you said would become prey, your offspring that don’t know good from bad, will go in. I’ll give it to them; they’ll take it over. 40You turn around and head out for the desert by the Red Sea.’

Deut 1:34-40

41“Then you said, ‘We’ve sinned against the LORD. We’ll go up and fight like he commanded.’ Every man put on his weapons and thought it would be easy to go up to the hill country.

42“The LORD said to tell them, ‘Don’t go up to fight. I’m not with you; they’ll defeat you.’ 43But you ignored him. You acted on your own to go up to the hill country. 44The Amorites came out like bees and chased you and crushed you from Seir to Hormah. 45You came back and cried in the LORD’s presence, but he ignored you. 46So you stayed at Kadesh a long time. Deut 1:41-46

Israel’s Wanderings Remembered

2:1“We turned around and set out for the desert toward the Red Sea like the LORD instructed me, and we circled Mount Seir for a long time. 2He told me, 3’You’ve circled this mountain long enough; turn north. 4Tell the people, “Go through the territory of your relatives, Esau’s descendants, who live in Seir. 5Don’t stir them up; I won’t give you a foot of their land. I’ve given Mount Seir to Esau. 6Buy food and water from them so you can eat and drink. 7The LORD has blessed you in everything you’ve done. He has known your wanderings through this big desert. He’s been with you 40 years. You haven’t lacked anything.”’

Deut 2:1-7

8“So we went past Esau’s descendants in Seir, away from the Arabah Road, away from Elath and Ezion-geber. We turned and passed through the Wilderness of Moab. 9The LORD told me, ‘Don’t harass Moab or stir them up to war, because I won’t give you any of their land. I’ve given Ar to Lot’s descendants. [10The Emim lived there before, a people as big, numerous, and tall as the Anakim. 11Like the Anakim they’re considered Rephaim, but the Moabites call them Emim. 12The Horites had previously lived in Seir, but Esau’s descendants destroyed them and replaced them, like Israel did to the land the LORD gave them.] 13Cross Wadi Zered.’ 14It took 38 years to get from Kadesh-barnea across Wadi Zered. That whole generation of soldiers died—like the LORD swore. 15Besides, he opposed them, destroying them from inside the camp.

16“When those soldiers had perished, 17the LORD told me, 18‘Cross over Ar, the border of Moab today. 19When you get across from Ammon, don’t harass them; I won’t give you any Ammonite land. I’ve given it to Lot’s descendants. [20It’s regarded as the land of Rephaim as well because they lived in it before. The Ammonites call them Zamzummin, 21a people as big, numerous, and tall as the Anakim, but the LORD destroyed them in front of the Ammonites. They drove them out and replaced them, 22like he did for Esau’s descendants in Seir. He destroyed the Horites. They drove them out and have settled in their place till now. 23The Philistines came from Crete and destroyed the Avvim that lived in villages as far as Gaza and lived in their place.]

Defeat of King Sihon

24Pass through Wadi Arnon. I’ve given you Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land. Start taking it over and confront him in battle. 25Today I’m beginning to put the fear of you on nations all around so when they hear about you, they’ll tremble with dread.’ Deut 2:8-25

26“I sent ambassadors from the Wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon with offers of peace, 27‘Let me go through your land. I’ll stay on the highway. 28Sell me food and water. Just let me go through on foot—29like the descendants of Esau and the Moabites did—till I cross the Jordan to the land the LORD is giving us.’ 30Sihon wouldn’t let us. The LORD had hardened his spirit and made him stubborn to deliver him to you. 31He told me, ‘I’ve started to deliver Sihon and his land to you. Start occupying it.’

32“Sihon and his people came out to fight us at Jahaz. 33The LORD delivered him, his sons, and his people to us. 34We captured his towns, and completely wiped out their men, women, and children. 35We just took the animals as spoil. 36From Aroer on the edge of Arnon valley and from the city that’s in the valley, all the way to Gilead no city was too strong for us. The LORD delivered them to us. 37You didn’t go near the land of the Ammonites—along Wadi Jabbok and the towns in the hill country—or wherever else the LORD prohibited.

Deut 2:26-37

Defeat of King Og

3:1“Then we turned and went up the highway to Bashan. Og king of Bashan and his people came out to battle at Edrei. 2But the LORD told me, ‘Don’t be afraid of him. I’ll deliver him, his people, and his land to you. Do what you did to Sihon.’ 3He delivered Og and his people to us. We didn’t leave any survivors.

4“We captured all 60 of Og’s towns, the whole region of Argob, his kingdom in Bashan. 5They were fortified towns with high walls, gates, and bars—besides a great many country villages. 6We destroyed them—men, women, and children—in every city, 7and took the animals and the spoil. 8We took the land of two Amorite kings east of the Jordan from Wadi Arnon to Mount Hermon. [9Sidonians call Hermon Sirion; the Amorites call it Senir.] 10We took all the towns on the plateau, all Gilead and Bashan as far as Salecah and Edrei. [11Og was the only Rephaim left. He had an iron bed 6 x 13½ft. It’s in Rabbah with the descendants of Ammon.] Deut 3:1-11

Division of the Land East of the Jordan

12“We took over that land. I gave Reuben and Gad the territory from Aroer by Wadi Arnon and half the hill country of Gilead and its towns. 13The rest of Gilead and all Bashan I gave to the Manasseh half-tribe—the whole region of Argob. [All Bashan is called The Land of Rephaim. 14Jair son of Manasseh took the whole region of Argob as far as the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites. He called Bashan by his own name. It’s still Havvoth-jair.] 15I gave Gilead to Machir. 16I gave Reuben and Gad the territory from Gilead to the middle of the Arnon valley. Their territory continued to Wadi Jabbok, the border of the Ammonites. 17I also gave them the Arabah, with the Jordan for a border from Chinnereth to the Sea of Arabah [the Dead Sea] at the foot of Pisgah to the east.

18“I told you at that time, ‘The LORD your God has given you this land. You trained soldiers, cross over armed, with your relatives, the people of Israel. 19Your wives, little ones, and livestock—I know you have lots of livestock—can stay in the towns I’ve given you. 20Stay there till the LORD gives your fellow citizens peace like he’s given you, and they take over the land west of the Jordan. Then you can go back to your possession.’

Moses Forbidden to Cross the Jordan

21I told Joshua, ‘You saw what the LORD did to those two kings. That’s what he’ll do to all the kingdoms you invade. 22Don’t be afraid of them. He’ll fight for you.’ Deut 3:12-22

23“I also pleaded with the LORD, 24‘You’ve begun to show me how great and strong you are. What God is there in the sky or on earth that can demonstrate such power? 25Let me cross over and see the fair land beyond the Jordan, the good hill country and Lebanon.’ 26But he was angry with me out of regard for you. ‘That’s enough! Don’t bring it up again. 27Go to the top of Pisgah and look in every direction. You’re not going to cross the Jordan. 28Commission Joshua, encourage him and strengthen him. He’ll lead the people across and give them the land you’ll see.’ 29We stayed in the valley across from Beth-peor. Deut 3:23-29

Moses Commands Israel to Obey

4:1“Listen, Israel, to the statutes and case laws I’m teaching you so you can take over the land. 2Don’t add to or take away from what I’m telling you. 3You’ve seen what the LORD did to you at Baal-peor: he destroyed everyone that followed Baal-peor. 4But every one of you is alive today that held onto the LORD your God. 5I’ve taught you statutes and case laws like the LORD commanded me so you’d do them in the land you’re entering. 6Keep them; that’s your wisdom and understanding in front of the nations that will hear those statues and say, ‘This great nation has wisdom and understanding.’ 7What great nation has a god as near it as the LORD is when we call on him? 8What great nation has statutes and case laws as good as this Law I’m setting in front of you today?

9“Be careful not to forget what you’ve seen or let those memories ever leave your heart. Tell your sons and grandsons about them. 10Think back to when you stood in front of the LORD at Horeb/Sinai. He told me to gather you so you could hear what he was saying and learn to respect him all your lives and teach your children. 11You stood at the foot of the mountain, and it burned as high as the sky—black clouds and dense darkness. 12You heard him speak to you out of the fire, but you didn’t see any shape. 13He declared the covenant to you, the Ten Commandments he wrote on two stone tablets. 14He told me then to teach you statutes and case laws so you’d do them in the land. Deut 4:1-14

Idolatry Forbidden

15“Watch carefully 16not to do something corrupt by making a carved image of anything male or female, 17animal on land, bird in the sky, 18fish in the water, or what crawls on the ground. 19Don’t gaze at the sun, moon, and countless stars, and get drawn away into worshiping and serving what the LORD your God has allotted to everyone under the sky. 20He brought you out of the iron furnace (Egypt) to be his own people like you are now. [21] 22I’ll die here, but you’ll cross over and take possession of the land. 23Watch that you don’t forget his covenant and make a carved image of anything. He forbids it. 24He’s a consuming fire, an exclusive God. Deut 4:15-24

25“Later on, if your descendants make an idol and anger the LORD, 26you’ll soon perish. I call earth and sky to witness against you today. You won’t live there very long. 27He’ll scatter you among the nations, and there won’t be many of you where he drives you. 28You’ll serve gods there made out of wood and stone, gods that can’t see, hear, eat, or smell. 29But you’ll look to the LORD your God from there, and you’ll find him if you look with all your heart and soul. 30When you’re in distress and those things come on you later, you’ll come back to him. 31He’s a merciful God. He won’t fail you, destroy you, or forget the covenant he swore with your ancestors.

Only the LORD Is God

32“Indeed, ask about any earlier time since God created people. Ask about any other place from one end of the sky to the other. Has anything like this ever happened? Has anything like this ever been heard of? 33Has any people heard God speak out of fire like you have, and lived? 34Has any god taken a nation from inside another nation by trials, signs, and wonders; by warfare, a strong hand and outstretched arm; by great terrifying displays like the LORD did for you in Egypt right in front of you? 35Those things happened so you could know the LORD is God. There’s no god but him. 36From the sky he let you hear his voice to discipline you. On the earth he let you see his great fire and hear him speak out of it. 37Because he loved your ancestors, he chose their descendants and brought you out of Egypt by his great power. 38He’s driving out nations bigger and stronger than you, and giving you their land. 39Take it to heart then that the LORD is God in heaven above and on earth below. There isn’t any other. 40Keep his statutes and commandments that I’m giving you. Then things will go well for you and your descendants, and you’ll live a long time in the land he’s giving you permanently.” Deut 4:25-40

Cities of Refuge

41Then Moses set aside three towns east of the Jordan 42where a person who accidentally killed someone could flee to and live: 43Bezar in the open country on the plateau for Reuben, Ramoth in Gilead for Gad, and Golan in Bashan for Manasseh.

44That’s the Law Moses set in front of Israel—45the testimonies, statutes, and ordinances he gave them when they left Egypt. 46He did that beyond the Jordan in the valley near Beth-peor in the land of 47the two kings that ruled the Amorites east of the Jordan. 48Their land stretched from Aroer on the edge of Arnon valley to Mount Sion (Hermon). 49Their territories went all along the Arabah on the east side of the Jordan south to the Sea of Arabah at the foot of Pisgah.

Deut 4:41-49

The Ten Commandments

5:1Then Moses called Israel together,

“Listen to these statutes and ordinances so you can learn them and observe them carefully. 2The LORD our God made a covenant with us at Horeb/Sinai. 3He didn’t make that covenant with our ancestors, but with us. 4Out of the fire he spoke to you directly at the mountain 5while I stood between him and you. I stood there to tell you what he said, because you were afraid of the fire and didn’t go up the mountain. He said,

6‘I am the LORD your God that brought you out of slavery in Egypt.

7‘Do not havef any god but me.

8‘Do not makef a carved image, any likeness of what is in the sky, on the ground, or in the water lower than the ground 9to worshipf or servef, because I am an exclusive God. I visit the consequences of parents’ sins on their descendants for three or four generations that hate me. 10I am kind to thousands who love me and obey me.

11‘Do not usef my name ‘the LORD’ your God as a byword. I will punish whoever does that.

12‘Observe the Sabbath. Set it apart like I’ve commanded. 13Workf six days, 14but the seventh day rest to me your God. Do not workf that day—you, your son or daughter, male or female servant, ox, donkey, cattle, foreigner among you. 15Rememberf that you were slaves in Egypt, and I brought you out with a strong hand and outstretched arm. That is why I have commanded you to observe the Sabbath.

16‘Honor your parents so you can live a long time and things will go well for you in the land I your God am giving you.

17‘Do not commit murderf.

18‘Do not commitf adultery.

19‘Do not stealf.

20‘Do not lief about other people.

21‘Do not covetf someone else’s wife, his house, field, male servant, ox, donkey, or anything else.’ Deut 5:1-21

22“With a loud voice the LORD said that to your whole assembly at the mountain out of the fire, cloud, and dense darkness. He didn’t add anything else. He wrote it on two stone tablets and gave them to me. 23You heard him speak out of the blackness while the mountain was burning. The leaders and elders in your tribes came to me, 24‘The LORD our God has shown us how great and glorious he is. We’ve heard him speak out of the fire. We’ve seen him speak to people, but they still live. 25But why should we die? This great fire will burn us up. If we hear him speak anymore, it’ll kill us. 26Who ever heard the living God speak out of fire like we have, and lived? 27You approach him and hear what he says. Then tell us, and we’ll do it.’

28“The LORD told me, ‘I’ve heard what they said. They’ve done well in saying it. 29Oh that they had a heart to respect me and keep my commandments so it would be well with them and their descendants forever! 30Tell them to go back home. 31But you stand here with me so I can tell you the commandments, statutes, and case laws you’re to teach them.’ 32Do exactly what he says. Don’t stray away from it. 33That way you’ll live, things will go well for you, and you’ll occupy the land a long time. Deut 5:22-33

Call to Commitment

6:1“The LORD your God told me to teach you those statutes 2so you and your descendants would respect him and keep them your whole life and live a long time. 3Do them, Israel, so things will go well for you, and you’ll multiply in a land flowing with milk and honey.

4“Listen, Israel, the LORD is our God, the LORD only. 5Love him with all your heart, soul, and strength. 6Keep in mind the things I’m commanding you. 7Teach them diligently to your children. Talk about them when you’re sitting at home, walking down the road, lying down, or getting up. 8Tie them like signs on your hand and make them like frontlets on your forehead. 9Write them on your gates and doorposts. Deut 6:1-9

10“The land the LORD is taking you to has big, splendid cities you didn’t build, 11houses full of good things you didn’t put there, hewn cisterns you didn’t dig, vineyards and olive trees you didn’t plant. When you eat and are satisfied, 12make sure you don’t forget him. 13Respect him only. Worship him and swear by him. 14Don’t follow the gods of people around you. The LORD is an exclusive God. 15If you follow other gods, his anger will flare at you and wipe you off the earth.

16“Don’t test the LORD like you did at Massah. 17Diligently keep his statutes. 18-19Do what he considers right and good so things will go well, so he’ll drive out your enemies and you’ll take over the good land. 20When your children ask you what his statutes mean, 21tell them, ‘We were Pharaoh’s slaves in Egypt, and he brought us out with a tremendous demonstration of power. 22He showed us great terrifying signs and wonders against Egypt, Pharaoh, and his household. 23He brought us out to give us this land. 24He told us to observe these statutes, to always respect him for our own good, for our survival, as is the case today. 25We’ll be good if we observe everything he’s commanded.’ Deut 6:10-25

Driving Out the Nations

7:1“The LORD will take you to the land and clear out the Hittites, Girgashites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, Jebusites—seven nations bigger and stronger than you. 2He’ll deliver them to you, defeat them, and destroy them. Don’t make treaties with them or show them mercy 3or intermarry with them. 4They’ll turn your children away from following him to serving other gods. His anger will flare and soon destroy you. 5Tear down their altars, smash their sacred pillars, cut down their Asherah poles, burn their carved images.

6“You’ve been set aside to the LORD your God. Out of all the earth’s nations, he chose you as his own. 7He didn’t set his love on you because you were bigger than other nations; you were few compared to them. 8Because he loved you and wanted to keep his oath to your ancestors, he brought you out with power and redeemed you from slavery under Pharaoh. 9Know then that the LORD is faithful and keeps covenant and kindness to a thousand generations that love him and obey him. 10But he repays directly people that hate him. He won’t delay repaying them with destruction. 11Keep the commandments, statutes, and case laws I’m commanding you. Deut 7:1-11

12“If you keep these case laws, he’ll keep you with his covenant and kindness. 13He’ll love you, bless you, and multiply you. He’ll bless your offspring and what your ground produces—grain, new wine, olive oil. He’ll increase your herd and the young in your flock. 14You’ll be more blessed than any other nation. No male or female will be sterile among you or your livestock. 15He’ll keep you from getting sick and not put on you any of the diseases you knew in Egypt. He’ll lay them on people that hate you. 16You’ll consume the nations he delivers to you. Don’t show them any mercy or serve their gods. That would be a snare to you.

17“If you say to yourselves, ‘These nations are bigger than we are. How can we overtake them?’ 18You don’t have to be afraid of them. Remember what the LORD did to Pharaoh and to Egypt. 19Remember the great trials you saw, the signs and wonders, the strong hand and outstretched arm he delivered you with. That’s what he’ll do to the nations you’re afraid of. 20He’ll send hornets after them till they perish who hide from you. 21A great, awesome God is among you. 22He’ll clear them away little by little. You won’t be able to put an end to them right away. Wild animals would take over. 23He’ll deliver them by throwing them into confusion till you destroy them. 24He’ll deliver their kings to you to wipe out. Nobody will be able to resist you. 25Burn the carved images of their gods. Don’t covet the silver or gold that’s on them or take it for yourselves. It would be a snare to you, and it’s detestable to the LORD. 26Don’t bring anything detestable into your house to serve as a devoted thing. Detest it completely; abhor it utterly.

Deut 7:12-26

Call Not to Forget the LORD

8:1“Do every commandment I’m giving you today, so you’ll live and multiply, and take over the land. 2Remember the way the LORD led you in the desert those 40 years to humble you. He was testing you to see if you were committed to obeying him. 3He let you get hungry, then fed you with manna, which you and your ancestors had never seen. He made you understand that a person doesn’t live by bread alone, but by everything the LORD says. 4All that time your clothes didn’t wear out; your feet didn’t swell. 5He was disciplining you like a father disciplines his children. 6So follow his commandments and respect him. 7He’s taking you to a good land with streams and fountains, springs flowing in the hills and valleys. 8It’s a land of wheat and barley; grapevines, fig trees, and pomegranates; olive oil and honey; 9a land where there’s plenty of food, whose stones contain iron, whose hills have copper you can mine. 10When you eat till you’re full, bless the LORD for the good land he’s given you. Deut 8:1-10

11“Make sure you don’t forget him or neglect his commandments, ordinances, and statutes. 12That way you’ll eat till you’re full, build nice houses and live in them, 13have herds and flocks that multiply, and increase your silver and gold along with everything else you have. 14Then you won’t get proud and forget about him. 15He led you through the big, terrible desert, its poisonous snakes and scorpions, its thirsty ground with no water. He brought water out of flint rock. 16He fed you manna to test you and humble you, to do you good in the end. 17Otherwise, you might say to yourselves that your own power and strength have created this wealth. 18Remember that he’s giving you the opportunity to create wealth in confirmation of his covenant. 19If you ever forget him and go after other gods, I’m telling you today, you’ll certainly perish 20like the nations he’ll make perish in front of you. Deut 8:11-20

Victory by God’s Power

9:1“Israel, you’re crossing the Jordan now to take over nations bigger and stronger than you, to take over big cities fortified to the sky, 2to take over people big and tall, the Anakim you’ve heard people say about, ‘Who can stand up to the descendants of Anak?’

3“Understand that it’s the LORD your God who’s crossing over ahead of you like a consuming fire. He’ll conquer and destroy them so you can drive them out quickly.

4“When he drives them out, don’t tell yourselves it’s because of your goodness that he brought you to this land. Instead, it’s because of their sinfulness that he drove them out. 5It’s not that you’re godly, but that they’re sinful. He’s confirming his oath to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

6“It’s not your goodness; you’re stubborn. Deut 9:1-6

The Gold Calf

7Don’t forget how you’ve provoked the LORD in the desert. From the time you left Egypt, you’ve been rebellious toward him. 8Even at Horeb/Sinai you provoked him. He was so angry with you he was ready to destroy you. 9When I went up on the mountain to receive the stone tablets of his covenant with you, I stayed there 40 days and nights without eating or drinking. 10He gave me the tablets he wrote that contained everything he’d told you out of the fire at your assembly. 11At the end of the 40 days, he gave them to me, 12‘Quick, go down. Your people have acted corruptly. They’ve turned aside so soon from what I commanded and made themselves a molten image. 13I’ve seen how stubborn they are. 14Stand aside so I can destroy them and erase their name. I’ll make a nation out of you that’s bigger and stronger than they are.’

15“I came down from the burning mountain with the two tablets in my hands. 16I saw you’d really sinned against him and made a molten calf. 17I threw the tablets down and shattered them in front of you. 18I fell down to the LORD as at the first for 40 days and nights. I didn’t eat or drink anything because your sin stirred him up. 19I was afraid his anger was going to destroy you, but he listened to me that time too. 20He was angry enough with Aaron to destroy him; so I prayed for him at the same time. 21I burned the sinful calf you’d made, pulverized it, ground it up, and threw the dust into the creek that was running down from the mountain. Deut 9:7-21

22“Again at Taberah, Massah, and Kibroth-hattaavah you provoked him. 23When he sent you from Kadesh-barnea to go up and take over the land he’d given you, you wouldn’t listen or trust him. 24You’ve kept rebelling since I first knew you.

25“I fell down to him for 40 days and nights because he said he’d destroy you. 26I prayed, ‘Lord GOD, don’t destroy your people, the permanent possession you redeemed with your greatness, the nation you brought out of Egypt by your power. 27Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Don’t just look at these people’s stubbornness and sin. 28Otherwise, the country you brought us from will say, “The LORD took them out to kill them in the desert. He hated them and couldn’t take them to the land he’d promised them.” 29But they’re your people, your inheritance that you brought out with your great power and outstretched arm.’

Deut 9:22-29

The Second Stone Tablets

10:1“At that time, the LORD said, ‘Carve out your own two stone tablets like the first ones, come up to me on the mountain, and make a wooden Ark. 2I’ll write on the tablets what was on the ones you shattered. Put them in the Ark.’ 3I made an Ark out of acacia wood and hewed out two stone tablets like the first ones and carried them up the mountain. 4He wrote the Ten Commandments on them that he’d given you on the mountain out of the fire when you assembled. He gave them to me. 5I came down and put the tablets in the Ark, and there they are.”

Deut 10:1-5

[6The Israelites set out from Beeroth Benejaakan to Moserah. Aaron died and was buried there, and his son Eleazar began to serve as priest. 7From there they set out for Gudgodah, then to Jotbathah, a land full of streams. 8At that time, the LORD set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the Ark, to stand in his presence, to serve him, and bless in his name till now. 9That’s why Levi doesn’t have a territory with his kin. The LORD is his inheritance—like the LORD your God told him.]

10“I stayed on the mountain 40 days and nights like the firs t time. The LORD LORD listened to me that time, too, and didn’t destroy you. 11He said, ‘Go on with your journey ahead of the people so they can take over the land.’

Fear the LORD

12“Now, Israel, what does the LORD require from you but to respect him, follow his ways, love him, serve him with all your heart and soul, 13and keep his commandments and statutes for your own good? 14The sky and highest heaven, the earth and everything in it belong to him. 15Yet he set his affection on your ancestors and chose their descendants above all the other nations, as it is now. 16Circumcise your heart and don’t stiffen your neck. 17He is the God of gods and Lord of lords, the great, strong, awesome God that doesn’t show favoritism or take bribes. 18He carries out justice for orphans and widows, and loves foreigners by giving them food and clothes. 19So love foreigners because you were foreigners in Egypt. 20Respect the LORD, serve him, hold onto him, swear by him. 21He’s your praise and your God, who has done for you the great, awesome things you’ve seen. 22Your ancestors went down to Egypt 70 people total. He’s made you as countless as the stars. Deut 10:6-22

Love and Obey the LORD

11:1“Love the LORD and always keep his ordinances. 2I’m not speaking to your sons today. They haven’t seen his discipline, his greatness, his strong hand and outstretched arm; 3his signs and works against Pharaoh, his country, 4his army, its horses and chariots. He made the Red Sea overwhelm them when they chased you. 5Your children didn’t see what he did to you in the desert before you got here. 6They didn’t see what he did to Dathan and Abiram, Eliab’s sons, when the ground swallowed them, their families, tents, and everything living with them. 7But you have seen his great work.

8“Keep every commandment I’m giving you so you’ll be strong enough to take over the land, 9so you’ll live a long time in that land flowing with milk and honey. 10That land is not like Egypt, where you sowed your seed and watered it by hand like a vegetable garden. 11The land you’re entering has hills and valleys that soak up rain, 12a land the LORD takes care of and watches over year around.

Deut 11:1-12

13“If you’ll love him and serve him with all your heart and soul, 14he’ll give you the autumn and spring rains so you can harvest your grain, new wine, and olive oil. 15He’ll grow grass in your pastures for your livestock, and you’ll eat till you’re satisfied. 16Don’t let your hearts deceive you into serving other gods. 17His anger will flare at you, and he’ll stop the sky from raining and the ground from growing crops, and you’ll soon perish.

18“Impress these things on your heart and soul, tie them to your hand, wear them on your forehead. 19Teach them to your children. Talk about them when you’re sitting at home, walking down the road, lying down, or getting up. 20Write them on your gates and doorposts 21so you and your children will flourish in the land for as long as the sky’s above the earth. 22If you keep these commandments carefully, 23the LORD will drive out the nations. You’ll take over nations bigger and stronger than you. 24Everywhere you step you’ll own.
