They went by way of the Arabah. 5But the army chased the king and overtook him in the plains by Jericho, and his whole army scattered. 6They captured him and took him to the king of Babylon at Riblah, and he passed sentence on him. 7They executed Zedekiah’s sons in front of him and then put out his eyes. They bound him with bronze restraints and took him to Babylon.

8The seventh day, fifth month, nineteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar, Nebuzaradan, commander of the guard and an official of the king, came to Jerusalem. 9He burned the LORD’s Temple, the king’s palace, and all the houses in Jerusalem, including every important building. 10The Babylonian army tore down the walls around Jerusalem. 11He exiled the rest of the people in the city, the deserters, and the rest of the population. 12He left some of the very poor to take care of the vineyards and fields. 2 Kg 25:1-12

13The Babylonians broke to pieces the bronze pillars, the stands, and the bronze sea that were in the LORD’s Temple, and carried the bronze to Babylon. 14They took away the pots, shovels, snuffers, spoons, and bronze items used in the Temple service. 15The captain of the guard took away the firepans and basins, what was fine gold and silver, 16the two pillars, the sea, and the stands Solomon had made for the Temple; the bronze from these was more than they could weigh. 17The two pillars were bronze plated 27ft tall. Their capitals were 4½ft high with a bronze network and pomegranates all the way around.

18The commander of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, Zephaniah the second priest, the three officers of the Temple, 191 official that oversaw the soldiers, 5 of the king’s advisers found in the city; the secretary for the commander of the army, who mustered the common people; and 60 men found in the city. 20He took them to the king of Babylon at Riblah, 21who executed them there in Hamath. Judah was in exile from its land.

22Nebuchadnezzar appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan as governor for the people he left in the country. 23When the commanders of the forces and their men heard it, they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah: Ishmael son of Nethaniah, Johanan son of Kareah, Seraiah son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, Jaazaniah son of the Maacathite, and their men. 24Gedaliah swore to them and their men, “Don’t be afraid of the Babylonians. Live in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and you’ll be okay.” 2 Kg 25:13-24

25But in the seventh month, Ishmael son of Nethaniah son of Elishama from the royal family, came with ten men and struck Gedaliah down. He died along with the Jews and Babylonians that were with him in Mizpah. 26Then the people, least and greatest, and the commanders of the forces went to Egypt for fear of the Babylonians.

Zedekiah Rules in Judah

27The twenty-seventh day, twelfth month, thirty-seventh year of Jehoiachin’s exile, Evil-merodach, king of Babylon, in his first year, released him from prison. 28He spoke graciously to him and set his throne above the other kings in Babylon. 29Jehoiachin changed out of his prison clothes and had his meals in the king’s presence the rest of his life. 30The king gave him a regular serving each day. 2 Kg 25:25-30

1 CHRONICLES

1:1Adam father of Seth father of Enosh father of 2Kenan father of Mahalalel father of Jared father of 3Enoch father of Methuselah father of Lamech father of 4Noah father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

5The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, Tiras

6The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Diphath, Togarmah;

7the sons of Javan: Elisha, Tarshish, Kittim, Rodanim;

8The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, Canaan

9The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, Sabteca.

The sons of Raamah were Sheba, Dedan;

10Cush was father of Nimrod, a great man in the world.

11The sons of Mizraim were the people of Lud, Anam, Lehab, Naphtuh, 12Pathrus, Casluh, where the Philistines came from, and Caphtor;

13The sons of Canaan were Sidon, his firstborn; Heth, 14the Jebusites, Amorites,

Girgashites, 15Hivites, Arkites, Sinites, 16Arvadites, Zemarites, Hamathites;

1 Ch 1:1-16

17The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech

18The son of Arpachshad was Shelah father of Eber.

19Eber had two sons: Peleg (during his life the earth was divided) and Joktan.

20Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

21Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah, 22Ebal, Abimael, Sheba, 23Ophir,

Havilah, and Jobab. All those were the sons of Joktan.

24Shem was father of Arpachshad father of Shelah father of 25Eber father of Peleg

father of Reu father of 26Serug father of Nahor father of Terah father of 27Abram (Abraham). 1 Ch 1:17-27

28The sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael

29These are their genealogies: Ishmael’s firstborn was Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel,

Mibsam, 30Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema, 31Jetur, Naphish, and

Kedemah.

32The sons by Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: Zimram, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak,

and Shuah.

The sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan.

33The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah.

All those were the descendants of Keturah.

34Abraham was the father of Isaac father of Esau and Israel.

35The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah

36The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and

Amalek

37The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah 1 Ch 1:28-37

38The sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan

39The sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam; Lotan’s sister was Timna.

40The sons of Shobal: Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam

The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah

41The son of Anah: Dishon

The sons of Dishon: Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran

42The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Jaakan

The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran 1 Ch 1:38-42

43The kings that ruled in Edom before Israel had a king

Bela was son of Beor; his city was Dinhabah.

44When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah of Bozrah became king.

45When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites became king.

46When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the field of Moah,

became king. His city was Avith.

47When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah became king.

48When Samlah died, Shaul of Rehoboth by the Euphrates River became king.

49When Shaul died, Baal-hanan son of Achbor became king.

50When Baal-hanan died, Hadad became king. His city was Pai; his wife was Mehetabel

daughter of Matred daughter of Mezahab.

51Then Hadad died.

The chiefs of Edom were Timna, Aliah, Jetheth, 52Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon, 53Kenaz, Teman,

Mibzar, 54Magdiel, Iram. 1 Ch 1:43-54

2:1The sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun, 2Dan, Joseph, Benjamin,

Naphtali, Gad, and Asher

3The sons of JUDAH: Er, Onan, and Shelah by Bath-shua the Canaanitess

Er, Judah’s firstborn, was sinful; so the LORD took his life.

4Tamar Judah’s daughter-in-law bore him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all.

5The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.

6The sons of Zerah were Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara—five.

(7The son of Carmi was Achar, the troubler of Israel, who violated the ban.)

8The son of Ethan was Azariah. 1 Ch 2:1-8

9The sons of Hezron were Jerahmeel, Ram, Chelubai, and Caleb.

10Ram was the father of Amminadab father of Nahshon, leader of

the sons of Judah.

11Nahshon was the father of

Salma father of

12Boaz father of

Obed father of

13Jesse father of Eliab, then Abinadab, then Shimea,

14then Nethanel, then Raddai, 15then Ozem, then

David 16and sisters Zeruiah and Abigail.

Zeruiah bore Abshai, Joab, and Asahel.

17Abigail bore Amasa by Jether the

Ishmaelilte.

18Caleb son of Hezron had sons by Azubah his wife

and by Jerioth. Her sons were Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.

19When Azubah died, he married Ephrath mother of Hur.

20Hur was father of Uri father of Bezalel.

21Afterward Hezron married the daughter of Machir (father of

Gilead).

He married her when he was 60 and she bore Segub.

22Segub was father of Jair, who governed 23 towns in

Gilead. 23But Geshur and Aram captured the towns

of Jair from them along with Kenath and its 60

surrounding villages. Those were sons of Machir

Avi-Gilead.

24After the death of Hezron in Caleb-ephrathah, Abijah his wife

bore him Ashhur father of Tekoa. 1 Ch 2:9-24

25The sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron were Ram, then

Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah. 26Jerahmeel had another wife,

Atarah mother of Onam.

27The sons of Ram, Jerahmeel’s firstborn, were Maaz,

Jamin, and Eker.

28The sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada.

The sons of Shammai were Nadab and Abishur.

29Abishur’s wife was Abihail mother of

Ahban and Molid.

30The sons of Nadab were Seled and

Appaim; Seled died without sons.

31The son of Appaim was Ishi

father of Sheshan father of Ahlai.

32The sons of Jada brother of Shammai were Jether

and Jonathan. Jether died without sons.

33The sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza.

Those were the descendants of Jarahmeel. 1 Ch 2:25-33

34Sheshan had only daughters. He had an Egyptian servant named Jarha. 35He gave his daughter to Jarha in marriage, and she bore 36Attai father of Nathan father of 37Zabad father of Ephlal father of 38Obed father of Jehu father of 39Azariah father of Helez father of 40Eleasah father of Sismai father of 41Shallum father of Jekamiah father of Elishama. 1 Ch 2:34-41

42The sons of Caleb, brother of Jerahmeel, were Mesha, his

firstborn, father of Ziph father of Mareshah father of Hebron.

43The sons of Hebron were Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and

Shema.

44Shema was father of Raham father of Jorkeam.

Rekem was father of Shammai 45father of Maon

father of Beth-zur. 1 Ch 2:42-45

46Caleb’s concubine Ephah bore Haran, Moza, and Gazez. Haran was father of Gazez. 47The sons of Jahdai were

Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.

48Caleb’s concubine Maacah bore Sheber and Tirhanah, 49as well

as Shaaph father of Madmannah and Sheva father of

Machbena and Gibea. Caleb’s daughter was

Achsah. 50Those were the sons of Caleb.

The sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, were

Shobal, founder of Kiriath-jearim, 51Salma, founder

of Bethlehem, and Hareph father of Beth-gader.

52Shobal, founder of Kiriath-jearim, was father of Haroeh, half of the Manahathites, 53and the families in Kiriath-jearim: the Ithrites, Puthites, Shumathites, and Mishraites; from them came the Zorathites and Eshtaolites.

54The sons of Salma were Bethlehem and the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab, and half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.

55The families of scribes that lived at Jabez were the Tirathites, Shimeathites, and Sucathites. Those are the Kenites that came from Hammath, father of the House of Rechab. 1 Ch 2:46-55

3:1These were David’s six sons born in Hebron:

the firstborn was Ammon by Ahinoam the Jezreelitess;

the second was Daniel by Abigail the Carmelitess;

2the third was Absalom son of Maacah daughter of Talmai, king of Geshur;

the fourth was Adonijah son of Haggith;

3the fifth was Shephatiah by Abital;

the sixth was Ithream by his wife Eglah.

4He ruled in Hebron for 7½ years and in Jerusalem for 33.

5These were born in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon—four by Bath-shua daughter of Ammiel; 6and Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet, 7Nogah, Nepheg, and Japhia, 8Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet—nine. 9All those were sons of David besides the sons of concubines. Tamar was their sister. 1 Ch 3:1-9

10Solomon’s son was Rehoboam father of Abijah father of Asa father of Jehoshaphat father of 11Joram father of Ahaziah father of Joash father of 12Amaziah father of Azariah father of Jotham father of 13Ahaz father of Hezekiah father of Manasseh father of 14Amon father of Josiah father of 15Johanan his firstborn, Jehoiakim second, Zedekiah third, and Shallum fourth.

16The sons of Jehoiakim: Jeconiah his son and Zedekiah his son

17The sons of Jeconiah the prisoner were Shealtiel, 18Malchiram, Pedaiah,

Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.

19The sons of Pedaiah were Zerubbabel and Shimei.

The sons of Zerubabbel were Meshullam and Hananiah;

Shelomith was their sister; 20Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah,

Hasadiah, and Jushab-hesed—5. 1 Ch 3:10-20

21The sons of Hananiah were Pelatiah and Jeshaiah, the

sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of

Obadiah, and the sons of Shecaniah,

22The son of Shecaniah was Shemaiah.

The sons of Shemaiah were Hattush, Igal,

Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat—6.

23The sons of Neariah were Elioenai,

Hizkiah, and Azrikam—3.

24The sons of Elioenai were

Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub,

Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani—7.

1 Ch 3:21-24

4:1The sons of JUDAH: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal

2Reaiah son of Shobal was father of Jahath father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the families of the Zorathites.

3These were the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash; their sister was Hazzelelponi.

4Penuel was father of Gedor and Ezer father of Hushah. Those were the sons of Hur, firstborn of Ephrathah ancestor of Bethlehem.

5Ashhur father of Tekoa had two wives: Helah and Naarah. 6Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. 7The sons of Helah were Zereth, Izhar, Ethnan,

8and Koz, ancestor of Anub and Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel son of Harum.

9A man named Jabez had more honor than his brothers, and his mother named him Jabez because she bore him “in pain.” 10Jabez called on the God of Israel, “Oh that you’d bless me and make my territory bigger, be with me, and keep me from harm so I won’t suffer!” God gave him what he asked. 1 Ch 4:1-10

11Chelub brother of Shuhah was father of Mehir father of Eshton.

12Eshton was father of Beth-rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah father of Irnahash. These

were the men of Recah.

13The sons of Kenaz were Othniel and Seraiah.

The son of Othniel was Hathath.

14bSeraiah was father of Joab, founder of Ge-harashim, so-called because they were craftsmen.

14aMeonothai was father of Ophrah.

15The sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh were Iru, Elah, and Naam.

The son of Elah was Kenaz.

16The sons of Jehallelel were Ziph and Ziphah, Tiria and Asarel.

17The sons of Ezrah were Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon. These are the sons of Bithia Pharaoh’s daughter that Mered married. She bore Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah father of Eshtemoa. 18His Jewish wife bore Jered father of Gedor, Heber father of Soco, and Jekuthiel father of Zanoah. 19The sons of the wife of Hodiah sister of Naham were the fathers of Keilah the Garmite and Eshtemoa the Maacathite. 1 Ch 4:11-19

20The sons of Shimon were Amnon and Rinnah, Benhanan and Tilon.

The sons of Ishi were Zoheth and Benzoheth.

21The sons of Shelah son of Judah were Er father of Lecah, Laadah father of Mareshah, the families of the linen workers at Beth-ashbea, 22Jokim the men of Cozeba, Joash Saraph, who ruled in Moab; and Jashubi-lehem. The records are ancient. 23These were the potters and people of Netaim and Gederah. They lived there with the king for his work. 1 Ch 4:20-23

24The sons of SIMEON: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul

25Shaul was father of Shallum father of Mibsam father of Mishma.

26Mishma was father of Hammuel, Zaccur, and Shimei.

27Shimei had 16 sons and 6 daughters, but his brothers didn’t have

many sons. Their whole family didn’t multiply like the

descendants of Judah. 28They lived in Beersheba, Moladah, and Hazar-shual, 29at Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad, 30Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag, 31Beth-Marcaboth, Hazar-susim, Beth-Birei, and Shaaraim. Those were their towns till David’s reign. 32Their villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, and Ashan—5 towns, 33along with the villages that were around them as far as Baal. These were their settlements, and they kept a genealogy. 34Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah; 35Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah son of Seraiah son of Asiel; 36Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah, 37Ziza son of Shiphi son of Allon son of Jedaiah son of Shimri son of Shemaiah: 38these named were leaders in their clans, and their families increased greatly. 39They went to the entrance of Gedor, to the east side of the valley, to look for pasture for their flocks. 40They found good pasture, and the land was large and quiet and peaceful; the previous residents were Hamites. 41These, according to the records, came at the time of Hezekiah, king of Judah, and attacked their tents as well as the Meunites that were there, and destroyed them till today, and lived in place of them, because there was pasture for their flocks. 42From them—from the descendants of Simeon—500 men went to Mount Seir with Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, sons of Ishi as their leaders. 43They destroyed the remnant of the Amalekites that escaped and have lived there ever since. 1 Ch 4:24-43

5:1, 3The sons of REUBEN, Israel’s firstborn: 3Hanoch and Pallu, Hezron and Carmi

(Because he defiled his father’s bed, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel; so he’s not enrolled in the genealogy by birthright. 2Although Judah prevailed over his brothers and the leader came from him, the birthright was Joseph’s.)

4The sons of Joel were Shemaiah, Gog, Shimei, 5Micah, Reaiah, Baal, 6Beerah that Tilgath-pilneser, king of Assyria, took away into exile. He was leader in Reuben. 7His relatives by clans—when their genealogy was figured—were Jeiel the chief, then Zechariah, 8Bela son of Azaz son of Shema son of Joel that lived in Aroer as far as Nebo and Baal-meon. 9He lived to the east as far as the entrance to the desert this side of the River Euphrates because their livestock had multiplied in Gilead. 10At the time of Saul, they conquered the Hagrites and occupied their tents in the whole region east of Gilead. 1 Ch 5:1-10

11The descendants of GAD lived across from them in Bashan as far as Salecah. 12Joel was the chief, Shapham second, then Janai and Shaphat in Bashan. 13Their kinsmen in their clans were Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Eber—7. 14These were the descendants of Abihail son of Huri son of Jaroah son of Gilead son of Michael son of Jeshishai son of Jahdo son of Buz 15and Ahi son of Abdiel son of Guni were heads of their clans. 16The descendants of Gad lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its surrounding towns, in the pastureland of Sharon as far as their boundaries. 17These were enrolled in the genealogies at the time of Jotham, king of Judah, and JeroboamI, king of Israel.

18The descendants of Reuben, Gad, and the Manasseh half-tribe were 44,760—brave men who carried shield and sword, shot bow and arrow, were capable in battle. 19They fought the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab. 20God helped them and delivered the Hagrites and everybody that was with them, because they cried out to God in the battle. He granted their petition because they trusted in him. 21They took their livestock: 50,000 camels, 250,000 sheep, 2,000 donkeys, and 100,000 men. 22Many fell slain because the war came from God. They settled in their place. 23The descendants of the Manasseh half-tribe lived in the land. They were numerous from Bashan to Baal-hermon, Senir, and Mount Hermon. 24The heads of their clans were Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, trained soldiers, famous men. 25But they sinned against their ancestors’ God and committed prostitution with the gods of the people in the land God had destroyed. 26The God of Israel stirred up Pul, king of Assyria—also known as Tiglath-pilneser/Tiglath-pileser—and he took Reuben, Gad, and the Manasseh half-tribe into exile, to Halah, Habor, Hara, and the Gozan River ever since. 1 Ch 5:11-26

6:1The descendants of LEVI: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari

2The descendants of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

3The children of Amram were Aaron, Moses, and Miriam.

The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

4Eleazar was father of Phinehas father of 5Abishua father of Bukki father of 6Uzzi father of Zerahiah father of 7Meraioth father of Amariah father of 8Ahitub father of Zadok father of 9Ahimaaz father of Azariah, father of 10Johanan father of Azariah (priest in the Temple that Solomon built in Jerusalem), and 11Azariah was father of Amariah father of 12Ahitub father of Zadok father of 13Shallum father of Hilkiah father of 14Azariah father of Seraiah father of 15Jehozadak, who went into exile when the LORD took Judah and Jerusalem away by Nebuchadnezzar. 1 Ch 6:1-15

16The sons of Levi were Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.

17The sons of Gershom were Libni/Ladan and Shimei.

18The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

19The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi.

20The sons of Gershom were Libni, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son, 21Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, Jeatherai his son.

22The sons of Kohath were Amminadab, Korah his son, Assir his son, 23Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son, 24Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.

25The sons of Elkanah were Amasai and Ahimoth, 26The sons of Elkanah were Zophai, Nahath his son, 27Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, and Elkanah his son.

28The sons of Samuel were Joel his firstborn and Ahijah second.

29The sons of Merari were Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son, 30Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, and Asaiah his son. 1 Ch 6:16-30

31These are the ones David appointed to sing in the LORD’s Tabernacle after the Ark rested there. 32They served in song at the Tent of Meeting till Solomon built the LORD’s Temple in Jerusalem. They served in their order.

33These are the ones with their sons that served. From the Kohathites were Heman the singer son of Joel son of Samuel (34son of Elkanah son of Jeroham son of Eliel son of Toah 35son of Zuph son of Elkanah son of Mahath son of Amasai 36son of Elkanah son of Joel son of Azariah son of Zephaniah 37son of Tahath son of Assir son of Ebiasaph son of Korah 38son of Izhar son of Kohath) son of Levi son of Israel.

39Heman’s brother Asaph stood on his right, that is, Asaph son of Berechiah (son of Shimea 40son of Michael son of Baaseiah son of Malchijah 41son of Ethni son of Zerah son of Adaiah 42son of Ethan son of Zimmah son of Shimei 43son of Jahath son of Gershom) son of Levi.

44On the left were their relatives the sons of Merari: Ethan son of Kishi (son of Abdi son of Malluch 45son of Hashabiah son of Amaziah son of Hilkiah 46son of Amzi son of Bani son of Shemer 47son of Mahli son of Mushi son of Merari) son of Levi.

48Their relatives the Levites were appointed for the service of the Tabernacle, God’s house.

1 Ch 6:31-48

49Aaron and his sons offered on the altar of burnt offering and the altar of incense for the work of the Holy of Holies, and atoned for Israel like Moses had commanded.

50These are the sons of Aaron: Eleazar, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son, 51Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son, 52Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son, 53Zadok his son, and Ahimaaz his son.

54These are their settlements according to their camps within their borders. To the descendants of Aaron of the clans of the Kohathites (Theirs was the first lot.), 55they gave Hebron in Judah with its pastures around it. 56But the fields round the town and its villages they gave to Caleb son of Jephunneh. 57To Aaron’s descendants they gave the following cities of refuge: Hebron, Libnah with its pastures, Jattir, Eshtemoa with its pastures, 58Hilen with its pastures, Debir with its pastures, 59Ashan with its pastures, and Beth-shemesh with its pastures. 60From Benjamin they gave Geba with its pastures, Allemeth with its pastures, and Anathoth with its pastures—13 towns. 1 Ch 6:49-60

61To the rest of Kohath’s descendants, they gave 10 towns by lot from the Manasseh half-tribe.

62To Gershom’s descendants according to their families, they gave 13 towns in Bashan from the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and Manasseh.

63To Merari’s descendants according to their families, they gave by lot 12 towns from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.

64Israel’s descendants gave the Levites the towns with their pastures. 65From the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin, they gave the towns by lot.

66Some families of Kohath’s descendants had towns from the tribe of Ephraim. 67They gave them the following cities of refuge with their pastures: Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, Gezer, 68Jokmeam, Beth-horon, 69Aijalon, and Gath-rimmon. 70From the Manasseh half-tribe they gave towns with their pastures: Aner and Bileam for the rest of the descendants of Kohath. 1 Ch 6:61-70

71To Gershom’s descendants they gave towns with their pastures from the family of the Manasseh half-tribe: Golan in Bashan and Ashtaroth. 72From the tribe of Issachar they gave towns with their pastures: Kedesh, Daberath, 73Ramoth, Anem. 74From Asher they gave towns with their pastures: Mashal, Abdon, 75Hukok, and Rehob. 76From Naphtali they gave towns with their pastures: Kedesh in Galilee, Hammon, and Kiriathaim.

77To the rest of the Levites, the sons of Merari, from the tribe of Zebulun they gave towns with their pastures: Rimmono and Tabor. 78On the east side of the Jordan, from Reuben they gave towns with their pastures: Bezer in the open country, Jahzah, 79Kedemoth, and Mephaath. 80From Gad they gave towns with their pastures: Ramoth in Gilead, Mahanaim, 81Heshbon, and Jazer. 1 Ch 6:71-81

7:1ISSACHAR had four sons: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron.

2The sons of Tola were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Samuel, heads of

families. Tola’s sons were trained soldiers in their generations. At the time

of David they numbered 22,600.

3The son of Uzzi was Izrahiah.

The sons of Izrahiah were Michael, Obadiah, Joel, Isshiah—all five, mighty men.

4With them by their generations according to their families were 36,000

troops of the army, because they had many wives and sons. 5Their relatives among the descendants of Issachar were trained soldiers, enrolled by genealogy—87,000 in all. 1 Ch 7:1-5

6BENJAMIN had three sons: Bela, Becher, and Jediael.

7Bela had five sons: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri. They were heads of families, trained soldiers enrolled by genealogy—22,034.

8The sons of Becher were Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah,

Anathoth, and Alemeth. 9They were enrolled by genealogy according to their

generations, heads of families—20,200 trained soldiers.

10The son of Jediael was Bilhan.

The sons of Bilhan were Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and

Ahishahar. 11These were descendants of Jediael according to the heads of

their families—17,200 trained soldiers prepared for war.

12Shuppim and Huppim were sons of Ir.

Hushim was the son of Aher. 1 Ch 7:6-12

13The sons of NAPHTALI: Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum, the descendants of Bilhah.

14The sons of MANASSEH, borne by his Aramaean concubine: Asriel and Machir father of Gilead

15Machir took a wife for Huppim and for Shuppim. His sister was Maacah. The name of

the second was Zelophehad, who had daughters. 16Maacah wife of Machir had a son

she named Peresh. His brother was Sheresh, whose sons were Ulam and Rakem.

17The son of Ulam was Bedan.

These were the sons of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh.

18His sister Hammolecheth bore Ishbod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.

19The sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam. 1 Ch 7:13-19

20The sons of EPHRAIM were Shuthelah and Bered, Tahath his son, Eleadah his son, Tahath his son, 21Zabad his son, Shuthelah his son, and Ezer and Elead thatpl the men in Gath who were born in the land killed because they came down to steal their livestock. 22Their father Ephraim mourned a long time, and his relatives came to comfort him. 23Then he slept with his wife, and she bore a son, and he named him Beriah, because “misfortune” had come on his family. 24His daughter was Sheerah—who built lower and upper Beth-horon—as well as Uzzen-sheerah. 25Rephah was his son along with Resheph, Telah his son, Tahan his son, 26Ladan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son, 27Non/Nun his son, and Joshua his son. 28Their possessions and settlements were Bethel, Naaran to the east, Gezer to the west, and Shechem as far as Ayyah with their towns. 29Along their border with the Manassites, they had Beth-shean, Taanach, Megiddo, and Dor with their towns. The descendants of Joseph lived in those towns. 1 Ch 7:20-29

30The sons of ASHER: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, as well as their sister Serah

31The sons of Beriah were Heber and Malchiel father of Birzaith.

32Heber was father of Japhlet, Shomer, and Hotham, as well as Shua their sister.

33The sons of Japhlet were Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath.

34The sons of Shemer were Ahi, Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.

35The sons of his brother Helem were Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.

36The sons of Zophah were Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, and Imrah,

37Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.

38The sons of Jether were Jephunneh, Pispa, and Ara.

39The sons of Ulla were Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.

40These were descendants of Asher, heads of families elite soldiers, principal leaders. The number enrolled by genealogy for military service was 26,000 men. 1 Ch 7:30-40

8:1BENJAMIN was father of Bela his firstborn, Ashbel second, Aharah third, 2Nohah fourth, and Rapha fifth.

3Bela was father of Addar, Gera, Abihud, 4Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah, 5Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.

6These are the sons of Ehud, heads of families among the people in Geba. They were exiled to Manahath: 7Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera, father of Uzza and Ahihud.

8Shaharaim was the father of children in Moab after he’d sent away his wives Hushim and Baara. 9By his wife Hodesh he became father of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam, 10Jeuz, Sachia, Mirmah, sons and heads of families. 11By Hushim he’d become father of Abitub and Elpaal.

1 Ch 8:1-11

12The sons of Elpaal were Eber, Misham, Shemed—who built Ono and Lod with their villages—13Beriah and Shema (heads of families among the people in Aijalon, who routed the people in Gath); 14Ahio, Shashak, and Jeremoth.

15Zebadiah, Arad, Eder, 16Michael, Ishpah, and Joha were sons of Beriah.

17Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber, 18Ishmerai, Izliah, and Jobab were sons of Elpaal.

19Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi, 20Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel, 21Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath were sons of Shimei.

22Ishpan, Eber, Eliel, 23Abdon, Zichri, Hanan, 24Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah, 25Iphdeiah, and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.

26Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah, 27Jaareshiah, Elijah, and Zichri were sons of Jeroham.

28These were heads of families in their generations, chief men that lived in Jerusalem.

1 Ch 8:12-28

29Jeiel father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon; his wife was Maacah. 30His firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab, 31Gedor, Ahio, Zecher, and 32Mikloth father of Shimeah/Shimeam. These families lived near each other in Jerusalem. 33Ner was father of Kish father of Saul father of Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.

34The son of Jonathan was Merib-baal father of 35Micah father of Pithon, Melech, Tarea, and Ahaz. 36Ahaz was father of Jehoaddah father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri; Zimri was father of 37Moza father of Binea father of Raphah father of Eleasah father of Azel. 38Azel had six sons: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. 39Azel’s brother Eshek was father of Ulam his firstborn, Jeush second, and Eliphelet third. 40The sons of Ulam were brave soldiers, archers, and had many sons and grandsons—150 of them.

Those were all descendants of Benjamin. 1 Ch 8:29-40

9:1So Israel was enrolled by genealogies. They’re recorded in The Book of the Kings of Israel. Judah was exiled to Babylon because they were unfaithful.

2The first to live again in their towns were Israel, the priests, the Levites, and the Temple servants. 3Some descendants of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh lived in Jerusalem:

4from the descendants of Perez son of Judah was Uthai son of Ammihud son of Omri son of Imri son of Bani;

5from the Shilonites were Asaiah the firstborn and his sons;

6from the sons of Zerah were Jeuel and their relatives: 690;

7from the descendants of Benjamin were Sallu son of Meshullam son of Hodaviah son of Hassenuah, 8and Ibneiah son of Jeroham, Elah son of Uzzi son of Michri, and Meshullam son of Shephatiah son of Reuel son of Ibnijah, 9and their relatives by generations: 956. Those were heads of families. 1 Ch 9:1-9

10From the priests were Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jachin, 11Azariah son of Hilkiah son of Meshullam son of Zadok son of Meraioth son of Ahitub, the chief officer of God’s Temple; 12Adaiah son of Jeroham son of Pashhur son of Malchijah, Maasai son of Adiel son of Jahzerah son of Meshullam son of Meshillemith son of Immer, 13and their relatives, heads of their families: 1,760 capable men for the service of God’s Temple.

14From the Levites were Shemaiah son of Hasshub son of Azrikam son of Hashabiah from the sons of Merari; 15Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, Mattaniah son of Mica son of Zichri son of Asaph, 16Obadiah son of Shemaiah son of Galal son of Jeduthun, Berechiah son of Asa son of Elkanah that lived in the villages of the Netophathites. 1 Ch 9:10-16

17The gatekeepers were Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their relatives, (Shallum the chief) 18stationed previously at the king’s gate to the east. 19Shallum son of Kore son of Ebiasaph son of Korah, and his relatives from his family—the Korahites—were over the work of the service, who kept the thresholds of the tent like their ancestors had done over the entrance to the camp of the LORD. 20Phinehas son of Eleazar ruled them previously; the LORD was with him. 21Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was gatekeeper at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting. 22There were 212 chosen to be gatekeepers in the thresholds. They were enrolled by genealogy in their villages, men that David and Samuel the seer appointed in their office of trust. 23They and their descendants guarded the gates of the LORD’s house—when it was a tabernacle—24 on all four sides. 25Their relatives in their villages were to come in every seven days to be with them. 26The four chief gatekeepers (Levites) were in an office of trust over the rooms and treasuries in God’s Temple. 27They spent the night around God’s Temple, because they were responsible for guarding them. They were responsible for opening the gates of the LORD’s house each morning.

28Some of them were responsible for the utensils for service. They counted them when they brought them in and took them out. 29Some were appointed to oversee the furniture and utensils for the sanctuary, the fine flour, the wine, oil, frankincense, and spices. 30Some descendants of the priests mixed the spices. 31Mattithiah, one of the Levites, the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, was responsible for what was baked in pans. 32Some relatives of the Kohathites prepared the showbread every Sabbath. 1 Ch 9:17-32

33These are the singers, heads of families among the Levites. They lived in rooms in the Temple because they were on duty day and night. 34They were heads of families among the Levites according to their generations, chief men living in Jerusalem.

35Jeiel father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon; his wife was Maacah. 36His firstborn was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab, 37Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.

38Mikloth was father of Shimeam/Shimeah. All these families lived near each other in Jerusalem. 1 Ch 9:33-38

39Ner was father of Kish father of Saul father of Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.

40Jonathan was father of Merib-baal father of Micah 41father of Pithon, Melech,

Tahrea, 42and Ahaz father of Jarah father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and

Zimri father of Moza 43father of Binea, Rephaiah, Eleasah and Azel. 44Azel had six sons: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. 1 Ch 9:39-44

The Death of Szul and His Sons

10:1The Philistines attacked Israel, and they fled and fell dead on Mount Gilboa. 2The Philistines overtook Saul and his sons and struck down his sons Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchi-shua. 3The battle grew intense against Saul, and the archers wounded him. 4He told his armor bearer, “Draw your sword and thrust me through so these uncircumcised Philistines don’t come and torture me.” But his armor bearer was too afraid to do it; so Saul took his sword and fell on it. 5When his armor bearer saw he was dead, he fell on his sword too. 6So Saul’s whole dynasty died together.

7When the Israelites in the valley saw they’d fled and Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their towns and fled; the Philistines came and lived in them. 8The next day, when the Philistines came to strip the dead, they found Saul and his sons. 9They stripped him, took his head and armor, and sent messengers around the land of the Philistines to carry the good news to their idols and the people. 10They put his armor in the temple of their gods and fastened his head in the temple of Dagon. 11When Jabesh-gilead heard what they’d done to Saul, 12brave men got up and took the bodies of Saul and his sons, buried their bones under the terebinth tree in Jabesh, and fasted a week.

13So Saul died for his trespass against the LORD 14and because he inquired from a medium instead of the LORD. He killed him and turned the kingdom over to David. 1 Ch 10:1-14

David Anointed King

11:1Then Israel gathered to David in Hebron,

“We’re your flesh and bone. 2When Saul was king, you led out and brought in Israel. The LORD your God said you would shepherd his people and be their leader.”

3The elders in Israel came to him, and he made a treaty with them in the LORD’s presence. They anointed him king according to the LORD’s message through Samuel.

David Takes Jerusalem

4Then David and all Israel went to Jerusalem (Jebus). The Jebusites, natives in the land, lived there. 5They told David, “You won’t get in here”; but he captured the fortress of Zion (The City of David). 6He had said, “Whoever strikes down the Jebusites first will be general of the army.” Joab son of Zeruiah went up first, so he became the general. 7David lived in the fortress; so they called it The City of David. 8He built the city all around from the Millo to the surrounding area, and Joab repaired the rest of Jerusalem. 9David became greater and greater because the LORD was with him. 1 Ch 11:1-9

David’s Mighty Men

10These are David’s leading powerful warriors, who greatly supported him in his kingdom, along with all Israel, in making him king. 11They were Jashobeam son of a Hachmonite, chief of the 30. He killed 300 men with his spear at one time. 12After him was Eleazar son of Dodo the Ahohite, one of the three powerful men. 13He was with David at Pasdammim when the Philistines converged there for battle. There was a barley field, and the people were running from the Philistines. 14They took their stand in the middle of the plot, defended it, and struck down the Philistines. The LORD gave them a great victory.

15Three of the 30 chief men went down to the rock to David into the cave near Adullam while the Philistine army was camping in the Valley of Rephaim. 16Davd was in the stronghold while the Philistine garrison was in Bethlehem. 17David was thirsty and said, “Oh that somebody would give me a drink from the well by the gate at Bethlehem!” 18The three broke through the Philistine camp and drew water from the well at Bethlehem and took it to David. But he wouldn’t drink it; he poured it out to the LORD. 19“In the presence of my God, I can’t do that. Should I, in effect, drink these men’s blood who risked their lives to bring it?” Those were exploits the three powerful men did. 1 Ch 11:10-19

20Abishai, Joab’s brother, was leader of the 30. He killed 300 with a spear; he had a reputation as well as the 30. 21Of the three in the second rank, he had the greatest honor and became their commander. But he didn’t measure up to the three.

22Benaiah son of Jehoiada, son of a fearless warrior from Kabzeel, powerful in deeds, struck down the two sons of Ariel of Moab. He also went down and killed a lion inside a pit on a snowy day. 23He killed an Egyptian that was 7ft 6. The Egyptian had a spear like a weaver’s beam, but Benaiah went down to him with a club and snatched the spear from him and killed him with it. 24-25Benaiah was renowned among the 30, but he didn’t measure up to the three. David appointed him over his guard. 1 Ch 11:20-25

26The elite soldiers in the armies were Asahel brother of Joab, Elhanan son of Dodo from Bethlehem, 27Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite, 28Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite, 29Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite, 30Maharai the Netophathite, Heled son of Baanah the Netophathite, 31Ithai son of Ribai from Gibeah of the sons of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite, 32Hurai of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite, 33Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite, 34the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan son of Shagee the Hararite, 35Ahiam son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal son of Ur, 36Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite, 37Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai son of Ezbai, 38Joel brother of Nathan, Mibhar son of Hagri, 39Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite, the armor bearer for Joab son of Zeruiah, 40Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite, 41Uriah the Hittite, Zabad son of Ahlai; 42Adina son of Shiza the Reubenite, a chief in Reuben and 30 with him; 43Hanan son of Maacah and Joshaphat the Mithnite, 44Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel sons of Hotham the Aroerite, 45Jediael son of Shimri and Joha his brother, the Tizite; 46Eliel the Mahavite and Jeribai and Joshaviah sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite; 47Eliel, Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite. 1 Ch 11:26-47

Warriors Join David

12:1These are men that came over to David at Ziklag, while he still couldn’t move around freely because of Saul. They were among the elite soldiers that helped him during war. 2They used bows. With either hand they could sling stones and shoot arrows. They were Saul’s relatives from Benjamin. 3The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; Jeziel and Pelet, sons of Azmaveth; Beracah and Jehu the Anathothite; 4Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, an elite soldier among the 30 and a leader over them. Then came Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, Jozabad the Gederathite, 5Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, Shephatiah the Haruphite; 6Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, Jashobeam, the Korahites; 7Joelah and Zebadiah, sons of Jerobam of Gedor.

8From Gad, brave soldiers came over to David in the stronghold in the open country. They were men trained in war, who could handle shield and spear, whose faces were like lions’ faces. They were as fast as gazelles on the mountains. 9Numbered 1-11, they were Ezer, Obadiah, Eliab, 10Mishmannah, Jeremiah, 11Attai, Eliel, 12Johanan, Elzabad, 13Jeremiah, and Machbannai. 14They were commanders in the army. The least was worth 100; the best was worth 1,000. 15They crossed the Jordan in the first month when it was flooding and put to flight everybody in the valleys to the east and the west. 1 Ch 12:1-15

16Then some men from Benjamin and Judah came to David’s stronghold. 17He went out to meet them,

“If you come peacefully to help me, my heart will be with yours. But if you’ve come to betray me to my adversaries, since I haven’t done anything wrong, may the God of our ancestors look at it and decide.”

18The Spirit came on Amasai, chief of the 30,

“We’re yours, David;

we’re with you, son of Jesse!

Peace, peace to you,

and peace to the One that helps you.

Indeed, your God helps you!”

David accepted them and made them captains of the band. 1 Ch 12:16-18

19From Manasseh also some came over to David when he was going with the Philistines to fight Saul. (But he didn’t end up helping them, because the lords of the Philistines conferred and sent him away, “He might desert to his Saul and turn on us.”) 20As he was going to Ziklag, these came over to him from Manasseh: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, commanders of thousands in Manasseh. 21They helped him against the bands of raiders, because they were fearless soldiers and commanders in the army. 22Daily, men kept coming over to help David, till there was a large army like God’s army.

23These are the divisions of armed troops that came to David in Hebron to turn Saul’s kingdom over to him like the LORD said:

24from Judah: 6,800 armed troops that carried shield and spear;

25from Simeon: 7,100 fearless soldiers;

26from Levi: 4,600;

27from Jehoiada, leader of Aaron’s house: 3,700;

28and Zadok, a fearless young soldier, of his family: 22 captains;

29from Benjamin: 3,000 of Saul’s relatives, the greater part previously allied with Saul’s house.

30from Ephraim: 20,800 fearless soldiers, famous in their families;

31from the Manasseh half-tribe: 18,000 men picked by name to make David king;

32from Issachar: 200 chiefs that understood the times, with knowledge of what Israel should do; with their relatives at their command;

33from Zebulun: 50,000 seasoned troops, ready for battle and equipped with all kinds of weapons; who helped David wholeheartedly.

34from Naphtali: 1,000 captains and 37,000 that carried shield and spear;

35from Dan: 28,600 equipped for battle;

36from Asher: 40,000 seasoned troops ready for battle;

37from beyond the Jordan—Reuben, Gad, and the Manasseh half-tribe: 120,000 armed with all kinds of weapons. 1 Ch 12:19-37

38These battle-ready men came to Hebron fully intending to make David king over all Israel. The rest in Israel were also intent on making him king. 39They were there with him three days, eating and drinking, because their relatives had made preparations for them. 40People nearby and as far away as Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali brought food on donkeys, camels, mules, and oxen—great amounts of cakes, fig cakes and bunches of raisins, wine, olive oil, oxen, and sheep. There was happiness in Israel. 1 Ch 12:38-40

The Ark Brought from Kiriath-Jearim

13:1Then David consulted with every commander of thousands and hundreds, 2and told the whole assembly,

“If it seems good to you and if the LORD our God wills, let’s send around to our relatives that are still in Israel, as well as to the priests and Levites that are with them in their towns and pastures, to have them meet with us. 3Let’s bring the Ark back. We neglected it in Saul’s time.”

4The assembly agreed because it seemed right to them. 5He brought Israel together from the Shihor in Egypt to Lebo-hamath, to bring God’s Ark from Kiriath-jearim. 6He and all Israel went up to Baalah (Kiriath-jearim) on the edge of Judah to bring up God’s Ark, which wears the name the LORD, who is enthroned between the cherubs. 7They hauled the Ark on a new cart from Abinadab’s house; Uzza and Ahio drove the cart. 8David and all Israel were celebrating to God with all their energy—with songs and lyres, harps, tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.

9When they came to the threshing floor of Chidon/Nachon, Uzza reached out to steady the Ark, because the oxen stumbled. 10The LORD’s anger burned against him, so he struck him down, and he died there in front of God. 11David was mad because the LORD “lashed out against Uzza,” and has called the place Perez-uzza ever since. 12David was afraid of God that day, “How can I bring the Ark home to me?” 13So he didn’t take it to The City of David but to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite nearby. 14It stayed with his family for 3 months, and the LORD blessed them and everybody he had. 1 Ch 13:1-14

David’s Wives and Children

14:1Hiram, king of Tyre, sent ambassadors to David with cedar trees, masons, and carpenters, to build him a palace. 2David saw that the LORD had made him secure as king over Israel, and that his kingdom was highly regarded for Israel’s sake. 3He took more wives at Jerusalem and had more sons and daughters. 4His children born in Jerusalem were Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon, 5Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet, 6Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia, 7Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet. 1 Ch 14:1-7

Philistines Defeated

8When the Philistines heard they’d anointed David king over all Israel, they went up to look for him. He heard about it and went out against them. 9They’d made a raid in the Valley of Rephaim. 10David asked God, “Should I attack the Philistines? Will you deliver them to me?” The LORD said, “Yes, go on up.” 11They went up to Baal-perazim, and David defeated them. He said. “God has used me to ‘break through’ my enemies like a flash flood”; so they named the place Baal-perazim. 12The Philistines abandoned their gods there; David had them burned.

13The Philistines made another raid in the valley. 14David asked God again, and he said,

“Don’t attack them head on. Circle around behind them and come at them across from the balsam trees. 15When you hear marching in the tops of the balsam trees, attack. God will have gone out ahead of you to strike their army.”

16David did that, and they struck down the Philistine army from Gibeon to Gezer. 17His fame went out to all the countries, and the LORD made them afraid of him. 1 Ch 14:8-17

The Ark Brought to Jerusalem

15:1David built houses for himself in The City of David and prepared a place for the Ark of God and pitched a tent for it. 2He said, “Don’t anybody carry the Ark but Levites. The LORD chose them to carry it and serve him permanently.” 3He gathered Israel to Jerusalem to bring the Ark up to the place he’d prepared. 4He gathered the descendants of Aaron and the Levites:

5from the descendants of Kohath, Uriel the chief, and 120 of his relatives;

6from the descendant of Merari, Asaiah the chief and 220 of his relatives;

7from the descendants of Gershom, Joel the chief and 130 of his relatives;

8from the descendants of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the chief and 200 of his relatives;

9from the descendants of Hebron, Eliel the chief and 80 of his relatives;

10from the descendants of Uzziel, Amminadab the chief and 112 of his relatives.

11David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests and for the Levites Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab,

12“You’re heads of families among the Levites. Consecrate yourselves and your relatives so you can bring the Ark up to the place I’ve prepared. 13You didn’t carry it the first time, so the LORD lashed out on us; we didn’t look to him according to the ordinance.”

14The priests and Levites consecrated themselves to bring up the Ark. 15The Levites carried it on their shoulders, with the poles on it like Moses had commanded by the LORD’s message.

1 Ch 15:1-15

16David told the chiefs among the Levites to appoint their relatives the singers and the ones with musical instruments—harps, lyres, loud cymbals—to make joyful music. 17The Levites appointed Heman son of Joel and his relatives, Asaph son of Berechiah, and Ethan son of Kushaiah from the descendants of Merari their relatives. 18The Levites appointed with them their relatives of the second rank: Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, and the gatekeepers Obed-edom and Jeiel. 19The singers Heman, Asaph, and Ethan were appointed to sound loud bronze cymbals. 20Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah were to play harps according to Alamoth. 21Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah were to lead with lyres pitched to The Sheminith. 22Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was in charge of the singing. He taught singing because he was good at it. 23Berechiah and Elkanah were gatekeepers for the Ark. 24Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer the priests blew bugles ahead of the Ark. Obed-edom and Jehiah were also gatekeepers for the Ark. 1 Ch 15:16-24

25David, with the elders in Israel and the commanders of thousands, went to bring up the Ark from Obed-edom’s house with joy. 26Because God was helping the Levites that were carrying the Ark, they sacrificed 7 bulls and 7 rams. 27David dressed in a fine linen robe with the Levites that were carrying the Ark, the singers, and Chenaniah, who led the singing. David also wore a linen ephod. 28Israel brought up the Ark with shouting, blowing rams’ horns and trumpets, crashing cymbals, and playing harps and lyres. 29When the Ark came to The City of David, Saul’s daughter Michal looked out the window, and saw King David dancing and celebrating; and she despised him. 1 Ch 15:25-29

16:1They put the Ark in the tent David had pitched for it and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings to God. 2When David had finished offering them, he blessed the people in the LORD’s name. 3To every man and woman in Israel, he passed out a loaf of bread, a helping of meat, and a raisin cake.

4He appointed some Levites to serve at the Ark—to celebrate, thank, and praise the LORD God of Israel: 5Asaph the chief, second to him Zechariah, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel with musical instruments—harps and lyres. Asaph played the loud cymbals; 6Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests blew bugles constantly in front of the Ark.

7That day David first assigned Asaph and his relatives to give thanks to the LORD.

1 Ch 16:1-7

David’s Song of Thanks

8Thank the LORD; call on him;

tell the nations what he’s done.

9Sing to him, sing praises to him;

talk about his wonderful works.

10Take pride in his holy name;

let the people that look to him be happy.

11Look to the LORD and his strength;

look to him continually.

12Remember the wonderful things he’s done,

the miracles and judgments he’s spoken,

13descendants of Israel his servant,

sons of Jacob his chosen ones. 1 Ch 16:8-13

14He’s the LORD our God;

his judgments are all over the world.

15Remember his covenant forever,

the message he commanded to a thousand generations,

16his covenant with Abraham,

his oath to Isaac.

17He confirmed it to Jacob as a statute,

to Israel as an everlasting covenant,

18“I’ll give you Canaan for an inheritance.”

19When they were just a few

with temporary residents included,

20they wandered about from nation to nation,

from one kingdom to another. 1 Ch 16:14-20

21He didn’t let anybody oppress them;

he reproved kings for their sakes:

22“Don’t touch my anointed ones;

don’t harm my prophets.”

23Sing to the LORD, all the earth;

tell the good news about his salvation every day.

24Tell about his glory the world over,

his wonderful deeds among the nations.

25The LORD is great, and deserves great praise;

he’s to be feared more than all other gods.

26The people’s gods are idols,

but the LORD made the sky.

27Honor and majesty are with him;

strength and joy belong to him. 1 Ch 16:21-27

28Attribute to the LORD, families of the nations,

attribute to him honor and strength.

29Attribute to the LORD the honor that’s due him;

bring him an offering;

worship him in his holy splendor.

30Tremble in his presence, all the earth;

yes, the world stands firm; it won’t be moved.

31Let the sky be happy and the earth celebrate;

let them say among the nations, “The LORD reigns!”

32Let the sea roar and everything that fills it;

let the field celebrate and everything in it. 1 Ch 16:28-32

33Then the trees in the forest will sing for joy,

because the LORD’s coming to judge the world.

34Give thanks to the LORD because he’s good;

his love endures forever.

35Then say, “Save us, our saving God;

gather us and deliver us from the nations

to give thanks to your holy name

and take pride in praising you.”

36Bless the LORD God of Israel,

from everlasting to everlasting.

The people said “Amen” and praised the LORD. 1 Ch 16:33-36

37He left Asaph and his relatives at the Ark to serve continually as each day’s work required. 38He left Obed-edom with his 68 relatives and Hosah with the son of Jeduthun as gatekeepers. 39He left Zadok the priest and his relatives at the Tabernacle in the high place at Gibeon 40to offer burnt offerings every morning and evening, according to the Law the LORD commanded Israel. 41With them were Heman and Jeduthun and the rest that were designated by name to give thanks to the LORD because his love endures forever. 42With them were Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for the ones that sounded out loud, with instruments for the songs of God and the sons of Jeduthun for the gate. 43Then the people left for home and David went back to bless his household. 1 Ch 16:37-43

The LORD’s Covenant with David

17:1While David was living in his palace, he told Nathan the prophet, “I’m living in a cedar palace, but the LORD’s Ark is under curtains.”

2Nathan said, “Do what’s in your mind. God is with you.”

3That same night, the message from God came to him,

4“Go tell my servant David, ‘The LORD says, “You’re not to build me a temple. 5I haven’t lived in a temple since I brought Israel up. I’ve gone from tent to tent and place to place. 6In all the places where I’ve lived with Israel, have I asked any judge that I’ve commanded to shepherd my people why he hasn’t built me a cedar temple?”’ 7Tell David, ‘The LORD of Hosts says, “I took you out of the pasture from behind sheep and made you a leader over Israel. 8I’ve been with you wherever you’ve gone and removed your enemies from you. I’ll make you as famous as anyone that’s ever lived in the world. 9I’ll appoint you a place for my people, and plant them so they won’t have to move anymore. Sinful people won’t lay waste to them like they did before, 10including the time I put judges over them. I’ll subdue your enemies and build you a dynasty. 11When your life’s over and you’ve gone to your ancestors, I’ll set up one of your sons and secure his throne permanently. 12He’ll build me a temple. 13I’ll be his father, and he’ll be my son. I won’t take my enduring love away from him like I did with your predecessor. 14I’ll settle him in my house and kingdom permanently.”’” 1 Ch 17:1-14

15Nathan told David everything in his vision.

David’s Prayer

16Then David went in and sat in the LORD’s presence,

“Who am I, LORD God, and what’s my family that you’ve brought me this far? 17It’s a small thing for you, but you’ve talked about my dynasty for a long time to come and regarded me by the standard for men of high degree. 18What more can I say about the honor you’ve put on me? You know me. 19For my sake and from your own heart, you’ve done these great things and made them known. 20Nobody’s like you; there’s no God besides you. From everything we’ve heard, 21what nation is like Israel? You went to redeem them out of Egypt to make a name for yourself with great and terrifying acts, in driving out nations ahead of your people. 22You made Israel your people permanently and became their God. 23Now make permanent your promise about me and my dynasty. 24Establish your name and make it great forever. 25-26It’s a good thing that you’ve revealed to me that you’ll build a dynasty for me. That’s encouraged me to pray to you. 27It has pleased you to bless my family so it will continue permanently. You’ve blessed it forever.” 1 Ch 17:15-27

David’s Military Victories

18:1After that, David defeated the Philistines and took Gath and its surrounding towns. 2He defeated Moab and they brought tribute. 3He defeated Hadadezer, king of Zobah, as far as Hamath and secured his rule all the way to the Euphrates River. 4He took 1,000 chariots, 7,000 cavalry, and 20,000 foot soldiers. He hamstrung the chariot horses but reserved enough for 100 chariots.

5When the Arameans from Damascus came to help Hadadezer, David killed 22,000 of them. 6He put garrisons in Aram of Damascus, and the Arameans brought tribute. 7He took the gold shields that Hadadezer’s officers carried and brought them to Jerusalem. 8From Tibhath and Cun, towns of Hadadezer, he took a large amount of bronze, which Solomon used to make the bronze sea, pillars, and bronze utensils. 1 Ch 18:1-8

9Tou/Toi, king of Hamath, heard that David had defeated Hadadezer’s whole army. 10He sent his son Hadoram to greet him and bless him for it. Hadoram brought all kinds of gold, silver, and bronze articles. 11David dedicated them to the LORD with the silver and gold he’d carried off from Edom, Moab, the Ammonites, Philistines, and Amalek.

12In addition, Abishai son of Zeruiah defeated 18,000 Edomites in the Valley of Salt. 13He put garrisons in Edom, and the Edomites served him. The LORD helped him wherever he went.

14David ruled Israel and administered justice and goodness for his people.

15Joab son of Zeruiah was over the army;

Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;

16Zadok son of Ahitub and Abimelech son of Abiathar were priests;

Shavsha was secretary;

17Benaiah son of Jehoiada was captain of David’s bodyguard;

David’s sons were chiefs at his side. 1 Ch 18:9-17

David Defeats the Ammonites and Syrians

19:1After this, Nahash, king of the Ammonites, died and his son became king. 2David said, “I’ll be kind to Hanun because his father was kind to me.” He sent ambassadors to console him about his father. 3But the officials in Ammon told Hanun, “Do you think David is honoring your father by sending ambassadors to comfort you? Haven’t they come to spy out the land to overthrow it?” 4Hanun took David’s ambassadors and shaved them, cut off their cloaks as high as their hips, and sent them away. 5Some people came and told David about the men. He sent to meet them because they were humiliated. He told them to stay in Jericho till their beards grew back; then come home.

6When the Ammonites saw they’d been offensive to David, Hanun and the Ammonites sent 37¾ tons 1,000 talents of silver to hire chariots and cavalry from Mesopotamia, from Aram-maacah and Zobah. 7They hired 32,000 chariots, the king of Maacah, and his soldiers. They camped by Medeba. The Ammonites gathered from their towns and came to battle. 8When David heard it, he sent Joab and the whole army, the strongest soldiers. 9The Ammonites came out and drew up in battle formation at the entrance to the city. The kings that had come were by themselves in the field. 1 Ch 19:1-9

10When Joab saw that the battle was set against him in front and behind, he selected elite soldiers and arrayed them against the Arameans. 11The rest he placed under his brother Abishai, and they arrayed themselves against the Ammonites. 12He said,

“If the Arameans are too strong for me, you help me. If the Ammonites are too strong for you, I’ll help you. 13Be strong; let’s show ourselves courageous for our people and the towns of our God. May the LORD do what seems good to him.”

14Joab and his troops engaged the Arameans, and they fled. 15When the Ammonites saw the Arameans flee, they retreated from Abishai into the city. Then Joab made a trip to Jerusalem.

16When the Arameans saw Israel had defeated them, they sent ambassadors to bring out the Arameans from the other side of the River with Shophach the commander of Hadadezer’s army leading them. 17When David heard it, he mustered Israel, crossed the Jordan, and came on them. He drew up in formation against them and they fought him. 18They fled, and he killed 7,000 charioteers and 40,000 foot soldiers, and put Shophach to death. 19When Hadadezer’s vassals saw Israel had defeated them, they surrendered and served David. The Arameans weren’t willing to help the Ammonites anymore. 1 Ch 19:10-19

David Defeats the Ammonites

20:1In the spring, when kings go to war, Joab led out the army and ravaged the country of the Ammonites and laid siege to Rabbah. David stayed in Jerusalem. Joab attacked Rabbah and overthrew it. 2Then David went to Rabbah and took the crown off their king’s head, and found that it weighed 75½ lbs a talent of gold, and was set with precious stones. They placed it on David’s head, and he brought out a really large amount of spoil from the city. 3He brought the people out, and cut them with saws, sharp instruments, and axes. He did that to all the Ammonite towns. Then he and the people came back to Jerusalem.

4About this time, war broke out with the Philistines at Gezer. Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, a descendant of the giants, and they were subdued. 5There was war with the Philistines again, and Elhanan son of Jair killed Lahmi brother of Goliath the Gittite, the shaft of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam. 6Another time there was war at Gath, where there was a huge man with six digits on each hand and foot. He had descended from the giants too. 7When he taunted Israel, Jonathan, son of David’s brother Shimea, killed him. 8Those three descended from the giants in Gath that David and his warriors killed. 1 Ch 20:1-8

David’s Ill-Advised Census

21:1Satan stood up against Israel and tempted David to take a census. 2David told Joab and the commanders of the troops,

“Go count Israel from Dan to Beersheba and bring me the results so I can know how many there are.”

3Joab said, “May the LORD add to his people 100 times as many as they are! But my lord the king, aren’t they all serving you? Why do you want to know this? Why bring guilt on Israel?”

4But the king’s word prevailed. So Joab went all over Israel and came back to Jerusalem. 5He gave David the census number: 1,100,000 swordsmen in Israel and 470,000 in Judah. 6He didn’t count Levi and Benjamin because he abhorred the king’s command. 7God was displeased with this thing, so he struck Israel. 1 Ch 21:1-7

8David said to God, “I’ve committed an awful sin. Please take it away. I’ve done something really foolish.”

9The LORD told Gad, David’s seer, 10“Tell David,

‘The LORD says 11to take 12either three years of famine, three months of being swept away by your enemies’ sword, or three days of the sword of the LORD when his angel destroys throughout Israel.’ What should I report to the One that sent me?” 1 Ch 21:8-12

13David told Gad, “I’m in great distress. I’ll cast myself on the LORD’s mercy because it’s so great. Don’t let me fall into human hands.” 14The LORD sent a plague on Israel; 70,000 people died. 15He sent an angel to destroy Jerusalem; but as he was about to do it, he looked and was sad over the catastrophe. He told the destroying angel, “That’s enough; relax your hand.” The angel was standing by the threshing floor of Ornan/Araunah the Jebusite. 16David looked up and saw him standing between earth and sky with his sword held out over Jerusalem. David and the elders, covered with burlap, fell on their faces. 17He told God, “I’m the one that sinned. What have these sheep done? LORD my God, please plague me and my father’s family, not your people.” 1 Ch 21:13-17

David Builds an Altar

18Then the angel of the LORD had Gad tell David to build an altar to the LORD on Ornan’s/Araunah’s threshing floor. 19David went up. 20Ornan/Araunah turned and saw the angel, and his four sons hid. He was threshing wheat. 21As David came to him, he left the threshing floor and prostrated himself. 22David told him, “Sell me this threshing floor so I can build an altar on it. Give it to me at full price so God will restrain the plague.”

23Ornan/Araunah said,

“Take it and do what seems good. I’ll give the oxen for burnt offerings, the threshing sledges for wood, the wheat for the grain offering—all of it.”

24But King David said, “I won’t take what’s yours for the LORD or offer a burnt offering that doesn’t cost me anything.” 25He paid him 15 lbs 600 shekels of gold for the site. 26He built an altar there and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. He called to the LORD, and he answered him with fire from the sky on the altar. 27The LORD told the angel to sheath his sword.

28When David saw that the LORD had answered him, he offered sacrifice there, 29because the Tabernacle and altar that Moses made in the countryside were at Gibeon. 30But David couldn’t go to it to ask God because the angel’s sword terrified him. 22:1David said, “This will be the Temple of the LORD God and the altar of burnt offering for Israel.” 1 Ch 21:18-22:1

David’s Preparations for the Temple

2David issued an order to gather the foreigners in Israel and set stonecutters to dress stones for God’s Temple. 3He provided large stores of iron for making nails for the doors in the gates and for clamps, more bronze than could be weighed, 4and cedar logs without number. The Sidonians and Tyrians brought him large supplies of cedar timber. 5He said,

“My son Solomon is young and inexperienced, and the LORD’s Temple will be magnificent, famous, and glorious all over the world. I’ll stockpile materials for it.”

David gathered lots of material for it before he died. 1 Ch 22:2-5

6Then he called Solomon and charged him to build a temple for the LORD God of Israel,

7“Son, I intended to build a temple for the LORD, 8but his message came to me, ‘You won’t build me a temple; you’ve shed so much blood and fought great wars. 9You’ll have a son that’s not a military figure. I’ll give him rest from his enemies everywhere. His name will be Solomon because I’ll give Israel ‘peace’ and quiet during his life. 10He’ll build a temple for me. He’ll be my son, and I’ll be his father. I’ll make his kingdom permanently secure.’ 11The LORD be with you so you can succeed at building it. 12May he give you discretion and intelligence, and give you charge over Israel so you can keep his Law. 13You’ll prosper if you observe carefully the statutes and ordinances he commanded Moses. Be strong and courageous; don’t be afraid or intimidated. 14I’ve taken great pains to stockpile materials: 3775 tons 100,000 talents of gold, 37,750 tons 1,000,000 talents of silver, bronze and iron past weighing, timber, and stone. You can add to that. 15You have lots of stonecutters, stonemasons, and carpenters skilled in all kinds of work. 16There’s no limit to the gold, silver, bronze, and iron. Get started. The LORD be with you.” 1 Ch 22:6-16

17He directed Israel’s leaders to help Solomon,

18“Isn’t the LORD with you? Hasn’t he given you rest in every direction? He’s delivered to you the nations in the land, and it’s under control. 19Set your heart and soul to look to him. Build his sanctuary so you can bring the Ark and God’s holy articles into it.” 1 Ch 22:17-19

Duties of Levites

23:1When David got old, he appointed Solomon king over Israel. 2He gathered the leaders with the priests and Levites. 3The Levites 30 years old and up numbered 38,000. 4Of these, 24,000 oversaw the work, 6,000 were officers and judges, 54,000 were gatekeepers, and 4,000 praised the LORD with instruments David made for that purpose. 6He divided them according to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari. 1 Ch 23:1-6

7The sons of Gershon were Ladan and Shimei.

8Three sons of Ladan were Jehiel the oldest, Jetham, and Joel.

9Three sons of Shimei were Shelomoth, Haziel, and Haran.

These were the heads of families in Ladan/Libni.

10-11The other sons of Shimei were Jahath, first; Zina/Zizah, second. Jeush and Beriah didn’t have very many sons, so they were all counted as one family. 1 Ch 23:7-11

12The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

13The sons of Amram were Aaron and Moses.

Aaron and his sons were set apart permanently to sanctify the LORD as most

holy, to burn incense to him, to perform service to him, and to bless in his

name.

14The sons of Moses, the man of God, were included in the tribe of Levi.

15The sons of Moses were Gershom and Eliezer.

16The son of Gershom was Shebuel the chief.

17The only son of Eliezer was Rehabiah.

Rehabiah had lots of sons.

18The son of Izhar was Shelomith the chief.

19The sons of Hebron were Jeriah, first; then Amariah, then Jahaziel, then Jekameam.

20The sons of Uzziel were Micah, first, then Isshiah.

21The descendants of Merari were Mahli and Mushi.

The sons of Mahli were Eleazar and Kish.

22Eleazar died and had only daughters, so their cousins, Kish’s sons, married them.

23The sons of Mushi were Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth. 1 Ch 23:12-23

24Those were Levi’s descendants by heads of families as counted in their census. They served in the LORD’s Temple from 20 years old and up. 25David said, “The LORD God of Israel has given his people rest, and he lives in Jerusalem permanently. 26The Levites won’t need to carry the Tabernacle and the utensils for its service.” 27By David’s last words, Levi’s descendants were counted from 20 years old and up. 28They were to assist Aaron’s descendants with the service in the courts and rooms in the LORD’s Temple. They were to purify the holy things 29and help with the showbread, the fine flour for grain offerings, wafers without yeast, what’s baked in the pan, or what’s well-mixed, and all measures of volume and size. 30They were to stand each morning and evening to thank and praise the LORD. 31They offered burnt offerings on Sabbaths, new moons, and scheduled festivals in the number set by the Law. 32They maintained the Tent of Meeting and the Holy Place and helped Aaron’s descendants with the service in the LORD’s house. 1 Ch 23:24-32

Duties of Priests

24:1These were the divisions of Aaron’s descendants. His sons were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar. 2But Nadab and Abihu died before their father did, and they didn’t have any sons; so Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests. 3David—with Zadok from Eleazar’s descendants and Ahimelech from Ithamar’s descendants—divided them by their offices for their service. 4Since there were more chief men descended from Eleazar than from Ithamar, they divided them into 16 heads descended from Eleazar and 8 from Ithamar. 5They divided them alike by lot because they were officers of the sanctuary and officers of God. 6Shemaiah son of Nethanel the secretary from the Levites, recorded them in the presence of the king, the officials, Zadok the priest, Ahimelech son of Abiathar, and the heads of the families among the priests and Levites—one family taken for Eleazar and one for Ithamar. 1 Ch 24:1-6

7The first lot came out for Jehoiarib, the second for Jedaiah,

8the third for Harim, the fourth for Seorim,

9the fifth for Malchijah, the sixth for Mijamin,

10the seventh for Hakkoz, the eighth for Abijah,

11the ninth for Jeshua, the tenth for Shecaniah,

12the eleventh for Eliashib, twelfth for Jakim,

13the thirteenth for Huppah, the fourteenth for Jeshebeab,

14the fifteenth for Bilgah, the sixteenth for Immer,

15the seventeenth for Hezir, the eighteenth for Happizzez,

16the nineteenth for Pethahiah, the twentieth for Jehezkel,

17the twenty-first for Jachin, the twenty-second for Gamul,

18the twenty-third for Delaiah, the twenty-fourth for Maaziah.

19Those were their officers for ministry when they came to the LORD’s Temple according to the ordinance Aaron their ancestor gave them by the LORD God’s command. 1 Ch 24:7-19

20Now about the rest of Levi’s descendants:

from the descendants of Amram, Shubael;

from the descendants of Shubael, Jehdeiah.

21from Rehabiah, Isshiah the chief.

22from the Izharites, Shelomoth;

from the descendants of Shelomoth, Jahath.

23the descendants of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah second, Jahaziel third, Jekameam fourth. 1 Ch 24:20-23

24the descendants of Uzziel, Micah;

from the descendants of Micah, Shamir.

25the brother of Micah, Isshiah;

from the descendants of Isshiah, Zechariah.

26the descendants of Merari: Mahli and Mushi.

the descendants by Jaaziah: Beno.

27the descendants of Merari: by Jaaziah were Beno, Shoham, Zaccur, and Ibri.

28by Mahli: Eleazar, who didn’t have any sons.

29by Kish, the sons of Kish: Jerahmeel.

30the descendants of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth.

Those were the Levites by families. 31They also cast lots—the head of each family and his younger brother alike—like their relatives the descendants of Aaron, in the presence of King David, Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of families among the priests and Levites. 1 Ch 24:24-31

Duties of Musicians

25:1David and the commanders of the army set apart some from sons of Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun to prophesy with lyres, harps, and cymbals. Those who performed their service were as follows:

2from the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asharelah were under the direction of Asaph, who prophesied under the direction of the king;

3from the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah—6 were under the direction of their father Jeduthun with the harp, who prophesied by giving thanks and praising the LORD;

4from the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.

5Those were sons of Heman, the king’s seer, to honor him according to God’s message, because God gave Heman 14 sons and 3 daughters.

6Those were under their father’s direction to sing in the LORD’s Temple, with cymbals, harps, and lyres for the service. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman served under the king’s direction. 7There were 288 trained in singing to the LORD with their relatives, talented men. 8They cast lots for their duties, least and greatest, teacher and pupil. 1 Ch 25:1-8

9The first lot came out for Asaph to Joseph—he and his relatives made 12;

the second for Gedaliah—he and his relatives made 12;

10the third came out for Zaccur—he, his relatives, and sons made 12;

11the fourth came out for Izri, who with sons and relatives made 12;

12the fifth came out for Nethaniah, who with sons and relatives made 12;

13the sixth came out for Bukkiah, who with sons and relatives made 12;

14the seventh came out for Jesharelah, who with sons and relatives made 12;

15the eighth came out for Jeshaiah, who with sons and relatives made 12;

16the ninth came out for Mattaniah, who with sons and relatives made 12;

17the tenth came out for Shimei, who with sons and relatives made 12;

18the eleventh came out for Azarel, who with sons and relatives made 12;

19the twelfth came out for Hashabiah, who with sons and relatives made 12; 1 Ch 25:9-19

20for the thirteenth came out for Shubael, who with sons and relative made 12;

21for the fourteenth came out for Mattithiah, who with sons and relatives made 12;

22the fifteenth came out for Jeremoth, who with sons and relatives made 12;

23the sixteenth came out for Hananiah, who with sons and relatives made 12;

24the seventeenth came out for Joshbekashah, who with sons and relatives made 12;

25the eighteenth came out for Hanani, who with sons and relatives made 12;

26the nineteenth came out for Mallothi, who with sons and relatives made 12;

27the twentieth came out for Eliathah, who with sons and relatives made 12;

28the twenty-first came out for Hothir, who with sons and relatives made 12;

29the twenty-second came out for Giddalti, who with sons and relatives made 12;

30the twenty-third came out for Mahazioth, who with sons and relatives made 12;

31the twenty-fourth came out for Romamti-ezer, who with sons and relatives made 12.

1 Ch 25:20-31

Duties of Gatekeepers

26:1For the divisions of the gatekeepers, from the Korahites there was Meshelemiah son of Kore from the sons of Asaph. 2Meshelemiah/Shelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael second, Zebadiah third, Jathniel fourth, 3Elam fifth, Johanan sixth, Eliehoenai seventh.

4Obed-edom had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad second, Joah third, Sacar fourth, Nethanel fifth, 5Ammiel sixth, Issachar seventh, and Peullethai eighth. God had blessed him. 6Shemaiah had sons who governed their family because they were brave soldiers: 7Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, whose brothers Elihu and Semachiah were brave men. 8Obed-edom’s sons, their sons and relatives were capable and strong for the service—62.

9Meshelemiah had sons and relatives—18 brave men.

10Hosah son of Merari had sons: Shimri the first (though not born first; his father made him first), 11Hilkiah second, Tebaliah third, and Zechariah fourth. Hosah had 13 sons and relatives.

1 Ch 26:1-11
