3You’ve visited me at night and tested my heart;

you’ve put me on trial and found nothing wrong;

I’m determined not to say anything sinful.

4Your word has kept me from following

the example of cruel people.

5My steps have stayed on your path;

my feet haven’t slipped. Ps 17:1-5

6I’m calling on you, God,

because you answer me.

7Demonstrate your amazing, enduring love

for the ones that take refuge in you

from people that rebel against you.

8Keep me as the pupil of your eye;

hide me under your wings

9from sinners who plunder,

from deadly enemies that surround me,

10that have no mercy in their hearts,

and brag arrogantly.

11They’ve tracked me down and surrounded me,

and threaten to knock me to the ground.

12They’re like lions eager to maul me,

like young lions lurking in ambush. Ps 17:6-12

13Confront them, LORD; knock them down;

deliver me from sinners with the sword

14that’s in your hand,

from people who’ve cast their lot in this life,

whose stomach you fill with your treasure.

They’re satisfied with having children

and leaving their wealth to their babies.

15But because I’m righteous,

I’ll be satisfied by seeing you when I wake up. Ps 17:13-15

Psalm 18 (2 Samuel 22)

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David,

the LORD’s servant, who sang this song to him

when he delivered him from his enemies and from Saul

He said,

1“I love you, LORD, my strength,

2my fortress, my deliverer,

my God, my Rock, my Refuge;

my shield, the place that saves me, my stronghold.”

3I called on him who deserves praise,

and he saved me from my enemies.

4The waves of death entangled me;

the torrents of destruction flooded over me;

5the cords of Sheol tied me down;

the snares of death had entrapped me.

6In my desperation, I cried out to the LORD,

and he heard me in his Temple. Ps 18:1-6

7Then the earth quaked and the mountains shook

because he was angry.

8Smoke poured out of his nostrils;

consuming fire flared from his mouth;

glowing coals erupted from him.

9He lowered the sky too

and came down with dense darkness under his feet.

10He rode on a cherub

and came flying swiftly on the wings of the wind.

11He covered himself with darkness like a pavilion,

with dark rain clouds veiling his advance

12and hiding the brightness around him,

while hailstones and lightning bolts broke through his clouds.

13The LORD thundered from the sky;

the Most High raised his voice;

hailstones and lightning bolts resounded.

14He shot his arrows and scattered my enemies;

lightning flashes routed them.

15Then the water in the ocean receded;

the seabed was exposed

at his rebuke,

at the blast from his nostrils. Ps 18:7-15

16He reached down from on high and grabbed me

and pulled me out of the path of the raging tsunami.

17He delivered me from enemies

that hated me,

that were too strong for me.

18They attacked me at a time of distress,

but the LORD was my buttress.

19He brought me out to a safe place

and rescued me because he delighted in me.

20The LORD rewarded me for my goodness,

for my innocence;

21I’d kept his ways

and hadn’t sinned by leaving him;

22his ordinances all stayed with me;

I hadn’t shoved any of his statutes away.

23I stood blameless in his presence

because I’d kept myself from sinning.

24So the LORD rewarded me for my goodness,

for my innocence. Ps 18:16-24

25To the kind you’re kind;

with the blameless you’re blameless;

26with the pure you’re pure;

with the treacherous you’re shrewd.

27You rescue the humble

but bring down the haughty.

28You’re my lamp, LORD my God,

and shine light into my darkness.

29With your help, I can crush a whole battalion

I can scale any wall. Ps 18:25-29

30God’s way is perfect;

the LORD’s promise proves true;

he’s a shield for everyone that depends on his protection.

31Who is God except the LORD?

Who is a rock but our God,

32who wraps me in strength

and makes my way safe?

33He makes my feet as surefooted a red deer’s hooves

and stands me securely on high ground.

34He trains my hands for battle

and strengthens my arms to draw a bronze bow.

35He’s given me his deliverance as a shield;

his help has made me great.

36He’s widened the path where I step

so my feet don’t slip. Ps 18:30-36

37I chased my enemies and overtook them;

I didn’t turn back till I’d eliminated them.

38I thrust them through so they couldn’t get up again;

they fell under my feet

39because you wrapped me in strength for battle

and subdued my assailants.

40You’ve made my enemies retreat;

I destroyed the ones that hated me.

41They looked around for help, but there wasn’t any;

they even cried out to the LORD, but he didn’t answer.

42I pulverized them like dust in the wind,

emptied them out like dirt on the street.

43You delivered me from conflict with the people

and placed me at the head of nations;

people I didn’t know now serve me.

44Foreigners submit as soon as they hear me;

45they lose heart and come cringing out of their fortresses.

Ps 18:37-45

46The LORD lives; praise be to my Rock;

exalted be God that delivers me,

47that avenges me,

that subdues nations under me.

48that rescues me from my enemies,

lifts me above my attackers,

and delivers me from violent people.

49So I’ll thank you among the nations, LORD,

and sing your praises.

50You give victory for your king

and show enduring love to your anointed one,

to me [David] and my descendants forever. Ps 18:46-50

Psalm 19

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David.

1The heavens show God’s glory;

the sky displays his workmanship.

2Day in and day out they speak;

night after night they display intelligence.

3There’s no speech or words;

there’s nothing to hear.

4Their testimony goes out to the whole world,

their message to the ends of the earth;

in them he’s pitched a tent for the sun.

5It’s like a groom coming out of his room,

excited like a man in shape to run a race.

6It rises at one side of the sky

and makes its circuit to the other;

nothing escapes its warmth. Ps 19:1-6

7The Law of the LORD is perfect for reviving the soul;

his Testimony is reliable for making simple people wise.

8The precepts of the LORD are right, bringing happiness;

his commandments are clear, enlightening the mind.

9Respect for the LORD is pure, lasting forever;

his judgments are true and altogether just.

10They’re worth more than lots of fine gold;

they’re sweeter than honey that drips from the honeycomb.

11They warn me

and reward me when I keep them.

12Who can see their own mistakes?

So declare me innocent of my unseen faults.

13Restrain me from presumptuous sins;

don’t let them gain control of me.

Then I’ll be blameless and relieved for not sinning.

14May what I think and say

be acceptable to you, LORD, my Rock, my Redeemer. Ps 19:7-14

Psalm 20

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

1When trouble comes, may the LORD answer you!

May Jacob’s God set you safely on high!

2May he send help from the sanctuary

and support you from Zion!

3May he remember your many meal offerings

and find your burnt offerings acceptable.

4May he grant you your heart’s desire

and make your plans successful.

5You’ll sing for joy over his deliverance

and hoist your banners in his name.

May the LORD give you your petitions. Ps 20:1-5

6We know the LORD saves his anointed ones;

he answers them from his holy heaven

with the saving strength of his right hand.

7Some nations boast about chariots and horses,

but we’ll boast about the LORD our God.

8Those nations will collapse and fall,

but we’ll rise up and stand tall.

9Give us victory, LORD, when we call. Ps 20:6-9

Psalm 21

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

1LORD, the king delights in your strength;

he’s happy because you’ve helped him.

2You’ve given him his heart’s desire;

you didn’t withhold his request.

3You met him with blessings

and crowned him with fine gold.

4He asked you for life,

and you gave him life everlasting.

5He has great honor because you delivered him

and endowed him with splendor and majesty.

6You make him blessed forever

and happy because you’re with him. Ps 21:1-6

7The king trusts in the LORD;

because of the enduring love of the Most High,

he won’t be deposed.

8You’ll discover all your enemies;

you’ll find out who hates you.

9You’ll throw them into a blazing furnace in your anger;

you’ll burn them up in your wrath

10and destroy their offspring.

11Though they’ve devised a coup to harm you,

they won’t succeed.

12You’ll put them to flight

when you snap your bowstring at their faces.

13Be honored in your strength, LORD;

we’ll sing praises about your power. Ps 21:7-13

Psalm 22

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

Set to The Hind of the Dawn

1My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?

Why are you so far from helping me,

so far from my groaning?

2I call out in the daytime, but you don’t answer;

I don’t get any relief at night.

3Yet you’re holy,

enthroned on Israel’s praises.

4Our ancestors trusted in you, and you delivered them.

5They called out to you, and you saved them;

they relied on you, and you didn’t disappoint them. Ps 22:1-5

6But I’m a worm, not a man;

people scorn me and despise me.

7Everybody that sees me makes fun of me;

they make faces at me and shake their heads at me and say,

8“Entrust yourself to the LORD; let him deliver you;

let him rescue you because he delights in you!”

9Yet you’re the One that delivered me from the womb

and made me trust when I was on my mother’s breasts.

10I’ve depended on you from birth;

you’ve been my God from my mother’s womb. Ps 22:6-10

11Don’t be distant because trouble’s near;

there’s nobody else to help me.

12Many bulls have surrounded me;

fierce bulls from Bashan have gathered around me.

13They bellow at me

like ravening, roaring lions.

14I’m being poured out like water;

all my bones are out of joint;

my heart’s melting like wax.

15My strength has dried up like a potsherd,

my tongue is sticking to my jaws,

and you’ve laid me down dead in the dust.

16Dogs have surrounded me;

an crowd has ganged up on me;

they’ve pierced my hands and feet.

17I can count all my bones;

people are staring at me;

18they’re dividing up my clothes

and gambling for my garments. Ps 22:11-18

19Don’t be distant, LORD;

you’re my only help; hurry and help me.

20Deliver me from the sword;

rescue me from the dog’s paws;

21save me from the lion’s mouth

and the wild ox’s horns. Ps 22:19-21

22I’ll tell my brothers about you

and praise you when your people gather.

23You that respect the LORD, praise him;

stand in awe of him, descendants of Israel,

24because he hasn’t looked down on the oppressed

or ignored them;

when they’ve appealed to him for help, he’s listened. Ps 22:22-24

25The theme of my praise in the great assembly comes from you;

I’ll fulfill my vows in front of people that respect you.

26The poverty-stricken will eat and be satisfied;

those who rely on the LORD will praise him.

May their hearts live forever! Ps 22:25-26

27The most distant places will remember and turn to the LORD;

all the families in the nations will worship him

28because the kingdom belongs to him;

he rules the nations.

29Prosperous people will eat and worship;

everyone that goes down to dust will bow to him,

all those who can’t keep themselves alive.

30Posterity will serve him;

one generation will tell the next one about him.

31To people not yet born,

they’ll come to declare his goodness,

that he’s the One that’s done all of this. Ps 22:27-31

Psalm 23

A Psalm of David

1The LORD is my shepherd;

I’ll have everything I need.

2He beds me down in green pasture

and leads me beside still water.

3He refreshes me

and guides me along good paths for his honor.

4Even though I walk through the darkest valley,

I won’t be afraid, because he’s with me;

his rod and staff reassure me.

5You set a table for me in front of my enemies;

you anoint my head with oil;

my cup runs over.

6Goodness and mercy will follow me all my life,

and I’ll live in the LORD’s house forever. Ps 23:1-6

Psalm 24

A Psalm of David

1The earth and everything in it belongs to the LORD,

the world and those who live here.

2He positioned land higher than seas,

more elevated than ocean currents.

3Who can climb his mountain

and stand in his holy place?

4People with clean hands and pure hearts,

who don’t offer themselves up to idols

or lie under oath.

5They’ll receive a blessing from the LORD,

goodness from the God who keeps them safe.

6That’s the way it is for those who seek him out

and worship him—even the House of Jacob. Ps 24:1-6

7Open up, gates;

open up, everlasting doors,

so the glorious King can enter!

8Who is the glorious King?

The LORD strong and powerful,

the LORD mighty in battle.

9Open up, gates;

open up, everlasting doors,

so the glorious King can enter!

10Who is the glorious King?

The LORD of Hosts,

he is the glorious King. Ps 24:7-10

Psalm 25

A Psalm of David

1I hold my life up to you, LORD;

2I trust you;

don’t let me down

or let my enemies celebrate over my defeat.

3Nobody that waits for you will be discredited;

people who deal treacherously

are the ones that will be discredited. Ps 25:1-3

4 LORD, let me know your ways;

teach me your paths;

5lead me in your truth

because you keep me safe;

I’ll always depend on you.

6Remember your mercy and enduring love

that have existed from ages past.

7Don’t keep in mind the sins I committed when I was young;

remember me in the light of your enduring love. Ps 25:4-7

8The LORD is good and just,

so he instructs sinners in his way

9and leads the humble in what’s right.

10Everything he does comes from truth and enduring love

for those who keep his covenant and testimonies.

11For your own honor,

pardon my sin because it’s great. Ps 25:8-11

12Who of you respect the LORD?

He’ll instruct you in what to choose

13so you’ll keep succeeding

and your offspring will inherit the land.

14People that respect the LORD are his friends;

he’ll make his covenant known to them.

15I keep looking to him

because he untangles my feet from my enemies’ net. Ps 25:12-15

16Turn to me and be gracious

because I’m lonely and downcast.

17Relieve me of my pain and anguish,

and lift me out of my doldrums.

18Look at my troubles

and forgive my sin. Ps 25:16-18

19Look at all the enemies I have

that hate me so much!

20Guard my life and rescue me;

don’t let me regret taking refuge in you.

21Oh that integrity and godliness would protect me

because I depend on you.

22Redeem Israel, God, from all its troubles. Ps 25:19-22

Psalm 26

A Psalm of David

1Declare me innocent, LORD,

because I’ve conducted myself with integrity

and trusted in you without wavering.

2Examine me, put me on trial,

test my motives and attitude.

3I keep my eye on your unfailing love

and follow you faithfully.

4I don’t sit with deceitful people

or run around with pretenders.

5I detest the company of unreliable people

and refuse to join in with sinners.

6I’ll wash my hands to express my innocence

and frequent your altar, LORD,

7singing my gratitude

and telling about the wonderful things you’ve done. Ps 26:1-7

8 LORD, I love the Temple where you live,

the place where your glory lies.

9Don’t carry off my soul with sinners,

or my life with bloodthirsty people

10that devise sinful schemes

and hand out bribes left and right.

11But I maintain my integrity;

redeem me with your grace.

12My foot stands on solid ground;

I’ll bless you publicly. Ps 26:8-12

Psalm 27

A Psalm of David

1The LORD is my light and salvation;

who am I going to be afraid of?

He defends me;

who am I going to dread?

2When bad people come to devour me,

they stumble and fall.

3Though an army attacks me, it won’t frighten me;

though war breaks out against me, I’ll stay confident. Ps 27:1-3

4I ask the LORD for one thing—what I look for most:

to live in his house my whole life,

to see his beauty and meditate in his Temple.

5When trouble comes, he’ll shelter conceal me;

he’ll hide me in a secret place

and station me on a high rock.

6I’ll hold up my head above my enemies;

in his Tabernacle I’ll offer sacrifices with shouts of joy

and sing praises to the LORD. Ps 27:4-6

7Listen when I call out, LORD;

be gracious and answer me.

8You said, “Seek me,”

my heart and soul responded, “I’ll seek you.”

9Don’t ignore me

or turn away angry.

You’ve been my help;

don’t abandon me, God my Savior.

10Even if my parents exposed me I as an infant to die,

you would pick me up. Ps 27:7-10

11Teach me your way, LORD;

lead me on a level path away from my enemies.

12Don’t turn me over to them,

because lying witnesses have taken the stand against me,

the kind that threatens violence with every breath.

13I’d have despaired if I hadn’t believed

I’d see the LORD’s goodness while I was alive.

14So wait for him;

be strong and courageous.

Yes, wait for him. Ps 27:11-14

Psalm 28

A Psalm of David

1I’m calling out to you, LORD;

don’t turn a deaf ear, my Rock;

otherwise, I’ll be like someone going down to the Pit.

2Help me when I plead for help,

when I lift up my hands toward your holy sanctuary.

3Don’t drag me away with the wicked,

with those who sin,

who offer their neighbors peace

while selfish motives lurk in their hearts.

4Pay them back according to their deeds,

in proportion to the sin they practice.

5Since they don’t appreciate

what you’ve made and done,

tear them down and don’t rebuild them. Ps 28:1-5

6Bless the LORD for listening to my petition.

7He’s my strength and shield;

I trust him and he helps me;

so I celebrate and thank him with songs.

8He’s his people’s strength,

the saving defense for his anointed ones.

9Save your people and bless your inheritance;

be their shepherd and carry them forever. Ps 28:6-9

Psalm 29

A Psalm of David

1Children of the mighty,

attribute to the LORD honor and strength.

2Honor him like he deserves;

worship him in his holy splendor. Ps 29:1-2

3The sound from the LORD carries out over the water;

our glorious God thunders across the ocean expanse.

4His voice is loud and majestic

5and blows down cedars in Lebanon.

6He makes Lebanon skip like a calf

and Sirion [Mt. Hermon] jump around like a young wild ox.

7The sound from the LORD flashes out lightning bolts

8and shakes the Wilderness of Kadesh;

9it makes deer go into labor

and strips the trees bare.

In his Temple everyone shouts, “Glory!”

10The LORD sits like a king above the flood,

enthroned forever.

11He gives his people courage

and blesses them with peace. Ps 29:3-11

Psalm 30

A Psalm of David

A Song at the Dedication of the Temple

1I’ll praise you, LORD, because you’ve rescued me;

you haven’t let my enemies celebrate victory over me.

2I appealed to you for help, my God,

and you restored my health;

3you brought me up from Sheol;

you kept me from going down to the Pit.

4Sing praise to the LORD, his holy people;

thank him, 5because his anger is only for a little while,

but his blessing lasts a lifetime.

Weeping may go on all night,

but rejoicing comes in the morning. Ps 30:1-5

6In my good fortune, I said, “I’ll never be shaken.”

7Your blessing, LORD, made me feel as stable as a mountain;

but then you hid from me, and I was shattered.

8I called out to you in a petition:

9“What does my death accomplish if you let me go down to the Pit?

Will dust praise you and tell about your faithfulness?

10“Hear me, LORD; be gracious and help me.”

11You turned my mourning into dancing;

you removed my burlap of mourning

and dressed me in happiness.

12Now I can sing praise to you unrestrained;

I can be eternally grateful to you. Ps 30:6-12

Psalm 31

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

1I take refuge in you, LORD;

never let me be disgraced;

in your goodness protect me.

2Listen to me, rescue me quickly;

be a rock for me,

a strong fortress to save me.

3You’re my rock and fortress;

for your honor, lead me and guide me.

4Free me out of the trap people secretly laid for me

because you’re my protection.

5I’m entrusting my spirit to you;

rescue me, LORD, true God. Ps 31:1-5

6I detest those who respect worthless idols;

I trust in you, LORD.

7I’ll be happy in your enduring love,

because you see my difficulties

and know the trouble I’m in,

8because you haven’t handed me over to my enemies;

you’ve set me on a spacious place. Ps 31:6-8

9Be gracious to me in my distress, LORD;

my eyes are melting away with grief,

my soul and body are getting weak as well

10because I live in constant sorrow;

I spend my years in sighing.

My strength is failing because of sin;

my body is wasting away.

11Because I have so many enemies,

my neighbors despise me,

my acquaintances abhor me,

and people shun me in the streets.

12I’m forgotten like someone long dead,

out of mind like a broken pot.

13I hear people’s slander;

there’s terror on every side;

my enemies conspire against me

and lay plots to kill me. Ps 31:9-13

14But I trust you, LORD;

I swear, “You’re my God.”

15My future’s in your hands;

rescue me from my enemies,

from those who persecute me.

16Smile at me;

save me with your enduring love.

17Don’t let my enemies disgrace me, LORD,

because I’m calling on you.

Put sinners to disgrace;

let them be silent in Sheol.

18Make lying lips be mute

that insult the good with pride and contempt. Ps 31:14-18

19How great your goodness is

that you’ve stored up for those who respect you,

that you’ve shown to people that take refuge in you

so others can see.

20You secretly hide them with you away from people’s plots,

and shelter them from the conflict that tongues can cause.

21Bless the LORD

because he showed me his enduring love

when I was surrounded like a city under siege.

22I despaired in my alarm, “I can’t see you!”

but you heard my appeal. Ps 31:19-22

23Love the LORD, all you holy people!

He preserves the faithful

and repays those who act arrogantly.

24Be strong and courageous,

you that rest your hopes in him! Ps 31:23-24

Psalm 32

A Maskil. A Psalm of David

1How blessed they are whose sin God forgives,

whose transgression he covers;

2whose disobedience the LORD doesn’t hold against them,

whose spirit doesn’t harbor deceit!

3When I didn’t acknowledge my sin,

my body wasted away,

I moaned all day,

4your hand weighed on me day and night,

my strength drained away in the summer heat.

5When I acknowledged it and said, “I’ll confess my sin to the LORD,”

you forgave me.

6So everyone that’s godly needs to pray to you

while there’s time;

so when distress floods in,

it won’t overwhelm them.

7You’re our hiding place

for protecting us from trouble

and surrounding us with songs about deliverance. Ps 32:1-7

8I’ll teach you the way to go;

I’ll focus my attention on you and advise you.

9Don’t be like a senseless horse or mule

that needs a bit and bridle to make it obey.

10Sinful people incur lots of sorrow,

but enduring love surrounds those who trust the LORD.

11Be happy and celebrate in him;

shout for joy, all of you with godly hearts. Ps 32:8-11

Psalm 33

1Sing for joy to the LORD, good people;

praise is fitting for the godly.

2Give him thanks with a lyre;

sing praises to him with a ten-string harp.

3Sing a new song to him;

play skillfully and shout for joy.

4You can believe what he says

and rely on what he does.

5He loves goodness and justice,

and fills the world with his enduring love. Ps 33:1-5

6The LORD made the sky with a word,

all its host with the breath from his mouth.

7He gathered the water in the ocean

and stored up the depths in reservoirs.

8The whole world must respect him

and stand in awe of him.

9He spoke and it happened;

he commanded and it occurred.

10The LORD overrides the counsel of nations

and frustrates the peoples’ plans.

11His counsel stands forever;

his plans endure across the generations. Ps 33:6-11

12The nation is blessed whose God is the LORD,

the people he’s chosen for his inheritance.

13The LORD looks down from heaven at everyone;

14from where he sits, he sees the whole human race.

15He made their hearts;

so he understands what they do.

16A king doesn’t prevail by his large army;

a soldier doesn’t save himself by his great strength.

17A warhorse gives false hope for victory;

it doesn’t deliver anyone by its power. Ps 33:12-17

18The LORD watches over those who respect him,

who place their hope in his enduring love

19to deliver them from death

and keep them alive at famine time.

20We wait for him, our help and shield,

21and celebrate in him because we trust in him.

22Send down your enduring love to us, LORD,

because we’ve put our hope in you. Ps 33:18-22

Psalm 34

A Psalm of David When He Faked Insanity

in Front of Abimelech, Who Drove Him Away

1I’ll bless the LORD at all times

and praise him constantly.

2I’ll make my boast about him;

the helpless will hear it and take heart.

3Let’s tell how great the LORD is;

let’s honor him together.

4I looked to the LORD; he answered me

and freed me from my fears.

5People that look to him are radiant;

they never look subdued.

6I cried out in my suffering, and he listened

and saved me from my troubles.

7An angel of the LORD camps around people that respect him,

and he rescues them. Ps 34:1-7

8Taste and find out how good the LORD is,

how blessed everyone is that takes refuge in him!

9Respect him, his holy people;

those who do, have everything they need.

10Young lions get hungry,

but anyone that looks to the LORD has everything good.

11Come, children, listen to me;

I’ll teach you to respect the LORD.

12Who wants to live

a long time and prosper?

13Keep your tongue from sinning

and your lips from lying.

14Quit doing bad and do good;

look for peace and pursue it. Ps 34:8-14

15The LORD watches over good people

and hears them cry out to him.

16He turns against those who practice sin,

and erases the memory of them.

17When good people call for help; he listens

and rescues them from their troubles.

18He’s close to the brokenhearted

and saves those whose spirit is crushed.

19Good people face lots of trouble,

but the LORD delivers them.

20They keep all their bones;

not a one of them will be broken.

21Sin slays the sinful;

God punishes those who hate the righteous.

22He redeems his servants;

he doesn’t condemn anyone that takes refuge in him. Ps 34:15-22

Psalm 35

A Psalm of David

1LORD, oppose the ones that oppose me;

fight those who fight me.

2Put on buckler and shield,

and come to my aid.

3Draw spear and javelin against my pursuers;

tell me you’ll save me.

4Dishonor the ones that want to kill me;

drive back and humiliate those who scheme against me.

5Make them like chaff in the wind,

with the angel of the LORD blowing them.

6Make their path dark and slippery,

with the angel of the LORD chasing them;

7for no reason they hid a net to catch me

and dug a pit to trap me.

8Bring destruction on them unawares;

have the net they hide catch them;

have them fall into that very destruction. Ps 35:1-8

9I’ll be happy in the LORD

and celebrate over his salvation.

10My very bones say, “LORD, who is like you

that delivers the oppressed from people too strong for them

and saves the needy from the one that robs them?”

11Malicious witnesses testify against me

and accuse me of things I didn’t do

12They repay me bad for good; I’m heartbroken.

13But when they were sick, I wore burlap;

I humbled myself with fasting

and prayed with my chin on my chest.

14I went about as if it was my friend or brother;

I bent over mourning as if it was my mother.

15But when I stumbled, they celebrated and ganged up on me;

strikers that I didn’t even know gathered against me

and slandered me for no reason.

16Like godless jesters at a feast,

they gnashed their teeth at me. Ps 35:9-16

17Lord, how long will you just watch?

Rescue me from their ravages;

save me from those lions.

18I’ll thank you in the great community

and praise you in the mighty throng.

19Don’t let my enemies celebrate over me

or wink maliciously who hate me.

20They don’t talk about peace;

they scheme against those who are peaceful in the land.

21They open their mouth wide against me,

“Aha, aha, we saw him do it!” Ps 35:17-21

22You can see what they’re doing, LORD;

don’t stand back and not say anything.

23Stir yourself up, awake for my justice,

for my cause, my Lord and my God.

24Judge me, LORD, according to your goodness;

don’t let my enemies celebrate over me.

25Don’t let them say to themselves, “Just what we’d hoped!”

Don’t let them say, “Let’s eat him alive!”

26Humiliate them who celebrate over my distress;

dress them in shame and dishonor

who vaunt themselves up over me. Ps 35:22-26

27Shout for joy you that are in favor of my vindication;

say again and again, “The LORD is great;

he delights in his servant’s prosperity.”

28I’ll declare your goodness and praise all day long. Ps 35:27-28

Psalm 36

For the Choir Director

A Psalm of David, the LORD’s Servant

1Sin speaks to sinful people’s hearts;

they don’t respect God at all.

2They flatter themselves

that he can’t discover their sin.

3Their words deceive;

they’ve stopped being wise and doing good.

4They devise schemes in bed

and carry them out in the morning with no qualms Ps 36:1-4

5LORD, your enduring love reaches the stars;

your faithfulness is as high as the sky;

6your goodness as mighty as the mountains;

your justice as deep as the ocean;

your provision sufficient for everything that breathes.

7How precious that enduring love is!

All humanity finds protection under your wings.

8They drink their fill from the abundance in your house,

from your river of delights.

9You’re their fountain of life;

in your light they see light.

10Maintain your enduring love to all who know you,

your goodness to the godly in heart. Ps 36:5-10

11Don’t let the proud tramp on me

or the sinful shove me away.

12Let sinners fall where they sin,

thrown down so they can’t get up. Ps 36:10-12

Psalm 37

A Psalm of David

1Don’t worry about bad people

or envy those who do wrong;

2they’ll wither like grass

and fade like flowers.

3Trust in the LORD and do good

so you can live in the land and enjoy security.

4Delight in the LORD,

and he’ll give you what your heart desires.

5Commit your way to him and trust him,

and he’ll act on your behalf.

6He’ll bring forth your goodness like the dawn

and your vindication like the midday sun. Ps 37:1-6

7Rest in the LORD and wait patiently for him;

don’t worry about people that prosper

by carrying out dishonest schemes.

8Stop being mad at them; set anger aside;

don’t concern yourself with them;

that only leads to your own sinning.

9They’ll be destroyed,

but those who depend on the LORD will inherit the land.

10Sinners will soon be gone;

you can look all over for them,

but they won’t be there.

11It’s the humble that inherit the land

and delight in abundant prosperity. Ps 37:7-11

12Bad people plot against the good

and gnash their teeth at them.

13But the LORD laughs at them

because he sees what’s going to happen to them.

14Sinners draw the sword and bend the bow

to bring down the poor and needy

and slay the godly;

15but their sword will pierce their own heart,

and their bow will break. Ps 37:12-15

16The little that good people have is better

than the abundance sinners possess,

17because the LORD will break the arms of sinners

and sustain the good.

18He knows the time of the blameless;

their inheritance lasts forever.

19They aren’t discouraged in hard times

and have plenty during famine.

20But the sinful perish;

the LORD’s enemies are like flowers in a pasture;

they dissipate like smoke.

21The wicked borrow and don’t repay,

but the good are generous and give.

22Those he blesses will inherit the land;

the ones he curses will die. Ps 37:16-22

23The LORD guides the steps of the godly

and delights in their lives.

24If they fall, they won’t fall headlong

because the LORD will hold their hand.

25I was young once; now I’m old;

yet I’ve not seen good people abandoned

or their children beg for bread.

26They’re gracious and generous;

their descendants are a blessing.

27Quit doing bad things and do good

so you’ll live forever. Ps 37:23-27

28The LORD loves justice

and doesn’t abandon his holy people;

he keeps them forever,

but cuts off the descendants of the wicked.

29The godly will inherit the land

and live there permanently.

30The godly utter wisdom and speak justice.

31The Law of their God is in their heart;

their feet don’t slip.

32Sinners spy on them

and try to kill them.

33The LORD won’t abandon the godly to their power

or let them be condemned when they’re judged.

34Wait for the LORD and keep his way,

and he’ll raise you up to inherit the land;

you’ll see the wicked destroyed. Ps 37:28-34

35I’ve seen a violent, wicked people spread themselves out

like tall trees in their native soil.

36Then they passed away and were gone;

I looked for them, but they were nowhere to be found.

37Take note of blameless, watch the godly

because peaceful people prosper;

38but sinners will be destroyed

along with their future.

39The salvation of the godly comes from the LORD,

their refuge when trouble comes.

40The LORD helps them and delivers them,

protects them from sinners and saves them

because they take refuge in him. Ps 37:35-40

Psalm 38

A Psalm of David

for a Memorial

1LORD, don’t rebuke me in your wrath

or discipline me in your furious anger.

2Your arrows have pierced deep into me;

your hand has come down hard on me.

3Because of your indignation, my body’s not sound;

by my sin I’ve ruined my health.

4My iniquities have piled up higher than my head

and weighed me down.

5My wounds have festered and grown foul.

My foolish choices 6have doubled me over;

I grieve all the time;

7I’m burning up with fever;

my health is broken.

8I’m numb and crushed,

and groan from inner conflict. Ps 38:1-8

9Lord, you know what I long for;

you hear my sighs.

10My heart’s pounding, my strength’s failing;

the sparkle in my eyes is gone.

11My friends and loved ones stand back from my sickness;

my relatives stay well away from me.

12Those who want to kill me lay snares for me;

the ones that want to injure me threaten destruction,

constantly plotting treachery. Ps 38:9-12

13But like someone deaf, I don’t hear;

like a mute I don’t speak.

14Yes, I’m like somebody that can’t hear,

someone with no arguments to offer.

15I’m depending on you, LORD;

you’ll have to answer for me.

16Don’t let them celebrate over me

or gloat when my foot slips.

17I’m ready to fall;

my sorrow continually looms in front of me.

18I’m confessing my iniquity;

I’m anxious about my sin.

19But my enemies are vigorous and strong;

they hate me for no reason

20and repay bad for good

because I follow after what’s good.

21Don’t leave me, LORD;

stay close by!

22Hurry and help me, Lord my savior! Ps 38:13-22

Psalm 39

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

Set to Jeduthun

1I said, “I’ll watch what I do

so I won’t sin with my tongue;

I’ll put a muzzle on my mouth

when sinful people come around.”

2But when I kept silent even about what was good,

it was of no avail;

my agitation grew worse.

3The more I thought about it

the more the fire burned within me;

so I spoke up:

4“LORD, show me my end,

how long I’ll live;

let me realize how fleeting my life is.

5You’ve made my days like handbreadths;

my lifetime is only a moment to you.

We all stand like a mere breath.

6We walk around like shadows in turmoil for nothing;

we accumulate wealth without knowing who will inherit it.

Ps 39:1-6

7“Now Lord, what is it I’m waiting for?

You’re my only hope.

8Save me from my sins;

don’t let fools humiliate me.

9I can’t open my mouth; I’m not able to speak

because you’re the one that disabled me.

10Stop striking me;

I’m exhausted from your blows.

11You discipline us for our sins

and consume like a moth what’s precious to us.

Clearly, we’re all nothing more than a breath. Ps 39:7-11

12“Hear my prayer, LORD;

don’t ignore my tears

because I’m a passing guest,

a nomad like my ancestors.

13Leave me alone so I can be happy again

before I’m gone and don’t exist anymore.” Ps 39:12-13

Psalm 40

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

1I waited patiently for the LORD;

he listened to my call for help.

2He brought me up out of the pit of despair,

out of the muddy clay,

set my feet on solid rock,

and made my footsteps secure.

3He put a new song in me, a song about praising God;

other people will hear it, see what he’s done, and trust in him.

4How blessed people are that trust in the LORD

instead of turning to proud or deceitful people.

5LORD my God, you’ve done so many amazing things;

your good intentions for us are too many to tell.

Nobody compares with you;

if I tried to tell about your wonderful acts,

I couldn’t recount them all. Ps 40:1-5

6Your don’t delight in sacrifices and meal offerings;

you haven’t required burnt offerings and sin offerings;

you’ve pierced my ears. [you gave me a bodyLXX.]

7Then I said, “I’m coming;

it’s written about me in the scroll;

8I delight in doing your will, my God;

I have your Law at heart.”

9In the great assembly

I’ve proclaimed the good news about goodness

I didn’t hold back

10or keep to myself the truth about your goodness;

I spoke openly about your saving power,

about your enduring love and truth. Ps 40:6-10

11 LORD, don’t withhold your mercy from me;

let your enduring love and truth keep protecting me.

12Troubles beyond number surround me,

and my own sins overtake me

till I can’t see any way to escape them.

13LORD, please hurry and help me.

14Embarrass and humiliate those who keep trying to destroy me;

disgrace the ones that delight in hurting me.

15Make them appalled at their disgrace

who say to me, “Aha, aha!”

16Make them happy who look to you,

who love your salvation and chant,

“The LORD is great.”

17Keep me in your thoughts

because I’m in misery and need you,

my helper, my deliverer.

Don’t delay. Ps 40:11-17

Psalm 41

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

1How blessed people are that have regard for the poor;

the LORD will deliver them when they have need.

2He’ll protect them, keep them alive, and call them blessed;

3sustain them when they’re sick and restore them to health.

Ps 41:1-3

4I said, “Be gracious to me, LORD;

heal my soul because I’ve sinned against you.”

5My enemies say rude things about me:

“When’s he going to die

so we can forget about him?”

6When they come to visit me,

they say things they don’t mean;

they just come to gather threads

they can weave into gossip when they leave.

7Everybody that hates me whispers behind my back

and makes up hurtful things to say about me:

8“He has some deadly disease;

he’ll never get out of bed again.”

9Even the close friend that I trusted, that I ate with,

has turned against me. Ps 41:4-9

10But you, LORD, be gracious and restore me

so I can pay them back.

11I know you’re pleased with me;

you haven’t let my enemies triumph over me.

12You’ve upheld me in my integrity

and brought me into your eternal presence.

13Bless the LORD God of Israel

from everlasting to everlasting.

Amen and Amen. Ps 41:10-13

BOOK 2

Psalm 42

For the Choir Director

A Maskil of the Sons of Korah

1My soul pants for God

like a deer pants for water.

2My soul is thirsty for the living God;

when will I ever see him?

3My tears have been my food day and night

as people ask me all the time, “Where’s your God?”

4I think about these things as I pour out my soul.

I used to go with the throng,

leading the procession to the house of God,

singing for joy and giving thanks

in the great celebration.

5Why despair, my soul?

Why be disturbed?

Put your hope in God because I’ll still praise him

for the help his presence brings.

6I’m in despair, God;

so I remember you from the land of the Jordan,

from the peaks of Hermon—from Mount Mizar.

7The sounds of your crashing waves echo back and forth;

your waves and breakers are sweeping over me. Ps 42:1-7

8The LORD directs his enduring love to me in the daytime;

I sing his songs at night, prayers to my living God.

9I say to God, my Rock, “Why have you forgotten me?

Why do I go around in mourning

because my enemies oppress me?”

10Like breaking my bones, they taunt me;

people keep asking me, “Where’s your God?”

11Why despair, my soul?

Why be disturbed?

Put your hope in God because I’ll still praise him

for the help his presence brings. Ps 42:8-11

Psalm 43

1Declare me innocent, God;

defend me against this ungodly nation;

deliver me from liars!

2You’re the God that I rely on for courage;

why reject me?

Why do I go around in mourning

because my enemies oppress me?

3Send your light and truth to lead me,

to bring me to the holy hill where you live.

4Then I can go to your altar, my greatest source of joy,

and praise you with a harp.

5Why despair, my soul?

Why be disturbed?

Put your hope in God because I still praise him,

my helper and my God. Ps 43:1-5

Psalm 44

For the Choir Director

A Maskil of the Sons of Korah

1God, our ancestors have told us

what you did in their time long ago.

2You drove out nations and planted this one;

you struck them and scattered them abroad.

3Our ancestors didn’t conquer the land with their sword;

their own arm didn’t save them.

Your right hand, your arm,

the light of your presence did it

when you showed them favor. Ps 44:1-3

4You’re my King, God;

ordain victories for Jacob in our day too.

5By your power we’ll push back our adversaries

and tramp down our attackers.

6We don’t trust in our bow;

our sword won’t save us.

7You are the one that must save us from our enemies

and disgrace those who hate us.

8We take pride in you always

and give you thanks forever. Ps 44:4-8

9Yet now you’ve set us aside to dishonor;

you don’t go out with our armies.

10You’ve made us retreat from our enemies;

those who hate us have plundered our land.

11You’ve butchered us like sheep

and scattered us among the nations.

12You sell us cheap

and make no profit from doing it.

13You make us a disgrace to our neighbors,

something to scoff at,

14a byword the world over,

a laughingstock among the nations. Ps 44:9-14

15All day long we’re disgraced and humiliated

16because people insult us;

we have enemies and avengers everywhere.

17That’s all come on us though we haven’t forgotten you

or been unfaithful to your covenant.

18Our heart hasn’t deserted you;

we haven’t strayed from your way;

19yet you’ve crushed us in a place filled with jackals

and covered us with the shadow of death. Ps 44:15-19

20If we’d forgotten you

or raised our hands to a foreign god,

21wouldn’t you have found it out?

You know all our inner secrets.

22But for the sake of your honor, our lives are always in danger;

we’re like sheep headed for slaughter.

23Wake up, LORD; why are you sleeping?

don’t reject us forever.

24Why ignore us

and forget our suffering and oppression?

25We’re struck down to the dirt;

our bodies stick to the ground.

26Get up and help us;

redeem us like your enduring love suggests. Ps 44:20-26

Psalm 45

For the Choir Director. Set to Lilies

A Maskil of the Sons of Korah. A Song About Love

1My heart is overflowing with a noble theme

as I recite my verses to the king;

my tongue is like the pen of a gifted poet.

2You’re more handsome than the sons of men;

gracious words stream from on your lips;

God has blessed you forever.

3Strap your sword to your thigh, Mighty Warrior,

in your splendor and majesty!

4 In your majesty, ride on to victory,

defending truth, humility, and goodness;

have your right hand display awesome deeds.

5Your sharp arrows pierce your enemies’ hearts;

nations fall under you. Ps 45:1-5

6Your throne is eternal, God;

your kingdom’s scepter is a godly one.

7You love goodness and hate sinfulness;

so God, your God, has anointed you

with more happiness than your companions.

8Your robes have the fragrance of myrrh, aloes, and cassia;

stringed instruments entertain you in ivory palaces.

9 Yourmas maids of honor include kings’ daughters;

at yourmas right hand stands the queen in gold from Ophir. Ps 45:6-9

10Listen, daughter; pay attention;

forget your people and your father’s family

11The king delights in your beauty;

since he’s your lord, bow to him.

12The people from Tyre will shower youfem with gifts;

wealthy citizens will sue yourfem favor.

13The princess looks beautiful

in her gown interwoven with gold.

14She’ll be led to the king in embroidered robes

with bridesmaids in her train.

15With happiness and celebration,

they’ll enter the palace of the king. Ps 45:10-15

16Yourmas sons will take the place of yourmas fathers;

you’llmas make them rulers over many lands.

17I’ll perpetuate yourmas memory in every generation;

the nations will be eternally grateful to youmas. Ps 45:16-17

Psalm 46

For the Choir Director

A Psalm of the Sons of Korah

Set to Alamoth. A Song

1God is our refuge and strength,

an ever-present help when trouble comes.

2So we won’t be afraid

though the ground tremors,

though the mountains cascade into the sea,

3though its water roars and foams,

though the ground quakes at its tsunamis.

4There’s a river of joy that flows into the city of God,

the sacred place where the Most High lives.

5God is there; it’s unmovable;

from the break of day, he protects it.

6When nations rage and kingdoms totter,

his voice thunders and earth melts away.

7The LORD of Hosts is with us;

the God of Jacob is our refuge. Ps 46:1-7

8Come and look at what the LORD does:

he brings destruction on the earth;

9he stops wars all over the world;

he breaks bows and snaps spears in two;

he burns chariots.

10“So be still and know that I’m God;

exalted in every nation,

honored all over the world.”

11The LORD of Hosts is with us;

the God of Jacob is our refuge. Ps 46:8-11

Psalm 47

For the Choir Director

A Psalm of the Sons of Korah

1Clap your hands, everybody;

shout to God with joy;

2because you are to revere the LORD Most High,

the great King over the whole world.

3He subdued people groups under us,

put nations beneath our feet,

4and chose our inheritance for us,

the pride of Jacob that he loves. Ps 47:1-4

5God has ascended with a shout,

with a trumpet fanfare.

6Sing praises to God, sing praises;

sing praises to our King, sing praises;

7because God is King over the whole world;

sing praises with a beautiful psalm.

8He reigns over the nations on his holy throne.

9The rulers of the people have gathered together

with the people of Abraham’s God;

because the shields of the earth belong to him;

he’s highly honored. Ps 47:5-9

Psalm 48

A Song. A Psalm of the Sons of Korah

1The LORD is great and deserves great praise

in the city of our God on his holy mountain.

2Mount Zion, the heights of Zaphon, is high and beautiful—

the joy of the whole earth, the city of the great King.

3In its towers God reveals himself as a strong defense.

4Kings joined forces

and advanced against that strong defense.

5But as soon as it came into view,

they panicked and fled.

6Panic seized them

like the anguish of a woman in childbirth.

7The LORD destroyed them

like ships of Tarshish capsized by an east wind.

8As we’ve heard, so we’ve seen

in the city of the LORD of Hosts, our God;

he’ll make it safe forever. Ps 48:1-8

9In your Temple we think about your enduring love.

10Like your name, God, your praise is everywhere;

your right hand is filled with goodness.

11Let Mount Zion be happy,

and the residents of Judah celebrate your goodness.

12Walk around Zion and count its towers;

13inspect its ramparts and tour its fortresses

so you can tell the next generation;

14because God is God forever;

he’ll guide us till we die. Ps 48:9-14

Psalm 49

For the Choir Director

A Psalm of the Sons of Korah

1Hear this, every nation;

listen, everyone on earth,

2low and high, rich and poor alike.

3My words are wise;

my thoughts are full of insight.

4I listen to proverbs

and expound my riddles on a harp.

5Why should I be afraid when there’s adversity,

when my enemies’ sins are all around me,

6people who trust in their wealth

and brag about how rich they are?

7Nobody can use wealth to redeem a brother from death

or pay God a ransom for him—

8redeeming a life is too expensive;

you may as well forget about

9living on forever and not seeing the Pit. Ps 49:1-9

10Even the wise die—

just like the ignorant and senseless—

and leave their wealth to others.

11They act like their houses will last forever,

like where they live will be there for all generations;

so they name their lands after themselves.

12But in all their pomp, they won’t endure;

they’ll perish like animals.

13This is the fate of the foolish

and those who agree with them:

14like sheep they’re appointed to Sheol;

death will be their shepherd.

The godly will rule them in the morning;

Sheol will consume their form

far from their stately homes.

15But God will redeem me from its power

and take me to himself. Ps 49:10-15

16Don’t be afraid when people get rich,

when their houses appreciate in value;

17because when they die, they won’t take anything with them;

what they gloried in won’t go down with them to the grave.

18Though they congratulate themselves while they’re alive,

though other people praise them for being successful,

19they’ll go to their ancestors

and never see the light of day.

20People in all their pomp who don’t have intelligence

amount to being like animals when they die. Ps 49:16-20

Psalm 50

A Psalm of Asaph

1God, the Mighty One, the LORD, has spoken

and calls to earth from sunrise to sunset.

2He shines forth out of Zion in perfect beauty.

3Our God comes; he doesn’t stay quiet;

a fire consumes in front of him;

a storm rages around him.

4He calls on the sky above and the earth beneath

to witness the judgment of his people.

5“Gather my people to me

that I’ve made a covenant with by sacrifice.”

6The heavens declare his justice

because God himself is judge. Ps 50:1-6

7“Listen, my people, and I’ll speak;

Israel, I’ll bring my charges against you.

I’m God, your God.

8I don’t have any complaint about your sacrifices

or burnt offerings that are always in front of me.

9But I don’t need any bulls from your barns

or male goats from your pens;

10every animal in the forest already belongs to me,

the livestock on a thousand hills.

11I know every bird in the mountains;

everything that moves in the field is mine.

12If I was hungry, I wouldn’t say anything to you about it,

because the whole world belongs to me and everything in it.

13Will I eat the meat of bulls

or drink the blood of male goats?

14Offer to me a sacrifice of thanksgiving;

keep your vows to the Most High.

15Call on me when there’s trouble;

then I’ll rescue you, and you’ll honor me.” Ps 50:7-15

16But God says to the sinful,

“What reason do you have to recite my statutes

or discuss my covenant?

17You hate discipline

and disregard what I tell you.

18Thieves are your friends;

you associate with adulterers.

19You give your mouth free reign;

your tongue tells lies.

20You sit around and gossip about your brother;

you slander your mother’s son.

21I didn’t speak up when you did those things,

so you thought it didn’t matter to me;

but now I’ll charge you

and lay out my case against you. Ps 50:16-21

22“Consider this, you that forget about me,

or I’ll tear you to pieces,

and there won’t be anyone to save you.

23Giving thanks is the sacrifice that honors me;

I’ll show you my deliverance if you keep to my path.” Ps 50:22-23

Psalm 51

Psalm for the Choir Director. A Psalm of David,

When Nathan the Prophet Came to Him,

After He’d Slept with Bathsheba

1Be gracious to me, God, in proportion to your enduring love;

according to your great mercy, blot out my transgressions.

2Wash me thoroughly from my sin;

cleanse me from my iniquity.

3I know my failings;

my sin always weighs on my mind.

4I’ve sinned against you and you only;

I did what you consider evil;

so you’re justified in what you say to me,

blameless when you condemn me. Ps 51:1-4

5I was born in sin;

in iniquity my mother conceived me.

6You want truth in the inward self;

you’ll make me know wisdom in myself.

7Purify me with hyssop, and I’ll be clean;

wash me, and I’ll be whiter than snow.

8Fill me with joy and happiness again,

and let the bones you broke mend up.

9Don’t look at my sins;

blot out my iniquities. Ps 51:5-9

10Create a clean heart in me, God;

renew a steadfast spirit within me.

11Don’t banish me from your presence

or take your Holy Spirit away from me.

12Restore to me the joy your salvation brings;

grant me a willing attitude to obey.

13Then I’ll teach transgressors your ways;

sinners will be converted to you.

14Deliver me from being guilty of murder

so I can joyfully sing about your goodness.

15LORD, open my lips

so I can express your praises.

16You don’t delight in sacrifice; otherwise, I’d give it;

you’re not pleased with burnt offerings.

17The sacrifice you want is a broken spirit;

you appreciate a repentant heart.

18In your good favor, do good to Zion;

build up the walls around Jerusalem.

19Then you’ll delight in godly sacrifices,

in burnt offerings and whole burnt offerings;

then young bulls will again be offered on your altar. Ps 51:10-19

Psalm 52

For the Choir Director. A Maskil of David,

When Doeg the Edomite Came and Told Saul,

“David has gone to Ahimelech’s house.”

1God’s enduring love lasts all day;

so why brag about sinning, great soldier?

2Your tongue cuts like a razor.

3You like evil more than good,

falsehood more than truth.

4You like words that devour

and a lying tongue that deceives.

5But God will strike you down once and for all;

he’ll pull you out of your tent

and uproot you from the land of the living. Ps 52:1-5

6Good people will see it and be amazed;

they’ll laugh at you and say,

7“Look at the men that wouldn’t take refuge in God,

but trusted in their great wealth

and used their strength to destroy.”

8But I’m like a green olive tree in God’s house;

I’ll always trust in his enduring love.

9I’ll be eternally grateful for what he’s done,

and depend on him in front of his holy people

because that’s good. Ps 52:6-9

Psalm 53

For the Choir Director. Set to Mahalath

A Maskil of David

1Fools tell themselves there’s no God.

They’re corrupt and commit disgusting sins;

none of them does what’s good.

2God looks down from heaven

to see if anybody understands,

if anybody looks to him.

3Every one of them has turned aside and become corrupt;

not a one does what’s good, not a one. Ps 53:1-3

4Won’t sinners ever learn?

They eat up my people like bread

and don’t pray to me.

5They’ll be in a panic like never before,

because I’ll scatter the bones of your attackers;

you’ll put them to shame because I’ve rejected them.

6Oh that deliverance would come out of Zion!

When I restore the fortunes of my people,

Jacob will celebrate, Israel will be happy. Ps 53:4-6

Psalm 54

For the Choir Director. A Maskil of David,

When the Ziphites Came and Told Saul,

“Isn’t David hiding among us?”

On Stringed Instruments

1Deliver me, God, by your name;

vindicate me by your power.

2Listen to my prayer; hear what I have to say.

3Foreigners have attacked me;

violent people have tried to kill me;

they don’t care about you.

4But God helps me; the LORD sustains my life.

5He pays back my adversaries

and destroys them in his faithfulness.

6I’ll sacrifice to him willingly

and thank him because he’s good.

7He’s delivered me from all my trouble

so I could triumph over my enemies. Ps 54:1-7

Psalm 55

For the Choir Director. A Maskil of David

On Stringed Instruments

1Hear my prayer, God;

don’t ignore my plea.

2Listen and answer;

trouble has overwhelmed me; I’m distracted

3by the threats of my enemies,

by bringing suffering on me

and bearing angry grudges against me. Ps 55:1-3

4My heart’s pounding;

terror of death has fallen on me.

5Fear and trembling have come over me;

horror has overwhelmed me.

6I said, “I wish I had wings like a dove!

I’d fly off and find peace.

7I’d flee far away

and lodge out in the countryside.

8I’d hurry to my shelter

from the howling wind and raging storm.” Ps 55:4-8

9Lord, destroy their plans; confuse their languages,

because all I see is violence and conflict in the city.

10Day and night they patrol the walls,

but sin and scheming threaten inside it.

11Ruin is rampant within it;

oppression and cheating never leave the streets. Ps 55:9-11

12It’s not an enemy that’s disparaging me;

I could handle that;

it’s not foes that hate me and rise up against me,

I could hide from them.

13But it’s you, my equal,

my companion, my familiar friend.

14We used to be close friends

that walked in God’s Temple together.

15Let death overtake my enemies;

let them go down alive to Sheol,

because there’s evil where they live. Ps 55:12-15

16I’ll call on the LORD my God to deliver me.

17Morning, noon, and night, he’ll hear my groaning

18and deliver my life in peace from my attackers,

because lots of people are opposing me.

19The One who sits enthroned from of old

will punish the ones that don’t change or respect him.

20As for that companion of mine,

he betrays his friends and breaks his promises

against those who are at peace with him. Ps 55:16-20

21His speech is smoother than butter,

but there’s war in his heart;

his words are more soothing than oil,

but secretly they’re drawn daggers.

22Put your burdens on the LORD, and he’ll take care of you;

he won’t let the godly fall.

23You, God, will bring the wicked down to the deepest pit;

bloodthirsty, devious people won’t live half their time,

but I’ll trust in you. Ps 55:21-23

Psalm 56

For the Choir Director. A Mikhtam of David,

When the Philistines Seized Him in Gath

Set to The Pigeon in Far-Off Terebinths

1Be gracious, God; people are walking all over me,

oppressing me all the time, 2attacking me.

3When I’m afraid, I put my trust in you.

4In you, whose word I praise, I’ve put my trust;

what can mortals do to me?

5All day long they try to frustrate my purposes;

they think up ways to harm me.

6They stir up conflict, they lurk, they watch my every step,

looking for a chance to kill me.

7Because they’re sinful, throw them out;

in anger put them down, God! Ps 56:1-7

8You’ve kept track of my wanderings

and collected my tears in your bottle;

aren’t they recorded in your scroll?

9My enemies will retreat when I call to you for help;

I know this one thing: you’re with me.

10In God, whose word I praise,

in the LORD, whose word I praise,

11I’ve put my trust so I won’t be afraid;

what can mortals do to me?

12I have to perform my vows to you;

I’ll give thank offerings for your help,

13because you’ve delivered me from death

and my feet from stumbling

so I can walk with you in the light of life. Ps 56:8-13

Psalm 57

For the Choir Director. A Mikhtam of David,

When He Fled from Saul in the Cave

Set to Do Not Destroy

1Be gracious to me, God,

because I depend on you to protect me;

in the shadow of your wings I take refuge

till danger passes.

2I call out to God Most High,

who accomplishes everything for me;

3he sends help from heaven to rescue me

and discredits whoever tries to run over me. Ps 57:1-3

4I live among lions;

I have to lie among those who breathe fire,

people whose teeth are spears and arrows,

whose tongues are sharp swords.

5Be raised up higher than the sky, God;

shine your glory on the whole world.

6They’ve set a trap for me to step in;

they’ve dug a pit for me—I’m weary from stress—

but they’ve fallen into it themselves! Ps 57:4-6

7My heart is steadfast, God; it’s steadfast;

I’ll sing; yes, I’ll sing praises!

8Wake up, my glory;

wake up, harp and lyre;

I’ll wake up the dawn with my songs.

9I’ll give you thanks, God, among the peoples

and sing praises to you among the nations.

10Your enduring love is as high as the sky;

your truth reaches up to the clouds.

11Be raised up higher than the sky, God;

shine your glory on the whole world. Ps 57:7-11

Psalm 58

For the Choir Director. A Mikhtam of David

Set to Do Not Destroy

1Leaders, do you decree what’s right?

Do you judge justly?

2No, you plot injustice in your hearts

and spread violence in the land.

3The sinful go astray from the womb;

they lie from the time they’re born.

4They have venom like vipers,

and stop up their ears like deaf cobras

5so they don’t hear their charmers’ voices

or those skilled at casting spells. Ps 58:1-5

6Pull out their fangs, God;

break the teeth out of the young lions.

7Make them disappear like water that drains away;

make their arrows shafts without points.

8Make sinners be like snails that dissolve as they go along,

like a miscarriage that never sees the sun.

9Before your pots can feel the heat of burning briers;

he’ll sweep them away with a whirlwind,

whether green or on fire. Ps 58:6-9

10Good people will celebrate when they see God pay them back;

he’ll wash their feet in the sinners’ blood.

11People will say, “There’s surely a reward for good people;

there’s certainly a God that judges on earth!” Ps 58:10-11

Psalm 59

For the Choir Director. A Mikhtam of David,

When Saul Sent Men to Watch the House and Kill Him

Set to Do Not Destroy

1Deliver me from my enemies, God;

set me on high away from my attackers.

2Save me from sinners;

rescue me from bloodthirsty people.

3They lie in ambush to kill me;

fierce enemies stir up conflict against me, LORD,

but not for my transgression.

4For no fault of mine, they run to attack me;

get up to see and help me! Ps 59:1-4

5LORD God of Hosts, God of Israel,

wake up and punish the nations;

don’t extend grace to any that are treacherous.

6They come back in the evening

and roam the city, howling like dogs.

7They growl with their mouth;

they have swords in their lips;

they say, “Who’s going to hear us?”

8But you laugh at them, LORD;

you scoff at the nations. Ps 59:5-8

9I’ll watch for you, my Strength, my fortress.

10You’ll meet me in your enduring love;

and let me look down in triumph at my enemies.

11Don’t kill them; otherwise, my people will forget;

scatter them with your power

and bring them to their knees, LORD our shield.

12For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips,

catch them in their pride, their curses, and the lies they tell.

13In your anger, destroy them so they’ll be out of the way,

so people will know that you rule in Jacob

and everywhere.

14They come back in the evening

and roam the city, howling like dogs.

15They wander around looking for food

and growl if they’re not satisfied. Ps 59:9-15

16But I’ll sing about your strength,

every morning about your enduring love.

You’ve been my fortress,

my refuge in trouble.

17I’ll sing praise to you, my Strength,

the God who shows me enduring love. Ps 59:16-17

Psalm 60

For the Choir Director. A Mikhtam of David,

to teach when he struggled with Aram-naharaim and Aram-zobah,

and Joab came back and struck 12,000 Edomites in the Valley of Salt

1You’ve rejected us, God, and broken us;

you’ve been angry, but restore us now.

2You’ve made the land quake; you’ve split it open;

now repair the faults and stop the tremors.

3You’ve made your people endure hardship

and given us wine that makes us stagger.

4You’ve raised a banner for those who respect you

as a rallying point for truth.

5Save us now with your right hand and answer us,

deliver your beloved. Ps 60:1-5

6In his kindness God has answered;

“I’ll celebrate by dividing up Shechem

and measuring out the Valley of Succoth.

7Gilead and Manasseh belong to me;

Ephraim is my helmet; Jacob is my scepter.

8Moab will be my washbasin;

I’ll scrape off my shoes on Edom

and shout in triumph over Philistia!” Ps 60:6-8

9Who will take me to a fortified city?

Who will lead me to Edom?

10Have you rejected us, God?

You’re not going out with our armies.

11Help us against our enemies;

we have no hope of human deliverance!

12Through you we can do valiantly;

you’ll tread down our adversaries. Ps 60:9-12

Psalm 61

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

On Stringed Instruments

1Listen to my prayer, God; hear my prayer.

2With a faint heart I call to you from the end of the earth;

lead me to the rock that’s higher than me.

3You’re my refuge, my strong tower against the enemy.

4Let me live in your tent forever

and take shelter under your wings.

5You’ve heard my vows, God,

and given me the inheritance that comes to those who respect you.

6Lengthen the king’s life;

make his lifetime like many generations.

7Have him sit enthroned in your presence forever;

appoint enduring love and truth to preserve him.

8I’ll sing praise to you forever

as I pay my vows each day. Ps 61:1-8

Psalm 62

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

Set to Jeduthun

1I wait for God alone

because my victory comes from him.

2He alone is my rock, my salvation, my fortress;

I won’t be shaken.

3How long will youpl assail me

so you can murder me,

like a leaning wall or crumbling fence?

4Your only intention is to knock me down;

you enjoy lying about me;

you bless out loud but curse inside. Ps 62:1-4

5My soul, wait in silence for God

because my hope lies only in him.

6He alone is my rock, my salvation, my fortress;

I won’t be shaken.

7My deliverance and glory rest with him,

my strong rock and refuge.

8Always trust him, people;

pour out your heart to him, our refuge. Ps 62:5-8

9Common people have no value;

the powerful aren’t what they seem.

Either one rises higher in the balances;

they’re both lighter than air.

10Don’t put confidence in extortion;

don’t place empty hopes in stealing.

If wealth does increase, don’t set your heart on it.

11God has spoken once;

I’ve heard it twice

that power belongs to God

12and the LORD has enduring love;

he pays people according to their work. Ps 62:9-12

Psalm 63

A Psalm of David,

When He Was in the Wilderness of Judah

1God, you’re my God; I look to you in earnest;

my soul thirsts for you;

my flesh yearns for you in this dry, weary land.

2So I’ve looked at you in the sanctuary

and seen your power and glory.

3 I’ll praise you

because your enduring love is better than life;

4I’ll bless you as long as I live

and lift up my hands in your name.

5You satisfy my soul like the finest food;

I offer praises gladly. Ps 63:1-5

6I remember you when I’m in bed;

I think about you during the night.

7You’ve been my help;

I sing for joy in the shadow of your wings.

8My soul clings to you;

your right hand upholds me.

9But those who are trying to destroy me

will end up in the ground.

10The sword will overwhelm them;

they’ll become prey for foxes.

11But the king will celebrate in God;

everybody that swears by him will glory

while liars’ mouths will be stopped. Ps 63:6-11

Psalm 64

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

1Listen to my complaint, God;

keep me from living in dread of my enemies.

2Hide me from the secret plots of bad people,

from the schemes of sinners

3that sharpen their tongue like a sword,

that aim bitter words like arrows,

4that shoot at innocent people from hiding places,

and do it suddenly without qualms.

5They latch onto sinful purposes

and talk secretly about setting traps;

they say, “Who will notice?”

6They look for ways to be unjust,

“We’re ready with a well-conceived plot,”

because the human mind and heart are cunning. Ps 64:1-6

7But God will wound them with an arrow

8and make them trip over their tongues!

Everybody that sees them will shake their heads.

9Then everybody will be respectful

and talk about what God’s done

and ponder what he’s made.

10Good people will be happy in the LORD

and take refuge in him;

the godly in heart will honor him. Ps 64:7-10

Psalm 65

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

A Song

5You answer us with awesome deeds, God who keeps us safe,

who is trusted in every land and the farthest sea.

6You established the mountains by your power

and dressed yourself with strength,

7you that still the roaring seas

and the disturbances among the nations.

8They who live at the ends of the earth

stand in awe at your wonders;

you make the dawn and sunset shout for joy. Ps 65:5-8

9You take care of the earth and water it;

you greatly enrich the ground and provide the water

to grow the grain;

that’s how you’ve ordained things to work.

10You water the plowed ground abundantly and level its ridges;

you soften its clods with showers and bless its growth.

11You crown the year with abundant harvests;

paths get overgrown with lush vegetation.

12The pastures in the countryside drip with dew;

the hills blossom with rejoicing.

13The meadows are clothed with flocks;

the valleys are covered with grain;

they shout and sing for joy. Ps 65:9-13

Psalm 66

For the Choir Director. A Psalm. A Song

1Make a joyful sound to God, all the earth.

2Sing about his honor;

make his praise glorious.

3Say to him, “What you do is so awesome!

Your enemies feign obedience to you

out of fear for your power.

4All the earth worships you and praises you;

they sing praises to you.” Ps 66:1-4

5Come and see what God has done;

it’s awesome what he’s done for people.

6He turned the Red Sea into dry ground;

the people crossed through the Jordan on foot;

they celebrated over him there.

7He rules by his power forever;

he keeps watch over the nations;

the rebellious don’t make an uprising. Ps 66:5-7

8Bless our God, you nations;

sound his praise abroad.

9He keeps us alive

and doesn’t let our feet slip.

10You’ve tried us, God,

and refined us like silver.

11You caught us in your net

and laid a heavy load in our lap.

12You put a ruler over us

and passed us through fire and water;

yet you brought us out into a large place.

13I’ll come to your Temple with burnt offerings

and keep the vows 14I made when I was in trouble.

15I’ll offer you burnt offerings of healthy animals

with the smoke of rams;

I’ll offer bulls and male goats. Ps 66:8-15

16Come and listen, you that respect God,

and I’ll tell you what he’s done for me.

17I appealed to him with my mouth

and extolled him with my tongue.

18If I cherish sinfulness in my heart,

the LORD won’t hear me.

19But he’s certainly heard me;

he’s listened to my prayer.

20Bless God,

who hasn’t ignored my prayer

or withdrawn his enduring love. Ps 66:16-20

Psalm 67

For the Choir Director. A Psalm. A Song

With Stringed Instruments

1God, be gracious and bless us;

smile at us

2so every nation can know your way

and your saving power.

3May the nations praise you;

may they all praise you.

4May they be happy and sing

because you judge them justly

and guide them.

5May the nations praise you, God;

may they all praise you.

6The earth has yielded its produce;

God, our God, has blessed us

7so everyone everywhere will respect him. Ps 67:1-7

Psalm 68

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

A Song

1Arise, God, scatter your enemies;

chase off those who hate you!

2Blow them away like smoke;

melt them like wax near fire;

make sinners perish in your presence.

3But may good people be happy,

delight in your presence,

celebrate and be glad.

4So sing to God, sing praises to him;

lay out a highway for the One that rides through deserts,

whose name is Yah,

and celebrate with him. Ps 68:1-4

5God in his holy Temple

is a father for the fatherless and a judge for widows;

6he makes a home for the lonely

and leads prisoners out to prosperity;

only the rebellious live in a parched land.

7God of Israel, when you went out ahead of your people

and marched through the desert,

8the ground shook,

the sky poured down rain,

Sinai itself quaked in front of you.

9You sent widespread, abundant rain, God,

and refreshed your inheritance when it was parched.

10The animals settled in it;

in your goodness you provided for the poor. Ps 68:5-10

11The Lord gives the command,

and a host of women sing the good news:

12“Kings and their armies flee

the women that stayed home divide the spoil!”

13Even those who stayed among the flocks found treasure

like the wings of a dove covered with silver

and pinions covered with glistening gold.

14The Almighty scattered the enemy kings there

like blowing snow in Zalmon.

15The mountain in Bashan is majestic,

a mountain range with many peaks.

16Mountain with many peaks, why do you look with envy

at the mountain God wanted for his home?

He’ll certainly live there forever.

17God had twice ten thousand chariots, thousands upon thousands;

Yahveh came with them from Sinai to the holy place.

18When you ascended on high and led captivityLXX captive,

and received gifts among people, even rebellious people—

so Yahveh God might live there.

Ps 68:11-18

19Bless Yahveh, who carries our burdens every day,

who keeps us safe 20and rescues us;

deliverance from death comes from Yahveh the Lord.

21He’ll bash in the heads of his enemies,

the hairy crowns of those who keep doing their guilty deeds.

22The Lord said, “I’ll bring them down from Bashan

and bring them up from the ocean depths

23so you can wash your feet in their blood

and your dogs can have their share of your enemies.” Ps 68:19-23

24They’ve seen your solemn procession, God,

the procession of God, my King, into the sanctuary—

25singers first, then musicians,

with young women playing tambourines.

26Bless God as a community,

Yahveh, the fountain of Israel.

27There’s Benjamin, the youngest, leading them,

the officials of Judah in the throng,

the officials of Zebulun and Naphtali.

28Summon your strength, God;

show us your power like you have before.

29Kings will bring you gifts

because of your Temple in Jerusalem.

30Scare off the beast that lives in the reeds,

the herd of bulls among the calves of the nations.

Trample underfoot its bars of silver;

scatter the nations that delight in war.

31Let envoys bring gifts out of Egypt;

let Nubia quickly submit to God. Ps 68:24-31

32Sing to God, kingdoms on earth;

sing praises to Yahveh,

33that rides high in the ancient sky,

that thunders out his loud voice.

34Attribute power to God,

whose majesty shines on Israel,

whose strength is displayed in the sky.

35He’s awesome in his sanctuary;

the God of Israel gives strength and power to his people.

Bless God! Ps 68:32-35

Psalm 69

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

Set to Lilies

1Save me, God;

I’m in water up to my neck!

2I’ve sunk in deep mud, where there’s no foothold;

a flood is sweeping over me.

3I’m worn out from crying; my throat’s dry;

my eyes are red from crying, waiting for my God.

4The people that hate me for no reason

outnumber the hairs on my head;

those who want to destroy me are powerful;

they’re trying to make me repay what I didn’t steal. Ps 69:1-4

5God, you know about my foolish choices;

I can’t hide the things I’ve done wrong.

6May those who put their hope in you

not be disgraced because of me;

may the ones who look to you

not be dishonored by what I’ve done;

7because I’ve endured humiliation for your sake;

I have shame written all over my face.

8I’m alienated from my brothers;

my mother’s sons treat me like a foreigner.

9I’m consumed with zeal for your Temple;

the insults of those who insult you have fallen on me.

10When I humble myself with fasting, they mock me;

11when I wear burlap, they make my name a byword.

12Those who sit in the city gate talk about me;

drunks make up songs about me. Ps 69:5-12

13But, I pray to you, LORD;

at an acceptable time, in your great enduring love,

answer me with your sure salvation.

14Save me from sinking in the mud;

deliver me from my enemies and from deep water.

15May the flood not overwhelm me

or the deep drown me

or the Pit close over me. Ps 69:13-15

16Answer me, LORD, because your enduring love is good;

turn to me according to your great mercy.

17Don’t abandon me,

because I’m in distress; answer me quickly.

18Come close to my soul and redeem it;

ransom me from my enemies.

19You know my disgrace, shame, and dishonor;

all my adversaries stand in your presence. Ps 69:16-19

20Insults have broken my heart; I’m heartsick.

I looked for sympathy, but there wasn’t any,

and for comforters, but I couldn’t find any.

21Instead, they gave me gall to eat and vinegar to drink.

22May their table become a snare

and their peace a trap.

23May their eyes go blind

and their loins tremble feebly.

24Pour out indignation on them;

overwhelm them with furious anger.

25Make their camp desolate

and their tents deserted.

26They persecute the one you yourself have struck;

they strike even more the ones you’ve already wounded.

27Pile their sins high;

don’t let them experience your goodness.

28Erase them from the Book of Life;

don’t enroll them with the godly. Ps 69:20-28

29I’m miserable with pain;

save me, God; set me safely up high.

30I’ll praise God with song

and magnify him with thanksgiving.

31That will please the LORD more

than a young bull with horns and hoofs.

32The humble will see it and be happy;

you that look to God for help will revive your hearts.

33The LORD listens to the needy;

he doesn’t look down on his imprisoned people. Ps 69:29-33

34Let earth and sky praise him,

the seas and everything that’s in them.

35God will save Zion and rebuild the towns in Judah

so the people can settle there and own it.

36The descendants of his servants will inherit it;

those who love him will live there. Ps 69:34-36

Psalm 70

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

for a Memorial

1Hurry and deliver me, LORD;

come quick to help me.

2Discredit those who want to kill me;

turn them back and

dishonor the people that delight in harming me.

3Because of their disgrace,

turn them back those who say, “Aha, Aha.”

4May the ones that depend on you be happy in you;

may those who love your deliverance repeatedly say,

“God is great.”

5But I’m poor and needy, LORD!

you’re my deliverer; don’t delay. Ps 70:1-5

Psalm 71

1I’ve taken refuge in you, LORD;

don’t let me be discredited.

2In your goodness, rescue me;

listen to me and save me.

3Be my rock of refuge that I can always go to;

give orders to save me

because you’re my rock and fortress.

4Rescue me from sinners,

from the grasp of cruel men.

5You’re my hope, Lord GOD,

my confidence since I was young.

6the One that took me from my mother’s womb

and sustained me since I was born. Ps 71:1-6

7Many have marveled over me

because you’ve been my strong refuge.

8I’m full of your praise

and glory all the time.

9Don’t set me aside in my old age

or leave me as my strength begins to fail.

10My enemies speak against me;

they who want to kill me consult with each other,

11“God has left him.

Let’s go get him;

he doesn’t have anybody to defend him.” Ps 71:7-11

12God, stay close by to help me.

13Consume my adversaries with shame;

cover their faces with dishonor that try to harm me.

14But I’ll keep hoping

and praising you on and on.

15I’ll tell about your goodness

and how many times you’ve saved me,

though I can’t count how often that’s happened.

16I’ll praise the great deeds of the Lord GOD

and tell about the goodness you alone have. Ps 71:12-16

17You’ve been teaching me since I was young;

I still talk about your wonderful deeds.

18Even when I’m old and grey, don’t leave me, LORD,

till I tell this generation about your strength

and future people about your power.

19Your goodness is as high as the sky,

you that have done great things.

Who is like you?

20You let me face troubles and distresses,
