but you revive me afterwards

and lift me out of deep despair.

21You increase your greatness toward me

and comfort me once again.

22I’ll praise you with a harp for your faithfulness, my God;

and sing praises with a lyre, you Holy One of Israel.

23I’ll shout for joy when I sing to you;

my soul that you’ve redeemed will praise you.

24I’ll talk about your goodness,

because the ones that were trying to harm me

have been discredited. Ps 71:17-24

Psalm 72

A Psalm of Solomon

1Give the king your judgments, God;

give your goodness to his son.

2May he judge your people fairly,

your oppressed ones with justice.

3Let the mountains bring prosperity to the people;

may the hills bring goodness.

4May he defend the downtrodden,

save the children of the needy,

and crush their oppressors. Ps 72:1-4

5Let them respect you as long as the sun lasts,

as long as the moon endures—throughout all generations.

6May the king rule like rain on mown grass,

like showers that water the ground.

7May good people flourish in his time

and have abundant peace till the moon disappears. Ps 72:5-7

8May he rule from sea to sea,

from the Euphrates River to the ends of the earth.

9Let desert nomads bow to him,

and his enemies lick dust.

10Let the kings of Tarshish and the islands bring presents,

and the kings of Sheba and Seba offer gifts.

11Let all kings bow to him

and every nation serve him.

12He’ll deliver the needy when they call for help,

the oppressed with no one to help them.

13He’ll have mercy on the poor and needy

and save their lives.

14He’ll rescue them from oppression and violence;

their blood is precious to him;

15so may they live long and receive the gold of Sheba;

let them pray to him continually

and bless him all day long. Ps 72:6-15

16May grain be abundant in the land;

may it wave on tops of the hills.

May it produce like Lebanon;

may its people blossom in the city like grass in the pasture.

17May the king’s name last forever

and grow as long as the sun shines.

Let people bless themselves by him

and all nations call him blessed.

18Bless the LORD, the God of Israel,

who alone does wonderful things.

19Bless his glorious name forever;

may the whole world be full of his glory.

Amen and Amen.

20The end of the prayers of David son of Jesse Ps 72:12-20

BOOK 3

Psalm 73

A Psalm of Asaph

1God is good to Israel,

to those whose hearts are pure.

2I’d almost stumbled; my steps almost slipped;

3because I envied the prosperity of the arrogant.

4They don’t seem to suffer when they die;

their bodies are healthy and well.

5They don’t have trouble like other people;

they aren’t stricken like everyone else.

6So pride is the gold chain around their neck;

violence is their clothes.

7Their eyes are puffy with fatness;

they have everything they could want.

8They mock, and talk about oppressing,

and talk down to the oppressed.

9They brag against the sky itself;

their words strut across the world. Ps 73:1-9

10So his people turn to them

and drink in all their claims.

11They say, “How does God know any of this?

Does the Most High even know what’s happening?”

12They’re the sinful,

always at ease as their wealth grows.

13It seems like I’ve kept my heart pure for nothing

and washed my hands in innocence for no reason,

14because I’m stricken all day

and endure grief every morning. Ps 73:10-14

15If I’d talked the way I felt,

I’d have betrayed your people.

16When I tried to understand why sinners prosper,

I was troubled by it

17till I went to God’s sanctuary;

then I understood their destiny.

18You put them on slippery places

and make them slide into ruin.

19They’re quickly destroyed,

completely swept away by sudden desolation!

20They’re like dreamers when they wake up, LORD;

their phantoms disappear. Ps 73:15-20

21When I was bitter and in turmoil inside,

22I was senseless and ignorant

like an animal in your presence.

23Nevertheless, I’m continually with you;

you’ve taken me by the hand.

24You’ll guide me with your advice

and afterward receive me into glory.

25Who do I have in heaven but you?

I want you more than anything on earth.

26My own flesh and heart may grow weak,

but you’re my strength and portion forever.

27Those who are far from you perish;

you destroy those who are not faithful to you.

28Your nearness to me is good for me;

I’ve made you my refuge

so I can tell everybody how you operate. Ps 73:21-28

Psalm 74

A Maskil of Asaph

1Why have you thrown us away forever, God?

Why does your anger smoke at the sheep in your pasture?

2Remember your community that you bought so long ago,

that you redeemed as a tribe for your heritage,

Mount Zion, where you’ve lived.

3Direct your attention to its continuing ruins;

the enemy has destroyed everything in the sanctuary.

4Your adversaries have roared in your sanctuary

and set up their own standards for signs.

5It’s like someone that used an axe in a forest;

6they broke down its carved work with hatchets and hammers.

7They burned the sanctuary to the ground

and defiled your home.

8They said to themselves, “We’ll completely subdue them”;

they set fire to your meeting places in the land.

9We don’t see miraculous signs anymore;

there aren’t any prophets;

nobody knows how long this will last.

10How long will your adversaries scoff, God,

and mock you? Forever?

11Why hold back from doing something?

Why keep your right hand against your chest? Ps 74:1-11

12Yet you’re my king from ancient times,

who provided deliverance on the earth.

13You divided the sea by your power

and bashed the heads of sea monsters in the water.

14You crushed Leviathan’s heads

and made it into food for animals in the open country.

15You opened springs and torrents,

and dried up flowing rivers.

16Day and night belong to you;

you put the sun and stars in place.

17You established boundaries for the land

and marked out summer and winter. Ps 74:12-17

18Remember, LORD, that your enemies are scorning you;

foolish people are ridiculing you.

19Don’t deliver your turtledove to a wild animal;

don’t forget forever the life of your hurting people.

20Have regard for your covenant

because the land is filled with violent places.

21Don’t let the oppressed return ashamed;

let the poor and needy praise you.

22Stand up for youirself, God;

remember how foolish people scoff at you all day long.

23Don’t forget the clamor of your adversaries,

the constant uproar of those who rebel against you. Ps 74:18-23

Psalm 75

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of Asaph

A Song; Set to Do Not Destroy

1Thank you, God, for being close by;

people declare your wonderful deeds.

2“When I set a time for judgment;

I’ll judge even-handedly.

3The earth and everybody in it melt;

I’m the One that firmly set its pillars.

4I said to people that brag, ‘Stop it,’

and to sinners, ‘Don’t lift up your horns;

5don’t raise them up high

or talk with such arrogance.’” Ps 75:1-5

6Exaltation doesn’t come from the east or west,

7but from God, the judge;

he puts one person down and raises another up.

8There’s a cup of foaming wine in his hand;

he has mixed it well and pours it out;

sinners have to drain it and drink its dregs.

9I’ll sing praise to Jacob’s God;

I’ll declare it forever.

10He’ll cut off the horns of the wicked,

but lift up the righteous. Ps 75:6-10

Psalm 76

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of Asaph

A Song. On Stringed Instruments

1God is known in Judah;

his name is great in Israel.

2His home is in Salem;

he lives on Zion.

3He has broken flaming arrows there,

shields, swords, and weapons of war.

4You’re glorious, more majestic

than mountains full of beasts of prey.

5Our stouthearted enemies have been stripped of their spoil;

they’ve sunk into deep sleep;

none of the soldiers could raise a hand against us.

6At your rebuke, God of Jacob,

horse and rider were thrown down into dead sleep.

7You’re to be respected;

who can withstand you when you’re angry? Ps 76:1-7

8You rendered judgment from heaven;

the earth lay silent in fear

9when you arose to measure out judgment,

to save the oppressed on earth.

10People’s wrath only heightens your honor;

you dress yourself with the ashes of their anger.

11Make your vows to the LORD your God and fulfill them;

let everyone bring gifts to the One they need to respect.

12He breaks the pride of princes;

kings on earth respect him. Ps 76:8-12

Psalm 77

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of Asaph

Set to Jeduthun

1I raise my voice up to God; I call out loud;

it rises to him so he’ll hear me.

2When trouble comes, I turn to the LORD for help.

All night I reach out to him,

but I get no reassurance.

3When I think about him, I’m shaken;

I sigh and feel faint.

4He won’t let me sleep;

I’m in such distress I can’t pray.

5I think about days gone by, years ago.

6I remember singing during the night,

meditating and pondering in my mind. Ps 77:1-6

7Will the LORD reject me forever now?

Won’t he ever be kind to me again?

8Has his enduring love stopped permanently?

Have his promises come to an end?

9Has he forgotten to be gracious?

In his anger has he withdrawn his mercy?

10I said, “It’s my destiny

that the LORD has turned against me.”

11Then I reconsider what all you’ve done, LORD,

and recall your wonders from of old.

12I think about everything you do.

13Your way is holy;

What god is as great as you?

14You work wonders

and demonstrate your power among the nations.

15You’ve rescued your people by your strength,

descendants of Jacob and Joseph. Ps 77:7-15

16When the water faced you, God,

it tremored to its depths.

17Clouds poured down water;

the sky thundered;

your arrows flashed.

18You thundered in the whirlwind;

lightning flashes lit up the landscape;

the ground shook.

19You went through the sea;

your path led into deep water,

but your footprints didn’t show.

20You led your people like a flock

by the hand of Moses and Aaron. Ps 77:16-20

Psalm 78

Maskil of Asaph

1Listen to my instruction, my people;

pay attention to what I’m saying.

2I’ll tell a parable and offer hidden truths from our history,

3things we’ve heard and known from our ancestors.

4We won’t keep them from our children;

we’ll tell the next generation what we praise the LORD for:

his strength, the amazing things he’s done. Ps 78:1-4

5He established a Testimony in Jacob

and appointed a Law in Israel,

one that he commanded our ancestors

to teach their children;

6so the coming generation would know—

children not yet born—

so they’d grow up and tell their children

7to put their confidence in God,

not forget what he’s done,

and keep his commands.

8They weren’t to be like their ancestors,

stubborn and rebellious,

who didn’t prepare their heart,

whose spirit wasn’t faithful to God.

9The Ephraimites were archers equipped with bows;

yet they retreated in battle.

10They didn’t keep God’s covenant

or follow his Law. Ps 78:5-10

11They forgot what he’d done,

the miracles he’d shown them.

12He performed wonders for their ancestors to see

in Egypt and in the plain of Zoan.

13He divided the sea so they could pass through it

and made the water stand in a pile.

14He led them with a cloud in the daytime

and the light of fire at night.

15He split rocks open in the desert

to give them drinking water in abundance.

16He brought streams out of rock

and made water run like a river.

17Yet they continued to sin against him,

to rebel against the Most High in the desert.

18In their heart they put him to trial

by asking for food they’d like better.

19They spoke against him

“Can God prepare a table in the desert?

20He struck the rock, and water gushed out

and streams overflowed.

Can he give us bread too?

Can he feed us meat?” Ps 78:11-20

21When the LORD heard it, he was furious;

his wrath burned like fire against Jacob;

his anger flared at Israel

22because they didn’t believe in him

or trust in him to deliver them.

23Yet he commanded the clouds above

and opened the doors in the sky,

24and rained down manna on them

and gave them bread from the sky to eat.

25People ate the bread of angels;

God sent them food in abundance.

26He made the east wind blow

and directed the south wind by his power.

27When he rained meat on them as plentiful as dust—

winged fowl as abundant as sand by the sea—

28he let them fall in the camp around the tents. Ps 78:21-28

29So they ate their fill of what they craved.

30Before they’d satisfied their desire,

while their food was in their mouths,

31God’s anger swelled up against them;

he killed their strongest

and cut down Israel’s picked men.

32In spite of that, they still sinned

and didn’t believe in his wonderful deeds.

33So he brought their days to an end in futility,

their years in terror. Ps 78:29-33

34When he started taking their lives,

they finally repented and turned to him diligently.

35They remembered that he was their rock,

that the Most High God was their redeemer.

36But they tried to flatter him and lie to him

37because they weren’t being honest with him

or faithful to his covenant.

38But in his mercy, he forgave their sin

and didn’t destroy them;

he often restrained his anger

and didn’t express all his wrath.

39He remembered that they were mortal,

wind that blows and doesn’t return.

40How often they rebelled against him in the desert

and grieved him there!

41Again and again they tested him

and pained the Holy One of Israel. Ps 78:34-41

42They didn’t keep in mind his power

or his rescuing them from their foe

43as when he performed his signs in Egypt

and his miracles in the plain of Zoan:

44he turned their streams to blood

so they couldn’t drink from them;

45he sent swarms of flies that devoured them

and frogs to devour them;

46he gave their crops to caterpillars

and the product from their labor to locusts;

47he destroyed their grapevines with hail

and their sycamore-figs with sleet;

48he exposed their cattle to hailstones

and their flocks to lightning bolts;

49he let loose his hot anger on them:

fury, indignation, and distress—

a band of destroying messengers;

50he directed his anger against them,

not sparing them from plague and death;

51he struck Egypt’s firstborn,

the oldest sons in the tents of Ham.

52Then he led his own people out like sheep

and guided them in the desert like a flock.

53He led them safely so they weren’t afraid,

but the sea drowned their enemies. Ps 78:42-53

54He brought them to his holy land,

to this hill country that he’d won.

55He drove out the nations in front of them,

divided up the land for an inheritance,

and enabled the tribes of Israel to live in their tents.

56Yet they tested him and rebelled against the Most High God,

and didn’t observe his testimonies.

57They were as unreliable as a crooked bow.

58They provoked him with their high places

and aroused his jealousy with their carved images. Ps 78:54-58

59When God heard it, he was angry

and came to abhor Israel.

60So he abandoned his house in Shiloh,

the Tabernacle he’d pitched among them.

61He let his powerful Ark be captured

and surrendered his honor to the adversary.

62He allowed the sword to destroy his people

and vented his anger on his inheritance.

63Fire consumed his young men;

virgins had no wedding songs.

64His priests fell by the sword,

and widows couldn’t weep. Ps 78:59-64

65Then the LORD woke up as from sleeping,

like a soldier aroused from drunkenness.

66He routed his adversaries

and put them to eternal shame.

67He rejected Joseph’s descendants

and chose not to keep the tribe of Ephraim,

68but chose Judah, Mount Zion that he loved.

69He built his sanctuary as high as the sky,

as enduring as the earth.

70He chose David his servant,

took him from the sheepfolds,

71from tending ewes that had young

to shepherding Jacob his people,

Israel his inheritance.

72He shepherded them with a godly heart

and led them with skillful hands. Ps 78:65-72

Psalm 79

A Psalm of Asaph

1Other nations have invaded your inheritance, God;

they’ve defiled your holy Temple

and laid Jerusalem in ruins.

2They’ve given the buzzards your servants’ corpses,

and the wild animals the flesh of your holy people.

3They’ve poured out their blood like water around Jerusalem;

there wasn’t anybody to bury them.

4We’ve become a disgrace to our neighbors,

mocked and derided by the people around us.

5LORD, will you be angry forever?

Will your jealousy keep burning like fire? Ps 79:1-5

6Pour out your wrath on nations that don’t know you,

that don’t call on you;

7they’ve devastated Jacob and laid waste his realm.

8Don’t hold our ancestors’ sins against us;

bring us mercy quickly because we’re in despair.

9For your honor, help us, God who delivers;

forgive our sins for your name’s sake.

10Why should the nations say, “Where’s their God?”

Show those nations your vengeance

for your servants’ blood that they shed.

11Listen to the moaning prisoner;

with your great power save those doomed to die.

12Repay our neighbors seven times over

for the taunts they’ve leveled at you, LORD,

13so we, your people, the sheep in your pasture,

can be eternally grateful to you

and recount your praise to all generations. Ps 79:6-13

Psalm 80

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of Asaph

Set to Lilies; A Testimony

1Listen, Shepherd of Israel,

you that lead Joseph like a flock;

show your glory,

you that are enthroned above the cherubs.

2Stir up your power against Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh;

and come to rescue us.

3Restore us, God;

look at us with favor so we’ll be saved. Ps 80:1-3

4LORD God of Hosts,

how long will you be angry with our prayers?

5You’ve fed us tears

and made us drink them in full measure.

6You made us a taunt to our neighbors;

they laugh at us among themselves.

7God of Hosts, restore us;

look at us with favor so we’ll be saved. Ps 80:4-7

8You took a grapevine out of Egypt,

drove out the Canaanite nations,

and planted it in their land.

9You cleared the ground for it;

it took deep root and spread across the whole land.

10It covered the mountains with its shadow

and God’s cedars with its branches.

11It grew its branches all the way out to the Mediterranean Sea,

its shoots as far as the Euphrates River.

12Why did you tear down its walls

so everybody that goes by can pick its fruit?

13A boar from the woods roots it up;

whatever moves in the countryside feeds on it. Ps 80:8-13

14God of Hosts, please come back now;

look down from heaven and take care of this grapevine,

15the root you planted,

the son you’ve raised for your use.

16Our enemies have cut it down and burned it;

may they perish at the rebuke from your angry look.

17Encourage the man at your right hand,

the son you made strong for yourself.

18Then we won’t turn away from you anymore;

revive us so we can call on you again.

19LORD God of Hosts, restore us;

look at us with favor so we’ll be saved. Ps 80:14-19

Psalm 81

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of Asaph

Set to The Gittith

1Sing to God your Strength;

make a joyful sound to Jacob’s God.

2Sing, beat the tambourine,

pluck the lyre and harp.

3At the new moons blow your ram’s horn,

at the full moon and on your festival days.

4It’s a statute for Israel,

an ordinance from Jacob’s God.

5He established it as a Testimony in Joseph

when he displayed his power all over Egypt.

I heard a language I didn’t know, saying. Ps 81:1-5

6“I’ll take the burden off your shoulders

and free you from heavy labor.

7You cried out in trouble, and I rescued you;

I answered you while I concealed myself in a thundercloud;

I tested you when you had no water at Meribah.

8Listen, my people, when I admonish you;

Israel, if only you’ll listen!

9There’s to be no foreign god among you;

don’t worship any alien deity.

10I’m the LORD your God

who brought you out of Egypt.

Open your mouth, and I’ll fill it.” Ps 81:6-10

11“But my people ignored me;

Israel wouldn’t obey.

12So I let them follow their stubborn heart

and go after their own devices.

13If only they’d listen!

If Israel would just follow my ways,

14I’d quickly subdue their enemies;

I’d turn my hand against their foes,

15I’d doom forever

those who hate me while pretending to obey me.

16I want to feed you with the finest wheat

and satisfy you with wild honey from the rocky cliffs.” Ps 81:11-16

Psalm 82

A Psalm of Asaph

1God presides over the divine council

and judges you judges.

2So how long will youpl judge unjustly

by showingpl partiality to lawbreakers?

3Renderpl justice to the weak and fatherless;

standpl up for the oppressed and destitute.

4Rescuepl the weak and needy;

deliverpl them from bad people. Ps 82:1-4

5You don’t know or understand;

You’re walking around in the dark;

the very foundations of your world are unstable.

6I say, “You’re gods,

children of the Most High,

7but you’ll die like other mortals

and fall like anyone else.”

8You judge the world, God!

You’re the One that owns the nations. Ps 82:5-8

Psalm 83

A Song. A Psalm of Asaph

1God, don’t keep quiet; don’t be silent.

2Your enemies are making an uproar;

those who hate you are exalting themselves.

3They’re plotting against your people,

conspiring against them 4and saying,

“Let’s wipe out their nation

so no one will remember them anymore.”

5Together they’re signing a treaty against you:

6Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites;

7Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek;

Philistia and the people in Tyre;

8Assyria has joined them too;

they’re allied with Lot’s descendants. Ps 83:1-8

9Deal with them like you dealt with Midian,

with Sisera and Jabin at the Kishon River,

10that you destroyed at En-dor,

that became like manure on the ground.

11Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb

and their officials like Zebah and Zalmunna,

12who said, “Let’s take over God’s pastures.” Ps 83:9-12

13Make them like whirling dust,

like chaff in the wind.

14Like a wildfire that burns a whole forest,

like a flame that sets mountains on fire;

15chase them with your storm;

terrify them with your tempest.

16Write shame all over their faces

till they submit to you, LORD.

17Frighten them forever;

let them die in disgrace

18so they’ll know that you

are supreme over the whole world. Ps 83:13-18

Psalm 84

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of the Sons of Korah

Set to The Gittith

1Your Temple is so beautiful, LORD of Hosts!

2I long, yes, even faint with longing for your courts;

my body and soul sing for joy to the living God.

3Even a sparrow finds a home for herself,

a swallow builds a nest to raise her young

near your altars, LORD of Hosts, my God and King.

4How blessed they are who live in your Temple

and continually sing your praises.

5How blessed people are whose strength comes from you,

who’ve resolved to make pilgrimages to Zion!

6As they pass through the Valley of Weeping,

they turn it into a spring;

autumn rains cover it with blessings.

7They grow from strength to more strength

till each one appears before God in Zion. Ps 84:1-7

8LORD God of Hosts, listen to my prayer;

listen to me, God of Jacob!

9Extend your favor to the shield

you anointed over us,

10because one day in your courts is better than a thousand elsewhere.

I’d rather stand at the threshold of your Temple

than live at ease in the tents of sinners,

11because the LORD is sun and shield,

who gives grace and honor

and doesn’t withhold anything good from those who do what’s right.

12LORD of Hosts, how blessed they are who trust in you! Ps 84:8-12

Psalm 85

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of the Sons of Korah

1LORD, you blessed your land;

you restored the fortunes of Jacob;

2you forgave your people’s iniquity

and pardoned their sins;

3you withdrew your fury

and turned away from your hot anger.

4Restore us, our Deliverer;

end your displeasure with us.

5Will you be angry with us forever?

Will you extend your wrath to every generation?

6Won’t you revive us

so we can celebrate over you?

7Show us your enduring love, LORD;

grant us your salvation. Ps 85:1-7

8I’ll listen to what our God the LORD says,

because he offers peace to his holy people,

those who avoid foolish behavior.

9His salvation is nearby for those who respect him,

so there can be honor in our land.

10Truth and enduring love combine;

goodness and peace kiss each other.

11Faithfulness grows up from the ground,

and goodness looks down from the sky.

12The LORD gives what’s good

so our land can yield its produce.

13Goodness goes ahead of him

and makes his footprints into a path. Ps 85:8-13

Psalm 86

A Prayer of David

1Listen, LORD, and answer me

because I’m troubled and in need.

2Preserve my life because I’m a godly man;

save me because I trust in you.

3Be gracious to me

because I call out to you all the time.

4Make me happy

because I hold up my life to you.

5You’re good, ready to forgive,

and abundant in enduring love

to everyone that calls on you.

6Hear my prayer, LORD;

listen to my petition.

7When I’m in trouble, I call on you

because you answer me.

8There’s no one like you among the gods,

no other deeds like yours.

9All the nations you’ve made will come

to worship you and honor you,

10because you’re great and do great things;

only you are God. Ps 86:1-10

11Teach me your way;

I’ll follow your truth;

make me consistently respect you.

12I’ll thank you, LORD my God, with all my heart

and honor you forever

13because you show me such enduring love;

you’ve rescued me from the depths of Sheol. Ps 86:11-13

14Arrogant people are attacking me, God;

a gang of violent men wants to kill me;

they don’t care about you.

15But you’re a merciful, gracious God,

slow to get angry

and abundant in enduring love and faithfulness.

16Turn to me and be gracious;

give me your strength;

save your servant’s son.

17Show me a sign of your favor

so the ones that hate me can see it and be put to shame,

because you’ve helped me and reassured me. Ps 86:14-17

Psalm 87

A Song. A Psalm of the Sons of Korah

1The city that the LORD founded stands on his holy mountain;

2he loves Zion more than the other places in Jacob.

3Glorious things are said about you, city of God.

4“I’ll count Rahab [Egypt] and Babylon among those who know me,

Philistia, Tyre, and Nubia too:

‘They’ve become citizens there,’” people will say.

5But they will say about Zion,

“This one and that one were born here”;

the Most High himself has made it so.

6When the LORD registers the nations,

he’ll say, “They’ve all become citizens here.”

7Then those who sing and those who play flutes will say,

“The springs of all our joy are in you.” Ps 87:1-7

Psalm 88

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of the Sons of Korah.

A Song. Set to Mahalath Leannoth

A Maskil of Herman the Ezrahite

1LORD God who keeps me safe,

I call out to you day and night.

2Let my prayer come to you;

listen to my call!

3I’ve had so much trouble;

I’m close to Sheol.

4I’m as good as dead,

like someone with no strength left.

5Abandoned among the dead

like someone slain in the grave,

I’m forgotten and cut off from you.

6You’ve put me in the Pit,

in regions dark and deep.

7Your anger overwhelms me;

wave after wave weighs heavily on me.

8You’ve made my friends avoid me

by making me someone they detest;

I’m trapped and can’t escape.

9My sight is blurry from tears;

I call on you every day, LORD,

and reach out to you for help. Ps 88:1-9

10Do you perform wonders for the dead?

Do departed spirits rise and praise you?

11Do they declare your enduring love in the grave

or your faithfulness in the place of destruction?

12Are your wonders known in the dark

or your goodness in the land of forgetfulness? Ps 88:10-12

13LORD, I call out to you for help;

in the mornings my prayers go up to you.

14Why are you rejecting me?

Why are you hiding from me?

15I’ve been attacked and close to death from my youth up;

I suffer from the terrors you bring; I’m overwhelmed.

16Your furious anger has swept over me;

your dreaded assaults have destroyed me.

17They surround me like water all the time

and engulf me completely.

18You’ve removed lover and friend far from me;

my companions lie in darkness. Ps 88:13-18

Psalm 89

A Maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite

1I’ll sing forever about the LORD’s enduring love

and make known his faithfulness to every generation,

2because I’ve said, “You build up enduring love;

in the heavens you establish your faithfulness.”

3The LORD said, “I’ve made a covenant with my chosen one;

I’ve sworn to David my servant,

4‘I’ll make your descendants secure forever

and build up your throne to all generations.’” Ps 89:1-4

5The sky praises your wonders

and extols your faithfulness in the assembly of your holy angels.

6Who in the sky can compare with you?

Who among the heavenly beings is like you,

7a God greatly respected in the council of holy angels

and awesome above everyone around him?

8Lord GOD of Hosts, who is like you?

You’re completely faithful.

9You rule the raging sea;

when its waves rise up, you quiet them.

10You’ve crushed Rahab like one that’s slain

and scattered your enemies with your strong arm. Ps 89:5-10

11The sky is yours; the earth belongs to you;

you’ve founded the world and everything in it.

12You’ve created north and south;

Tabor and Hermon shout for joy over you.

13You have a powerful arm and a strong hand;

you lift your right hand high.

14Goodness and justice make the foundation for your throne;

enduring love and truth proceed ahead of you.

15How blessed people are who know the sound of joy,

who walk in the light of your presence, LORD.

16In your name they celebrate all day;

your goodness lifts their spirits.

17They glory in your strength;

your blessing honors them.

18Their shield belongs to the LORD;

their king belongs to the Holy One of Israel. Ps 89:11-18

19Long ago you said in a vision to your holy people,

“I’ve crowned a great man,

chosen from the common people.

20I found my servant David

and anointed him with my holy oil.

21My hand will make him secure;

my arm will give him strength.

22His enemies won’t outsmart him;

sinful people won’t oppress him.

23I’ll crush his adversaries

and strike down those who hate him.

24My faithfulness and enduring love will be with him,

and I’ll make him honored. Ps 89:19-24

25I’ll establish his rule as far as the sea

and set his control over the rivers.

26He’ll call out to me, ‘My Father,

my God, the Rock that keeps me safe.’

27I’ll make him my firstborn,

the highest among the kings on earth.

28I’ll keep my enduring love for him forever

and confirm my covenant with him.

29I’ll make his descendants permanently secure,

his throne as eternal as the sky. Ps 89:25-29

30“If his descendants leave my Law

and don’t follow my judgments,

31if they violate my statutes

and don’t keep my commandments,

32then I’ll bring a rod to bear on their sin

and stripes on their iniquity.

33But I won’t break off my enduring love from him

or deal falsely in my faithfulness.

34I won’t violate my covenant

or alter what I’ve said.

35Once I’ve sworn by my holiness,

I won’t lie to David.

36His descendants will continue permanently,

his throne will last like the sun with me.

37It’ll be secure as permanently as the moon,

as faithful as its witness in the sky.” Ps 89:30-37

38But, you’ve thrown him away and rejected him;

you’re angry with your anointed.

39You’ve spurned the covenant with him

and profaned his crown in the dust.

40You’ve broken down his walls

and brought his fortresses to ruin.

41Everyone that passes by plunders him;

he’s become a disgrace to his neighbors.

42You’ve raised up his adversaries

and made them celebrate.

43You’ve turned back the edge of his sword

and haven’t made him stand in battle.

44You made his splendor cease

and threw his throne on the ground.

45You’ve shortened his youth

and covered him with shame. Ps 89:38-45

46How long, LORD,

will you conceal yourself,

will your anger burn like fire?

47Remember how long life is.

What emptiness have you created people for?

48Who can live without dying?

Can anyone avoid Sheol? Ps 89:46-48

49Where’s your former enduring love

that you faithfully swore to David?

50Remember the scorn your servants endure,

how I carry many people’s insults inside me

51that your enemies have used for taunts,

that they’ve mocked your anointed one with.

52Bless the LORD forever!

Amen and Amen. Ps 89:49-52

BOOK 4

Psalm 90

A Prayer of Moses, the Man of God

1LORD, through all generations

you’ve been our dwelling place.

2Before the mountains were born

or you gave birth to the world,

from one end of time to the other, you’ve been God. Ps 90:1-2

3You turn people back to dust and say,

“Return to dust, mortals.”

4A thousand years to you

are like yesterday,

like a watch in the night.

5You sweep us away like the dreams in our sleep.

In the morning we sprout like grass 6and flourish;

then toward evening we fade like blossoms

and wither away.

7Your anger consumes us;

your wrath scares us.

8You place our iniquities in front of you;

our secret sins are open to you.

9All our days pass away in your fury;

we finish our years with a sigh.

10We live for 70 years or by good health for 80 years;

yet whatever their length, they’re full of labor and pain

because they’re gone so soon, and we fly away.

11Who understands the power of your anger and fury

in comparison to the respect you deserve?

12So teach us to count our days

so we can grow in wisdom toward you. Ps 90:3-12

13Come back to us, LORD; how long will it be?

Have pity on your servants.

14Satisfy us in the morning with your enduring love

so we can sing and be happy our whole life.

15Make us happy for as long as you’ve punished us,

for the years we’ve had misfortune.

16Let us see your work

and our children witness your majesty.

17Bless us, LORD our God;

make our efforts successful;

yes, make them succeed! Ps 90:13-17

Psalm 91

1Those who live in the shelter of the Most High

will find rest in the shadow of the Almighty.

2They’ll say about the LORD,

“Our refuge and fortress, the God we trust!” Ps 91:1-2

3He delivers you from the trapper’s snare

and deadly pestilence.

4He covers you with his pinions;

you can find refuge under his wings;

his faithfulness shields and protects you.

5You won’t be afraid of terrors at night,

of arrows that fly by day,

6of pestilence that lurks in the dark,

or destruction that lays waste at noon.

7A thousand may fall at your side,

ten thousand by your right hand;

but disaster won’t touch you.

8You’ll stand by and watch his recompense to the wicked,

9because you’ve made the LORD your refuge,

the Most High your hiding place.

10Misfortune won’t fall on you;

no plague will get near you. Ps 91:3-10

11He’ll make his angels responsible

for guarding you whatever you do.

12They’ll carry you

so you won’t trip over a rock.

13You’ll step on lions and cobras

and crush them.

14“I’ll rescue them that love me

and set up high those who know me.

15They’ll call on me, and I’ll answer them;

I’ll be with them in trouble,

rescue and honor them.

16I’ll satisfy them with long life

and give them salvation.” Ps 91:11-16

Psalm 92

A Psalm

A Song for the Sabbath

1It’s good to thank you, LORD,

to sing praises to you, Most High;

2to declare your enduring love in the morning

and your faithfulness at night

3with a lute and a ten-stringed harp,

with melody on a lyre.

4Because you’ve made me happy by what you’ve done,

I’ll sing for joy over what you do. Ps 92:1-4

5Your deeds are so great, LORD,

your thoughts so deep!

6Senseless people don’t realize,

ignorant mortals don’t understand

7that when sinners sprout up like grass

and the wicked flourish,

it’s only that they’ll be destroyed forever.

8But you’re on high forever.

9Your enemies will perish;

everybody that sins will scatter. Ps 92:5-9

10You’ve made me as strong as a wild ox

and anointed me with fresh oil.

11I’ve looked in triumph at my enemies

and heard about the defeat of my attackers.

12Good people flourish like palm trees;

they grow like cedars in Lebanon.

13Planted in the LORD’s Temple,

they flourish in the courts of our God.

14They bear fruit even when they’re old;

they’re still green and full of energy.

15They declare that the LORD is good,

that he’s our rock; there’s nothing bad about him. Ps 92:10-15

Psalm 93

1The LORD reigns, robed in majesty,

dressed in strength.

The world stands firm; it won’t move.

2Your throne has been secure from of old;

you’re from eternity past.

3The floods have swelled;

the roar of their pounding waves has increased.

4But more than the thunder of overwhelming water,

more than the mighty ocean breakers against the shore,

LORD on high, you are powerful.

5Your decrees stand firm;

holiness adorns your Temple forever. Ps 93:1-5

Psalm 94

1LORD God of vengeance, shine!

2Rise up, Judge of the whole world;

repay the proud.

3How long will you let sinners celebrate?

4How long will they pour out their arrogant words,

vaunt themselves up

5crush your people,

attack your heritage

6murder widows and foreigners and orphans,

7and say, “The LORD’s not watching;

Jacob’s God is not paying attention.” Ps 94:1-7

8You silly people, you pay attention;

when will you ever understand?

9Can’t he hear, who created the ear?

Can’t he see, who formed the eye?

10Won’t he that rebukes nations, discipline you;

doesn’t the Source of knowledge know what you’re doing?

11The LORD knows that your thoughts

are nothing but hot air.

12The ones you discipline are blessed, LORD,

the ones you teach out of the Law;

13so you can grant them relief in adversity,

till you dig a pit for the wicked.

14The LORD won’t abandon his people

or forsake his inheritance.

15The administration of justice will be good again,

and the godly will follow it.

16Who else will stand up for me against evil people?

Who else will take a stand for me against sinners? Ps 94:8-16

17If the LORD hadn’t helped me,

I would soon have occupied the silent place.

18When I cried out, “I’m slipping,”

his enduring love kept me from falling.

19When my anxious thoughts multiplied,

he cheered me up.

20Can corrupt rulers be his allies

and plot schemes with their wicked laws?

21Can they gang up on good people

and condemn the innocent to death?

22No, because the LORD is my fortress;

my God the Rock is my refuge.

23He’ll bring their sinfulness back on them

and destroy them with their own evil;

the LORD our God will wipe them out. Ps 94:17-23

Psalm 95

1Come, let’s sing to the LORD;

let’s make a joyful sound to the Rock that saves us.

2Let’s go to him with thanksgiving

and sing to him with psalms.

3The LORD is a great God,

a great King above all gods.

4He controls the deep sea;

he owns the mountain peaks

5and the ocean because he created them;

he made the dry land. Ps 95:1-5

6Come, let’s bow in worship;

let’s kneel to the LORD our Maker.

7He’s our God, and we’re sheep in his pasture,

the flock under his care.

If you hear him today,

8don’t harden your hearts like they did at Meribah

that day at Massah in the desert.

9Your ancestors kept testing me

though they’d been seeing my work for 40 years.

10I detested that generation and said,

“They err in their hearts;

they don’t know my ways.”

11So I swore in my anger,

“They certainly won’t enter my rest.” Ps 95:6-11

Psalm 96

1Sing a new song to the LORD;

sing to him, all the earth.

2Bless him in song;

proclaim every day the good news that he saves.

3Tell about his glory the world over,

his marvelous deeds among the nations.

4The LORD is great and deserves great praise;

he’s to be respected more than all gods

5because the nations’ gods are idols,

but the LORD created the sky.

6Honor and majesty lie in him;

strength and beauty fill his sanctuary. Ps 96:1-6

7Families of the nations,

attribute to the LORD honor and strength.

8Attribute to the LORD the glory he deserves;

take an offering to his courts.

9Worship him in holy attire;

tremble at him, all the earth.

10Say among the nations, “The LORD reigns;

yes, the world is firmly set; it won’t move;

he’ll judge the nations fairly.”

11Let the heavens be happy and the earth rejoice;

let the ocean roar and everything that’s in it;

12let the fields celebrate and all that grows there;

then the trees in the forest will sing 13to the LORD

because he’ll judge the world with justice

and its people with truth. Ps 96:7-13

Psalm 97

1The LORD reigns; let the world rejoice;

let the distant shores be glad.

2Clouds and dense darkness surround him;

goodness and justice are the foundation for his throne.

3Fire goes forth ahead of him

and burns up his adversaries.

4His lightning lights up the world;

the world sees it and trembles.

5The mountains melt like wax

at his presence everywhere.

6The sky declares his goodness;

every nation can see his glory. Ps 97:1-6

7Let those who worship carved images be discredited,

those who take pride in idols;

bow to him, all you gods.

8Zion hears that and is happy;

the towns in Judah celebrate

because of your justice, LORD,

9You’re greater than all gods.

10Hate evil, you that love the LORD,

who preserves his holy people

and delivers them from sinners.

11Light is sown like seed for the godly,

like happiness for the godly in heart.

12Be happy in him, good people;

praise him for his holiness. Ps 97:7-12

Psalm 98

A Psalm

1Sing a new song to the LORD

because he’s done outstanding things;

his right hand and holy arm have given him victory.

2He has made his salvation known

and revealed his goodness to the nations.

3He has remembered his enduring love

and faithfulness to Israel;

people the earth over have seen

the deliverance our God gives. Ps 98:1-3

4Make a joyful sound to the LORD, all the earth;

break out in joyful song.

5Sing praises to him with lyre and melody;

6make a joyful sound with trumpets and rams’ horns

to the King, the LORD.

7Let the ocean roar and everything in it,

the world and those who live here.

8Let the rivers clap their hands;

let the mountains sing 9to the LORD

because he’s coming to judge the world righteously

and its people fairly. Ps 98:4-9

Psalm 99

1The LORD reigns;

let the people tremble;

he sits on his throne above the cherubs;

let the earth quake!

2The LORD is great in Zion;

he’s exalted above all nations.

3Let them praise his great, awesome name;

he is holy.

4The great King who loves justice

has established what’s fair for all.

5Exalt the LORD our God

and worship at his feet; he is holy. Ps 99:1-5

6Moses and Aaron were among his priests;

Samuel too was one who called on him;

they called on the LORD and he answered them.

7He spoke to them in the pillar of cloud;

they kept the testimonies and statutes he gave them.

8He was a forgiving God;

yet he disciplined them for their sins.

9Exalt the LORD our God

and worship on his holy mountain; because

he is holy. Ps 99:6-9

Psalm 100

A Psalm for Thanksgiving

1Make a joyful sound to the LORD, all the earth.

2Serve him gladly;

come to him with singing.

3Acknowledge that the LORD is God;

he made us; we didn’t make ourselves.

We’re his people, sheep in his pasture.

4Enter his gates with thanksgiving

and his courts with praise.

Thank him and bless him 5because he’s good;

his enduring love never ends;

his faithfulness extends to every generation. Ps 100:1-5

Psalm 101

A Psalm of David

1I’ll sing about your enduring love and justice,

and sing praises to you, LORD.

2I’ll pay attention to the way that’s blameless;

when will you come to help me?

In my home I’ll walk in integrity.

3I won’t set anything base beside me;

I’ll hate what they do who fall away;

I’ll stay away from them.

4I’ll cast perverse things out of my heart

and have nothing to do with evil.

5I’ll withdraw from anyone that slanders another;

I won’t put up with people

that have haughty looks or arrogant hearts. Ps 101:1-5

6I’ll focus my attention on the faithful

to be my friends.

Those who follow the blameless way

are the ones that will be my servants.

7I won’t let deceivers serve in my Temple;

liars won’t maintain their relationship with me.

8Each morning I’ll destroy the wicked in the land

and rid the city of the LORD of everyone that sins. Ps 101:6-8

Psalm 102

A Prayer by the Oppressed When They’re Faint

and Pour Out Their Complaint to the LORD

1Listen to my prayer, LORD!

Let my cry come to you.

2Don’t turn away from me in my distress;

when I call, answer quickly.

3My days dissipate like smoke;

my bones lie scorched on a hearth.

4My heart is weak and withers away like grass;

I have no appetite 5in my loud groaning;

I’m skin and bones.

6I’m like a pelican in the desert,

like an owl in desolate places;

7I lie awake

like a lonely bird on a housetop. Ps 102:1-7

8My enemies taunt me all day;

they ridicule me and use my name as a curse.

9I eat ashes for food

and mix my drink with tears

10because of your indignation,

because you’ve thrown me away.

11My days are like a shadow;

I wither like the grass.

12But you live forever, LORD;

you endure for all generations.

13Have mercy on Zion;

it’s time to be gracious to it;

the appointed time has come.

14Your servants delight in its very rocks

and have regard even for its dust.

15So the nations will respect the LORD;

kings will respect your honor.

16The LORD will build up Zion;

he’ll appear in his glory.

17He’ll have regard for the destitute;

he won’t disregard their prayer. Ps 102:8-17

18Write this for the next generation,

so people not yet born will praise the LORD:

19He looked down from his holy height;

from heaven he gazed at earth

20to hear the groaning prisoners,

to free those doomed to die;

21so people will celebrate the LORD in Zion

and praise him in Jerusalem

22when the nations gather

and the kingdoms assemble to serve him. Ps 102:18-22

23He weakened my strength

in the course of my life and shortened it.

24 I say to him,

My God, don’t take me away in the middle of life;

you live throughout all generations.

25You founded the earth long ago;

the sky is your handiwork.

26Even they will perish, but you’ll remain;

they’ll wear out like a robe,

and you’ll change them like clothes.

27But you’ll be the same; your years won’t end.

28Your people’s children will continue in security;

their descendants will thrive in your presence.” Ps 102:23-28

Psalm 103

A Psalm of David

1Bless the LORD, all that I am!

Everything that’s in me, bless him.

2Bless the LORD, all that I am;

May I never forget how he helps me:

3he pardons my sins

and heals my diseases;

4he rescues me from the Pit

and crowns me with enduring love and mercy;

5he satisfies my years with good things,

and renews my youth like an eagle’s. Ps 103:1-5

6The LORD performs good deeds

and renders justice for people mistreated.

7He made his ways known to Moses

and demonstrated his acts to Israel.

8The LORD is merciful and gracious,

slow to anger and abounding in enduring love.

9He won’t constantly confront us

or always be angry with us.

10He hasn’t dealt with us according to our sins

or rewarded us in proportion to our iniquities.

11As high as the sky is above the earth,

so great is his enduring love toward those who respect him.

12As far as the east is from the west,

that’s how far he’s removed our sins from us.

13Like a father that has mercy on his children,

the LORD has mercy on those who respect him.

14He knows how we’re made;

he’s aware that we’re only dust. Ps 103:6-14

15People are like grass,

they flourish like flowers in a field.

16When the wind blows on them, they’re gone

like they’d never been there.

17The LORD’s enduring love is

from eternity past to future for them who respect him;

his goodness is to children’s children

18to those who keep his covenant,

that obey his commandments. Ps 103:15-18

19The LORD has secured his throne in the sky;

he’s sovereign everywhere.

20Bless the LORD, angels, great in power,

who do what he says and obey him.

21Bless the LORD, all his hosts

who serve him and do his will.

22Bless the LORD, everything he’s created

everywhere he reigns.

Bless the LORD, everything that I am! Ps 103:19-22

Psalm 104

1Bless the LORD, everything that I am!

LORD my God, you’re so great;

you’re dressed in splendor and majesty.

2You cover yourself with light as with a robe;

you’ve stretched out the sky like a tent.

3You laid the beams for your rooms on the water;

you make the clouds your chariot

and walk on the wind.

4You make the winds your messengers

and blazing fire your ministers. Ps 104:1-4

5You built the earth on foundations

so it would never shift.

6You covered it with the ocean like a robe

deeper than the mountains.

7At your rebuke it receded;

at the sound of your thunder, it withdrew.

8The mountains rose up; the valleys sank down

to the level you determined for them to have.

9You set a boundary the water couldn’t cross

so it wouldn’t flow back over the earth again. Ps 104:5-9

10You make springs in the valleys

so creeks flow between the mountains.

11They water the animals in the countryside

and quench the thirst of wild donkeys.

12Birds live beside them

and chirp in the trees.

13You water the mountains from your home above;

your work provides for the earth. Ps 104:10-13

14You make grass grow for the livestock

and crops from people’s labor

so they could produce food from the ground

15and wine to cheer them up,

so they could make their faces shine with oil

and grow food to sustain them.

16The LORD’s trees drink their fill,

Lebanon’s cedars that he planted,

17where birds build their nests

and storks make roosts in fir trees. Ps 104:14-17

18High mountains are for wild goats,

and rocks provide cover for badgers.

19You made the moon to mark the seasons;

the sun knows where to set.

20You send darkness, and it becomes night;

wild animals prowl around in it.

21Young lions roar after their prey

and seek their food from God.

22When the sun comes up,

they go back and lie down in their dens,

23and people go out to work till evening. Ps 104:18-23

24LORD, how many things you’ve done!

you’ve done them all with wisdom

and filled the earth with your creations.

25Yonder is the ocean, big and wide;

it teems with schools of fish without number,

marine life large and small.

26Ships move along on it,

Leviathan too, which you formed to play in it. Ps 104:24-26

27They all depend on you

to feed them when it’s time.

28You give them food, and they gather it;

you open your hand and satisfy them with good.

29If you hide, they’re scared;

you take away their breath, and they die.

30You send out your breath, and they’re created;

you renew the surface of the ground. Ps 104:27-30

31Let the LORD’s honor endure forever;

let him delight in things he’s made.

32The world trembles at his look;

the mountains smoke at his touch.

33I’ll sing to the LORD as long as I live;

I’ll sing praise to my God as long as I’m here.

34May my meditations please him;

I’ll be happy in him.

35Let sinners vanish from the earth;

let the wicked cease to exist.

Bless the LORD, everything that I am!

Hallelujah! Ps 104:31-35

Psalm 105

1Be grateful to the LORD; call on him;

tell the nations what all he’s done.

2Sing praises to him;

talk about the amazing acts.

3Take pride in his holy name;

let the people be happy that rely on him.

4Rely on the LORD and his strength;

depend on him always.

5Remember his amazing miracles,

the judgments he’s rendered,

6descendants of Abraham his servant,

children of Jacob, his chosen ones!

7He’s the LORD our God,

who renders judgment all over the world. Ps 105:1-7

8He remembers his eternal covenant,

the message he commanded to a thousand generations,

9his covenant with Abraham, his oath to Isaac.

10his statute confirmed to Jacob

as an ongoing covenant.

11He swore, “I’ll give you Canaan to inherit.”

12When they were just a few,

temporary residents,

13they wandered from nation to nation,

from kingdom to kingdom.

14He didn’t let anybody oppress them;

he reprimanded kings on their behalf:

15“Don’t touch my anointed ones;

don’t harm my prophets.” Ps 105:8-15

16He called for a famine in the land

and cut off their food supply.

17He sent a man ahead of them,

Joseph, sold as a slave.

18They hurt his feet with restraints

and put an iron collar around his neck

19till God’s message came to him

and revealed what kind of man he was.

20The king released him;

the people’s ruler let him go.

21He made him master of his household,

steward over everything he owned,

22even to imprison his officials if he saw fit

so he could teach his elders wisdom. Ps 105:16-22

23Then Israel/Jacob went down to Egypt

and lived as a foreigner in the land of Ham.

24God multiplied his people

and made them stronger than their enemies,

25whose hearts he turned against his people

to mistreat them.

26Then he sent Moses his servant

and Aaron his chosen one

27to perform his amazing acts among them,

miracles in the land of Ham:

28he engulfed their land in darkness

when they defied him and his message;

29he turned their water to blood

and killed their fish; Ps 105:23-29

30frogs overran the land

even into the king’s bedrooms;

31swarms of flies came,

and gnats infested the whole region;

32he gave them hail for rain,

and lightning flashed in the land;

33he struck down their grapevines and fig trees

and stripped their trees;

34he summoned countless young locusts to come

35and eat the vegetation in the country

and devour the produce from the ground;

36he struck the Egyptians’ firstborn,

the first issue of their strength. Ps 105:30-36

37Then he brought Israel out with silver and gold;

nobody among the tribes faltered.

38The Egyptians were glad when they left

because they’d come to dread them.

39He spread a cloud over them

and sent fire to light up the night.

40They asked, and he brought quail

and satisfied them with manna from the sky.

41He opened a rock and water came out

and ran into the desert like a stream.

42He remembered his sacred promise

to Abraham his servant.

43He brought his people out with joy and celebration.

44He gave them the lands of nations,

and they harvested what those nations had grown;

45he did it so they would keep his statutes

and observe his laws.

Hallelujah! Ps 105:37-45

Psalm 106

1Hallelujah!

Be grateful to the LORD because he’s good;

his enduring love lasts forever.

2Who can recount all his mighty deeds?

Who can ever praise him enough?

3How blessed they are who maintain justice,

who practice goodness all the time!

4Remember me, LORD, when you’re gracious to your people;

come and rescue me

5so I can share in your holy people’s prosperity,

celebrate in your nation’s happiness,

and glory in your heritage. Ps 106:1-5

6We and our ancestors have sinned,

committed iniquity, and behaved badly.

7Our ancestors in Egypt didn’t get the point of the LORD’s amazing acts

or remember his abundant kindness;

instead, they rebelled against him at the Red Sea.

8Nevertheless, he saved them to defend his honor

and demonstrate his power.

9He commanded the Red Sea to dry up,

and led them through its depths as through a desert.

10He saved them from those who hated them;

he rescued them from their enemy.

11The water drowned their adversaries;

not a one survived.

12Then they believed in him and praised him in song. Ps 106:6-12

13But they soon forgot what he’d done

and didn’t wait for his direction,

14but made loud demands

and put him on trial in the desert.

15So he gave them what they asked for,

but sent a wasting disease among them. Ps 106:13-15

16When men in the camp got jealous of Moses

and of Aaron, the LORD’s holy priest,

17the ground opened up

and swallowed Dathan and Abiram’s rebels.

18Fire broke out among their companions

and consumed the sinful. Ps 106:16-18

19They made a calf at Horeb/Sinai

and worshiped a molten image;

20they exchanged their Glorious One

for an image of a bull that eats grass.

21They forgot God, who’d saved them

and done such great things in Egypt,

22amazing things in Ham,

awesome things at the Red Sea.

23So he said he’d destroy them.

If Moses, his chosen one, hadn’t stood in the gap

to turn away his wrath, he would’ve done it.

24They refused to enter the pleasant land

and didn’t believe what he promised;

25they grumbled in their tents

and didn’t listen to the LORD.

26So he swore he’d let them die in the desert,

27disperse their descendants among the nations,

and scatter them in other lands. Ps 106:19-27

28They joined in the worship of Baal-peor

and ate sacrifices to the dead.

29What they did provoked him

to send a plague out among them.

30Then Phinehas got up and intervened;

so the plague stopped.

31He’s been considered a good man ever since. Ps 106:28-31

32They’d already provoked God at Meribah

and got Moses in serious trouble 33for speaking rashly.

34Later, they failed to eradicate the nations like the LORD told them to,

35 but mixed in with them, learned their practices,

36and served their idols, which led to their downfall.

37They even sacrificed sons and daughters to the demons

38and thereby shed innocent blood,

the blood of their sons and daughters

that they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan;

they polluted the land with blood.

39So they defiled themselves with their practices

and played the prostitute in their deeds. Ps 106:32-39

40The LORD’s anger so sparked against his people

that he abhorred his special possession.

41So he gave them over to the surrounding nations;

people that hated them ruled them;

42their enemies subdued them

and oppressed them.

43Many times he delivered them,

but they kept rebelling with their own intentions

and sank into sin. Ps 106:40-43

44Nevertheless, he felt compassion for them

when he heard them cry out in distress.

45He remembered his covenant

and relented because of his enduring love.

46He even made their captors be kind to them.

47Save us, LORD our God;

retrieve us from the nations

so we can thank you and glory in praising you.

48Bless the LORD God of Israel

from everlasting to everlasting.

Everybody say, “Amen.”

Hallelujah! Ps 106:44-48

BOOK 5

Psalm 107

1Be grateful to the LORD because he’s good;

his love endures forever.

2Let his redeemed say it,

the ones he rescued from their adversaries

3and gathered from other countries

east and west, north and south. Ps 107:1-3

4Some wandered in trackless desert

and couldn’t find their way to any inhabited city.

5Hungry and thirsty,

their souls fainted inside them.

6Then they appealed to the LORD in their trouble,

and he delivered them from it;

7he led them straight to a city they could live in.

8They need to thank him for his enduring love

and his awesome acts for his people!

9He satisfies the thirsty

and fills the hungry with good things. Ps 107:4-9

10Some sat in darkness and death’s shadow,

prisoners suffering in iron shackles,

11because they’d rebelled against what God said

and spurned the advice of the Most High.

12So he humbled them with labor;

they stumbled and nobody was there to help.

13Then they appealed to the LORD in their trouble,

and he delivered them from it.

14He brought them out of darkness and death’s shadow

and broke their chains.

15They need to thank him for his enduring love

and his awesome acts for his people!

16because he shattered bronze gates

and cut iron bars in two. Ps 107:10-16

17Some were fools

and suffered because they rebelled and sinned.

18The very sight of food was repulsive to them;

they came close to dying.

19Then they appealed to the LORD in their trouble,

and he delivered them from distress.

20He sent his message to heal them

and delivered them from destruction.

21They need to thank him for his enduring love

and his wonderful acts for his people!

22Let them offer sacrifices of thanksgiving

and tell about his deeds with joyful singing. Ps 107:17-22

23Some went down to ships by the sea

and did business on the ocean;

24they, too, have seen what the LORD can do,

his powerful acts on the great deep.

25He spoke and a storm arose

that whipped up the waves,

26waves that swelled up toward the sky

and crashed down to the depths;

sailors’ courage melted away in their terror.

27They reeled and staggered like drunks;

they were at their wits’ end.

28Then they appealed to the LORD in their trouble,

and he delivered them from distress.

29He stilled the storm and calmed the waves.

30Then they were happy because they had quiet;

so he guided them to the port they desired.

31They need to thank him for his enduring love

and his wonderful acts for his people!

32Let them extol him in front of the community

and praise him at the elders’ seats. Ps 107:23-32

33He transforms rivers into desert,

springs into thirsty ground,

34productive land into a salt waste

because sinful people live there.

35But he transforms a desert into a sea,

dry land into springs.

36He enables hungry people to live there

and build a city,

37sow fields, plant vineyards,

and gather a big harvest. Ps 107:33-37

38He blesses them and they multiply;

he keeps the number of their livestock from decreasing.

39When they’re decreased and brought low

through oppression, misery, and sorrow,

40he pours contempt on their rulers

and makes them wander in trackless wasteland.

41But he sets the needy safely on high away from adversity

and makes their families like a flock.

42The godly see it and are happy,

but bad people don’t have anything they can say.

43Who is wise? Pay attention to these things

and think about the LORD’s enduring love. Ps 107:38-43

Psalm 108

A Song. A Psalm of David

1I’m steadfast, God;

I’ll sing praises in my heart.

2Wake up, harp and lyre;

I’ll wake up at dawn!

3I’ll thank you, LORD, among the nations

and sing praises to you everywhere,

4because your enduring love is bigger than the sky;

your truth is as high as the heavens.

5Be lifted up, God, above the sky;

display your glory the world over.

6Save with your power and answer me

so your beloved can be delivered. Ps 108:1-6

7God has spoken in his holiness:

“I’ll gladly divide up Shechem.

8Gilead and Manasseh belong to me;

Ephraim, my helmet;

Judah, my scepter;

9Moab, my washbasin;

I’ll wipe my feet on Edom

and shout in triumph over Philistia.” Ps 108:7-9

10Who will take me to the besieged city?

Who will lead me to Edom?

11Are you rejecting us, God?

Aren’t you going out with our armies?

12Help us against our adversary

because human help can’t save us.

13Through you, we’ll do mightily;

you can tramp down our enemies. Ps 108:10-13

Psalm 109

For the Choir Director. A Psalm of David

1God that I praise, speak up for me!

2Deceitful people speak against me;

they slander me with lies.

3They surround me with hateful words

and fight me for no reason.

4In return for my love, they accuse me

even when I’m praying for them.

5They repay me evil for good,

hatred for love. Ps 109:1-5

6Appoint someone corrupt over them,

an accuser to stand beside them.

7When they’re judged, pronounce them guilty;

count even their prayers as acts of sin.

8Shorten their lives

and give someone else their position of oversight.

9Make their children fatherless

and their wives widows.

10Have their children go begging,

looking for food far from their ruined homes.

11Have their creditors seize everything they own

and foreigners plunder what they’d labored to produce.

12May no one extend enduring love to them

or be gracious to their fatherless children.

13Cut off their posterity;

erase their names from the next generation. Ps 109:6-13

14LORD, remember their fathers’ sins

and not blot out their mothers’ transgressions;

15always keep them in mind;

Have people forget they ever lived,

16because they didn’t show enduring love;

they persecuted poor, needy people,

and murdered the despondent.

17They loved to curse; put curses on them!

they didn’t like to bless; don’t bless them!

18They cover themselves with cursing like clothes;

it soaks into their bodies like water,

down to the bone like oil!

19Put it on them like a robe they have to wear all the time,

like a belt they always have on.

20Make such things the LORD’s reward to accusers

that claim bad things about me. Ps 109:14-20

21But LORD God, deal graciously with me

because your enduring love is good;

deliver me 22because I’m poor and needy

and wounded in my heart.

23I’m passing on like a lengthening shadow;

I’m brushed off like a locust.

24My knees are weak from fasting;

I’m skin and bones.

25I’m someone people scorn;

they just shake their heads at the sight of me. Ps 109:21-25

26Help me, LORD my God;

in your enduring love, save me.

27Show them this is your doing.

28Let them curse, but you bless;

when they attack me, humiliate them,

and I’ll be happy.

29Dress those accusers in dishonor;

cover them with their humiliation like a cloak. Ps 109:26-29

30I’ll praise the LORD repeatedly;

I’ll praise him in front of everyone,

31because he stands by the needy

to save them from those who condemn them to death.

Ps 109:30-31

Psalm 110

A Psalm of David

1The LORD said to my Lord,

“Sit at my right hand

till I make your enemies your footstool.”

2The LORD will extend your mighty scepter from on Zion,

and say, “Rule your enemies.”

3Your soldiers will volunteer readily

when you muster your army in holy array;

your strength will be renewed

every morning like the dew.

4The LORD has sworn and won’t change his mind,

“You’re a priest forever after the order of Melchizedek.”

5The LORD is at your right hand

to shatter kings when it’s time to display his anger.

6He’ll render judgment against the nations by filling them with corpses;

he’ll shatter leaders worldwide.

7He’ll refresh himself from streams along the way

and raise up his head in triumph. Ps 110-:1-7

Psalm 111

1Hallelujah!

I thank the LORD with all my heart

in the presence of his godly people.

2His works are so outstanding

no one that delights in them

can quit thinking about them;

3their splendor and majesty

reflect his eternal goodness;

4he makes his amazing acts memorable

because they show his grace and mercy.

5He feeds those who respect him

and remembers his covenant with them;

6he demonstrated his power to his people

by giving them other nations’ land. Ps 111:1-6

7His works are just and true;

so his people can trust his commandments

8to bring eternal security

when they practice them sincerely.

9He has provided redemption for his people

and ordained his covenant with them forever;

he’s holy and awesome.

10Respecting the LORD is the most important thing about being wise;

doing what he commands brings understanding.

Praise him forever. Ps 111:7-10

Psalm 112

1Hallelujah!

How blessed people are that respect the LORD

and delight in what he calls on them to do.

2Their descendants will be successful

and a blessing to their own generation.

3They’ll have wealth and riches in their homes,

and their goodness will last forever.

4Godly people have light in the dark;

they’re gracious, merciful, and good.

5Goodness comes to those who graciously lend

and conduct their affairs with justice.

6Misfortune won’t overcome them,

and people will remember the good they’ve done. Ps 112:1-6

7Bad news doesn’t scare people like that

because they’ve committed themselves to the LORD they trust;

8they’re confident and courageous

and face their adversaries with assurance.

9They give freely to the poor,

so their goodness lasts forever

in ongoing influence and honor.

10Sinners will see that and get mad;

they’ll grit their teeth—and leave;

what they wanted won’t happen. Ps 112:7-10

Psalm 113

1Hallelujah!

Servants of the LORD, praise him;

2bless him from now on forever;

3from sunrise to sunset, praise him.

4On high above the nations,

he displays his glory in the sky.

5Who is like the LORD our God

that sits on high, 6but humbles himself to watch

what’s happening in the sky and on earth?

7Then he raises up the poor from the dust

and lifts the needy from the ash pile

8to seat them beside the princes of his people.

9He gives the barren woman a home

like a happy mother of children.

Hallelujah! Ps 113:1-9

Psalm 114

1When Israel left Egypt—

when the House of Jacob came out

from a nation with a different language—

2the land of Judah became his sanctuary;

Israel became his kingdom.

3The Red Sea saw them coming and backed away;

the Jordan quit flowing.

4The mountains jumped like rams;

the hills skipped around like lambs.

5What’s the matter with you, Sea, that you’re backing away,

or Jordan, that you’ve quit flowing,

6or mountains, that you jump like rams,

or hills, that you skip around like lambs?

7Earth, tremble at the Lord, Jacob’s God,

8who turned rock into water

and flint into a fountain. Ps 114:1-8

Psalm 115

1Not to us, LORD, not to us,

but to you be honor

because of your enduring love and faithfulness.

2Why should the nations say,

“Where’s their God?”

3Our God is in heaven,

where he accomplishes what he intends.

4Their man-made idols are just silver and gold

5with mouths that can’t talk,

eyes that can’t see,

6ears that can’t hear,

noses that can’t smell,

7hands that can’t feel,

feet that can’t walk,

throats that can’t make a sound!

8The ones that make them will become like them,

likewise everybody that relies on them. Ps 115:1-8

9Israel, trust in the LORD;

he’s your helper and shield.

10House of Aaron, trust in the LORD;

he’s your helper and shield.

11All of you that respect the LORD, trust in him;

he’s your helper and shield.

12He cares about you; he’ll bless you;

Israel and Aaron;

13he’ll bless everyone that respects him,

least and greatest.

14May he increase you and your children;

15may the Maker of earth and sky bless you. Ps 115:9-15

16The sky belongs to him,

but he’s given us the earth.

17The dead don’t praise the LORD;

nobody does that descends into silence;

18but we’ll bless him

from now on forever.

Hallelujah! Ps 115:16-18

Psalm 116

1I love the LORD because he listens to my petitions;

2so I’ll call on him as long as I live.

3The snares of death were all around me;

the pains of Sheol came on me;

I suffered distress and sorrow.

4Then I called on the LORD,

“Please save me.” Ps 116:1-4

5You’re gracious and good, merciful God.

6You preserve the simple;

when I was brought low, you saved me.

7I can rest again

because you’ve been good to me;

8you’ve saved me from death,

my eyes from tears,

my feet from stumbling.

9I’ll walk with you in the land of the living.

10I kept believing even when I said,

“I’m greatly oppressed.”

11I said in my anxiety,

“Everybody’s lying to me!” Ps 116:5-11

12How can I repay you, LORD,

for all your benefits?

13I’ll lift up the cup of salvation

and call on you.

14I’ll fulfill my vows to you

in the presence of your people.

15You care about your holy people when they die.

16LORD, I’m your servant,

the son of your maidservant;

you’ve removed my shackles.

17I’ll offer you a thanksgiving sacrifice

and call on you. Ps 116:12-17

18I’ll fulfill my vows to you

in the presence of your people,

19in the courts of your Temple in Jerusalem.

Hallelujah! Ps 116:18-19

Psalm 117

1Praise the LORD, every nation;

praise him, every people group,

2because he has great enduring love toward us;

hisY faithfulness lasts forever.

Hallelujah! Ps 117:1-2

Psalm 118

1Be grateful to the LORD because he’s good;

his love lasts forever.

2Let Israel say,

“His love lasts forever.”

3Let the house of Aaron say,

“His love lasts forever.”

4Let those who respect the LORD say,

“His love lasts forever.” Ps 118:1-4

5I called on the LORD in my distress,

and he answered me and set me free.

6He’s on my side; so I won’t be afraid;

what can mortals do to me?

7He’s beside me to help me;

so I look in triumph at those who hate me.

8It’s better to take refuge in the LORD than trust in people,

9to take refuge in him than put trust in rulers. Ps 118:5-9

10All the nations surrounded me;

in the LORD’s name I destroyed them.

11They surrounded me on every side;

in the LORD’s name I destroyed them.

12They swarmed around me like bees;

they stung like burning briers;

in the LORD’s name I destroyed them.

13They shoved me back so hard I started to fall,

but the LORD came to my aid.

14He’s my strength and song;

he’s my salvation. Ps 118:10-14

15Joyful shouting over deliverance

goes on in the tents of good people;

the LORD’s right hand has done valiantly.

16He has lifted high his right hand;

His right hand has done mighty things.

17I’ll live to tell what he’s done.

18He disciplined me severely,

but he didn’t let me die. Ps 118:15-18

19Open the gate to goodness for me

so I can go in and thank the LORD.

20This is his gate;

good people enter through it.

21Thank you for answering me;

you’ve become my salvation. Ps 118:19-21

22The stone the builders rejected

has become the cornerstone.

23That’s the LORD’s doing;

it’s amazing.

24Today is a day the LORD has made;

let’s celebrate and be happy in it.

25LORD, save us

and send us prosperity.

26Blessed is the one that comes in the LORD’s name;

we bless you from his Temple.

27The LORD is God; he gives us light;

tie the festival sacrifice to the horns of the altar.

28You’re my God; I thank you;

you’re my God; I praise you.

29Give thanks to the LORD because he’s good;

his love lasts forever. Ps 118:22-29

Psalm 119

Aleph א

1How blessed they are who follow his way blamelessly,

who follow the Law of the LORD,

2who observe his testimonies

and look to him with all their heart.

3They do no evil who follow his ways.

4You’ve charged us

to keep your commandments diligently.

5Oh that my ways may become secure

by reflecting on your statutes!

6I won’t be disgraced

if I keep my eye on everything you’ve commanded.

7I’ll thank you by living with a godly heart

as I learn your good ordinances.

8I’ll keep your statutes;

don’t give up on me! Ps 119:1-8

Bet ב

9How can the young keep their conduct pure?

By guarding it with what you say.

10I’ve looked to you wholeheartedly;

don’t let me stray from your commandments.

11I’ve treasured up your word in my heart

so I won’t sin against you.

12You’re blessed, LORD;

teach me your statutes.

13I’ve recited all the ordinances you’ve given

14and delighted in your testimonies as much as in wealth.

15I’ll study your precepts

and fix my attention on your ways.

16I’ll delight in your decrees

and commit your word to memory. Ps 119:9-16

Gimel ג

17Deal well with me

so I can live and keep your word.

18Open my eyes so I can see

the wonderful things in your Law.

19I’m a foreigner in the world;

so make your commandments clear to me.

20I feel a burden

to always keep your ordinances.

21You rebuke the insolent, the accursed

that wander off from your commandments.

22Take their insults and contempt away from me

because I observe your decrees.

23Even though officials sit around plotting against me,

I still think about your statutes

24and delight in your decrees;

they’re my counselors. Ps 119:17-24

Dalet ד

25I’m lying in the dust;

revive me with your message.

26I’ve told you my intentions and you responded;

now teach me your statutes!

27Make me understand what your commandments mean

so I can think about your wonderful deeds.

28I melt away with sorrow;

encourage me with your message.

29Put false ways far away from me

and graciously teach me your Law.

30I’ve chosen to be faithful

and keep your ordinances at hand.

31I hold onto your testimonies, LORD;

don’t let me feel humiliated!

32I’ll follow your commands

because by them you increase my understanding. Ps 119:25-32

He ה

33Teach me, LORD, the way your statutes direct,

and I’ll keep them to the end.

34Help me understand

so I can observe your Law properly.

35Lead me the way your commandments dictate

because I delight in them.

36Incline my heart to your testimonies

rather than to dishonest profit.

37Turn my attention away from pointless things

and give me life in your ways.

38Confirm to me your promise

to those who respect you.

39Turn away the disgrace I dread,

because your ordinances are good.

40I want to obey your commandments;

so in your goodness give me life. Ps 119:33-40

Vav ו

41Direct your enduring love toward me, LORD,

the salvation you offer in your word,

42so I can answer whoever tries to discredit me,

because I trust what you say.

43Don’t take your message out of my mouth,

because I’ve put my hope in your ordinances

44so I can keep your Law ever and always.

45I’m free because I look to your precepts.

46I’ll talk to kings about your testimonies

without feeling self-conscious.

47I delight in your commandments;

48I lift up my hands to them

and study your statutes. Ps 119:41-48

Zayin ז

49Remember your promise

that you made for me to trust in.

50That’s my reassurance in adversity;

your promise revives me.

51Godless people utterly deride me;

yet I won’t turn aside from your Law.

52When I remember your ordinances from of old,

I find comfort.

53Burning indignation has seized me

because of sinners that abandon your Law.

54Your statutes are my songs

wherever life leads me.

55I think about you at night,

about keeping your instructions.

56This has been my way of life:

observing your commandments. Ps 119:49-56

Het ח

57LORD, you’re my portion;

I promise to obey what you say.

58I ask for your blessing with all my heart;

be gracious to me like you promised.

59When I think about your ways,

I turn to your testimonies.

60I hurry to obey your commandments.

61Although sinful people’s cords ensnare me,

I won’t let them pull me away from your Law.

62At midnight I get up to thank you

for your good ordinances.

63I’m a friend to everyone that respects you

and keeps your precepts.

64The earth is full of your enduring love, LORD;

teach me your regulations. Ps 119:57-64

Tet ט

65You’ve dealt well with me,

LORD, like you promised.

66Give me discernment and insight

because I believe in your commandments.

67Before I suffered I went astray,

but now I keep your word.

68You’re good and do good;

teach me your regulations.

69The godless have smeared me with slander;

but I’ll still observe your precepts with all my heart.

70Their hearts are dull,

but I delight in your Law.

71Suffering was good for me

because from it I learned to obey your statutes.

72Your Law is more valuable to me

than thousands of pieces of silver and gold. Ps 119:65-72

Yod י

73You made me and fashioned me;

help me understand so I can appreciate your commandments.

74May the ones that respect you see me and be happy

because I wait for your promise.

75LORD, I know your judgments are right

and that it was in your faithfulness that you oppressed me.

76Let your enduring love comfort me

like you promised.

77Send me your mercy so I can live,

because I delight in your Law.

78Discredit godless people

because they’re undermining my welfare with deceit;

meanwhile, I’ll stay focused on your precepts.

79May those who respect you return to me,

the ones that know your testimonies.

80May my heart be blameless in regard to your statutes

so I won’t have any regrets. Ps 119:73-80

Kaph כ

81I’m weary waiting for your rescue,

but I’ve put my hope in your message.

82My eyes strain to see your promises come true,

while I say, “When will you comfort me?”

83Though I’ve shriveled up like a wineskin in smoke,

I don’t lose touch with your regulations.

84How long will I live?

When will you punish my persecutors?

85Godless men have dug pits to capture me,
