tell the towns in Judah, “Your God is coming!”

10He’ll come with power

to rule with his strong arm;

he’ll bring his reward with him.

11He’ll tend his flock like a shepherd;

he’ll pick up the lambs in his arms

and carry them against his chest,

and gently lead the nursing ewes. Is 40:9-11

12Who else has measured the ocean in the palm of his hand

or the sky with a span,

or counted the dust?

Who else has weighed the mountains in a scales

or the hills in a balance?

13Who has directed the LORD’s Spirit

or instructed him as his advisor?

14Who did he consult for enlightenment?

Who taught him what’s good?

15The nations are just a drop in the bucket,

a piece of sand on a scales;

he picks up islands like specks of dust.

16Lebanon couldn’t provide enough wood

or its animals be sufficient for a burnt offering.

17All the nations amount to nothing in front of him;

they’re of no consequence compared to him. Is 40:12-17

18Who can we compare God to?

What’s he like?

19An idol is something an artisan makes,

a goldsmith plates with gold,

a silversmith makes silver chains for.

20People too poor for such an offering

select wood that won’t rot

and find a skilled craftsman

to prepare an idol that won’t fall over. Is 40:18-20

21Haven’t you heard? Don’t you know?

Didn’t anybody tell you at the beginning of the earth that

22the One who sits above the circle of the earth,

whose inhabitants are like grasshoppers to him—

he’s the One that stretches out the sky like a curtain,

spreads it out like a tent to live under.

23He’s the One that dethrones rulers

and unseats judges.

24They’ve hardly been planted,

hardly sown, hardly taken root,

when he blows on them and they wither,

and the wind carries them off like chaff.

25Who can you compare him with;

who’s his equal?

26Look up and see who created those stars,

who leads the host of them out in full number

and calls each one by name;

because of his great power and strength,

not a one of them is missing. Is 40:21-26

27Jacob, why do you think

the LORD can’t see what you’re going through,

that he doesn’t notice the justice you deserve?

28Don’t you know? Haven’t you heard?

The eternal God, the LORD,

the creator of the earth, doesn’t get tired;

no one can measure his intelligence.

29He gives stamina to the tired

and increases strength in the weak. Is 40:27-29

30Even youths get weary;

young men collapse exhausted;

31but those who trust in the LORD

keep finding new strength;

they walk and don’t get weary;

they run and don’t get tired;

they soar up on wings like eagles. Is 40:30-31

God’s Help for Israel

41:1“Lands beyond the sea, come to order and listen;

prepare your case;

step forward and present it;

your case is next on the docket.

2Who has stirred up the king in the east

that he rightly called to his service,

who delivers up nations and subdues kings;

who makes them like dust with his sword,

like wind-driven chaff with his bow;

3who chases them away and passes along safely

on paths he hasn’t walked before?

4Who does such momentous deeds

generation after generation from the beginning till now?

I, the LORD, am the One, Is 41:1-4

5“The islands have seen it and fear;

far-off places tremble;

they’re coming; they’re getting close.

6Each one encourages the other, ‘Be strong!’

7So the carver encourages the goldsmith;

the one that shapes with the hammer

encourages the one that beats the anvil,

and says of the soldering, ‘It’s good’;

he fastens it down with nails

so it won’t rock. Is 41:5-7

8“But you, Israel my servant,

Jacob my chosen,

descendant of Abraham my friend,

9you that I took from a far-off place

and called from the most remote parts

and said, ‘You’re my servant;

I’ve chosen you—

10don’t be afraid, I’m with you;

don’t look around discouraged; I’m your God;

I’ll encourage you and help you;

you can count on me to hold you up

with my righteous right hand.’ Is 41:8-10

11All who are incensed at you will be disgraced;

anybody that opposes you will perish.

12You’ll look around for people in conflict with you

and won’t find any;

any who attack you won’t exist anymore,

13because I’m the LORD your God

that holds you up,

that tells you,

‘Don’t be afraid, I’ll help you.’ Is 41:11-13

14So don’t be afraid, Jacob you worm, you people in Israel;

I’ll help you,” the LORD says;

“Your rescuer is the Holy One of Israel.

15I’ll make you into a new, sharp threshing sledge with teeth;

you’ll thresh the mountains and pulverize them

and grind the hills into chaff.

16You’ll winnow them, the wind will blow them away,

the storm will scatter them;

but you’ll celebrate in the LORD

and take pride in the Holy One of Israel. Is 41:14-16

17“The poor and needy are looking for water,

but there isn’t any;

their tongues are parched with thirst;

I, the LORD, will answer them myself;

as the God of Israel, I won’t abandon them.

18I’ll make creeks run in the barren hills

and open up springs in the valleys below;

I’ll make the desert a lake of water

and turn dry land into fountains. Is 41:17-18

19In the desert I’ll put cedars and acacia trees,

myrtles and olive trees;

I’ll plant junipers there

along with box trees and cypress trees.

20I’ll do that so people can recognize

that I’ve done it;

the Holy One of Israel has created it. Is 41:19-20

21“Present your case for your idols,” the LORD says;

“bring forward your strong proofs,”

the King of Jacob says.

22“Predict for us what’s going to happen;

tell us what happened before

so we can connect them with their outcome

and learn what those outcomes will be.

23State what the future holds

so we can tell you are gods;

do anything—good or bad—

so we can look around and be scared together.

24You aren’t anything; you can’t do anything;

anybody that chooses you is pathetic. Is 41:21-24

25“I’ve stirred up a leader from the north;

he answers me from the rising sun;

he’ll come on rulers like on mortar,

like a potter treading clay.”

26Who predicted this from the start,

so we could know about it?

Who said it in former times,

so we could say, ‘He was right’?

Nobody said anything;

nobody heard any god say a word. Is 41:25-26

27“I was the first to tell Zion, ‘Help’s coming,’

and Jerusalem, ‘I’ve got good news.’

28But when I look,

there’s no advisor among them;

if I ask them, who can answer?

29They’re all fake;

they don’t do anything;

molten images are wind and hot air. Is 41:27-29

The Servant of the LORD

42:1“My Servant that I uphold,

my Chosen One I delight in,

I’ve put my Spirit on him;

he’ll bring righteousness to the Gentiles.

2He won’t holler or be boisterous;

he won’t make a racket in the streets.

3He won’t break a bruised reed

or put out a flickering wick;

he’ll faithfully render justice.

4He won’t falter or lose heart;

he’ll establish justice on earth;

distant lands will rely on his instruction.” Is 42:1-4

5God, Yahveh, says—

who created the sky and stretched it out,

who made the earth and what comes from it,

who gives breath to the people on it

and spirit to those who walk in it—

6“I’m Yahveh; I’ve called you to demonstrate my goodness;

I’ll hold you by the hand and watch over you.

I’ll appoint you to be a covenant for the people,

a light for the Gentiles

7to open the eyes of the blind,

to free prisoners from dungeons

and those living in darkness from prison.

8I’m Yahveh; that’s my name.

I won’t share my honor with anyone else

or my praise with carved images.

9My former prophecies have already happened;

now I’m prophesying new ones;

I’ll tell you about them before they occur.” Is 42:5-9

A Song of Praise to the LORD

10Sing a new song to Yahveh;

sing his praise from the ends of the earth,

you that sail the ocean,

you distant lands and people that live there!

11Let the desert towns join the chorus,

the villages where Kedar lives;

let the people of Sela sing for joy

and shout from the mountaintops.

12Let them honor Yahveh

and declare his praise in distant lands.

13He will rush out like a soldier

and stir up his fury like a warrior;

he’ll raise his battle cry

and prevail over his enemies. Is 42:10-13

14“I’ve kept quiet,” God says, “and restrained myself for a long time;

now like a woman in labor, I’ll groan and gasp and pant.

15I’ll make mountains and hills desolate

and wither their vegetation;

I’ll turn rivers into wadis

and dry up the ponds.

16I’ll lead the blind on a new road,

guide them in unfamiliar paths;

I’ll make darkness into light ahead of them

and make rough places smooth;

I’ll do these things;

I won’t leave them undone.

17I’ll drive back and completely disgrace

those who trust in idols

and say to molten images, ‘You’re our gods.’ Is 42:14-17

Israel Deaf and Blind

18“Listen, you deaf;

look, you blind.

19Who is as blind as my servant,

as deaf as my messenger?

Who is as blind as my chosen people,

as blind as Yahveh’s servant?

20You look at many things, but don’t see;

your ears are open, but you don’t listen.”

21Because he’s good, Yahveh was pleased

to make his Law great and glorious.

22But his people have been robbed and plundered,

trapped in caves and hidden in prisons;

they’ve become prey with no savior,

spoil with nobody to demand, “Give them back!”

Is 42:18-22

23Who among you will learn from the past?

Who will listen about the future?

24Who gave Jacob up for spoil and Israel to plunderers?

Wasn’t it Yahveh that you’ve sinned against,

whose ways you wouldn’t follow,

whose Law you didn’t obey?

25So he poured out his hot anger on you in fierce warfare

and enveloped you in flames;

you didn’t catch on, and it burned you;

you didn’t take it to heart. Is 42:23-25

Israel’s Only Savior

43:1But this is what the LORD your creator says, Jacob,

the One that formed you, Israel,

“You don’t need to be afraid, because I’ve redeemed you

and called you by name. You’re mine!

2When you pass through the sea, I’m with you;

when you cross rivers, they won’t flood over you;

when you walk through fire, the flame won’t burn you;

3because I’m the LORD your God,

the Holy One of Israel, your Savior.

I’ve given Egypt to ransom you,

Nubia and Seba in exchange for you. Is 43:1-3

4Since you’re precious to me,

since you’re honored and I love you,

I’ll trade other people in return for you,

others in exchange for your life.

5You don’t need to be afraid, because I’m with you;

I’ll bring your offspring from the east and west.

6I’ll say to the north, ‘Give them up!’

and to the south, ‘Quit holding onto them.’

Bring my sons and daughters from distant countries—

7everyone that wears my name,

that I’ve created for my honor.” Is 43:4-7

8Bring out the blind, though they have eyes,

and the deaf, though they have ears.

9Gather the nations; assemble the peoples.

Which of their idols can tell about the past?

They need to present witnesses to justify themselves

that what they say is true.

10“You’re my witnesses, Israel,” the LORD says,

“the servant I’ve chosen

so you can know me and believe me,

and understand that I’m the only One;

no god ever existed before me;

none will exist after me.

11I’m the LORD;

there’s no Savior but me.

12I’m the One that predicted it, did it, and proclaimed it

before there was any foreign god among you;

so you’re my witnesses,” the LORD says;

“I’m God.

13From eternity I’m God;

No one can take anyone away from me;

no one can undo what I do.” Is 43:8-13

The LORD’s Promised Victory

14This is what the LORD your Rescuer says,

“To help you, I’ll dispatch an army against Babylon

to drive them out as refugees

in the ships they’re proud of;

the Babylonians’ celebration will turn into mourning.

15I’m your King, Israel’s Creator,

16who made a path through the Red Sea,

a road through the flood,

17who brought out in Egypt horse and chariot,

army and soldier.

They all lay down at the same time, drowned,

snuffed out like a flickering wick. Is 43:14-17

18But don’t just recall those former things

or ponder the past.

19Duly note something new I’m doing now;

it’s happening; see it?

I’m making, like before, a highway in the wilderness,

streams in the desert.

20Wild animals will honor me,

jackals and owls;

because I’ve put water in the wilderness

and streams in the desert

so my people can drink.

21The people I created for myself at that time

will one day declare my praise worldwide. Is 43:18-21

22“Yet recently you haven’t called on me for help, Jacob;

you’re tired of me, Israel.

23You haven’t brought me the sheep for your burnt offerings

or honored me with your sacrifices,

though I haven’t burdened you down with offerings

or worn you out with incense.

24You haven’t bought any calamus for me

or satisfied me with the fat of your sacrifices.

Instead, you’ve burdened me down with your sins;

I’m tired of your iniquities. Is 43:22-24

25“I, yes, I am the One that will erase

your transgressions for my own sake

and not hold onto your sin against me.

26Remember me; let’s debate our case together;

state your evidence for being innocent.

27But from the time of your first ancestor

through your subsequent leaders,

you’ve sinned against me.

28So I profaned the priests of the sanctuary;

I delivered Jacob to total destruction

and Israel to lasting contempt. Is 43:25-28

44:1“But listen now, Jacob my servant,

Israel my chosen one.

2This is what the LORD says who created you

and formed you from the womb,

who will help you:

‘Don’t be afraid, Jacob my servant,

Jeshurun my chosen one.

3As I’ll pour out water on thirsty ground

to make streams on desert land,

I’ll also pour out my Spirit on your offspring

and bless your descendants;

4they’ll thrive like well-watered grass,

like poplars beside streams.

5This one will say, “I belong to the LORD”;

that one will wear Jacob’s name;

others will write on their hand, “Belonging to the LORD,”

and name Israel’s God with honor.’” Is 44:1-5

The Folly of Idols

6This is what the King of Israel says,

its Redeemer, the LORD of Hosts,

“I’m the first and last;

there’s no God but me.

7Who is like me? Speak up;

recount things to me in sequence

from the time I created this ancient nation;

then tell that nation what’s going to happen to them.

8 Don’t tremble in fear;

haven’t I announced it to you long ago?

You’re my witnesses.

Is there any God but me?

Is there any other Rock?

I don’t know of a one.” Is 44:6-8

9Those who carve idols don’t accomplish anything because their precious objects can’t do anything. Their worshippers don’t know that; so they’ll be put to shame. 10Who but fools make their own gods and then worship them? 11The craftsmen are mere mortals. They’ll all gather with the worshipers, take their stand, and go down in terror and infamy.

12A blacksmith shapes iron into a cutting tool over coals in his forge. He beats it with hammers till he gets hungry and weak, thirsty and tired. 13Then a carver shapes a block of wood, stretches out a measuring line on it, and draws a pattern on it with red chalk. He works it with chisels and planes to look like a beautiful human figure to set in a little shrine in somebody’s house. 14He cuts down a cedar, takes a cypress or oak, and plants a fir tree in the woods, and the rain makes it grow. 15-16It becomes something he can burn. So he burns half of it to warm himself up and say “Ah, I’m warm; the heat feels good.” Or he bakes bread and eats a roast and is satisfied. 17He carves the other half into an image, his god. He falls down to it, worships it, and prays to it, “Deliver me, my god.” Is 44:9-17

18They don’t understand because God has glazed over their eyes so they can’t see, and closed their minds so they can’t think. 19The one that made it doesn’t stop to reflect,

“I burned half of it to bake bread and roast meat;

I worshiped the other half!”

20He eats ashes and trusts something that can’t help him. He doesn’t ask, “Am I holding something fake in my hand?”

Restoration for Jerusalem

21“Remember, Jacob and Israel; you’re my servant;

I made you; I won’t forget you.

22I’ve wiped out your transgressions like a dark cloud,

your sins like a heavy morning fog;

come back to me; I’ve redeemed you.”

23Shout for joy, sky, because the LORD made you!

Make a joyful sound, depths of the earth.

Break into singing, mountains, forest, and every tree in them;

the LORD has redeemed Jacob and taken pride in Israel.

Is 44:18-23

24This is what the LORD your Redeemer says

who formed you in the womb,

“I’m the One that made everything:

I stretched out the sky by myself

and spread out the earth.

Who helped me?

25I expose false prophets’ omens

and make fools out of fortunetellers;

I force the wise to eat their words

and turn their “knowledge” into nonsense. Is 44:24-25

26I carry out my prophets’ predictions

and perform my messengers’ advice;

I’m the One that says Jerusalem will be inhabited

and the towns in Judah will be rebuilt!

27I’m the One that tells the deep ocean to dry up

and its currents to be dry.

28I say about Cyrus, ‘He’s my shepherd!

He’ll do everything I tell him’;

he’ll decree that Jerusalem will be rebuilt

and the Temple foundations will be laid again.”

Is 44:26-28

Cyrus, the LORD’s Chosen One

45:1This is what the LORD says to Cyrus his anointed

whose right hand he’ll empower

to subdue nations and dethrone kings,

to open fortress gates so they won’t be shut:

2“I’ll go ahead of you to level out the mountains,

shatter bronze gates, and cut through their iron bars.

3I’ll give you treasures stored in the dark

and wealth hidden in secret places,

so you’ll know it’s me,

the LORD God of Israel, who calls you by name.

4For the sake of Jacob my servant,

Israel my chosen one,

I’ve called you by name

and given you an honorable title

even though you didn’t know me. Is 45:1-4

5I’m the LORD; there’s no other;

there’s no God but me.

I’ll arm you for war though you don’t know who I am,

6so people from sunrise to sunset

can know there’s no God but me.

I’m the LORD; there’s no other,

7the LORD that creates light and makes darkness,

that sends peace and brings catastrophe—

I’m the LORD that does all of that. Is 45:5-7

8“Sky, shower from above;

clouds, rain down goodness;

ground, open up so salvation can sprout

and goodness can spring up from you.

I’m the LORD your creator. Is 45:8

9“Misfortune awaits the ones that fuss at their Maker

like a clay pot fussing at a potter!

Will a pot say to a potter, ‘What are you doing?’

or ‘What you’re making doesn’t have any handles’?

10Misfortune awaits the baby that says to its father,

‘Why did you beget me?’

or its mother, ‘Why did you have me?’” Is 45:9-10

11The LORD, the Holy One of Israel and your Maker, says

“Will you question me about my children

or tell me how to do my work?

12I’m the One that made the world and created people in it;

I stretched out the sky and hung the stars there.

13I’ll stir up Cyrus for my righteous purposes

and smooth his paths;

he’ll rebuild my city and free my exiles

without payment or reward.” Is 45:11-13

The LORD, the Only Savior

14The LORD says,

“Egyptians, Nubians, and Sabeans—men of stature—

will come in chains and fall down in front of you;

their wealth and merchandise will be yours.

They’ll say to you,

‘God is with you for sure;

there’s nobody else, no other God.’”

15Truly you’re a God that works in mysterious ways,

God of Israel, Savior!

16They’ll be disgraced who manufacture idols;

they’ll go away together in humiliation.

17The LORD will deliver Israel permanently;

Israel won’t ever be put to shame. Is 45:14-17

18The LORD says—who created the sky,

who made the earth and shaped it,

who didn’t make it waste and void,

but shaped it to be lived in—

“I’m the LORD; there’s no other.

19I haven’t spoken secretly in some dark corner;

I didn’t tell Jacob’s descendants

to look for me in a desolate place;

I’m straightforward

and declare what makes sense. Is 45:18-19

20“Get together and return;

come near together, refugees from the nations around.

They don’t know what they’re doing

who carry around wooden idols

and pray to gods that can’t save.

21Consult together and set forth your case.

Who predicted those things from of old?

What idol has proclaimed it for so long?

Am I not the One, the LORD?

There’s no God but me,

an upright God and Savior;

there’s none but me.

22Turn to me and be saved, people everywhere,

because I’m God, there’s no other. Is 45:20-22

23I’ve sworn by myself;

I won’t take back the reliable message,

the message that every knee will bow to me

and every tongue will swear allegiance.

24They’ll say about me,

‘Godliness and strength are only in the LORD.’

People will come to me;

everyone that’s been mad at me will be put to shame.”

25Israel’s offspring will be justified

and honored in the LORD. Is 45:23-25

Babylon’s False Gods

46:1Bel bows down, Nebo stoops over;

their images, loaded on beasts of burden and livestock,

are too heavy for their tired animals to bear.

2The idols themselves are stooped over;

their owners are bowed down too;

the people couldn’t keep the burden

from going into captivity with them. Is 46:1-2

3“Listen to me, House of Jacob,

remnant of Israel, you that I’ve carried from birth,

4till your graying years I’ll do the same;

I’ve made you, and I’ll take care of you,

carry you along, and save you. Is 46:3-4

5“What can you compare me with?

Who’s my equal?

6Those who lavish gold from the purse

and weigh silver on the scale,

hire a goldsmith to make a god out of it;

then they bow down to worship it.

7They lift it up on their shoulder and carry it around;

they set it in its place, and it doesn’t move.

If they call out to it, it can’t answer

or deliver them from their trouble. Is 46:5-7

8“Remember this and be confident about it, sinners.

Keep in mind the things from long ago,

because I’m God; there’s no one like me.

10I predict the end from the beginning,

from ancient times what hasn’t happened yet.

I say, ‘My purpose will come about;

I’ll accomplish what I delight in.’

11I’ll call a bird of prey from the east,

a leader from a distant country to do my bidding.

I’ve said truthfully what I’d do,

and I’ll do it. Is 46:8-11

12“Listen to me, stubborn people

who are so far from being good;

13I’m willing to bring my goodness now;

my salvation is not something distant

that will take a long time to get here;

I’ll show Zion my salvation

and Israel my glory now. Is 46:12-13

Prediction of the Fall of Babylon

47:1“Come sit in the dirt,

virgin daughter of Babylon.

Sit on the ground without a throne;

you won’t be treated honorably anymore.

2Grind meal with heavy millstones;

take off your veil, strip off your skirt,

uncover your legs and cross the rivers.

3Your nakedness will show;

your shame will be exposed;

in my revenge I won’t spare you or anybody else.” Is 47:1-3

4Our Redeemer is the Holy One of Israel;

Yahveh of Hosts is his name.

5“Sit silently in the dark,

daughter of Babylon;

you won’t be called

the queen of kingdoms anymore.

6I was angry with my people

and punished them by letting them fall to you.

But you didn’t show them any mercy;

you put a heavy yoke even on the elderly.

7Yet you said, ‘I’ll be queen forever’;

you were thoughtless about these things

and didn’t consider the consequences. Is 47:4-7

8“Listen to this, you that love pleasure,

that live securely and tell yourselves,

‘I exist and nobody can harm me;

I’ll never be a widow or lose my children.’

9But both will happen to you suddenly the same day—

losing your children and becoming a widow;

those disasters will come on you in full measure

despite your many sorceries and powerful spells.”

Is 47:8-9

10“You felt secure in your sinfulness and said,

‘Nobody can see me.’

Your ‘wisdom and knowledge’ have misled you;

you’ve told yourself,

‘I exist and nobody can harm me.’

11But misfortune will come on you

that you can’t charm away;

disaster will fall on you

that you can’t buy off;

destruction will meet you suddenly

that you’re not prepared for. Is 47:10-11

12“Stick with your spells and sorceries

that you’ve labored under since you were young;

maybe you can scare somebody.

13You’re tired of all the advice you’ve received;

let the astrologers—who prophesy by the stars,

and predict by the new moon—

stand up and save you from what’s coming.

14They’re like chaff in a fire;

they can’t deliver themselves from the flames;

there won’t be any good place for you to sit and keep warm.

15That’s the way it is for the ones you’ve worked with

and done business with from your youth;

each one will go off in their own direction;

nobody can save you. Is 47:12-15

Stubborn Israel

48:1“Listen to this, Jacob called ‘Israel,’

that came from Judah’s family,

that swear by the LORD and invoke Israel’s God,

but not sincerely and rightly,

2that call yourself The Holy City

and depend on the LORD of Hosts: Is 48:1-2

3long ago, I told you what was going to happen;

all at once it has; my prediction has come true.

4I know how stubborn you are,

that your neck is as stiff as iron,

and your head is as hard as bronze.

5I made my prediction long ago

so you couldn’t say your idol did it,

that your carved image, your molten god commanded it.’

Is 48:3-5

6“You’ve heard my predictions and seen them fulfilled,

but you still won’t own up to them;

now I’ll tell you things you haven’t heard.

7They’re not things from long ago;

so you can’t claim you knew them all along.

8I know what traitors you are;

you’ve been rebels from birth.

9Yet for my name’s sake, I’ve delayed expressing my anger;

for my honor I’ve restrained it

to keep from wiping you out.

10I’ve refined you, but not like silver;

I’ve refined you in the furnace of suffering.

11For my own sake—yes, I’ll do it for my own sake—

I won’t let my reputation be tarnished;

I won’t share my honor with idols. Is 48:6-11

Israel Freed from Babylon

12“Listen to me, Jacob, Israel that I’ve chosen;

I’m the only One, the first and the last.

13I’m the One that founded the earth

and spread out the sky;

when I call out the stars, they come out in force.

14Come here, all of you, and listen!

Which of your idols has told you this?

I’ve set my regard on Cyrus;

he’ll carry out my intentions on Babylon;

he’ll oppose the Babylonians.

15There I’ve said it; I’ve called him;

I’ve brought him; he’ll succeed.

16Come close and listen:

from the beginning I’ve spoken plainly

about what would happen.”

Already the Lord GOD and his Spirit have sent me with that message.

Is 48:12-16

17This is what the LORD says,

your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel:

“I’m the LORD your God

that teaches you how to succeed

and leads you the way you should go.

18If only you’d paid attention to what I told you,

you’d have had peace like a river

and goodness like ocean waves washing over you.

19Your descendants would have been too numerous to count,

like grains of sand by the seashore;

I wouldn’t have needed to cut them off

or destroy them out of my presence.” Is 48:17-19

20“Get out of Babylon! Escape from the Babylonians!

Shout the news everywhere with joy:

the LORD has rescued his servant Jacob!

21They weren’t thirsty while he led them through the desert;

he made water gush out of rock for them to drink;

22“But there’s no peace for the wicked,” the LORD says. Is 48:20-22

The Servant of the LORD

49:1Listen, far off lands;

pay attention, distant nations.

The LORD called me before I was born;

he named me inside my mother’s body.

2He made my mouth like a sharp sword

and hid me under his hand;

he made a polished arrow out of me

and put me in his quiver.

3He told me, “You’re my servant, Israel;

I’ll demonstrate my glory in you.”

4But I replied, “I haven’t really accomplished anything;

I’ve just worn myself out for nothing;

yet surely my just due is in the LORD’s hands;

I’ll have to trust him for my reward.” Is 49:1-4

5The LORD says,

who formed me in the womb to be his servant

and bring Jacob back to him

(because the LORD values me and strengthens me):

6“It’s not a minor thing to serve me

and restore the remnant in Israel;

I’ll also make you a light to the Gentiles,

to take the news about my salvation all over the world.”

7This is what Israel’s Redeemer says

to the despised nation,

the one that other nations abhor,

the servant of rulers:

“Kings will stand at attention when they see you;

officials will bow

because of the LORD, who is faithful,

the Holy One of Israel that has chosen you.” Is 49:5-7

The Restoration of Israel Promised

8The LORD says,

“I’ll respond to you at an appropriate time

and help you when you need deliverance.

I’ll offer you as a covenant to the people

to restore Israel’s land,

to parcel out its deserted territories,

9to say to the ones in bonds, ‘Be free,’

and to those in darkness, ‘Come out into the light.’

My ‘sheep’ will graze along the roads

and pasture on the former barren hills. Is 49:8-9

10They won’t be hungry or thirsty;

the scorching heat won’t oppress them,

because the One that shows them mercy

will lead them to springs of running water.

11I’ll make my mountains a level road

and raise my highways above the valleys.

12They’ll come from a long way off,

some from the north and west,

some from the region of Sinim.”

13Shout for joy, earth; celebrate, sky!

Break out into singing, mountains!

The LORD will comfort his people

and shown mercy to his suffering ones. Is 49:10-13

14Yet Zion says, “The LORD has abandoned me;

he’s forgotten about me.”

15But the LORD says,

“Can a mother forget her nursing child

or withhold mercy from the son she bore?

Even if you forget, I won’t.

16I’ve written your name on my palms;

your fallen walls are always on my mind.

17Those who rebuild you will soon return to start their work;

the ones that want to destroy you will leave.

18Look up and around;

your people are gathering to you.

As I live,” the LORD says,

“you’ll put them all on

like a bride attaches jewels to her wedding gown.

Is 49:14-18

19In place of your empty spaces,

you’ll be overrun with residents;

your enemies that swallowed you will be long gone.

20The children born in exile will tell you

it’s too crowded here.

21You’ll ask yourselves.

‘Who was their father?

I was bereaved and barren,

wandering in exile;

I was alone; who had all these children?

Who raised them?’” Is 49:19-21

22The Lord GOD says,

“I’ll signal to the nations

to bring back your boys in their arms

and to carry your little girls on their shoulders.

23Kings will be your foster fathers;

queens will be your nurses.

They’ll bow to you,

and lick the dust off your feet.

You’ll know I’m the LORD;

the ones that trust me won’t be disappointed. Is 49:22-23

24Can anybody steal prey back from a warrior

or rescue captives from a tyrant?

25But the LORD says,

“I’ll even retrieve the captives of the strong

and rescue the tyrant’s prey.

I’ll combat anybody that combats you,

and save your children.

26I’ll make your oppressors eat their own flesh

and get drunk on their own blood.

Everyone will know I’m the LORD, your Savior,

your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.” Is 49:24-26

Israel’s Sin and the Servant’s Obedience

50:1The LORD says,

“Did I put your mother away with divorce papers?

Did I sell you as slaves to pay my debts?

No, I sold you because of your transgressions

and divorced your mother for her sins.

2When I came, why wasn’t anybody home?

When I knocked, why didn’t anyone answer the door?

Am I too poor to pay a ransom;

don’t I have the strength to rescue?

I can dry up the sea with a word,

make rivers empty and the fish in them die and stink.

3I dress the sky in darkness

and cover it with burlap.” Is 50:1-3

4The Lord GOD has given me a disciple’s tongue

so I can comfort the weary with his message;

he wakes me up morning after morning

to help me understand his will.

5He’s cleaned out my ears,

and I haven’t pulled away.

6I’ve turned my back to the ones who scourge me

and my cheeks to those who pull out my beard;

I haven’t covered my face from being spit on.

7He helps me so I’m not disgraced;

I set my face like flint

and know I won’t feel ashamed. Is 50:4-7

8The One that vindicates me is close at hand;

who wants to fight me?

Let’s stand up to each other.

Who wants to take me to court?

Go on, sue me!

9The Lord helps me;

who can condemn me?

Adversaries will wear out like old, moth-eaten clothes.

10Who among you respects the LORD,

obeys his servant,

and still lives in the dark?

Trust the LORD and rely on him.

11You that live by the light of the fires you set

will fall into them in torment. Is 50:8-11

Everlasting Salvation for Israel

51:1“Listen to me, you that want to be good,

that look to the LORD,

the Rock you were hewn from,

the quarry you came from.

2Look to Abraham your ancestor,

to Sarah who bore you in pain;

he was just one man when I called him;

then I blessed him and multiplied him.”

3Indeed, the LORD will comfort Zion again

and have mercy on its desolate places;

he’ll make its wilderness like Eden,

its desert like the LORD’s orchard.

Joy and happiness will be there,

thanksgiving and songs. Is 51:1-3

4“Listen, my people;

pay attention, my nation,

because my law will go out from me;

my justice will shine like a light for the nations,

to distant lands that wait for me.

5My goodness will come soon

to set my deliverance in motion,

my arms will bring justice to the nations;

the distant lands will look to me.

6Look up at the sky;

then look at the earth below it,

because the sky will dissipate like smoke,

the earth will wear out like a garment,

the people in it will die like gnats;

but my deliverance will be permanent,

my goodness won’t end. Is 51:4-6

7Listen, you that know goodness

and have my Law in your heart;

don’t worry about criticism

or be intimidated by scorn;

8moths will eat away at your adversaries like a cloak;

worms will consume them like wool;

but my goodness will last forever,

my deliverance will continue to all generations.”

9Wake up, wake up, show your strength, arm of the LORD;

wake up as in the old days, generations ago;

wasn’t it you that cut Rahab in pieces,

that pierced the dragon? Is 51:7-9

10Wasn’t it you that dried up the sea,

the water in the great deep,

that made it a path

for the rescued to pass through?

11The ones the LORD has ransomed will return

to Zion with happy shouts,

crowned with everlasting joy;

sorrow and sighing will disappear. Is 51:10-11

12“I’m the One that gives you assurance.

Why be afraid of mortals

that wither like grass?

13Why forget the LORD your Maker

that stretched out the sky

and laid the foundations for the world?

Why constantly fear your enemies’ fury

when they threaten to destroy you?

Where’s the fury of those oppressors now?

14Exiles will soon be free;

they won’t starve to death in dungeons,

15because I’m Yahveh your God

that stirs up the sea and makes its breakers roar.

(“Yahveh of Hosts” is my title.)

16I’ve put my message in your mouth

and covered you with my hand

to establish the sky,

to found the earth,

to tell Zion, ‘You’re my people.’” Is 51:12-16

17Wake up! Jerusalem;

get up, you that drank from the LORD’s hand

the cup of his anger,

that drank to the dregs the chalice

that made you stagger.

18Out of all the children you’ve borne and raised,

there’s no one to take you by the hand and guide you.

19Two things have happened to you:

devastation and destruction, sword and famine.

Who’s going to mourn for you?

How can I comfort you?

20Your children have fainted;

they lie helpless at the head of every street

like an antelope in a net,

full of the LORD’s anger, your God’s rebuke. Is 51:17-20

21So listen to this, oppressed people,

drunk but not with wine;

22this is what your Lord says, the LORD your God

that contends for his people:

‘I’ve taken out of your hand

the cup filled with my anger,

the chalice that made you stagger;

you won’t have to drink it anymore.

23I’ll hand it to your tormentors to drink

who told you to lie down so they could walk on you.

You made your back like the ground,

like a street for them to tread.” Is 51:21-23

Deliverance for Jerusalem

52:1Wake up, wake up;

dress yourself with strength, Zion;

put on your beautiful clothes, Jerusalem the holy city;

defiled, godless people won’t invade you anymore.

2Get up, shake off the dust, captive Jerusalem;

take the chains off your neck, resident in Zion,

3because the LORD says:

“You were sold for nothing;

you’ll be redeemed without money.

4In the beginning my people went down to Egypt to live;

now the Assyrians oppress them for no reason.

5Why are my people enslaved for nothing

and their rulers wail and blaspheme me all the time?

6Now my people will know my name;

they’ll know I’m the one that’s talking to them.” Is 52:1-6

7How welcome on the mountains

is the messenger that brings good news,

that announces peace and happiness,

that declares salvation and says to Zion,

“Your God reigns!”

8Listen! Your watchmen are happy and singing;

they can see that the LORD is restoring Zion.

9Break out in joyful song together,

you laid-waste places in Jerusalem,

because the LORD has comforted his people;

he’s redeemed Jerusalem.

10He’s bared his holy arm

so the nations can witness the deliverance he’s bringing.

11Leave, leave there; don’t hang onto anything defiled;

purify yourselves, you that bring back the LORD’s sacred objects.

12You won’t go out quickly like fleeing refugees;

the LORD will lead you out;

the God of Israel will be your rear guard. Is 52:7-12

The Suffering Servant Poem (52:13-53:12)

13My servant will succeed;

he’ll be looked up to and highly honored.

14But, even as many were astonished at you, my people,

so his astonishing appearance was marred beyond human resemblance,

his form mutilated beyond recognition.

15He’ll cleanse many nations;

kings will shut their mouths in his presence.

They’ll see what they had no one to tell them

and understand what they hadn’t heard. Is 52:13-15

53:1Who has believed our message?

Who has the LORD shown his arm to?

He grew up before the LORD like a tender sprout,

like a shoot out of parched ground.

2He wasn’t particularly handsome or noble

to draw our attention to him

or have the looks that would attract us to him.

3People despised and abandoned him,

a pained man, acquainted with grief;

like someone people look the other way from,

we looked down on him and didn’t respect him. Is 53:1-3

4Actually though, he was shouldering our weaknesses

and carrying our pains,

but we considered him

someone God struck and made suffer.

5But he was pierced for our sins,

crushed for our iniquities.

The discipline that was for our welfare fell on him,

and by his scourging we are healed.

6We’ve all wandered off like sheep

and turned to our own way;

but the LORD laid on him the sinfulness of us all. Is 53:4-6

7He was oppressed and suffering,

but he didn’t say anything;

like a lamb they led to slaughter

or a sheep silent before its shearers,

he didn’t open his mouth.

8He was taken away by oppression and condemnation;

who realized at the time

that he was being cut off from the living

for the sins of my people, who deserved the stroke?

9They assigned his grave with criminals

though he hadn’t deceived or been violent;

yet he was associated with a rich man in his death. Is 53:7-9

10But it was the LORD’s plan to crush him,

to put him to grief;

when he offers himself as a guilt offering,

he’ll see his offspring and extend his life,

and the LORD will accomplish his good pleasure in him.

11He’ll see what results from his anguish and feel fulfilled;

by his experience, my servant the upright one,

will justify many by shouldering their sins.

12So God will assign him a place among the great,

and he’ll divide the spoil with the strong

because he poured out his life

when they treated him like a transgressor.

But he was shouldering many other people’s sins

and interceding for them. Is 53:10-12

The Future Glory for Zion

54:1“Shout for joy, childless woman;

break into joyful shouting and cry out,

you that have never had birth pangs;

because the woman that’s by herself

will have more children than a married woman,”

the LORD says.

2“Make a bigger space for your tent;

stretch out its curtains—don’t hold back;

lengthen your guy ropes and drive your pegs deeper.

3You’ll spread out left and right;

your descendants will live in the nations

and resettle ruined towns. Is 54:1-3

4“Don’t be afraid, you won’t be disgraced;

don’t feel humiliated, you won’t feel ashamed.

You’ll forget the shame of your youth;

you won’t remember the disgrace of your widowhood;

5because your husband is your Maker;

his name is Yahveh of Hosts;

your Redeemer is the Holy One of Israel,

the God of the whole world. Is 54:4-5

6Yahveh has called to you

like a wife abandoned and grieving,

like a young woman divorced.

7For a short time I separated from you,

but I’ll bring you back with mercy.

8To show you my anger,

I withdrew from you awhile;

but with enduring love,

I’ll have mercy on you now,”

Yahveh your Redeemer says.

Is 54:6-8

9“This is like Noah’s time to me,

when I swore that water like he saw

wouldn’t flood the world again;

In that same way I swear now

that I won’t be angry with you or rebuke you.

10Mountains may quake and hills may shake,

but I won’t remove my enduring love from you

or break my covenant for peace with you,”

the LORD says who has mercy for you.

Is 54:9-10

11“Suffering city, storm-tossed and uncomforted,

I’ll rebuild you with stones set in antimony

and lay your foundations in lapis lazuli.

12I’ll make your battlements out of rubies,

your gates out of carbuncles,

your entire wall out of precious stones.

13All your descendants will be the LORD’s disciples;

they’ll prosper greatly.

14You’ll be established in goodness

far from fear and oppression;

terror won’t get near you.

15If anybody assaults you, it won’t be because I sent them;

whoever attacks you will fall in defeat.

16I’ve created blacksmiths that blow the burning coals

and make weapons for their purpose;

I’ve also created destroyers that ruin them.

17No weapon designed to oppose you will achieve its aim;

you’ll refute whoever brings charges against you in court.

I’ll vindicate you,” the LORD says. Is 54:11-17

Invitation to the LORD’s Salvation

55:1“Everyone that’s thirsty, come to the water;

you that don’t have any money, come, buy, and eat;

get wine and milk for free.

2Why spend money on what’s not food,

wages on what doesn’t satisfy?

3Come and listen so you can live;

I’ll make an everlasting covenant with you

like the faithful mercies I showed David.

4I’ve appointed him as a witness to the nations,

a leader and commander for them.

5You too will call nations you don’t know;

nations that don’t know you will hurry to you

because of the LORD your God,

the Holy One of Israel,

because he has honored you.” Is 55:1-5

6Look for the LORD while you can find him;

call on him while he’s near.

7Sinners need to change the way they act;

the unjust have to abandon selfish intentions.

They must return to the LORD

so he’ll have mercy on them,

come back to their God

because he’ll generously pardon.

8“I don’t think like you do;

I don’t do like you do,” the LORD says.

9“As high as the sky is above the earth,

my ways are above your ways

and my thoughts above your thoughts. Is 55:6-9

10As rain and snow fall from the sky

and don’t go back there without watering the ground,

making it sprout and produce,

and providing seed to the sower and bread to the eater—

11so my message won’t come back to me

without accomplishing what I sent it to do.

12You’ll go out with joy

and be led forth in peace;

the mountains and hills

will break out in singing;

the trees in the field will clap their hands.

13Cypress trees will come up in place of thorns;

myrtles will grow instead of nettles;

they’ll be a memorial to the LORD,

an everlasting sign that won’t be destroyed.” Is 55:10-13

Blessings for All Nations

56:1The LORD says,

“Maintain righteousness and be godly

because my salvation’s coming;

my deliverance will arrive.

2They are fortunate who do that,

who hold onto it,

who honor my Sabbath

and don’t do anything sinful.

3Foreigners that join themselves to the LORD shouldn’t say,

‘He’ll surely make a difference between me and his people’;

eunuchs shouldn’t say, ‘I’m a dead tree.’”

4The LORD says,

“For eunuchs that keep my Sabbaths holy,

choose to do what pleases me,

and keep my covenant—

5I’ll erect a memorial inside my Temple walls

and inscribe on it a name that’s better than heirs. Is 56:1-5

6“Foreigners that join me

to minister to me, love and serve me,

observe my Sabbaths, and keep my covenant—

7I’ll bring to my holy mountain

and make happy in my Temple for prayer;

I’ll accept their sacrifices and burnt offerings on my altar;

I’ll make my Temple a house for prayer for all nations.”

8The Lord GOD who brings back the dispersed from Israel, says,

“Still others I’ll bring to those I’ve already gathered.”

Is 56:6-8

Sinful Leaders Condemned

9All you wild animals in the field and forest,

come and devour my people.

10The watchmen are blind;

they don’t know what’s going on.

They’re dogs that can’t bark,

always lying around asleep, dreaming.

11They have huge appetites they can never satisfy;

they’re shepherds that don’t know how to shepherd.

They’ve all turned to their selfish interests,

looking for personal profit.

12“Come on,” they say, “let’s get some wine

and drink lots of alcohol;

tomorrow let’s do it again—and more so.” Is 56:9-12

57:1Good people perish and nobody notices;

the devout disappear without anyone realizing it,

because God takes good people out of harm’s way

2They who take the godly road

go to peace and rest in their graves.

Idolatrous Worship Condemned

3“But come here, you sons of sorcerers,

you offspring of adulterers and prostitutes.

4Who are you making fun of?

Who are you mouthing off to?

Who are you sticking out your tongue at?

Aren’t you rebellious brats, lying cads

5that worship your idols with lust among the terebinths

under every green tree,

that slaughter your children in the wadis

on the jagged rocks beneath the cliffs? Is 57:1-5

6Your destiny is among those smooth-stone fertility symbols

that you worship in those wadis; they’re your fate;

you pour out liquid offerings to them

and make grain offerings;

am I supposed to be appeased by stuff like that?

7You’ve committed adultery on every high mountain

and gone up there to offer sacrifice to your idols.

8You’ve put pagan symbols on the back of your doors

and on your doorposts;

you’ve deserted me and uncovered yourself

to your Temple prostitutes;

you’ve loved their bed

and looked at their nakedness. Is 57:6-8

9You’ve gone to Molech with olive oil

and lots of perfume;

you’ve sent your messengers far and wide,

even to Sheol.

10You’ve worn yourselves out by your long search,

but you didn’t give up;

you found renewed strength and didn’t faint. Is 57:9-10

11“Who were you worried about and fearful of

when you lied and didn’t think about me?

12I’ll tell everybody about your so-called good deeds,

but they won’t do you any good.

13When you appealed for help,

did your collection of idols deliver you?

A gust of wind can pick them up;

a breath can blow them over.

But whoever takes refuge in me will inherit the land

and possess my holy mountain.” Is 57:11-13

Comfort for the Contrite

14God says,

“Fix the road; rebuild it;

get rid of every obstacle to my people.”

15This is what the high and lofty One says

that lives forever, whose name is Holy:

“I live in a high and holy place

to revive the courage of the humble

and the heart of the repentant.

16I won’t oppose you forever or always be angry;

the spirit and breath of the ones I’ve created

would lose spirit and give up.

17I was angry and struck them

for their sinful, unjust gain;

I hid from them and was angry,

and they went on turning away in heart. Is 57:14-17

18I’ve seen their ways, but I’ll heal them anyway;

I’ll lead them, comfort their mourners,

19and create praise from them.

Peace to the near and far;

I’ll heal them,” the LORD says.

20“But sinful people are like a tossing sea;

it can’t relax;

it stirs up debris and mud.

21There’s no peace for them,” my God says. Is 57:18-21

False and True Worship

58:1“Shout; don’t hold back;

raise your voice like a ram’s horn;

tell my people their transgressions.

2They look to me daily and seem to delight to know my ways,

as if they’re a good nation that hasn’t left my ordinances;

they ask for favorable verdicts

and act like they delight in drawing near to me.

3Then they wonder, ‘Why have we fasted, and you haven’t noticed?

Why have we humbled ourselves, and you haven’t acknowledged it?’

It’s because you fast to get what you want

(meanwhile overworking your workers)! Is 58:1-3

4You fast only to win disputes and fist fights—

not to be heard on high.

5Is that the kind of fast I had in mind for humbling yourselves?

Isn’t that just going through the motions of bowing your head like a reed

and spreading out burlap and ashes under you?

Do you call that penance, a fast that’s acceptable to the LORD?

6Isn’t this the kind of fast I had in mind:

loosening the bonds of people you falsely imprisoned,

undoing the straps of their yoke,

freeing the oppressed,

and breaking every ties that binds people? Is 58:4-6

7Isn’t it sharing your food with the hungry,

bringing the homeless into your house,

dressing the naked when you see them,

not hiding from relatives that need you?

8Then your light will break forth like the dawn;

your wounds will heal quickly.

Your good reputation will precede you;

the glory of the LORD will have your back.

9You’ll call and he’ll answer;

you’ll appeal to him, and he’ll say, ‘I’m here.’

If you remove oppression from among you,

the finger pointing and vicious gossip,

if you feed the hungry

and satisfy the needs of the suffering—

10then you’ll be a light shining in the dark;

the gloom around you will turn to noonday light. Is 58:7-10

11The LORD will always guide you,

quench your thirst,

and restore your strength;

he’ll make you like an irrigated garden,

like a year-round spring.

12Your people will rebuild the ancient ruins

on foundations from long ago;

you’ll repair the breaches in the walls

and fix the streets you live on. Is 58:11-12

13“If you turn around from the direction you’re headed,

stop doing just whatever you please on my holy day,

consider the Sabbath a delight,

honor the LORD’s day by what you do that day,

step aside from your own pursuits

and seeking your own pleasure and talking idly—

14then you’ll be delighting in the LORD.

He’ll give you honor on the earth

and satisfy you with the heritage of your ancestor Jacob.”

The LORD has spoken. Is 58:13-14

Warnings Against Sin

59:1It’s not that the LORD’s hand is not too weak to save

or his ear too deaf to hear you call.

2It’s your iniquities that have separated you from him;

your sins have shut him off from you,

so he ignores you.

3You’ve defiled your hands with blood,

your fingers with sin,

your lips with lying,

your tongues with gossip.

4None of you brings just suits or argues cases honestly;

you hide behind double talk and perjury;

you conceive schemes and give birth to sin. Is 59:1-4

5You hatch viper eggs and weave spider webs;

whoever eats the eggs dies;

snakes hatch from the cracked eggs.

6Your webs can’t become clothes;

you can’t dress yourselves with what you’ve made.

Your deeds are sinful;

you use your hands for violence.

7You hurry to do harm,

run to shed blood,

and think sinful things;

destruction lies scattered along your highways.

8You don’t know any road that leads to peace;

you give the wrong directions;

whoever follows them gets lost. Is 59:5-8

9So justice is a long way off from you;

right living doesn’t help you.

You hope for light, but it’s dark here;

you look for sunny days but live in gloom.

10You grope along the wall like the blind

and fumble around like people without eyes;

you stumble around as much at noon as you do at dusk,

like the dead among the living.

11You growl like bears and moan like pigeons;

you look for justice, but it doesn’t come;

you want salvation, but it’s a distant prospect. Is 59:9-11

12You’ve multiplied your sins right in God’s face;

they testify against you.

You know you’re sinful;

13you transgress and deny the LORD

and turn your backs on him.

You advocate oppression and rebellion,

conceive and tell lies from the heart.

14The courts oppose justice;

it’s nowhere near;

truth stumbles in the streets;

honesty is illegal.

15aThere is no truth;

those who turn from sin become victims. Is 59:12-15a

15b-16The LORD was amazed;

it displeased him that there was no justice.

Nobody was intervening to help the oppressed;

so he brought about salvation himself

and sustained it with his goodness.

17He put on goodness like a breastplate,

and a helmet of salvation on his head;

he dressed himself in vengeance

and wrapped himself with zeal like a mantle.

18He’ll repay his adversaries according to their deeds,

recompense his enemies with his anger,

and carry out retribution to the ends of the earth.

19So they’ll fear the LORD in the west

and honor him from the rising of the sun,

because he’ll come like a rushing tide

that he drives with the wind.

20“A redeemer will come to Zion,

to those who turn from sin in Jacob,” the LORD says. Is 59:15b-20

21“This is my covenant with you:

my Spirit that’s on you,

my message that’s in you

won’t leave you, your children,

or grandchildren from now on.” Is 59:21

Israel’s Future Glory

60:1“Arise, shine; your light has come;

the glory of the LORD has risen on you.

2Darkness will cover the earth;

thick blackness will blanket the nations;

but the LORD will shine on you;

his glory will appear on you.

3Nations will come to your light,

kings to the brightness of your rising. Is 60:1-3

4“Look all around you;

they’re all gathering home to you.

Your little boys will come from a long way off;

your girls will be carried in arms.

5Then your eyes will be radiant;

you’ll be thrilled and happy,

because commerce from the sea will return to you,

and the nations’ wealth will be available to you.

6Caravans of camels will cover you,

young camels from Midian and Ephah.

The ones from Sheba will bring gold and frankincense,

and good news about the praises of the LORD.

7The flocks of Kedar will gather to you;

the rams of Nebaioth will serve you.

I’ll accept them on my altar

and honor my Temple.

8Who are these that fly like a cloud,

like pigeons to their windows? Is 60:4-8

9The distant lands will learn to trust in me;

the ships from Tarshish will come first,

bringing your descendants home from afar

and their silver and gold with them

for the LORD your God,

for the Holy One of Israel,

because he’s honored you. Is 60:9

10“Foreigners will rebuild your walls;

their kings will be your servants.

Though I struck you in my anger,

now I’ll have mercy on you in my favor.

11Your gates will stay open day and night

so nations can bring their wealth to you,

and their kings can be led as captives

in the victory procession.

12Nations that won’t serve you will perish.

13The splendor of Lebanon will come on you,

the juniper, box tree, and cypress tree together,

to beautify the place for my feet in my sanctuary.

14The descendants of your oppressors will come bowing to you;

your despisers will prostrate themselves at your feet.

They’ll call you The City of the LORD,

Zion of the Holy One of Israel. Is 60:10-14

15“Whereas you’ve been hated, shunned, and abandoned,

I’ll make you something to be proud of forever,

a joy for endless generations.

16You’ll nurse on the milk of nations, breasts of kings;

you’ll know that I’m the LORD, your Savior,

your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

17I’ll bring gold for bronze,

bronze for wood,

silver for iron,

iron for stone.

I’ll make peace your administrators

and goodness your overseers. Is 60:15-17

18Violence will disappear from your land,

war from inside your borders;

you’ll call your walls Salvation and your gates Praise.

19You won’t need the sun for daylight

or the moon to be bright.

You’ll have the LORD for an everlasting light;

he’ll be your glory.

20Your sun won’t set anymore;

your moon won’t have phases.

You’ll have the LORD for an everlasting light;

your mourning will be over.

21Your people will be good;

they’ll own their land forever,

the branch I planted with my own hands will honor me.

22The smallest will become a clan;

the least will be a nation.

I, the LORD, will hurry it along when the time comes.” Is 60:18-22

The Year of the LORD’s Favor

61:1The Spirit of the Lord GOD is on me;

he’s anointed me to bring good news to the downtrodden.

He’s sent me to bandage up the brokenhearted,

to liberate captives,

to free prisoners,

2to announce that this is

the year the LORD shows blessing,

the day he sets things right,

to comfort anyone that’s grieving,

3to give to the sad in Zion

a crown in place of ashes,

the oil of happiness instead of mourning,

the mantle of praise rather than a fainting spirit

so they’ll be like Terebinths of Goodness

the LORD has planted to demonstrate his glory. Is 61:1-3

4Then they’ll rebuild the ancient ruins,

set back up what was torn down,

repair destroyed towns deserted for generations.

5Foreigners will pasture your flocks,

do your farming, and tend your vineyards.

6But you’ll be the LORD’s priests;

people will speak of you as his ministers.

You’ll feed on the wealth of nations

and take pride in their prosperity.

7Instead of humiliation you’ll have a double portion;

rather than dishonor you’ll celebrate over your lot.

You’ll have everlasting joy in your land.

8“I, the LORD, love justice

and despise short-changing in burnt offering;

I’ll make an everlasting contract with you

and faithfully pay you for your work.

9Then the nations will honor your offspring worldwide;

everyone will recognize you as the offspring the LORD blessed.”

Is 61:4-9

10I’m really happy in the LORD;

I celebrate over my God

because he’s dressed me in salvation

and wrapped me in goodness like a robe,

like a groom dresses himself in a garland,

and a bride adorns herself with jewels.

11As the ground produces seeds

and a garden makes sprouts grow,

so the Lord GOD makes goodness and praise

spring up for all the world to see. Is 61:10-11

Isaiah’s Prayer for Jerusalem

62:1For Zion’s sake I’ll speak to God;

for Jerusalem’s sake I won’t keep still,

until your goodness glows brightly,

and your salvation radiates like a burning torch;

2so the nations can witness your goodness

and kings can gaze at your glory.

The LORD himself will give you a new name.

3You’ll be a beautiful crown in his hand,

a royal diadem he holds up high.

4You won’t be called Abandoned [Azubah] anymore

or your land be named Desolate [Shemamah];

you’ll be My Delight Is in It [Hephzibah],

and your land will be Married [Beulah],

because he delights in you,

and your land will be married to him.

5Like a young man marries a virgin,

your sons will marry you, Jerusalem;

like a groom is happy over a bride,

your God will be happy over you. Is 62:1-5

6I’ve stationed watchmen on your walls, Jerusalem,

not to be silent day or night,

but to remember you to the LORD

7till he makes you something worth praising in the world.

8He has sworn by his right hand and strong arm,

“I’ll never again let your enemies eat your grain

or foreigners drink the new wine you labored for.

9But the ones that put the grain in the granary

will eat it and praise me;

the ones that pick the grapes

will drink the wine in the courts of my sanctuary.” Is 62:6-9

10Go out through the gates;

clear the way for my people.

Build a highway so they can return;

get the loose rocks off the road.

Hoist a flag the nations can see.

11The LORD has declared all over the world,

“Tell Zion its salvation’s coming;

he’s bringing his reward with him.”

12They’ll call you The Holy People [Ha‘am Haggadosh],

The LORD’s Redeemed [Ge’ule-adonai],

The Sought For, A City No Longer Forsaken. Is 62:10-12

Vengeance Against Israel’s Enemies

63:1Who is this that’s coming from Edom

in crimson clothes from Bozrah,

one majestic in attire

and marching with such power?

“The One that’s announcing vindication,

that has the strength to save.”

2Why are your clothes stained red

like those who tread out grapes?

3“Ineed, I’ve been treading in a winepress—alone;

nobody from the nations could help me;

so I tramped down my foes in my fury;

their life blood spattered my garments

and stained my clothes.

4I’ve had a day for payback on my mind;

a year for redemption to come.

5But I looked, amazed

that there was no one to intervene for the oppressed;

so my own arm did the saving;

anger sustained me.

6I tramped down nations in my fury

and made them drunk in my wrath;

I poured out their blood on the ground.” Is 63:1-6

Praise for Deliverance

7I’ll recount the praises and tell about Yahveh’s enduring love

in proportion to everything he has granted us;

I’ll declare the great goodness he has shown

in proportion to his mercy and kindness toward Israel.

8He said, “They’re my people,

offspring that surely won’t betray me again;

so he saved them.

9In all their adversity he felt their suffering;

so he sent the angel from his presence to save them.

In his love and mercy, he redeemed them;

he picked them up and carried them

like he’d done in the past.

10But they did rebel and grieve his Holy Spirit;

so he became their enemy and opposed them. Is 63:7-10

11Then his people remembered the past at Moses’ time.

“Where’s the One that brought them up from the sea

with the shepherds of his flock?

Where is the One that put his Holy Spirit among them,

12that showed his power when Moses raised his right hand,

that divided the water for them to make an eternal name for himself,

13that led them through the deep sea?

Like a horse in open country, they didn’t stumble;

14like livestock that goes down to a sheltered valley,

the Spirit of the LORD gave them rest;

that’s the way he led his people

to make a glorious name for himself.” Is 63:11-14

Prayer for Pardon

15Look down from heaven,

from your holy house;

where are your zeal and powerful deeds?

I don’t sense the mercy

you used to have toward us.

16Even if Abraham would disown us

and Israel wouldn’t recognize us,

you’d still be our Father and Redeemer.

17LORD, why let us stray from your ways

and harden our hearts against you?

For our sake, bring us back as your special possession.

18Your holy people had your sanctuary for a while,

but our adversaries have tramped it down.

19We’ve become like a nation you never ruled,

like people that never wore your name. Is 63:15-19

64:1Oh that you’d open the sky and come down

and the mountains would quake in your presence—

2like a flame that burns brush and boils water—

to show yourself to your adversaries

so they’d tremble in your presence!

3When you did awesome things we didn’t expect,

you came down and the mountains quaked in your presence.

4No one has ever heard of a God like you

that acts on behalf of people that wait for him.

5You visit those who enjoy doing good,

who remember you and your ways.

You were angry because we kept sinning for a long time;

can we ever be saved?

6We’ve all become unclean;

our best efforts are like menstrual rags.

We wither like leaves;

our sins blow us away like the wind.

7No one calls on you or reaches out to you

because you’ve hid from us

and delivered us to the consequences of our sins. Is 64:1-7

8But now, LORD, you’re our Father;

we’re the clay, you’re the potter;

you’ve made us.

9Don’t be angry beyond measure;

don’t hold our sin against us forever;

look now, we’re all your people.

10Your holy cities have become a desert;

Zion is a wasteland;

Jerusalem is desolate.

11Our holy, beautiful Temple,

where our ancestors praised you,

has been burned;

all our precious things lie in ruins.

12Will you limit yourself to this much retribution,

or will you keep disciplining us no end? Is 64:8-12

Judgment and Final Salvation

65:1“I let people look for me who weren’t asking about me;

people that weren’t looking for me found me.

I said, ‘I’m here! Over here!’

to people that didn’t call on me.

2All day long I spread out my hands to a rebellious nation

that follows its own ideas,

3that continually angers me to my face

by offering sacrifices to idols in sacred gardens

and burning incense on pagan altars,

4that sit in tombs and spend the night in secret places,

that eat pig meat

and have broth from unclean meat in their pots,

5that say, ‘Stay away from me;

don’t touch me;

I’m holier than you are!’

They’re smoke in my nose, a fire that burns all day. Is 65:1-5

6I’ve written it out in front of me:

I won’t stand idly by; I’ll repay.

I’ll pay back into their laps

7the sins they and their ancestors committed;

since they’ve burned incense on the mountains

and scorned me on the hills,

I’ll measure out their former deeds into their arms,”

the LORD says.

8“As new wine comes from clusters

and somebody says,

‘Don’t ruin it; it’s useful’;

that’s what I’ll do with my servants

and not destroy them all.

9I’ll preserve a remnant from Jacob and Judah

to inherit my mountains;

my chosen ones will inherit it;

my servants will live there. Is 65:6-9

10Sharon will be a pasture for flocks;

the Valley of Achor will be a resting place for herds—

for my people that look to me.

11-12But I’ll destine for the sword

you that leave me,

that forget my holy mountain,

that set a table for Fortune

and fill cups with mixed wine for Destiny.

You’ll bow down to slaughter,

because I called, but you didn’t answer;

I spoke, but you ignored me;

you did what I consider sinful;

you chose what I don’t delight in.” Is 65:10-12

13So the Lord GOD says,

“My servants will eat, but you’ll be hungry;

my servants will drink, but you’ll be thirsty;

my servants will celebrate, but you’ll be humiliated;

14my servants will make a joyful sound with a happy heart,

but you’ll cry with a heavy heart

and wail with a broken spirit.

15The name you leave behind will be a curse to my chosen ones,

and the Lord GOD will slay you;

but I’ll call my servants another name

16because those who bless themselves on earth

will bless themselves by the true God;

the ones that take an oath in the land

will swear by the true God;

because I’ll forget the former troubles

and hide them from me. Is 65:13-16

New Earth and Sky

17“I’m creating a new earth and sky;

people won’t think about previous things anymore.

18Be happy and celebrate forever in what I create,

because I’ll create Jerusalem for celebrating

and its people for happiness.

19I’ll celebrate over Jerusalem

and be happy with my people;

they won’t hear weeping and crying anymore.

20No longer will babies live just a few days,

or adults die young;

they’ll die when they’re 100;

anybody that dies young will be considered cursed.

21They’ll build houses and live in them,

plant vineyards and eat their fruit. Is 65:17-21

22They won’t build and someone else occupy them;

they won’t plant and somebody else eat the fruit.

The lifetime of my people will be like the lifetime of a tree;

my chosen ones will enjoy what they make.

23They won’t work to no end

or have children that face catastrophes;

they’ll be the offspring of people the LORD has blessed—

their descendants as well.

24Before they call, I’ll answer;

while they’re speaking, I’ll listen.

25Wolf and lamb will graze together;

a lion will eat straw like an ox,

but snakes will eat dust.

They won’t hurt anything in all my holy mountain,”

the LORD says. Is 65:22-25

Judgment and Hope

66:1The LORD says,

“Heaven is my throne; earth is my footstool;

where are you going to build me a Temple to rest in?

2I made all this;

that’s why it’s here.

But the ones I especially love

are humble with a repentant spirit

and respect what I say. Is 66:1-2

3“But for the ones who’ve chosen their own way

and delight in detestable things,

offering an ox will be like human sacrifice,

sacrificing a lamb will be like breaking a dog’s neck,

offering a grain offering will be like offering pig’s blood,

burning incense will be like blessing an idol.

4I’ll carry out their punishments

and bring on them what they dread;

because I called, but nobody answered;

I spoke, but they ignored me.

They did what I consider sinful

and chose what I don’t delight in.” Is 66:3-4

5Listen to this message from the LORD,

you that respect what he says,

“Your brothers that hate you and exclude you

because you’re loyal to me, have scoffed,

‘Honor the LORD so we can see how happy he makes you!’

But they’re the ones that will be humiliated.

6The uproar in the city and the Temple

is the LORD paying back his enemies. Is 66:5-6

7“Before she travailed, she brought forth;

before her pain came, she had a boy.

8Who ever heard of such a thing?

Who has seen anything like that?

Can a country be born in a day?

Can a nation be brought forth all at once?

But as soon as Zion’s travail began,

she brought forth her children.

9Would I bring to term and not deliver?

Would I that give delivery shut the womb?

10Be joyful over Jerusalem, you that love her;

be happy with her, you that mourn for her;

11so you can be satisfied by her consoling breasts,

nurse and be delighted by her bountiful bosom.” Is 66:7-11

12This is what the LORD says,

“I extend peace to her like a river,

the wealth of nations like an overflowing stream.

She’ll nurse you and carry you on her hip,

and play with you on her lap.

13I’ll comfort you like a mother does;

I’ll comfort you in Jerusalem.”

14When you experience it, you’ll be happy;

you’ll flourish like new grass.

The LORD’s servants will realize what he’s doing;

his enemies will experience his indignation. Is 66:12-14

15He will come in fire;

his chariots will rush in like a windstorm

to render his anger with fury,

to rebuke with flames.

16He’ll condemn by fire and sword;

the number he slays will be countless. Is 66:15-16

17“Those who ‘sanctify and purify’ themselves to enter sacred gardens with idols in the center, that eat pig meat and disgusting things like mice, will all come to their end at the same time. 18I know what they’re thinking; I can see what they’re doing. The time’s coming to gather all nations to see my glory. 19I’ll perform a sign among them and send survivors out from them to the nations—to Tarshish, Put, Lud, Meshech, Rosh, Tubal, Javan, and distant lands that have never heard of me. 20From all the countries they’ll bring me your people as a grain offering. On horses, mules, and camels; in chariots and litter wagons they’ll bring them to my holy mountain Jerusalem,” the LORD says.

66:17-20

21“1’ll make some of them priests and Levites.”

22As surely as the new earth and sky will last,

your descendants and name will endure.

23-24Every new moon and Sabbath,

all humanity will come to bow to me.

When they leave, they’ll see the corpses of those

who’ve rebelled against me.

The maggots won’t die;

the fire won’t go out.

They’ll be repulsive to everybody that sees them,” the LORD says. Is 66:21-24

JEREMIAH

1:1The Words of Jeremiah Son of Hilkiah

from the Priests at Anathoth in Benjamin

2Messages from the LORD came to him from the thirteenth year of Josiah son of Amon, king of Judah. 3They came as well during the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah, till the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah son of Josiah, king of Judah, till Jerusalem’s exile in the fifth month. Jer 1:1-3

The Call of Jeremiah

4A message from the LORD came to me:

5“I knew you before I formed you in the womb;

I set you apart before you were born

and appointed you to be a prophet to the nations.”

6I said,

“Lord GOD!

I don’t know how to speak for you;

I’m too young.”

7But the LORD told me,

“Don’t say you’re too young;

you’ll go where I send you

and say what I tell you.

8You don’t need to be afraid of them;

I’ll protect you.”

9He reached out and touched my mouth,

“I’ve put my message in you

10and appointed you over nations and kingdoms

to pull up and tear down,

to overthrow and destroy,

to build and plant.” Jer 1:4-10

11A message from the LORD came to me:

“What do you see, Jeremiah?”

“An ‘almond’ branch.”

12“Yes; I’m ‘watching,’

and I’ll certainly do what I say.”

13Another message came to me:

“What do you see?”

“A boiling pot facing this way from the north.” Jer 1:11-13

14Then he said,

“Evil is going to pour out from the north onto the people in this country. 15I’m calling the armies in the kingdoms up north. Each one will set a throne at Jerusalem’s gates, against its walls all round, against the towns in Judah. 16I’ll render judgment on this nation for leaving me and sacrificing to other gods, for worshiping what they’ve made with their own hands. 17Gird up your loins. Get up and tell them everything I’ve told you. Don’t let them intimidate you, or I’ll dishearten you in front of them. 18Today, I’m making you like a fortified city, like an iron pillar, like bronze walls against the whole land, Judah’s kings, officials, priests, and people. 19They’ll fight you, but they won’t win, because I’m with you.” Jer 1:14-19

Israel Forsakes God

2:1A Message from the LORD came to Me:

2“Go proclaim in Jerusalem that the LORD says,

‘I remember your devotion when you were young,

your love as my betrothed,

your following me in the open country

through uncultivated land.

3Israel was holy to me,

the first fruits of my harvest;

everybody that tried to eat some of it became guilty,

and disaster fell on them.’” Jer 2:1-3

4A Message from the LORD to the House of Jacob

and the Families of Israel

5The LORD says,

“What did your ancestors find wrong with me

that they left me and followed emptiness

and became empty themselves?

6They didn’t say, ‘Where’s the LORD

that brought us out of Egypt

and led us through the wilderness,

through deserts and pits,

drought and deep darkness,

through land nobody crossed,

where nobody lived?’ Jer 2:4-6

7I brought you to a productive land

to eat the good things it produced,

but you defiled it

and made my permanent possession detestable.

8The priests didn’t say, ‘Where’s the LORD?’

Those who administered the Law didn’t know me;

the rulers sinned against me;

the prophets prophesied by Baal

and followed things that didn’t profit. Jer 2:7-8

9“So I’ll contend with you and your grandsons.

10Sail to Cyprus and see;

send to Kedar and look carefully

to see if there’s anything like this!

11Has any nation ever changed gods

to what weren’t gods?

But my people have exchanged their honor

for what are worthless.

12Be appalled at that, sky;

shudder and be dismayed.

13My people have committed two sins:

they’ve left me,

the fountain of living water,

and hewed out cracked cisterns

that can’t hold water. Jer 2:9-13

14“Is Israel a slave or a home-born servant?

Why has he become prey?

15Young lions have roared at him loudly;

they’ve made his country a wasteland

and destroyed his towns without residents.

16Egyptians from Memphis and Tahpanhes

have broken the crown on his head.

17Haven’t you done this to yourself

by leaving the LORD your God,

when he was leading you along his way? Jer 2:14-17

18What are you doing on the road to Egypt

to drink the water in the Nile?

Why go to Assyria

to drink the water of the Euphrates?

19Your own sins will correct you;

your apostasies will rebuke you.

Know then that it’s sinful, a bitter thing

to leave the LORD your God;

you don’t respect me at all,” the Lord GOD of hosts says. Jer 2:18-19

20“Long ago I broke your yoke

and tore off your slave chains;

but you said, ‘I won’t serve!’

On every tall hill under every green tree,

you’ve lain down like a prostitute.

21Yet I planted you as a choice stock,

as faithful seed.

How then have you turned yourself

into the degenerate sprouts of a wild vine?

22Though you wash yourself with lye and lots of soap,

I can still see the stain from your sin,”

the Lord GOD says. Jer 2:20-22

Israel an Unfaithful Wife

23“How can you keep saying, ‘I’m not defiled;

I haven’t gone after the images of Baal’?

Look at your way in the valleys!

Acknowledge what you’ve done!

You’re a restless young camel,

pacing back and forth,

24a wild donkey accustomed to the desert,

in her heat sniffing the wind.

Who can control her?

They don’t need to waste energy looking for her;

she’ll come to them in her month.

25Don’t run after them till your feet are sore

and your throat’s dry.

But you said, ‘Don’t try to change me!

I love those foreign gods;

I’ll keep living their way.’ Jer 2:23-25

26“Like a thief embarrassed at getting caught,

the House of Israel is embarrassed—

they, their kings and officials,

priests and prophets,

27who say to a tree, ‘You’re my father,’

to a stone, ‘You’re my mother.’

They turn their backs on me;

but when trouble comes, they’ll call out,

‘Get up and save us.’

28Where are the gods you made for yourselves?

Have them save you if they can.

Judah, you have as many gods

as you have towns. Jer 2:26-28

29“Why complain to me?

You’ve all sinned against me.

30I’ve disciplined you for nothing;

you didn’t respond to it.

Your sword has killed your prophets

like a ravenous lion kills prey.

31Generation, listen to the LORD’s message.

Have I been a desert to Israel

or a land of deep darkness?

Why do my people say, ‘We’re free to roam;

we won’t come to you anymore’? Jer 2:29-31

32Can a young woman forget her jewelry,

or a bride her wedding dress?

Yet my people have forgotten me time and again.

33You scheme so well to find love!

You’ve even taught immoral women how to do it

34The blood of the innocent poor

you’ve spattered on your clothes

though you didn’t catch them breaking in;

but despite that

35you say, ‘I haven’t done anything wrong;

surely he’s not mad at me!’ Jer 2:32-35

36How lightly you gad around from one way to another;

Egypt will humble you like Assyria did.

37You’ll leave here with your hands on your head,

because the LORD has rejected the ones you depend on;

you won’t prosper by them.” Jer 2:36-37

3:1God says,

“If a husband divorces his wife

and she marries another man,

will he take her back?

Wouldn’t that pollute the land?

But you’re a prostitute with lots of lovers;

yet you turn back to me to get help.

2Look up at the barren hills;

where haven’t you committed adultery?

You sit by the roads waiting for them

like a nomad in the desert.

You pollute the land

with your sinful prostitution.

3So I’ve withheld showers;

spring rain hasn’t come;

yet you’re a brazen prostitute

that refuses to be ashamed.

4Haven’t you called out to me just now,

‘Father, you’re the friend I had when I was young’?

5‘Are you going to stay angry forever?

Are you always going to be offended?’" Jer 3:1-5

Judah Follows Unfaithful Israel

6At the time of King Josiah, the LORD said to me:

“Have you seen what unfaithful Israel has done? She’s gone up on every tall hill and carried on her prostitution under every green tree. 7I thought that after she’d done that, she’d come back to me.
