I’ll let them judge you by their customs, 25and I’ll direct my jealousy against you in anger. They’ll cut off your nose and ears, and any survivors will fall by the sword. They’ll capture your children and burn your survivors. 26They’ll strip off your clothes and take your beautiful jewels. 27That’s how I’ll stop your lewdness and prostitution with Egypt so you won’t look up to it or remember it anymore. 28I’ll turn you over to the ones you despise, people you’re alienated from. 29They’ll deal with you in hate, take your property, and leave you naked. 30Your lewdness and prostitution will be exposed. 31You’ve followed your sister’s ways; so I’ll give you her cup to drink.’ Ezek 23:22-31

32“The Lord GOD says,

‘You’ll drink your sister’s cup,

which is deep and wide.

You’ll be laughed at and ridiculed

because it holds a lot.

33You’ll be filled with drunkenness and distress:

the cup of horror and desolation,

the cup of your sister Samaria.

34You’ll drink it and drain it.

Then you’ll dash it to pieces

and beat your breasts.

I’ve said so.

35Because you’ve thrown me away and forgotten me, take the punishment for your lewdness and prostitution.’” Ezek 23:32-35

God’s Judgment on Both Sisters

36The LORD said:

“Son of man, will you willing to judge Oholah and Oholibah? Then remind them of their detestable acts. 37Say,

‘You’ve committed adultery and murder—

adultery by worshiping your idols,

murder by burning your children as food for them—

children you bore to me.

38You’ve defiled my sanctuary

and profaned my Sabbaths.

39The very day you killed your children for your idols,

you went into my sanctuary to worship—my Temple!

40“You sisters” even sent messengers

to bring men from a long way off.

You took baths,

put on eyeshadow and fine jewelry,

41and sat down on a splendid couch

by a table where you’d put my oil and incense.

42The sound of debauchery surrounded you,

and common drunks were brought in from the wilderness.

They put bracelets on your wrists

and beautiful crowns on your heads. Ezek 23:36-42

43Then I said about you women

that were worn out from committing adulteries,

“Will these guys commit adultery

with women in that condition?!”

44But they slept with you like prostitutes,

Oholah and Oholibah, lewd women.

45But good men will condemn you

for your adultery and murder.’

46“The Lord GOD says,

‘Bring an army against them;

turn them over to terror and plunder:

47stone them,

cut them down with swords,

kill their children,

burn their houses.

48That’s how I’ll stop lewdness in the land.

Warn every woman not to do like “the sisters” have done,

49“Your lewdness will come back on you

as the penalty for worshiping idols.

That way you’ll know I’m the Lord GOD.’” Ezek 23:43-49

The Cooking Pot

24:1The tenth day, tenth month, ninth year, a message from the LORD came to me:

2“Son of man, write down the date. Today the king of Babylon laid siege to Jerusalem. 3Tell the rebellious people a parable, ‘The Lord GOD says,

“Put a pot on and pour water in it;

4put good pieces of meat in it,

thigh and shoulder;

fill it with choice bones.

5Take the best of the flock

and put wood under the pot.

Boil it hard;

seethe the bones with the meat.” Ezek 24:1-5

6‘The Lord GOD says,

“Misfortune awaits the bloody city;

it awaits the rusty pot!

Take out piece after piece

without choosing which ones.

7The blood she shed is in her;

she put it on a bare rock;

she didn’t pour it on the ground

and cover it with dirt.

8To cause anger to rise up

and take revenge,

I’ve put her blood on a bare rock

so it won’t be covered.” Ezek 24:6-8

9‘So the Lord GOD says,

“Misfortune awaits the bloody city!

I’ll make it a big pile.

10Pile on the wood, kindle the fire,

boil the meat well,

mix in the spices,

burn the bones.

11Then set it empty on the coals

to get it hot

so its bronze will glow,

its dross will dissolve,

and its rust will burn off.

12I’ve worked hard for nothing,

because its extreme rust isn’t gone;

let it rust in the fire! Ezek 24:9-12

13In your filthiness is lewdness;

I wanted to clean you up,

but you didn’t want to be clean.

You won’t be clean from your filthiness

till I’ve spent my anger on you.

14I, the LORD, have said it; it’s coming, I’ll do it. I won’t hold back. I won’t pity or be sorry. I’ll judge you according to your ways and deeds.”’” Ezek 24:13-14

Ezekiel’s Wife Dies

15A message from the LORD came to me:

16“Son of man, I’m about to take away the delight of your eyes in one stroke, but don’t mourn or cry or shed tears. 17Groan silently; don’t perform ritual mourning for the dead. Wrap your turban on, put your shoes on, don’t cover your mouth in sorrow, or eat the bread of mourning.” Ezek 24:15-17

18I told the people about it in the morning; that evening my wife died. The next morning, I did what God told me.

19The people said, “Won’t you tell us what you’re doing means for us?”

20I told them,

“A message from the LORD came to me, 21‘Tell Israel, “I’m about to profane my sanctuary, the pride of your power, the delight of your eyes and soul. The children you’ve left behind will fall by the sword. 22Do what I’ve done. Don’t cover your mouth in sorrow or eat the bread of mourning. 23Put your turbans on your heads and your shoes on your feet. Don’t mourn or weep, but pine away in your sins and groan to one another. 24Follow Ezekiel’s example. When it comes, you’ll know I’m the Lord GOD.”’ Ezek 24:18-24

25“Son of man, won’t that be when I take their fortresses away from them, their pride and joy, the delight of their eyes, their heart’s desire, their children—26when somebody escapes and comes to you with the news? 27Then you can speak to the one that escaped. You’ll be a sign to them. They’ll know I’m the LORD.”

Ezek 24:25-27

A Message for Ammon

25:1A message from the LORD came to me:

2“Face the Ammonites and prophesy against them, 3‘Because you said, “Ha!” at my sanctuary when it was profaned, and at Israel when it became a wasteland, and at Judah when they went into exile, 4I’m going to turn you over to the people from the east. They’ll set up their camps among you and live there, eat your fruit and drink your milk. 5I’ll turn Rabbah into a pasture for camels and the Ammonites a resting place for flocks. 6Because you clapped your hands and stamped your feet and celebrated with scorn at Israel, 7I’ll give you to the nations for spoil, cut you off from the peoples, and make you perish from the land so you’ll know I’m the LORD.’ Ezek 25:1-7

A Message for Moab

8“The Lord GOD says, ‘Because Moab and Seir consider Judah like any other nation, 9I’m going to take away Moab its frontier towns, the pride of its land: Beth-jeshimoth, Baal-meon, and Kiriathaim. 10I’ll give it and the Ammonites to the people from the east and the Ammonites will pass from memory. 11I’ll carry out judgments on Moab. They’ll know I’m the LORD.’”

12“The Lord GOD says, ‘Edom has taken revenge on Judah and incurred grievous guilt, 13so I’ll slay its people and animals and lay it waste. They’ll fall by the sword from Teman to Dedan. 14I’ll take revenge on Edom by my people Israel. They’ll act in Edom according to my anger; so they’ll know my payback.’

A Message for Philistia

15“The Lord GOD says, ‘The Philistines have acted in scornful revenge to destroy with everlasting enmity. 16So I’ll slay the Cherethites and destroy the remnant along the coast. 17I’ll carry out severe vengeance with angry rebukes. They’ll know I’m the LORD.’” Ezek 25:8-17

A Message for Tyre

26:1The first day of the month, eleventh year, a message from the LORD came to me:

2“Son of man, Tyre has said about Jerusalem, ‘Ha! its gate’s broken; it has swung open to me. I’ll be filled now that it’s laid waste.’ 3But the Lord GOD says, ‘I’ll bring nations against you, Tyre, like waves in the sea. 4They’ll destroy your walls and tear down your towers. I’ll scrape away the rubble and make you a bare rock, 5a place for spreading nets by the sea. I’ve spoken: you’ll become spoil for the nations, 6and your inhabitants on the mainland will die by the sword. You’ll know I’m the LORD.’” Ezek 26:1-6

7“From the north I’ll bring Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, king of kings, with horses, chariots, cavalry, and an enormous army. 8He’ll slay your inhabitants on the mainland with the sword, build siege walls, put up a mound and a roof of shields against you. 9He’ll aim his battering rams at your walls and tear down your towers with his axes. 10The huge number of his horses will cover you with dust; your walls will shake from his cavalry, wagons, and chariots when they pour through your gates like men overwhelming a breached city. 11He’ll trample your streets with his horses and slay your people with the sword. He’ll tear down your strong pillars, 12make spoil out of your wealth, and plunder your merchandise. He’ll tear down your walls, destroy your beautiful houses, and throw your stones, timber, and rubble into the sea. 13So I’ll silence your songs and harps. 14You’ll be a bare rock, a place to spread nets. You won’t rebuild; I’ve said so.” Ezek 26:7-14

15“The Lord GOD says to Tyre, ‘Won’t the whole coastland quake at the sound of your fall when the wounded groan and the slaughter is taking place in you? 16Then the rulers of the sea will step down from their thrones, remove their robes, strip off their embroidered clothes, and dress themselves with cringing. They’ll sit on the ground, shaking every moment, appalled at you. 17They’ll chant a dirge for you,

“How you’ve disappeared from the seas, renowned city!

You and your residents were powerful seafarers

that imposed fear on people everywhere!

18The islands trembled the day you fell.

Yes, the islands in the sea

were distressed at your passing.”’” Ezek 26:15-18

19The Lord says GOD, “When I make you a desolate city, like towns with no residents, when I wash the deep up over you and big rivers flood you, 20then I’ll take you down to the Pit to the people of old and make you live in the lower parts of the earth, like the ancient waste places. So people won’t live in you, but I’ll set glory among the living. 21I’ll bring terror on you, and you won’t exist anymore. Though people look for you, they’ll never find you.” Ezek 26:19-21

A Lament for Tyre

27:1A message from the LORD came to me:

2“Son of man, sing a funeral song for Tyre 3that sits at the port to the sea, the nations’ merchant to many ports, The Lord GOD says,

‘Tyre, you’ve said “I’m perfectly beautiful.”

4Your borders extend into the heart of the sea;

your builders have perfected your beauty.

5They’ve made your planks out of fir trees from Seir;

they’ve taken a cedar from Lebanon to make a mast for you.

6They shaped your oars out of oaks from Bashan;

with ivory they’ve inlaid your deck with boxwood from Cyprus.

7Your sail was made out of fine embroidered linen from Egypt;

it became your identifying mark.

Your awning was blue and purple from the coasts of Elishah.

8The residents of Sidon and Arvad rowed for you;

your wise men, Tyre, were on board as your navigators.

9The elders of Gebal and its skilled men caulked your seams.

All the ships in the sea and their sailors were with you,

dealing in your merchandise.’ Ezek 27:1-9

10“Persia, Lud, and Put were soldiers in your army. They hung their shields and helmets on your walls and set forth your splendor. 11Men from Arvad and your army stood all around on your walls, and brave soldiers were in your towers. Their shields hung on your walls and completed your beauty. Ezek 27:10-11

12“Tarshish was your customer because you had such a store of all kinds of wealth; they bought your merchandise with silver, iron, tin, and lead. 13Javan, Tubal, and Meshech traded with you; they bought your merchandise with men’s lives and bronze containers. 14Beth-togarmah gave horses, war horses, and mules for your wares. 15Dedan traded with you. Distant lands served as your markets; they paid with ivory tusks and ebony. 16Syria was your customer because you had an abundance of goods; they bought your wares with emeralds, purple, embroidered work, fine linen, coral, and rubies. 17Judah and Israel traded with you; they bought your merchandise with wheat from Minnith, cakes, honey, olive oil, and salve. 18Damascus was your customer because you had an abundance of goods, an abundance of all kinds of wealth, and because of the wine from Helbon and white wool. 19Vedan and Javan paid for your casks of wine from Izal with wrought iron, cassia, and sweet cane. 20Dedan traded with you in saddlecloths for riding. 21Arabia and the princes of Kedar traded with you; 22they paid with gold, precious stones, and the finest spices. 23Haran, Canneh, Eden, the traders of Sheba, Asshur, and Chilmad traded with you 24for choice garments, clothes made out of blue and embroidered work, carpets of many colors and in tightly wound cords. Ezek 27:12-24

25The ships of Tarshish carried your wares.

You were full and quite magnificent

in the heart of the seas.

26“Your rowers have taken you

onto stormy high seas;

the east wind has capsized you

in the middle of the sea.

27Your wealth, your wares and your merchandise,

your sailors and captains,

ship builders and merchants,

all the soldiers and everyone on board—

sinks into the sea.

28At the outcry of your terrified captains,

the countryside shakes. Ezek 27:25-28

29The ones that row, the captains of the sea,

abandon ship and stand on shore.

30They wail over you

and cry bitterly.

They throw dust on their heads

and wallow in ashes.

31They shave their heads for you

and put on burlap.

They weep bitterly for you. Ezek 27:29-31

32As they wail, they take up

a funeral song for you:

‘Who is like Tyre

that’s silent at the bottom of the sea?

33When your wares came from the sea,

you satisfied many nations.

With your great wealth and merchandise,

you enriched kings everywhere. Ezek 27:32-33

34Now the sea has wrecked you

in open water;

your merchandise and crew

have sunk with you.

35The people that live along the coasts

are appalled at what’s happened to you.

Their kings are horribly afraid;

their countenance has fallen.

36The merchants among the nations gasp at you;

you’ve come to a horrible end

and won’t exist anymore.’” Ezek 27:34-36

A Message for Tyre’s King

28:1A message from the LORD came to me again:

2“Son of man, tell the leader of Tyre, ‘The Lord GOD says,

“You’re arrogant; you’ve said,

‘I’m a god; I sit in God’s seat

in the heart of the sea.’

But you’re a mortal, not God,

though you vaunt yourself up as if you were God.

(3You think you’re wiser than Daniel,

that no secret is a match for you.

4By your wisdom and intelligence,

you’ve become rich

and gained gold and silver for your treasuries. Ezek 28:1-4

5By your great wisdom and trade,

you’ve increased your wealth,

and you’re arrogant because of it.)”

6‘So the Lord GOD says,

“Because you’ve exalted yourself as if you were God,

7I’ll bring foreigners on you,

the most ruthless of nations.

They’ll draw their swords

against the beauty of your wisdom

and defile your splendor.

8They’ll bring you down to the Pit,

and you’ll die like those killed

in the middle of the sea. Ezek 28:5-8

9Will you still say, ‘I’m a god,’

in the presence of your slayer?

Though you’re a mortal, not God,

will you still say, ‘I’m a god,’

in the hands of the ones who mortally wound you?

10You’ll die the death of the uncircumcised

by the hand of foreigners.

I’ve said so!”’” Ezek 28:9-10

11A message from the LORD came to me:

12“Son of man, chant a dirge for the king of Tyre.

Tell him, ‘The Lord GOD says,

“You had the seal of perfection,

wise and perfectly beautiful.

13You were in Eden, God’s orchard.

You wore every precious stone:

rubies, topaz, diamonds,

beryl, onyx, and jasper

lapis lazuli, turquoise, emeralds.

There was gold workmanship

for your settings and engravings.

They were prepared the day you were created.

14I placed an anointed cherub to guard you;

you were on God’s holy mountain

and walked among the burning stones. Ezek 28:11-14

15You were blameless in your ways

from the time you were created

till sin became obvious in you.

16By the abundance of your trade,

you became violent and sinned.

So I’ve thrown you as profane

from God’s mountain.

I’ve destroyed you, guardian cherub,

from among the burning stones.

17You became proud of your beauty

and corrupted your wisdom because of your splendor.

I threw you on the ground;

I put you in front of kings

so they could see you. Ezek 28:15-17

18By the great number of your sins

committed in your trading,

you profaned your sanctuaries.

So I’ve brought fire out of you,

and it burned you up.

I’ve turned you to ashes in the world

in front of everybody that sees you.

19Everybody that knows you

is appalled at what’s happened to you.

You’ve panicked

and won’t exist anymore.”’” Ezek 28:18-19

A Message for Sidon

20A message from the LORD came to me:

21“Son of man, face Sidon and prophesy against it.

22‘The Lord GOD says,

“I’m against you, Sidon,

and I’ll be honored by what I do to you.

They’ll know I’m the LORD,

when I carry out judgments on you;

I’ll demonstrate my holiness by what I do to you.

23I’ve sent disease to you

and blood in your streets.

The wounded will fall in you

by the sword everywhere.

You’ll know I’m the LORD. Ezek 28:20-23

24“For Israel there won’t any longer be a briar to prick or a thorn to hurt them from any that scorn them. They’ll know I’m the Lord GOD.”

25‘The Lord GOD says, “When I gather Israel back from the nations where they’re scattered and demonstrate my holiness in them in front of the nations, then they’ll live in the land I’ve given Jacob. 26They’ll live in it securely, build houses, and plant vineyards. I’ll carry out judgment on everybody that scorns them. They’ll know I’m the LORD their God.”’” Ezek 28:24-26

A Message for Egypt

29:1The twelfth day, tenth month, tenth year, a message from the LORD came to me:

2“Son of man, turn toward Pharaoh, Egypt’s king, and prophesy against him and Egypt. 3Say,’The Lord GOD says,

“I’m against you, Pharaoh, Egypt’s king,

you big crocodile that lies in your streams,

that has said, ‘My Nile belongs to me; I made it.’

4I’ll put hooks in your jaws

and make the fish in your streams cling to your scales.

I’ll drag you out on the shore

with fish clinging to your scales. Ezek 29:1-4

5I’ll abandon you to the wilderness,

you and the fish in your streams.

You’ll fall in the open field

and not be buried.

I’ll make you food for scavengers on the ground

and buzzards from the sky.

6Then you residents in Egypt will know I’m the LORD,

because to Israel you were only a staff made out of reeds.

7When he took hold of you,

you cut his hands;

when he leaned on you,

you broke and his loins buckled. Ezek 29:5-7

8‘So the Lord GOD says, “I’m going to bring a sword against you, and slay people and animals. 9Because you said, ‘The Nile belongs to me, I made it,’ 10I’m against you and your streams. Egypt will become a wasteland from Migdol to Syene to the border of Nubia. 11People and animals won’t travel through it; nobody will live there for 40 years. 12So I’ll make Egypt desolate among desolate lands and its cities desolate among desolate cities for 40 years. I’ll scatter the Egyptians among the nations.

13‘The Lord GOD says, “After 40 years, I’ll gather the Egyptians back from where they’ve scattered. 14I’ll return their fortunes and make them go back to the land of Pathros and become a minor kingdom there. 15Egypt will be low among the kingdoms and never again raise itself above them. I’ll make it too small for that. 16Israel will never rely on it again. They’ll be reminded of their sin in going back to Egypt. They’ll know I’m the Lord GOD.”’ Ezek 29:8-16

17The first day, first month, twenty-seventh year, a message from the LORD came to me:

18“Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, made his army struggle hard against Tyre. Every head became bald, and every shoulder was rubbed raw. But he and his army didn’t get enough from Tyre to pay for the struggle. 19So I’ll give him Egypt so he can carry off its wealth, capture its spoil, and seize its plunder to pay his army. 20I’ve given him Egypt for his struggle because he acted on my behalf. 21At that time, I’ll make a horn sprout for Israel and open your mouth among them. They’ll know I’m the LORD.” Ezek 29:17-21

A Lament for Egypt

30:1A message from the LORD came to me again:

2“Son of man, prophesy, ‘The Lord GOD says,

“Wail, ‘Oh for the day!’

3The day of the LORD is near,

a cloudy day of doom for the nations.

4A sword will come at Egypt;

there’ll be anguish in Nubia

when the slain fall in Egypt.

They’ll carry away its wealth

and tear up its foundations.

5Nubia, Put, Lud, Arabia, Libya, and the people of any land allied with them will fall by the sword with them. Ezek 30:1-5

6’The LORD says:

“Those who support Egypt will fall;

its proud power will collapse.

From Migdol to Syene

they’ll fall by the sword.

7They’ll be desolate among desolate lands;

its cities will lie desolate among devastated cities.

8They’ll know I’m the LORD

when I set Egypt on fire

and break down its helpers.

9At that time, I’ll send ambassadors in ships

to terrify secure Nubia;

anguish will come down on them as at Egypt’s doom.

It’s coming!”

10‘The Lord GOD says,

“By Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon,

I’ll put an end to Egypt’s wealth. Ezek 30:6-10

11Him and his people, the most ruthless of the nations,

I’ll bring in to destroy the land.

They’ll draw their swords against it

and fill the country with the slain.

12I’ll dry up the Nile’s canals

and sell the land to evil men.

I’ll use foreigners to make the land desolate

and everything that’s in it,

I the LORD have said it. Ezek 30:11-12

13‘The Lord GOD says,

“I’ll destroy the idols

and make images cease in Memphis.

There won’t be a prince in Egypt anymore;

I’ll put fear in Egypt.

14I’ll make Pathros desolate,

set fire to Zoan,

and carry out judgment on Thebes.

15I’ll pour out my anger on Sin, Egypt’s fortress;

I’ll slay the population in Thebes,

16I’ll set Egypt on fire.

Sin will writhe in anguish;

Thebes will be breached;

Memphis will endure daily distress. Ezek 30:13-16

17The young men of On and Pi-beseth

will fall by the sword;

the women will go into captivity.

18It will be a dark day in Tehaphnehes

when I break the yoke bars of Egypt there.

The pride in its power will be gone;

a cloud will cover it,

and Egypt’s inhabitants will go into captivity.

19So I’ll carry out judgments on Egypt,

and they’ll know I’m the LORD.”’” Ezek 30:17-19

20The seventh day, first month, eleventh year, a message from the LORD came to me:

21“Son of man, I’ve broken the arm of Pharaoh, Egypt’s king. It hasn’t been put in a sling to mend or wrapped with a bandage to get strong enough to hold a sword.’ 22So the Lord GOD says, ‘I’ll break both of his arms, the good arm and the broken one, and make the sword fall from his hand. 23I’ll scatter the Egyptians among the nations. 24I’ll strengthen the king of Babylon and put my sword in his hand. Pharaoh will groan from his wounds. 25I’ll strengthen the king of Babylon’s arms, but Pharaoh’s arms will fall. When the king of Babylon holds out his sword against Egypt 26and I scatter the Egyptians among the nations, they’ll know I’m the LORD.”’” Ezek 30:20-26

A Cedar in Lebanon

31:1The first day, third month, eleventh year, a message from the LORD came to me:

2“Son of man, tell Pharaoh and his large host,

‘Who is as great as you?

3Assyria was a cedar in Lebanon

with beautiful branches and forest shade

and its top in the clouds.

4The water made it grow, the underground water made it tall;

rivers continually flowed where it was planted;

it sent out its channels to all the trees.

5So it was taller than any other tree.

It grew lots of long branches

because it had plenty of water;

it spread them out. Ezek 31:1-5

6Birds nested in it;

animals from the countryside gave birth under it;

all the nations lived in its shade.

7So it was beautiful in its size and the length of its branches

because its roots went down to abundant water.

8The cedars in God’s forest couldn’t match it;

the cypress couldn’t compare with its branches;

the trees in the plane couldn’t equal its limbs.

No tree in God’s forest could compare with its beauty.

9I made it beautiful with its many big branches;

all the trees in Eden, which were in God’s orchard,

were jealous of it. Ezek 31:6-9

10‘So the Lord GOD says, “Because it was tall with its top in the clouds and was proud of its height, 11I’ll give it to a despot to deal with according to the sinfulness it deserves. 12Foreign tyrants will cut it down and leave its limbs on the mountains and in the valleys. They’ll lie piled up in the ravines. Everybody on earth will leave its shade. 13Birds will live on its remains, and animals will be on its fallen branches. 14None of the trees beside water will grow tall and set their tops in the clouds or their terebinth trees stand tall in their height. They’ll die, given over to the underworld among mortals.” Ezek 31:10-14

15‘The Lord GOD says, “When it goes down to Sheol, I’ll chant dirges, close the deep over it, and hold back its many streams. I’ll cover Lebanon with gloom for it, and the trees will wither away because of it. 16The nations will shake from the sound of its fall when I send it down to the Pit. The well-watered trees of Eden, Lebanon’s best, will find comfort in the nether world. 17They’ll go down with it to those slain by the sword, who were its strength and lived under its shade among the nations. 18Which of Eden’s trees equals you in size and beauty? Yet you’ll go down with Eden’s trees to the underworld and lie among the uncircumcised, slain by the sword. That’s the way it will be with Pharaoh and his large army!”’ Ezek 31:15-18

A Lament for Pharaoh

32:1The first day, twelfth month, twelfth year, a message from the LORD came to me:

2“Son of man, chant a dirge for Pharaoh, Egypt’s king. Tell him,

‘You consider yourself a young lion among the nations,

but you’re like a sea monster in the ocean.

You splash around in your rivers,

stir up the water with your feet,

and muddy the rivers.’”

3The Lord GOD says,

“I’ll cast my net over you

along with a host of nations

and haul you up from the water.

4I’ll dash you to the ground,

toss you out in an open field,

let the birds light on you,

and have the animals gorge on you. Ezek 32:1-4

5I’ll scatter your bodies on the mountains

and fill the valleys with your carcasses.

6The land will soak up your blood

all the way to the mountains;

I’ll fill the ravines with you.

7When I blot you out,

I’ll veil the sky, darken the stars,

and cover the sun with a cloud;

the moon won’t shine.

8I’ll darken the lights in the sky above you

and cover your land in darkness. Ezek 32:5-8

9I’ll trouble many nations when I take you captive among them to lands you haven’t known. 10They’ll be appalled at what’s happened to you. Because of you, their kings will be horribly afraid when I brandish my sword at them. When you fall, they’ll shudder every minute for their own life.” Ezek 32:9-10

11The Lord GOD says,

“The sword of Babylon’s king will come on you. 12I’ll make your large army fall by the swords of powerful men, all of them tyrants over nations.

They’ll crush Egypt’s pride

and destroy its army.

13I’ll destroy its livestock from beside the waterways;

nobody’s foot or animal’s hoof

will muddy them anymore.

14I’ll make their waterways soak up the water

and make their streams flow like olive oil.”

15When I make Egypt desolate

and the land lacking in what filled it,

when I strike everybody that lives there,

they’ll know I’m the LORD.

16That’s the dirge the nations will chant over Egypt and its army.” Ezek 32:11-16

17The fifteenth day, first month, twelfth year, a message from the LORD came to me:

18“Son of man, wail for Egypt’s army. Along with the powerful nations, take it down to the nether world with those who go down to the Pit.

19‘Who are you more beautiful than?

Go make your bed with the uncircumcised.’

20They’ll fall among those slain by the sword. Egypt will be delivered to the sword; they’ll take it and its army away. 21Out of Sheol the strong among the powerful will talk about Egypt and its allies. ‘The uncircumcised have gone down, they lie still, slain by the sword.’ Ezek 32:17-21

22“Assyria is there with all its company, all slain by the sword. 23They who had spread terror among the living lie in the most remote parts of the Pit,

24“Elam is there with its army around its grave, all of them fallen by the sword. They who had spread terror among the living bore their disgrace with the ones they sent down to the Pit. 25They’ve made a bed for Elam among the slain—all uncircumcised.

26“Meshech, Tubal, and their armies are there, their graves around them, all slain by the sword, uncircumcised, though they’d spread terror among the living. 27They don’t lie beside the fallen heroes of old, the uncircumcised who went down to Sheol with their weapons, whose swords were laid under their heads, whose shields rested on their skeletons. Though the living once feared them, 28they’ll be broken among the uncircumcised and lie with the ones they’d slain. Ezek 32:22-28

29“Edom is there, its kings and princes, who, despite their power, lie among the uncircumcised, slain by the sword with those who go down to the Pit.

30“All the chiefs from the north are there too, and all the Sidonians, who, for the terror resulting from their power, went down in disgrace with the ones they’d slain. They lie uncircumcised with those slain by the sword and bear their disgrace with those who go down to the Pit.”

31The Lord GOD says, “Pharaoh will see them and be comforted for his army slain. 32Though I had spread the fear of him among the living, he and his army will lie among the uncircumcised, slain by the sword.” Ezek 32:29-32

Ezekiel Is Israel’s Watchman

33:1A message from the LORD came to me:

2“Tell your people, ‘If I bring the sword on a country, and the people’s watchman 3blows the ram’s horn to warn them—4then those who don’t pay attention are responsible for their own death. 5If they’d taken warning, they would’ve saved their life. 6If the watchman sees the sword coming and doesn’t warn the people, if the sword takes some people, they’ll be taken away in their sin, but I’ll hold the watchman responsible for it.’

7“Son of man, I’ve made you a watchman for Israel so you’ll hear a message from me to warn them. 8When I tell sinful people they’re going to die, but you don’t warn them, they’ll die in their sin, but I’ll hold you responsible for it. 9But if you warn them and they don’t turn from your way, they’ll die in their sin, but you’ve saved your life. Ezek 33:1-9

10“Now, son of man, tell Israel, ‘You’ve said, “Our sins are on us and we’re rotting away in them. How can we survive?”’ 11Tell them, ‘As I live,’ the Lord GOD says, ‘I don’t get any satisfaction out of seeing sinful people die. I want them to turn from their way and live. Turn back from your sinful way! Why die, Israel?’ 12Son of man, tell your fellow citizens, ‘People’s goodness won’t deliver them when they sin. People’s sinfulness won’t prevent them from living when they quit doing it. Good people can’t have life from goodness when they practice sin. 13When I say to good people they’ll surely live and they presume on their goodness and keep sinning, I won’t consider their good deeds; they’ll die in that sin. 14But when I say to sinful people, ‘You’ll surely die,’ and they quit sinning—15if they return a pledge, repay what they stole, follow the statutes that give life and don’t sin—they’ll surely live. 16I won’t hold their past sins against them. They’re doing good; they’ll live. Ezek 33:10-16

17“Yet your people say, ‘The Lord’s way is not right,’ when it’s their own way that’s not right. 18When good people turn from their goodness, they’ll die because now they’re practicing sin. 19When sinful people turn from their sinfulness, they’ll live because they’re practicing goodness. 20Yet you say, ‘The Lord’s way is not right.’ House of Israel, I’ll judge each of you by your own ways.” Ezek 33:17-20

Israel’s Fall Explained

21The fifth day, tenth month, twelfth year of our exile, refugees from Jerusalem arrived to tell me the city had fallen. 22The LORD’s hand had been heavy on me the evening before. When they came the next morning, he made me able to talk again.

23A message from him came to me:

24“Son of man, those who live in Israel’s waste places are saying, ‘Abraham was only one, yet he possessed the land. So to us who are many the land has been given as a possession.’ 25Tell them the Lord GOD says, ‘You eat meat with blood in it and look up to your idols as you shed innocent blood. Should you have the land? 26You rely on your sword, you commit disgusting deeds, you defile your neighbor’s wife. Should you have the land? 27As I live, those who live in the waste places will fall by the sword. Whoever is in the open country wild animals will kill. The ones in strongholds and caves will die from disease. 28I’ll make the land desolate; pride about its power will stop. Israel’s mountains will be so desolate nobody can get through them. 29They’ll know I’m the LORD when I make the land desolate because of their disgusting deeds.’ Ezek 33:21-29

30“Son of man, your fellow citizens talk about you by the walls and in their doorways, ‘Come on, let’s hear a message from the LORD.’ 31They come and sit with you like my people, but they do the lustful things they talk about and set their hearts on making money. 32As far as they’re concerned, you’re someone with a beautiful voice that plays an instrument well and sings love songs. They hear what you’re saying, but they don’t do it. 33So when what you say does happen—as it surely will—they’ll know a prophet was among them.” Ezek 33:30-33

Prophecy Against Israel’s Shepherds

34:1A message from the LORD came to me:

2“Son of man, prophesy against Israel’s shepherds. ‘The Lord GOD says, “Misfortune awaits you, shepherds that feed yourselves! Shouldn’t shepherds feed the flock? 3You eat the healthy and dress with their wool. You slaughter the healthy sheep without feeding the flock. 4You don’t strengthen the sickly, heal the diseased, bandage up the crippled, bring back the scattered, or look for the lost. With force and severity, you bully them. 5They’re scattered all over the world because they didn’t have a shepherd; they became prey for wild animals. 6My flock wandered around in the mountains and tall hills; nobody looked for them.

Ezek 34:1-6

7‘So, shepherds, listen to the LORD: [8-9] 10“Give me my sheep. You’re fired. I’ll protect my flock so you can’t eat them anymore.”’”

11The Lord GOD says, “I’ll look for my sheep myself. 12Like a shepherd does when he’s among them, I’ll bring them back from where they scattered on a cloudy, gloomy day. 13-14I’ll gather them from other countries, feed them on good pasture, and graze them on Israel’s high mountains, by its streams, in populated places. 15I’ll lead my flock to rest, 16bandage up the crippled, doctor the sick, watch over the healthy and strong. I’ll feed them with justice.” Ezek 34:7-16

17The Lord GOD says, “My flock, I’ll decide between one sheep and another, between rams and billy goats. 18Do you care so little about feeding on good pasture that you tramp it down? Do you care so little about drinking clean water that you muddy it up with your hooves? 19My flock has to eat what you tramp down and drink what you muddy up!”

20So the Lord GOD says, “I’ll decide between healthy sheep and sickly ones. 21You butt and shove with your shoulder and gouge the weak with your horns till you drive them off. 22I’ll protect my flock so they won’t be prey anymore, and judge one sheep from another. 23I’ll set one shepherd over them, my servant David; he’ll feed them. 24I’ll be their God; he’ll be their prince. I’ve said so. Ezek 34:17-24

25“I’ll make a peace treaty with them and get rid of dangerous animals so they can be safe in the countryside and sleep in the woods. 26I’ll make them and the places around my mountain a blessing. It will rain when it’s supposed to—showers of blessing. 27The trees in the orchard will bear their fruit; the ground will grow its crops. They’ll know I’m the LORD when I’ve broken the bars of their yoke and delivered them from those who enslave them. 28They won’t be prey for other nations anymore, and the animals in the world won’t devour them. Nobody will make them afraid. 29Their land will be famous for growing crops, and they won’t be victims of famine or have to put up with insults from other nations. 30They’ll know that I, the LORD their God, am with them, and they’re Israel, my people. 31My ‘sheep’ in my pasture, you’re my people and I’m your God,”

the Lord GOD says. Ezek 34:25-31

Prophecy Against Mount Seir

35:1A message from the Lord came to me:

2“Son of man, face Mount Seir and prophesy against it, 3‘The Lord GOD says,

“I’m against you, Mount Seir;

I’ll make you a wasteland.

4I’ll lay your towns waste,

and you’ll be desolate.

You’ll know I’m the LORD.

5In your endless enmity, you delivered Israel to the sword at the time of its catastrophe, its final punishment. 6So as I live, I’ll deliver you to bloodshed. Since you haven’t despised bloodshed, it’ll pursue you. 7I’ll make Mount Seir a waste and slay everyone that tries to escape or return there. 8I’ll fill its mountains with the dead. They’ll fall in its hills, valleys, and ravines. 9I’ll make it a permanent wasteland and its towns uninhabited. It will know I’m the LORD. Ezek 35:1-9

10“Mount Seir has said, ‘I’m going to take over those two lands and make them mine’—though the LORD was there. 11So as I live,” the Lord GOD says, “I’ll deal with you in proportion to the anger, envy, and hate you’ve shown them. I’ll make myself known among them when I condemn you. 12You’ll know that I’ve heard your contempt for the mountains in Israel, ‘They’re desolate; they’ve been given to us to devour.’ 13I’ve heard you speak arrogantly against me over and over. 14While the whole world celebrates, I’ll make you desolate. 15As you celebrated Israel’s desolation, you’ll be desolate, Mount Seir and all Edom. You’ll know I’m the LORD.” Ezek 35:10-15

Prophecy to the Mountains of Israel

36:1“Son of man, prophesy to the mountains of Israel, ‘Listen to 2what the Lord GOD says, “Your enemy has ridiculed you, ‘Ha!’ and ‘The everlasting mountains are ours now!’” 3So prophesy, ‘For good reason other nations made you desolate and crushed you from every direction, took possession of you, and mocked and whispered.’” 4So, mountains of Israel, listen to the message from the Lord GOD to the mountains and hills, ravines and valleys, desolate wastes and abandoned towns that have become prey and objects of derision. 5In my burning jealousy, I’ve spoken against those nations, particularly Edom that took over my land with wholehearted joy and scornful attitude. I’ve sworn to drive it out to become prey. 6So prophesy to Israel’s mountains and hills, ravines and valleys, ‘I’ve spoken in my anger because you’ve had to endure the insults from other nations. 7I swear they will endure insults.’” Ezek 36:1-7

8“But you, mountains of Israel, will grow branches and bear fruit for my people because they’ll be coming back soon. 9I’ll return to you, and you’ll be cultivated and planted. 10People will multiply in Israel to live in the towns and rebuild the places in ruins. 11People and animals will reproduce in you. I’ll make you lived-in like before and treat you better than at first. So you’ll know I’m the LORD. 12My people carry on their lives in you and own you. You’ll become their inheritance and never again bereave them of children.” 13The Lord GOD says, “Other nations tell you, ‘You’ve devoured your people and bereaved them of children,’ 14but you won’t do that anymore. 15I won’t let you listen to their insults anymore. You won’t make your nation stumble anymore.” Ezek 36:8-15

16A message from the LORD came to me:

17“Son of man, when Israel was living in their own land, they defiled it with their ways and deeds. Their way was unclean like a woman in her period. 18So I poured out my anger on them for the blood they’d shed, because they’d defiled the land with their idols. 19I scattered them among the nations and judged them by their ways and deeds. 20When they got to those nations, they profaned my holy name, because people said, ‘These are the LORD’s people; yet they’ve come out of his land.’ 21I was concerned about my holy name that they’d profaned among the nations.

22“So, tell Israel, ‘It’s not so much for your sake that I’m about to act; it’s in regard to my holy name that you’ve profaned where you’ve gone. 23I’ll vindicate the holiness of my great name. Then the nations will know I’m the LORD.” Ezek 36:16-23

24“I’ll bring you back from the nations, 25sprinkle clean water on you to cleanse you from your filthiness and idols, 2and give you a new heart and spirit. I’ll take out your stone heart and give you a physical one, 27and put my spirit in you so you’ll follow my statutes and observe my ordinances. 28You’ll live in the land I gave your ancestors. You’ll be my people, and I’ll be your God. 29I’ll save you from your uncleanness, send you abundant crops of grain, and keep famine away from you. 30I’ll multiply fruit on your trees and produce in the fields. 31You’ll remember your sinful ways and deeds, and abhor yourselves. 32Understand that I’m not doing this because you deserve it. Be ashamed of yourselves, Israel!” Ezek 36:24-32

33“When I cleanse you from your sins, the towns will be rebuilt and lived in again. 34The land will be cultivated for everybody to see that goes by. 35They’ll say, ‘This wasteland has become like the Orchard of Eden. The desolate, ruined towns are fortified and lived in.’ 36Then the nations that are left around you will know I’ve rebuilt the ruined places and replanted what was desolate. I’ll do what I’ve said.”

37The Lord GOD says, “I’ll let Israel ask me to increase their people like a flock. 38People’s flocks will fill the wasted towns like sacrifices in Jerusalem at festival time. They’ll know I’m the LORD.” Ezek 36:33-38

A Valley of Dry Bones

37:1-2The LORD’s hand was on me. He took me out in spirit and put me down in a valley full of dry bones, 2and had me walk around among them.

3“Son of man, can these bones come alive?”

“Lord GOD, you know.”

4“Prophesy over them, ‘Dry bones, listen to the LORD. 5I’ll put breath in you so you can come to life. 6I’ll put sinews on you, make flesh grow back, and cover you with skin. You’ll know I’m the LORD.’”

7As I prophesied, there was a rattling sound, and the bones came together, bone to bone. 8I saw sinews on them, flesh grew, and skin covered them; but they weren’t breathing. Ezek 37:1-8

9He told me to prophesy to their breath, “The Lord GOD says to come from the four winds and breathe on these slain so they can come to life.”

10So I prophesied and breath came into them, they came to life, and stood up, a big army.

11Then he said,

“Son of man, these bones are the whole House of Israel. They’re saying, ‘Our bones are dried up. Our hope is gone. We’re completely cut off.’ 12So prophesy that the Lord GOD says, ‘I’ll open your graves and resurrect you, and take you to Israel. 13You’ll know I’m the LORD when 14I’ve put my breath in you, you’ve come to life, and I’ve put you in your own land.’” Ezek 37:9-14

Reunion of Israel and Judah

15A message from the LORD came to me again:

16“Son of man, take a stick and write on it, ‘For Judah and the people of Israel, his companions.’ Take another stick and write on it, ‘For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim and the House of Israel, his companions.’ 17Then put them together in your hand to make one stick. 18When your people ask you what these sticks mean, 19say that the Lord GOD says, I’ll take Joseph’s stick—which is in Ephraim’s hand—and the tribes of Israel, his companions. I’ll put them with Judah’s stick, to make one stick in my hand.’ 20The sticks you write on they’ll see in your hand. 21Tell them the Lord GOD will gather the people of Israel from among the nations where they’ve gone and bring them home. 22He’ll make them one nation under one king. 23They won’t defile themselves with idols, detestable things, or any of their sins. He’ll deliver them from the places where they live, where they’ve sinned, and cleanse them. They’ll be his people, and he’ll be their God.”

Ezek 37:15-23

24-25“My servant David will be their king, their one shepherd forever. They’ll follow my ordinances and keep my statutes. They and their descendants will live permanently on the land I gave Jacob, where your ancestors lived. 26I’ll make an everlasting peace treaty with them, bless and multiply them, set my sanctuary among them, 27live with them, and be their God; and they’ll be my people. 28The nations will know I’m the LORD who sanctifies Israel when my sanctuary is with them forever.”’” Ezek 37:24-28

A Message for Gog

38:1A message from the LORD came to me:

2“Son of man, face Gog of the land of Magog, the prince that rules Meshech, and Tubal, and prophesy against him, 3‘The Lord GOD says, “I’m against you, Gog. 4I’ll turn you around, put hooks in your jaws, and take you out—you, your army, horses and horsemen, all splendidly attired, a large army with buckler and shield, wielding swords; 5Persia, Nubia, and Put with them, all with shield and helmet; 6Gomer with all its troops; Beth-togarmah from the remote parts of the north with all its troops—many nations with you.

7“Be prepared, you and the armies allied with you as their commander. 8After a long time, you’ll be drawn to a land restored from the sword, whose residents live safely. They will have gathered from many nations to the mountains in Israel, which had been a continual waste. 9You and your troops will come down on them like a storm, like a cloud over the land.” Ezek 38:1-9

10‘The Lord GOD says, “At that time, you’ll start plotting, 11‘I’m going to go up against a land with unwalled villages, against people at rest, that live safely, that don’t have walls, bars, and gates. 12I’ll capture spoil, seize plunder, attack waste places that are lived in now and people that gathered from the nations, who have acquired livestock and goods, and think the world revolves around them.’ 13But Sheba, Dedan, the merchants of Tarshish and its surrounding villages, will ask you, ‘Do you think the army you’ve gathered can capture lots of spoil, seize plunder and goods, carry off silver and gold, and drive away livestock?’ Ezek 38:10-13

14“So, son of man, prophesy against Gog that the Lord GOD says, ‘When my people are living securely, you’ll know it, won’t you? 15You’ll come from the far north, riding horses, a great army 16swooping down like a cloud over the land. In the last days, Gog, I’ll bring you against my land so the nations can see my holiness displayed by what happens to you.’ Ezek 38:14-16

17‘The Lord GOD says, “Aren’t you the one I spoke about in former times through my prophets in Israel? They predicted for years that I’d bring you against them. 18‘When Gog comes against Israel, my fury will flare.’ 19In my zeal and blazing anger, there will be a violent earthquake in Israel. 20Fish in the sea, buzzards from the sky, scavengers in the open country, things crawling on the ground, and everybody in the world will shudder at my presence. Mountains will crumble, cliffs will collapse, walls will crash to the ground. 21I’ll call for a sword against Gog on all my mountains. His swordsmen will turn against each other. 22With disease and blood I’ll render judgment on him: rain on him, his troops, and many allies, a torrential rain with hailstones, fire, and sulfur. 23I’ll show my greatness, sanctify myself, make myself known where many nations can see me. They’ll know I’m the LORD.”’ Ezek 38:17-23

39:1“Son of man, prophesy against Gog, ‘The Lord GOD says, “I’m against you, ruler of Meshech, and Tubal. 2I’ll turn you around, drive you on, take you up from the most remote parts in the north, and bring you against Israel. 3I’ll knock the bow out of your left hand and the arrows out of your right hand. 4-5You and your troops will fall on the mountains in Israel. I’ll feed you to every vulture and wild animal in the open country. I’ve said so. 6I’ll rain down fire on Magog and those who live securely in distant lands. They’ll know I’m the LORD.’

Ezek 39:1-6

7“I’ll make my holy name known among my people; I won’t let it be profaned anymore. The nations will know I’m the LORD, the Holy One in Israel. 8The day I’m talking about is coming; it will happen.’

9“For seven years, the people in the towns of Israel will go out and build fires with the weapons, shields and bucklers, bows and arrows, war clubs and spears. 10They won’t get wood from the pasture or gather firewood from the woods; they’ll build fires out of weapons and plunder the ones that plundered them,” the Lord GOD says. Ezek 39:7-10

11“When I give Gog a burial ground in Israel—in the valley east of the Dead Sea, it will block travelers. They’ll bury Gog with all his army there and call it the Valley of Hamon-Gog. 12It will take Israel seven months of burying to clean up the land. 13The common people will do the burying to their renown when I glory myself,” the Lord GOD says. 14“They’ll appoint men to go through the land and bury the ones left on the ground. 15When they see a human bone, they’ll put a marker by it till those who do the burying put it in the Valley of Hamon-Gog. 16The city’s name will be Hamonah [Horde]. So they’ll clean up the land.”

Ezek 39:11-16

17“Son of man, tell every bird and wild animal, ‘Gather to the great sacrifice I’m going to make for you on the mountains in Israel so you can eat flesh and drink blood. 18You’ll eat the flesh of powerful men and drink the blood of princes as if they were rams, lambs, goats, and bulls—grain-fed animals from Bashan. 19You’ll eat till you’re gorged and drink blood till you’re drunk from the sacrifice I’ll make for you. 20At my table you’ll gorge on horses, charioteers, and mighty warriors,’” the Lord GOD says. Ezek 39:17-20

21“I’ll demonstrate my honor among the nations. They’ll see the judgment I’ve carried out on them. 22Israel will know I’m the LORD their God from then on. 23The nations will know Israel went into exile for their sin, and I hid from them. I abandoned them to their enemies, and they fell by the sword. [24]”’”

25So the Lord GOD says, “Now I’ll restore Jacob’s fortunes and have mercy on the whole House of Israel. I’ll be zealous for my holy name. 26When they live securely in their own land with nobody to threaten them, they’ll forget their shame and unfaithfulness to me. 27When I bring them back from the nations, they’ll sanctify me in a way many lands can see. 28They’ll know I’m the LORD their God because I exiled them and then gathered them back. I won’t leave any of them there. 29I won’t hide from them anymore because I’ve poured out my Spirit on Israel.” Ezek 39:21-29

VISION OF THE NEW TEMPLE AREA

40:1At the beginning of the twenty-fifth year of our exile, tenth month, fourteenth year after the city fell, the LORD’s hand weighed heavy on me. 2In visions he took me to Israel and set me on a tall mountain. On it to the south was a structure like a city. 3He took me over there. Standing in the gate was a bronze-looking man with a flax line and a measuring rod in his hand. 4He told me,

“Son of man, look, listen, pay attention to everything I show you. That’s why the LORD brought you here. Tell Israel everything you see.” Ezek 40:1-4

The East Gate

5There was a wall all the way around the Temple. The man holding a measuring rod (10’ 4" long, each cubit being 17.72" ordinary cubit plus 2.95" ordinary palm = 20.8" royal cubit) measured the thickness and height of the wall at 10’ 4" 1 reed each. 6Then he went to the east gate, up its steps, and measured its threshold at 10’ 4" 1 reed wide and deep. 7The guard rooms were 10’ 4" 1 reed square with 8’ 7" 5 cubits between them. The threshold of the gate facing inward was 10’ 4" 1 reed, 8and the porch of the gate facing inward was 10’ 4" 1 reed. 9He measured the porch of the gate at 13’ 10" 8 cubits; the porch of the gate faced inward. 10There were 3 guardrooms on each side of the gate, all the same size. The side pillars were square. 11The opening of the gate was 17’ 3" 10 cubits wide and 20’ 5" 13 cubits deep. 12There was a barrier wall in front of the guardrooms 21" 1 cubit thick on each side, and the guardrooms were 10’ 4" 6 cubits square. 13He measured the gate from the roof of the one guardroom to the roof of the other as 43’ 1" 25 cubits wide from one door to the opposite door. 14He made the side pillars 103’ 6" 60 cubits high. The gate extended around to the side pillar of the courtyard. 15From the front of the entrance gate to the front of the inner porch of the gate was 86’ 3" 50 cubits. 16There were beveled windows narrowing inward toward their side pillars within the gate all around; the same for the porches. The porch had windows all around inside, and the dividing walls were decorated with palm trees. Ezek 40:5-16

The Outer Court

17Then he took me to the outer court. There were rooms and a pavement made for the court all the way around—30 rooms that faced the pavement. 18The lower pavement ran alongside the gates, corresponding to their length. 19Then he measured the width from the front of the lower gate to the outside of the inner court at 172’ 5" 50 cubits on the east and north.

The North Gate

20He measured the length and width of the gate of the outer court that faced north. 21It had 3 guardrooms on each side, and its side pillars and porches had the same measurements as the first gate. It was 86’ 3" long and 43’ 1" wide 50 x 25 cubits. 22Its windows and porches and its palm tree had the same measurements as the gate that faced east. 7 steps led up to it, and its porch was in front of them. 23The inner court had a gate across from the gate on the north as well as the gate on the east; he measured 172’ 5" 1o0 cubits from one gate to the other. Ezek 40:17-23

The South Gate

24Then he led me south to the south gate. He measured its side pillars and porches; they were the same as the others. 25The gate and its porches had windows all the way around like the other windows. It was 86’ 3" long and 43’ 1"wide 50 x 25 cubits. 26There were 7 steps going up to it, and its porches were in front of them. It had palm tree decorations on its side pillars, one on each side. 27The inner court had a gate facing south, and he measured 86’ 3" 50 cubits from gate to gate.

Gates to the Inner Court

28Then he took me to the inner court by the south gate. It was the same size as the others. 29Its guardrooms, side pillars, and porches were the same size as the others. The gate and its porches had windows all the way around; it was 86’ 3" by 43’ 1" 50 x 25 cubits. 30There were porches all the way around that measured 43’ 1" by 8’ 7" 25 x 5 cubits. 31Its porches faced the outer court. There were palm trees on its side pillars; its stairway had 8 steps. Ezek 40:24-31

32He took me to the inner court on the east side. That gate had the same measurements as the others. 33Its guardrooms, side pillars, and porches measured the same as the others. The gate and its porches had windows all the way around; it was 86’ 3" by 43’ 1" 50 x 25 cubits. 34Its porches faced the outer court. There were palm trees on its side pillars on each side; its stairway had 8 steps.

35Then he took me to the north gate. It also had the same measurements as the others. 36Its guardrooms, side pillars, and porches were the same as the others. The gate had windows all the way around; it, too, was 86’ 3" by 43’ 1" 50 x 25 cubits. 37Its side pillars faced the outer court. There were palm trees on each side of its side pillars; its stairway had 8 steps. Ezek 40:32-37

Rooms for Preparing Sacrifices

38There was a room with its doorway by the side pillars at the gates, where they would wash the burnt offering. 39In the porch of the gate, there were 2 tables on each side for slaughtering the burnt offering, sin offering, and guilt offering. 40On the outer side, as you went up to the gate toward the north, there were 2 tables on each side of the gate; 414 tables were on each side next to the gate—8 tables for slaughtering sacrifices. 42For the burnt offering there were 4 hewn-stone tables 2’ 7" 1½ cubits square and 1’ 8" high 1 cubit. On them they lay the instruments for slaughtering the burnt offering and the sacrifice. 43The double hooks—4" 1 handbreadth long—were fastened on the Temple all the way around. The meat from the offering was to be laid on the tables. Ezek 40:38-43

Rooms for the Priests

44From the outside to the inner gate were rooms for the singers in the inner court, one of which was at the side of the north gate with its front toward the south, and one at the side of the east gate facing north. 45He said,

“This room that faces south is for the priests that oversee maintenance of the Temple. 46The room that faces north is for the priests that are in charge of the altar. These are the descendants of Zadok from the Levites, who approach the LORD to minister to him.”

The Temple Courtyard and Temple

47He measured the court at 172’ 5" 100 cubits square. The altar stood in front of the Temple.

48Then he took me to the porch of the Temple and measured each side pillar of it—8’ 7" 5 cubits square; each side of the gate was 5’ 2" 3 cubits square. 49The porch measured 34’ 6" x 19’ 20 x 11 cubits. At the stairway by which it was ascended, were columns belonging to the side pillars, one on each side. Ezek 40:44-49

41:1Then he took me to the nave and measured the side pillars. Each pillar was 10’ 4" 6 cubits square. 2The entrance was 17’ 3" 10 cubits wide; the sides of the entrance were 8’ 7" 3 cubits on each side. He measured the length and width of the nave at 69’ x 34’ 6" 40 x 20 cubits. 3He went inside and measured each side pillar of the doorway at 3’ 5" 2 cubits, and the doorway at 6’ 10" high and 12’ 1" wide 6h x 7w cubits. 4He measured the front of the nave at 34’ 6" 20 cubits square He told me, “This is the Holy Place.” Ezek 41:1-4

5He measured the Temple wall at 10’ 4"’ 6 cubits and the width of the side rooms at 6’ 11" 4 cubits all around the Temple. 6The side rooms were three stories high, 30 rooms on each floor. They extended to the wall on their inside all around so they could be fastened and not be fastened into the wall of the Temple. 7The side rooms surrounding the Temple were wider at each successive story. Because the structure surrounding the Temple went up by stages on all sides of it, the width of the Temple increased as it went higher. So one went up from the lowest story to the highest by way of the second story. 8I saw also that the Temple had a raised platform all around. The foundations of the side rooms were 10’ 4" 6 long cubits. 9The outer wall of the side rooms was 8’ 7" 5 cubits thick. But the space between the side rooms belonging to the Temple 10and the outer rooms was 34’ 6" 20 cubits wide all around the Temple. 11The doorways of the side rooms opened onto the part of the platform that was left free, one door to the north and one to the south. The width of the part that was left free was 8’ 7" 5 cubits all around. Ezek 41:5-11

12The building in front of the separate area at the side toward the west was 105ft wide. The building’s wall was 8’ 7" 5 cubits thick all around, and it was 155’ 3"long 90 cubits. 13Then he measured the Temple at 172’ 5" 100 cubits long. The separate area with the building and its walls was also 172’ 5" 100 cubits long. 14The front of the Temple and the separate area along the east side were 172’ 5" 100 cubits.

15He measured the length of the building along the front of the separate area behind it, with a gallery on each side at 172’ 5" 100 cubits. Ezek 41:12-15a

He also measured the inner nave and the porches of the court. 16The nave of the Temple, the inner room, and the outer vestibule were paneled. Around all three there were windows with recessed frames. The threshold was paneled with wood all around from the floor to the windows (which were covered), 17to the space above the door, even to the inner room, and on the outside. On all the walls round about in the inner room and the nave were carved likenesses 18of cherubs alternating with palm trees. Each cherub had two faces: 19the face of a man toward the palm tree on the one side, and face of a young lion toward the palm tree on the other side. They were carved on the whole Temple round about. 20From the floor to above the door, cherubs and palm trees were carved on the wall. Ezek 41:15b-20

21The doorposts of the nave were square. In front of the Holy Place was something like 22an altar of wood 3’ 5" x 3’ 5" x 5’ 2" 2 x 2 x 3 cubits tall. Its corners, base, and sides were wood. He said to me, “This is the table that is before the LORD.” 23The nave and Holy Place each had a double door. 24The doors had two swinging leaves apiece. 25On the doors of the nave were carved cherubs and palms trees, such as were carved on the walls. There was a wood canopy in front of the vestibule outside. 26There were recessed windows and palm trees on each side on the side walls of the vestibule. Ezek 41:21-26

Rooms for the Priests

42:1Then he took me north to the outer court, to the rooms across from the Temple yard and the north building. 2The length of the building on the north side was 172’ 5" x 86’ 3" 50 x 100 cubits. 3Beside the 34’ 6" 20 cubits that belonged to the inner court and facing the pavement of the outer court, there was a three-story gallery. 4In front of its rooms was an inner walkway 17’ 3" wide x 172’ 5" long 10 x 100lcubits with doorways on the north. 5The upper rooms were narrower, because the galleries took more space away from them than from the lower and middle floors of the building. 6The rooms had three stories and didn’t have any pillars like the pillars in the courts. So the upper rooms were set back more than the lower two levels. 7The outer wall beside the rooms toward the court was 86’ 3" 50 cubits long. 8The rooms in the outer court were 86’ 3" 50 cubits long. The rooms facing the Temple were 172’ 5" 100 cubits long. 9Below those rooms, was the east entrance as you enter them from the outer court, where the outside wall begins. Ezek 42:1-9

10On the east across from the yard and the building there were rooms 11with a passage in front of them. They were like the rooms on the north with the same length and width and with the same exits, arrangements, and doors. 12Below the south rooms, there was an entrance on the east side—where a person goes into the passage—and across from them there was a dividing wall.

13Then he told me,

“The north and south rooms, across from the separate area, are holy rooms where the priests that are near the LORD are to eat the most holy things. They’ll lay the most holy things there—the grain offering, sin offering, and guilt offering; because the place is holy. 14When the priests go in, they’re not to go out to the outer court from the sanctuary without laying there the holy vestments that they minister in. They’ll put on other clothes so they can go to the parts of the building that’s open to the public.”

15When he’d finished measuring the inside of the Temple, he took me out through the east gate, and measured all the way around the Temple: 165170’ 500 reeds on the east, 17north, 18south, and 19west sides. 20The Temple had a wall all the way around it, 5170’ 500 reeds long in both directions, to separate the holy from the common. Ezek 42:10-20

The LORD’s Glory Returns to the Temple

43:1Then he led me to the east gate, 2and the glory of Israel’s God was shining through it. His voice sounded like crashing water, and the earth radiated with his glory. 3The vision I saw was like the one when he came to destroy the city, like the one by the Chebar River. I fell on my face. 4The glory of the LORD came into the Temple through the east gate. 5The Spirit lifted me up and took me to the inner court, and the glory of the LORD filled the Temple. Ezek 43:1-5

6While a man stood beside me, I heard someone talking to me from the Temple:

7“Son of man, this is the place for my throne and the soles of my feet, where I’ll live among the people of Israel permanently. Israel and its kings won’t defile my holy name anymore, either by their prostitution, by the dead bodies of their kings, 8or by setting their threshold beside my threshold or their doorposts beside my doorposts with only a wall between them and me. They’ve defiled my holy name with their disgusting deeds; so I’ve consumed them in my anger. 9Now they need to put their idolatry and their kings’ dead bodies far away from me so I can live among them from now on. Ezek 43:6-9

10“Son of man, describe to Israel what the Temple its layout look like and so they’ll regret their sins. 11If they regret everything they’ve done, then picture the Temple, its appearance, its exits and entrances, and full layout. Show them its ordinances and laws. Write them down in their presence so they can observe them. 12This is the rule for the Temple: the whole area on top of the mountain will be most holy.

The Altar

13“These are the measurements of the altar: the base will be a 20.7" 1 long cubit square with a 3.4" 1 handbreadth border. This will be the height: 14from the base on the ground to the lower ledge is 3’ 5" 2 cubits, with a width 20.7" 1 cubit; from the smaller ledge to the large ledge is 6’ 11" 4 cubits, with a width of 20.7" 1 cubit. 15The altar hearth will be 6’ 11" 4 cubits; from the altar hearth projecting upward will have 4 horns 20.7" 1 cubit high. 16The altar hearth will be 20’ 8" 12 cubits square. 17The ledge will be 24’ 1" 14 cubits on four sides with a rim around it 10.3" ½ cubit wide and a base 20.7" 1 cubit wide all the way around. The altar’s steps will face east.” Ezek 43:10-17

18“He said to me, “Son of man, the Lord GOD says, ‘These are the statutes at the time it’s built, to offer burnt offerings on it and sprinkle blood on it. 19For a sin offering, give a young bull to the Levitical priests that have descended from Zadok, who come near to me to minister. 20Put some of its blood on the altar’s four horns, on the four corners of the ledge, and on the border around it. Cleanse it and atone for it that way. 21Take the bull of the sin offering and burn it in the appointed place in the Temple outside the sanctuary. 22On the second day, offer a male goat without blemish for a sin offering. They’re to cleanse the altar like they cleansed it for the bull. 23When you’ve finished cleansing it, present a young bull without blemish and a ram without blemish from the flock. 24Present them before the LORD. The priests are to sprinkle salt on them and offer them up as a burnt offering to the LORD. 25For a week each day prepare a goat for a sin offering, a young bull, and a ram from the flock without blemish. 26For a week atone for the altar and purify it to consecrate it. 27From the eighth day on, the priests are to offer your burnt offerings on the altar and your peace offerings; and I’ll accept you.’” Ezek 43:18-27

The Prince, Levites, and Priests

44:1Then he brought me back through the outer gate of the sanctuary, which faces east; it was shut. 2The LORD told me,

“Keep this gate shut. Nobody is to go in through it because I’ve gone in through it. 3The prince will sit in it to eat bread in my presence. He’ll go in by the vestibule of the gate and go out the same way. Ezek 44:1-3

4Then he brought me through the north gate to the front of the Temple. I looked and watched the glory of the LORD fill the Temple; I fell on my face. 5The LORD said,

“Son of man, mark well, see with your eyes and hear with your ears everything I tell you about the statutes and laws of the LORD’s Temple. Mark well the ones who can and can’t be admitted to the sanctuary. 6Tell the rebellious people in Israel, ‘Enough of your abominations! 7Enough bringing foreigners—uncircumcised in heart and flesh—into my sanctuary to profane my Temple, when you offered me my food, the fat and blood. You made my covenant void—besides all your abominations. 8You’ve not taken care of my holy things yourselves; you’ve set foreigners to take care of my sanctuary. Ezek 44:4-8

9“No foreigner living among the Israelites—uncircumcised in heart and flesh—can enter my sanctuary. 10The Levites that left me when Israel went astray after their idols will be punished. 11Yet they will minister in my sanctuary and oversee the gates to the Temple: they’ll slaughter the burnt offering and sacrifice for the people, and minister to them. 12Because they ministered to them in front of their idols and Israel stumbled over them, I’ve sworn that they’ll be punished: 13they won’t come near to serve as priests to me or approach any of my things most holy; they’ll bear their disgrace and the abominations they’ve committed. 14Yet I’ll give them responsibility for the Temple, its service, and everything done in it. Ezek 44:9-14

15“But the Levitical priests, the descendants of Zadok, who kept charge of my sanctuary when Israel left me, will come near to minister to me. They’ll serve me to offer the fat and blood. 16They’ll go into my sanctuary; they’ll come near to my table to minister to me and keep my charge. 17When they go in at the gates of the inner court, they’ll wear linen vestments, not wool, while they’re ministering at the gates of the inner court and in the Temple. 18They’ll wear linen turbans and underclothes around their waist, nothing that will make them sweat. 19When they go to the people in the outer court, they’ll take off those vestments, lay them in the holy rooms, and put on other clothes so they won’t transmit holiness to the people. 20They’re not to shave their heads or let their hair grow long; they’ll trim it. 21They’re are not to drink wine when they go into the inner court.

22Priests are not to marry a widow or divorced woman, only a virgin from Israel or a priest’s widow. 23They’ll teach my people the difference between holy and profane, clean and unclean. 24In disputes, they’ll act as judges and judge by my ordinances. They’ll keep my laws and statutes at my stated festivals and set aside my Sabbaths. 25They’re not to defile themselves by going near a dead person except for father, mother, son, daughter, brother, or virgin sister. 26After he’s defiled, he’ll wait a week and then be clean. 27The day he goes into the inner court of the sanctuary to minister, he’s to offer a sin offering for himself.

Ezek 44:15-27

28“Don’t give them an inheritance in Israel; I’m their possession. 29They’ll eat the grain offering, sin offering, and guilt offering. Every devoted thing in Israel will belong to them. 30First part of the harvest of every kind and every kind of contribution will be for the priests. Give the priest the first of your dough to bring a blessing on your house. 31The priests aren’t to eat any bird or animal that’s died naturally or been torn to pieces by animals. Ezek 44:28-31

Division of the Land

45:1“When you divide the land by lot for inheritance, allot to the LORD, a holy district 8.2 x 3¼ miles 25,000 x 10,000 cubits; it will be holy throughout. 2Inside it will be a holy place 861’ 500 cubits square with 86’ 3" 50 cubits open all the way around. 3Inside the district, set aside a section 8.2 x 3¼ miles 25,000 x 10,000 cubits for the sanctuary, the most holy place, 4the holy portion of the land. It will be for the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary who come near to minister to the LORD, a place for their houses and a holy place for the sanctuary. 5Another section 8.2 x 3¼ miles 25,000 x 10,000 cubits will be for the Levites, the ministers of the Temple, and as their possession for towns to live in. 6Alongside the section designated as the holy district, assign for the possession of the city an area 1.63 x 8.2 miles 5,000 x 25,000 cubits. It will be for the whole House of Israel. Ezek 45:1-6

7“The prince will have land on both sides, alongside the holy district and the property for the city, on the west side and on the east side. Its length will correspond to one of the tribal portions and extend from the east to the west boundary of the land. 8He’ll own it so my officials won’t any longer oppress my people, but they’ll give the rest of the land to the tribes of Israel.

Warnings for the Princes

9“Stop it, officials of Israel! Stop evicting my people! Stop violence and destruction. Practice justice and goodness.

10“Use accurate balances, ephahs, and baths. 11An ephah and a bath will be the same amount; so they both contain 1.1 bushels .1 homer. 12A shekel will be 20 gerahs; 60 shekels will equal a mina. Ezek 45:7-12

Offerings and Festivals

13“This is the offering you’re to provide: .18 bushel ⅙ ephah from 11 bushels 1 homer of wheat, .18 bushel ⅙ ephah from 11 bushels 1 homer of barley; 14and the prescribed portion of olive oil (that is, 9 gallons 1 bath of oil), .9 gallon .1 bath from each 90 gallons 1 cor (which is 90 gallons 10 baths, or 1 homer, because 10 baths equal 1 homer); 15and one sheep from each flock of 200 from the watering places of Israel—for a grain offering, a burnt offering, and a peace offering, to make atonement for them,” the Lord GOD says. 16“All the general populace will give this offering for the prince. 17He will provide the burnt offerings, grain offerings, and liquid offerings for the festivals, new moons, and Sabbaths—at the stated festivals. He’ll provide the sin offering, grain offering, burnt offering, and peace offering, to atone for Israel. Ezek 45:13-17

18“On the first day of the first month, take a young bull without blemish and purify the sanctuary. 19The priests will take blood from the sin offering and put it on the door posts of the Temple, on the four corners of the ledge of the altar, and on the posts of the gate of the inner court. 20To atone for the Temple, they’re to do that on the seventh of the month for everybody that goes astray or sins in ignorance.

21“On the fourteenth day of the first month, observe the Passover festival for a week; eat bread without yeast. 22On that day the prince will provide a bull for a sin offering for himself and the people. 23Each day of the festival he’ll provide a burnt offering to the LORD: 7 bulls and 7 rams without blemish, and 1 male goat for a sin offering. 24He’ll provide a grain offering: 4½ pecks 1 ephah with each bull and ram, and 1½ gallons 1 hin of olive oil with each 4½ pecks 1 ephah. 25On the fifteenth day, seventh month, for the week of the festival, he’ll provide sin offerings, burnt offerings, grain offerings, and olive oil.” Ezek 45:18-25

46:1‘The Lord GOD says, “The gate in the inner court that faces east will be shut the six working days, but open on Sabbaths and new moons. 2The prince will go in through the porch of the gate from outside and stand by the gate post. The priests will provide his burnt offering and peace offerings. He’ll worship at the threshold of the gate and then leave, but the gate won’t be shut till that evening. 3The people will also worship at the doorway of that gate before the LORD on Sabbaths and new moons. 4The prince’s burnt offering on the Sabbath will be 6 lambs and 1 ram without blemish. 5The grain offering will be a 4½ pecks 1 ephah with the ram, and a grain offering with the lambs as much as he can give, and 1½ gallons 1 hin of olive oil with each 4½ pecks 1 ephah. 6On the new moon, he’ll offer 1 young bull, 6 lambs, and 1 ram, all without blemish. 7He’ll provide a grain offering, 4½ pecks 1 ephah with the bull and the ram, and as much as he can give with the lambs, and 1½ gallons 1 hin of olive oil for each 4½ pecks 1 ephah. 8The prince will enter through the porch of the gate and leave the same way.

Ezek 46:1-8

9“When the people present themselves to the LORD at the stated festivals, the one that goes in through the north gate to worship will leave through the south gate. The one that goes in through the south gate will leave through the north gate. Nobody will leave through the same gate they entered. 10When they go in, the prince will go in with them; when they go out, he’ll go out. 11At the feasts and stated festivals, the grain offering will be 4½ pecks bushel 1 ephah with each bull and ram, and with the lambs as much as a person can give, together with 1½ gallons 1 hin of olive oil with each 4½ pecks 1 ephah. 12When the prince provides a freewill offering, burnt offering, or peace offering, the gate facing east will be opened for him. He’ll provide his burnt offering and his peace offerings as he does on the Sabbath day. Then he’ll go out, and the gate will be shut behind him.

Ezek 46:9-12

13“Each morning, provide a year-old lamb without blemish for a burnt offering to the LORD. 14Provide a grain offering with it, .18 bushel ⅙ ephah and ½ gallon ⅓ of a hin of olive oil to moisten the fine flour, a grain offering to the LORD continually by ongoing ordinance. 15So a lamb and a grain offering with the olive oil will be provided every morning.

16‘The Lord GOD says, “If the prince gives a son a gift out of his inheritance, it will be a permanent possession. 17But if he gives a servant a gift from his inheritance, it will go back to the prince at the Year of Jubilee. His inheritance will belong only to his sons. 18The prince won’t confiscate people’s inheritance or chase them off their land. He’ll give his sons an inheritance from his own possessions so my people won’t be separated from their possessions.”’”

Ezek 46:13-18

19Then he took me through the entrance at the side of the gate into the holy rooms for the priests, which faced north. There was a place at the far back toward the west. 20He said, “This is where the priests will boil the guilt offerings and sin offerings, and bake the grain offering so they won’t bring them out into the outer court to transmit holiness to the people.” 21Then he took me to the four corners of the outer court. There was a small court in each corner, 22four enclosed corner courts, all the same size—69’ x 51’ 8" 40 x 30 cubits. 23There was a row of masonry around them, and boiling places were made under the rows all the way around. 24He told me, “These places are where the ministers of the Temple will boil the nations’ sacrifices.” Ezek 46:19-24

A River of Healing from the Temple

47:1Then he took me back to the Temple door. Water was running east from under the threshold of the Temple, which faced east. It was running down from under the right side of the Temple from south of the altar. 2He brought me out through the north gate and led me around the outside of the outer gate by way of the gate that faces east. Water was trickling from the south side.

3When the man went out toward the east with a line in his hand, he measured 1,723ft 1,000 cubits and led me through the water, which was up to my ankles. 4Again he measured 1,723ft 1,000 cubits and led me through water up to my knees. He measured another 1,723ft 1,000 cubits and led me through water up to my waist. 5He measured 1,723ft 1,000 cubits again, a river I couldn’t cross because it was too deep to ford; it was deep enough to swim in. 6He said, “Do you see that?”

Ezek 47:1-6a

He took me back to the riverbank. 7Lots of trees were growing on both sides of the river now. 8He said,

“This water runs east down to the Arabah, to the sea, and makes it fresh. 9Wherever the water goes, everything that forms schools will live.
